Name: Arham Bajaj
Title: True essence of Palace with the magical temples.
Review: If you are planning to visit Jaipur, plan 1 whole day trip where you can begin by watching early morning Sunrise from Jalmahal, then proceed to Amber fort. Inside Amber fort, you can feel the essence of Rajasthani tradition by riding over big elephants which will take you inside the fort, or you can also walk above the fort from parking place. Once you roam around the palace, do not forget to go to Jagat Shiromani temple as well. It is the only temple in the world with the statue of Lord Krishna and Meera bai. Also, you will find very rare temples where Lord Vishnu is kept alongside with Lord Krishna because Lord Krishna had all the 16 kala of Lord Vishnu. The temple is around 400 years old.

Name: David D
Title: A large and picturesque palace fortress in the old city of Amer.
Review: Amer was the original home of the rulers of the region, before they relocated to the city of Jaipur. Their palaces and fortresses can still be seen in Amer however, and the most famed of these is Amer Fort itself. The fort can be accessed by elephant or by jeep, although walking is also a possibility. There are some potential ethical concerns about the treatment of elephants in Jaipur, so be sure to research this and choose responsibly if you do want to take an elephant ride. The palace itself is beautiful, with painted walls and one palace of mirrors and silvered glass. The best thing about it is the views however and it is really very special. The best time to visit for the heat is during winter (from November to January), however this time also sees significant air pollution, which can diminish the views.

Name: Aaradhya G
Title: Best and excellent service provider
Review: Ameber fort is very beautiful place to  visit. Mr Rajkumar gave his best services and his communication skills was fantastic.

Name: Jonathan Mathrws
Title: Magnificent
Review: Magnificent and majestic palace and fort built centuries earlier on a hill near Jaipur city. Can be traversed by foot, elephants or by car and jeep

Name: The Mick
Title: Great attraction. Give yourself time
Review: This site was WELL worth the time and couple-bucks to see.  Give yourself some time though; you'll need time to see this fort and hike a mile or so up to see the fort above.

Name: Hemlata M
Title: Amezing fort
Review: Amezing fort in jaipur we enjoyed jaipur trip with my husband  memorable trip. Jaipur was nice city üëå .

Name: Janice N
Title: Truly amazing!!
Review: We in the West think that castles in Europe are amazing!  Stand by to be absolutely blown away with this one!!  Who knew there could be so much wealth and power!! You can even have an elephant ride for the full effect!!

Name: Touseef Majeed
Title: Must Visit Place In Jaipur
Review: Best Place To Visit. Hire. A Guide For 400. He Will Give You Much Worth Experience Inreturn. Great Great Place

Name: Gertrud
Title: A must see
Review: Most impressive fort I have seen so far. Verx well kept, lots to discover, lots of interesting explanations. You can walk around at your own pace and discover a lot. Also marvellous photo opportunities.

Name: Tracy Benjamin
Title: Awesome
Review: The fort or palace as it is known by is awesome. We went by Jeep to the fort though there is the option of elephant ride too. There is also a temple inside with quite an amazing history behind it .

Name: Trudy W
Title: Stunningly Beautiful
Review: Go first thing in the morning and walk up. No need for the jeep. Please do not use the elephants. I hired a guide so i got a fantastic history lesson on the palace and the fort and the maharajas and maharanis. Plus a private photographer.  I found it interesting. Worth getting up early for.

Name: Stanzin Namgyal
Title: It was an okay experience
Review: it‚Äôs an okay experience and one can skip it as well.It‚Äôs a well maintained fort and has few artefacts of the royal family.

Name: exploredaunexplored
Title: Grand
Review: Amer fort is huge. There's lot of walking and climbing steps involved. Pls go with a good guide. The history is mind blowing. Such intricate details. I went via airbnb experience. It was totally worth it. On the entrance there's someone playing traditional instruments. The magnificent gates. Everything is brilliant. The best part is the view from the top sections

Name: sanjay das
Title: Excellent
Review: Awesome experience quite busy.Guudes are 400rs. They may take you to a rip off tourist shop after tour. Also if you are nri or OCI or can speak hindi just get your tickets direct and queue with everyone else Guudes will take you to foreigner line and try to get you to pay more. No where recognising OCI as Indian ID apart from Taj Mahal.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Must see historical palace whilst in Jaipur
Review: We had an excellent guide for the days tour of Jaipur to provide the historical knowledge and context. It requires a long car journey to and up the steep hill to see this historical and impressive Amber Palace Fort. Much of this Palace and Fort is open to admire the architecture, craftsmanship involved and explore the buildings and courtyards. Great views across the valleys.

Name: Unnikrishnan
Title: Historical
Review: The two most prominent places to visit in Jaipur are the Amber fort and the Jal Mahal apart from other places like the Hawa Mahal and City Palace, Jantar Mantar, etc.

Name: Apolonia70
Title: My equal favourite fort in India
Review: This is a large complex with many levels and offerings - artifacts, paintings, decor - the architecture is amazing - a good few hours with great photographic opportunities. Also a good workout walking around.

Name: Wansbrough2012
Title: A bucket list item ticked off
Review: We visited as part of our Uniworld Golden Triangle itinerary and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  We had the benefit of a guide who passed on a lot of information and details of the history and I would urge you if you visit, to arrange one. There is some fantastic architecture and the views out at the top and incredible. Great experience. üëçüèº

Name: Gustavo A
Title: Amazing views all around!
Review: This place is beautiful, huge and with plenty of things to see. No need to go by truck, the walk up to the palace is not even that steep. Easily doable even if you're not in shape. Ignore the truck/jeep guys. Up there you get amazing views of jaipur and the area surrounding the palace. Plus, there are monkeys all around which is pretty cool (careful, they scream and sometimes steal your stuff). The architecture is very distinct and the place is in good conditions to visit. It did seem to me that it should be getting more security and staff around to prevent people form deteriorating it further. Still, a must visit in Jaipur, and super cheap for what you get to see!

Name: Detlef Volke
Title: Fascinating big fort
Review: Go up on an elephant and enjoy the Slow Ride ;-)Do not Look at hookers who Want to sell some stuff but trat the fotographer.

Name: KittyinLondon
Title: Go early!
Review: We had a guide with us all day and arrived here about 9am. If you go here, and you should, go early! When we departed there was a queue of cars of at least one hour just to get close, let alone into, the palace. This was the main reason, I liked Jaipur. It's worth 2 hours of your time

Name: Rishi S
Title: Good
Review: Good...would have been nice if the elephant ride was on the way down the fort as well.The insane traffic during peak season makes it difficult to get some good pictures on the fort.

Name: KunalMathuria
Title: India‚Äôs glorious past
Review: Beautiful old world fort, true essence & beauty of India of the past. Sheesh mahal is outstanding. The parade grounds and kings court are also beautiful

Name: D Jain
Title: Wow, but only recommended in winters
Review: Amber fort is one of the must see places in Jaipur. Most of the fort is open, and winters is a perfect time to explore this beautiful fort and know its history. A guide is a must to truly appreciate the significance and artmanship of the entire fort.

Name: Deepak H
Title: Outstanding Palace
Review: Watch out for the maddening crowds and the long traffic jam up the hill. The palace itself is an absolute marvel.

Name: theSeeker
Title: Majestic structure
Review: Amber palace is a must see in Jaipur. Make sure to visit it during day time to enjoy it completely. Though entry is available till 9pm, the lighting is not enough. The majestic fort has been part of many movies like Jodha Akbar. It's good to avail the service of a guide at a price of 400 for a group of 4 people. Me and my family had an affable gentleman named Mukesh Sharma explaining the history and other details of the palace. Great too hear how the Sheesh Mahal uses technique of mirror reflection to keep the rooms warm during winter

Name: gira p
Title: Worth the visit
Review: I recommend reading about the history of the Palace before your visit. Very well preserved. Wear comfortable shoes and keep your camera handy.

Name: BackBencherBoots
Title: Amber Fort
Review: Amer, the old city of Jaipur, is where the Amber fort, usually known as Amer fort, is situated. Swai Man Singh and later Swai Jai Singh constructed the fort. It is located in the Hills outskirts of Jaipur for the Royal family and their army.

Name: John L
Title: What an amazing place to see - must visit
Review: Loved seeing the Amber fort and all the beautiful detail and we were lucky that there was a film crew there at the time so got to see some amazing sights - a must visit

Name: Prasanna
Title: Must in Jaipur tour.
Review: A must visit in your Jaipur tour. The brilliance of the architectural structure and design with all the logic makes you want to live in that era. Take a guide. Nominal charge- Rs.400/- add a tip of Rs.100/- it's worth it.Beware of the shops who try to sell(force-sell)  goods to you in the name of Amer made indigenous items. No harm in buying though.

Name: Morgan and Robyn
Title: Amazing place to visit, add it to your Bucket List!
Review: A beautiful Fort with amazing rooms. The  Fort, was completed  in  the  early  18th  century,  offering a  fascinating  insight  into  the  lifestyle  of  the  Moghul ruling families.

Name: gautam s
Title: Overall very good,but need to have a knowledgeable guide,during visit
Review: Beautiful Rajwada fort & palace & a glory of Jaipur Kings,surrounded with hills & looks beautiful during rainy & winter season.Light & sound show attracts very much,also El3phant ride is enjoyable.

Name: santosh
Title: Amer fort
Review: A very big fort that reminds the glory and architecture of rajputana , it is very big fort made by kachhwaha rajputs , man singh mahal , deewane aam ,deewane khas and location of the fort is excellent

Name: Jill
Title: Great Palace! Must visit
Review: Amazing.. Even when you already saw thousand pictures. of Amber fort. But seeing it live was an exponential experience. It is a must to visit palace in Jaipur. It has a very luxury and beautiful ancient vibe!

Name: Something Tookish
Title: Beautiful and clean palace
Review: Extremely well maintained buildings and clean grounds. The inlaid stone pictures and beautiful tile work make this well worth the visit. No shortage or vendors trying to sell their wares.

Name: Suhas G
Title: Majestic palace
Review: Great palace. Guide gave a very good description of inhabitants and life in palace. Half a day spent here.

Name: Mumtaazrs
Title: Simply stunning. No more words.
Review: A must visit place. The aura of the palace brings alive the times when these places were inhabited by the royals.

Name: FlavourSeeker
Title: Mostly good, some bad parts
Review: We had a great time visiting this fort. We had a knowledgeable guide who regaled various stories of the  Royals, and the grandeur of the fort was pretty cool. The hall of mirrors was also very nice. The whole place was a great example of a fusion between Hindu and Mughal architecture, reflective of the synergies between those communities of the time. There are several cool books and crannies to explore, and learn more about, which can take up a good chunk of time. There are some very unfortunate aspects of this fort, though. There is a severe lack of respect that the visitors have towards this fort - it is dirty, littered with trash, and the large majority of people who visit this place are only interested in taking selfies, while barging and pushing others around. The elephants look very weak and abused, and it's important not to support the continued exploitation of these majestic creatures, as they are not treated well. Very sad to see.In one of the small hallways we saw a used baby diaper (yes, very used and brown) shoved into the window - which was disgusting and so sad. The actual maintenance of the fort could be improved as well. But it's a really impressive fort.

Name: Bhaskar_10
Title: Grandeur display of Indian History and Culture
Review: Visited on 8th November 2022This place can be approaced on foot, on elephant or on jeep apart form your own private vehicle. Jeep fare is INR 100 for going and coming back with 6-8 passenger per jeep which was our choice of travel.Entry fee is INR 100/- per adulty and INR 20/- for students with id card. This rate is for Indian nationals. Not sure if this is seperate for other nationalities.The fort itself depicts the grandeur of teh Rajputana both with the magnificence and magnitude of the architecture and size.Conducted tours will help the visitor with more understanding of teh history and lifestyle of teh kings and its pupils, thus I will recommend all to take a guide who can cost INR 200-300/- for 1 hour tour.On a hot day ot will be tourture thus plab early morning or post 4pm . THis place is always crowded.Must visit for all coming to Jaipur

Name: Wafa B
Title: Amber Fort, Jaipur.
Review: What a beautiful piece of India‚Äôs history. A must do visit in Jaipur. A beautiful mix between the Hindi and Mughal architecture where the Islam and Hinduism religion met and built a wonderful fort.

Name: maria machi
Title: Hidden treasures
Review: Very beautiful palace, amazing walled fortress, short distance from the city. It took us 3 hours to look around and we did not feel them. No signals to show the way so you risk missing some areas. We knew there was more since we had a map from an audio tour you can purchase at the entrance for 200 rupees, cheaper than the guides and more entertaining. You use your own phone. We didn‚Äôt use the elephants to go up, we visited them later. I bought a cute umbrella for the sun, for 400 rupees, it can be found in the city for 250, but it was worth it.

Name: GLRoberts99
Title: Brilliant but do not use the elephants
Review: This is a stunning fort / palace. It has been restored (and still needs some work doing to it), but it is fantastic. We had a very knowledgeable guide who appreciated what we wanted to see and took us through the very large property. The detail and the delicacy of some of the decoration in rooms, around doors, and on ceilings is exquisite. The history and myths that surround it, lead to wonderful stories, and make it a "Must See" location.The only downside was the use and abuse of elephants which are used to ferry idle tourists to the fort from the carpark.

Name: 995dwightd
Title: Must see portion of Golden Triangle Tour
Review: High on a hill, isolated.  Take an elephant or a car ride to the top.  Normal museum artifacts, buildings and the like inside the fort.  This entire area (Jaipur) is shades of brown and amber from lack of rainfall.  A different kind of beauty.

Name: Ekta Gupta
Title: Amazing Fort
Review: Best experience fof India Heritage, definitely a must visit place in Jaipur. Amber fort is the Pride of Jaipur.

Name: Petra W
Title: Best tourist attraction in Jaipur
Review: Of all the forts and landmarks in Jaipur, this was the best one. It's huge and would have been magnificent in it's day. I suggest you skip the others and only do Amber Fort.

Name: Anita K
Title: Beautiful Visit
Review: This is a beautiful fort, worth visiting. But my suggestion is visit it in the early morning. It gets crowded by mid morning and there is no place to park or to walk. Get a guide to take you, Salim Khan did an amazing job to showing us the fort as well as take the most amazing photos as he is a photographer. Contact him if you want a good guided tour of Amber Fort. 93510-08078.All the guides tell you not to shop at the stores within the fort and that they will take you to the wholesale shops to buy the same things, but I must tell you that the shops within the fort have some of the best products which you will not find outside in the many touristy shops that they take you to after the tour. The shops in the City Palace and in Amber Fort have beautiful jewellery, artifacts and block printed stuff which will interest the foreigners, and the quality is really good. Pricing is a little high, but it is to be expected.The drivers will also tell you that they will take you to the best places for shopping, but my suggestion is to buy what you like when you see it since there is no guarantee you will find it elsewhere.

Name: StorkRN1
Title: Definitely the best fort I saw in India
Review: Had a guide w our group and it was worth it to hear about all the details of this gorgeous fort. Great views on a hill, great gardens, I loved the mirrored hall.

Name: Aditi
Title: Best fort
Review: Great fort and best day out in jaipur We where group of friends enjoyed visiting amber fort and palace.

Name: SecbadRoadie
Title: Amazing architecture
Review: It is a beautiful palace. When you visit, be sure to hire a guide. When the guide narrates the whole history of the palace, it seems magical.

Name: sakura
Title: Solid and beautiful
Review: It was a very solid and beautiful place.I wanted to take my time because it's paid place, but it was a pity that some staffs of cleaning and tending the plants were pestering me for money. It's vacant in the morning (open at 8am.)„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇÈáçÂéö„Å™‰Ωú„Çä„ÅßÁ∂∫È∫ó„Å™Â†¥ÊâÄ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂÖ•Â†¥Êñô„ÇíÊâï„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÇÜ„Å£„Åè„ÇäË¶ã„Åü„Åã„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅÊéÉÈô§„ÇÑÊ§çÊú®„ÅÆÊâãÂÖ•„Çå„Çí„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã‰∫∫„Å™„Å©„Åå„ÅäÈáë„Çí„Åõ„Å≥„Å£„Å¶Êù•„Çã‰∫ã„ÅåÊÆãÂøµ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊúù„Ç§„ÉÅ„Å´Ë°å„Åè„Å®Á©∫„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å¶ËâØ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ8ÊôÇÈñãÈ§®„ÄÇ

Name: SurenKaushik
Title: Worth a visit
Review: This is an imposing fort with its huge precincts. A Guide would be of great help here. The place is huge and truly magnificent.  Seniors may well do with a walking stick. The Sound and Light show in the evening is well worth the effort and money.

Name: Bilal K
Title: Best place
Review: Rahul is a great person. He loves his elephants. We loved the entire experience.Each and every single moment was just awesome.

Name: ian m
Title: Worth a visit.
Review: Probably best to have a guide to get the best out of this attraction - as with most such palaces in Rajasthan it's a cross between a fort and a palace.

Name: jsthouston
Title: Large and imposing
Review: I found this fort more impressive from a distance than up close. The fact that it was hot and crowded probably did not help. It is massive and imposing but you get that impression driving up while going inside added little at least for myself.

Name: Federico
Title: A must-see in Rajasthan!
Review: One of the most symbolic and well-known forts in Rajasthan. Highly recommend to start the visit in the afternoon in order to be there when the sun sets.Among the wonders of the Amber Fort, our favorites were the Sheesh Mahal (Mirror Palace) and the presence of monkeys all around the fort's grounds.A must-see!

Name: Ravikanth Garladinne
Title: Excellent place
Review: One of the best forts in Rajasthan situated in serene locales in Jaipur is a must watch for people travelling to Jaipur. It is exquisite

Name: Riju Dixit
Title: Cultural treasure trove
Review: Hire a guide to truly understand the history of this place. You will have many selling souvenirs. Tip - you can get upto 5-6 magnets for Rs.100. Dont get conned like me....i picked 2 - which also appeared reasonable.

Name: duttash
Title: Amber Palace - a royal visit
Review: Amber Palace is a must see in Jaipur.  A short drive from the city center - it is majestic and imposing.  If you plan ahead you can get to the castle riding on an elephant.  The lines are long so please show up early. The castle has a kali temple hidden inside.  Great view of the plains from the hilltop.  It is a must see.

Name: iexplorer
Title: A jewel of Jaipur
Review: Amber Fort is a jewel of Jaipur, with its majestic, beautiful architecture and rich history. Built by the legendary Raja Man Singh sometime in the 17th century.

Name: Parikshit S
Title: Great Services
Review: Amber Palace is an fabulous place to visit. very eye catching spot in jaipur. must visit this place if you are looking for advanture.

Name: Vandana
Title: A must visit
Review: This place is beautiful and on the way you can see a step well. This has a beautiful kali mata temple inside. The sheesh mahel inside is fantastic.

Name: Ashutosh pandey
Title: Awespme
Review: The fort is awesome. It is huge.  It can be scaled by foot, by elephant or by jeep. The sheesh mahal is worth the visit

Name: DanWon74
Title: Nice palace outside the main city area
Review: End of rainy season and we were lucky that the rain stopped few minutes after arrival. Had a friendly and experienced guide (recommend to use a local guide vs. self guided). Nice views from the different courtyards and good historical stories shared by guide. Highlight is the glass palace part.

Name: vishwas dole
Title: Best fort in Jaipur
Review: It is a place as well as fort in Jaipur It is around 10/12 kilometer from Jai Mahal Place, taxi takes around Rs. 2000 for a day trip of Jaipur Amer Palace is great example of Rajput architecture.There are a lot of attractions for one to see at the Amer Fort, including the diwan-e-aam, the Sheesh Mahal. `There a tunnel which connects Amer to Jaigarh Fort. (as per Guide information) very well maintained, entrance fee is around 300/-   at base of the fort you can take the photo which covers whole fort in one frame

Name: Subrat Saurabh
Title: Must visit in Jaipur
Review: This is a best thing about my Jaipur trip. I got an amazing guide who explained me the astrology and astronomy behind the fort. He charged me very nominal. This fort is too huge and you will find lot of spot where Bollywood movies were shot. You will get an amazing view from the fort and lot of backdrop for Photoshoot

Name: Glow Spa
Title: Amer is hot place of jaipur
Review: nice palace, good maintain of heritage place,its good to see all greenery there as rainy season.best time is september

Name: Mahabub A
Title: Awesome place...
Review: This place is awesome. The view from the mountains is eye catching and everything here is adorable. We also hired a guide to explain about its history in detail. It is one of the world Heritage site.

Name: Jayesh M
Title: Jayesh Mor
Review: The palce is beautiful but must see with the help of local Guide.He will explain the history and importance of all places in palace. Must see

Name: montykhan65@gmail.com
Title: Beautiful creation‚Ä¶.
Review: If someone visit Jaipur and never visit Amber fort that would be the most sad part of life. This is a beautiful pieces of work . More you see more you want to know‚Ä¶!!!

Name: Noam B
Title: Very intersting!
Review: Impressive architecture and artworks, especially the gate, and the mirror work at Shish-Mahal. Beautiful views of the lake with the "floating" garden.

Name: FLnurseER
Title: Stunning architecture, well maintained fort
Review: A definite must see in Jaipur. We were taken to the closest entrance in a jeep then walked up the sloping paths and many steps, where comfortable footwear is a must. The fort was not crowded and we enjoyed a couple of hours with our Pink City guide Jai, who had expertly guided us through the many rooms and courtyards, pointing out the beautiful detailed decor of mirrored mosaics and colored glass patterns, intricate marble inlays and amazing fine architecture. Without his guidance, we would have missed many points of interest as the area to see is so vast. There were many specific photo ops along the way and our guide took memorable pictures of our family. We bought good quality souvenirs in a wonderful gift store with large selection of beautiful items. This fort is not to be missed, but please do not use the elephants to ride up. For a wonderful kind interaction with these animals we visited the  Elefun Sanctuary.

Name: jyoti k
Title: Bhot aache guide hai ap bhi try krna Hans Kumar brahm Bhatt
Review: Yeh hamre amber palace ke guide hai Hans kumar Brahm Bhatt.. yeh bhot aache insan hai inhone hame pura Amber place bhot aache se gumaya ek ek chiz samjya btay or inhone hamri family ko apni family ki tarh treat  kiya or inke  sath gumke hame beda maza aya or inhoone hamri bhot aache aache fhots bhi click ki thanks sir hans Kumar brahm Bhatt.

Name: H·∫øn M
Title: Beautiful place and garden
Review: I like the story of this place which was told by a good storyteller. I just met the tour guide at the gate and simply go with him with a reasonable price. The ticket is a bit high is Rs.500. The architect was blend between Muslim and Hindu. The used nature color to paint at the walls and the ceilings which is incredible. And you should take more 15 minutes to visit the museum nearby

Name: Arpit Agarwal
Title: Beauty at its best
Review: It's so beautiful and magnificent. You can spend 2-3 hours there. The architecture of this fort Is amazing. It's quite outside of the city but after visiting this fort you will not regret it..Another amazing example of a well-maintained fort. Has a very detailed explanation of how the fort was built, and its significance along with an explanation of each. The view you get of the fort when you are about to reach the fort is quite mesmerizing. Definitely worth visiting if you are in Jaipur. Do check out Nahargarh too if you can

Name: Curiositytraveller
Title: Palace with nice view
Review: It is a magnificent palace with nice architecture.  There was option to reach there with elephant ride, jeep ride or walking. We avoided elephant ride since we feel it should not be promoted. Palace has beautiful room sheeshahal. Will suggest you to have audio guide or guide with you.

Name: dhyancoelho
Title: Interesting
Review: Please take a guide .. it's Rs.300/- but the information is very good n enriching..Well maintained n clean too .Best visited in cooler months..

Name: Nirmal
Title: Super
Review: Amber fort is a renowned place in the wprld . we went Here as a part of our itinerary for visiting Jaipur with our collegues. Historic place an felt very nice.

Name: OsloTim
Title: Amazing place
Review: The visit to Amber palace was spectacular. The history and architecture was sublime. One of my favorite places in India

Name: Hema singh
Title: Magnificent
Review: The forts of Jaipur are magnificent. There are six in all. The Amber Palace is the best and most visited by tourists of the world. The other palaces are also worth visiting out of which the Jal Mahal and City Palace are outstanding.

Name: Srini
Title: Beautiful
Review: wonderful place. Beautiful architecture. Well maintained and a must visit attraction. It was very hot when we visited.

Name: Travel with AJ
Title: Gem of Jaipur
Review: stunning palace of jaipur and great history behind it . marvelous palaces , crowded areas  & raining .. wow we loved it  mirror place was the best along with diwane  e aam.

Name: Ankita D
Title: Must visit palace!
Review: Amazing experience. The fort is beautiful and the guide takes you around the fort explaining all the details and key notes about the history. There are several view points and photography points to take good pictures. You can also take elephant ride inside the fort.

Name: Shivam
Title: Best visit
Review: The Amber Palace is situated at the top of a hill near Jaipur city. It is huge and mesmerising. The elephant ride is a rich experience. The evening Light and Sound show is also wonderful

Name: John
Title: Beautiful place to visit
Review: This is a must-see.  We had an excellent guide Naval who walked us through the history of the place.  Its good to take a guide as they explain every part of the palace.

Name: GSaini80
Title: Beautiful Palace, mirror place is must visit place.
Review: Beautiful Palace, mirror place is must visit place. If possible visit in cooler months. We choose monsoon season. Temperature were in low 30‚Äôs  but humidity made it unbearable.

Name: MaDiAn
Title: One of the best forts to visit
Review: Go there in the mornings because you can ride an elephant to get up to the fort. As it gets very hot during the day the Elephants only walk up there till 10.

Name: Anup Kumar G
Title: Must see when visiting Jaipur
Review: Amazing place to see the grandeur of Rajasthan. Since there is a lot of walking in the open area, try to find a day with good weather. On the way back, there is nice shopping area set up by, Rajasthan Small Scale Cottage Industry (RSSCI). This is a must visit as well. Budget around 4-5 hours for the entire trip, excluding the drive to/from Jaipur.We engaged Tulsi N. Gupta (+91-98295-99376, tngupta376@gmail.com) as the tourist guide. He was brilliant. Reach out to him if you visiting this place.The elephant ride is highly recommended as well. Do plan to arrive early as the rides run till 12.00PM only.

Name: Nadia L
Title: Must visit
Review: Fabulous history & cultural experience - recommendation to get a Tour guide - no more than 200-300rs

Name: Alok Chauhan
Title: Amazing
Review: On our visit to Jaipur we went to see the Amber fort . We went by jeep. Elephant safari is also available.  The sheesh Mahal inside the fort is amazing

Name: Dilip Singh
Title: Majestic
Review: A majestic fort. The view is unbelievable. The road to the fort is  steep. Can be travelled by Jeeps, Elephants or can be traversed on foot.

Name: Priyanka
Title: Good
Review: Nice n worth visiting atleast once. Temple located inside is beautiful. A cafe in amber palace is also great, which has a wide variety to offer.

Name: Rishi S
Title: Superb Historical walk

Title: Lovely fort

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Nice fort.  Half day visit.
Review: Its a nice fort in city amer.  Its a half day visit.  You may buy from the shop which the guide takes you to as the prices are reasonable over there compared to other shops.

Name: David D
Title: The observatory of the rulers of Jaipur.
Review: This was where the rulers of Jaipur had teams of astronomers and astrologers watching the heavens to make observations. It contains a number of technical marvels, including the world‚Äôs largest purpose-built sundial. However, as impressive as everything here is, it didn‚Äôt advance the science of astronomy much, as the theories built upon here were already known elsewhere and the precision of the observations didn‚Äôt in themselves add to scientific knowledge. But it is still a very impressive sight to see and a must-see while in Jaipur.

Name: Arun Mani Kanta Gunda
Title: Excellent
Review: What a beautiful location and scenery,nature is really cool, enjoyed the visit and stay here very valuable moments from history can be seen here

Name: Woodstag
Title: Must visit Jantar Mantar Astronomy and Science site
Review: Recommend booking a guide in advance to provide the historical facts and how the impressive solar based astronomy and science instruments worked 1728. Jantar Mantar is a great educational site to visit and experience. You are impressed with the scientific acumen of our ancestors to be able to predict the position of the sun without the aid of computing to 2 seconds. It houses the largest sun dial in the world.

Name: Shashank Dixit
Title: Astronomical and Cosmic Calculation Center of 17th Century
Review: Jantar Mantar that can better be understand as the place for performing astronomical and cosmic calculation with the light of the sun and the rotation of the Earth around the Sun.What is today's one of the world heritage site was built by Sawai Jai Singh in 1728 who had the insyreat and fascination towards astronomical science. He had built 5 Jantar Mantars across the western part of the country (Jaipur, Mathura, Ujjain and Benaras) though currently operational only in Jaipur.Definitely recommend and should be part of your city tour that can be very informative to the children.Refer to the review photos for the ticket prices break up and operating hours.

Name: KittyinLondon
Title: Big queues in afternoon
Review: We had a guide with us all day so when we arrived here in the afternoon, he was able to bypass the queue of at least an hour and get us in. We did feel bad about that. This is an interesting place, and there are signposts that explain things, but our guide enhanced that experience through his explanations.Allow 1 hour.

Name: tarun9369
Title: Rich Indian heritage
Review: Jantar mantar is an ancient site which has various structures used to determine the time , location and distance of celestial objects...this was made by the royal kings of Jaipur and located at five locations in India including jaipur...it's walkable distance from city palace Jaipur...entry ticket is there ( can not be taken online)...better to take a guide as they can explain how the structures work...one time.visit place...it's open garden and there is a snack counter at the exit...

Name: weiwei_sg
Title: Astronomy and Astrology
Review: Unless you know how astronomical instruments work, you need a guide to explain the functions, working and astrological beliefs in this small but well maintained park. Most interesting that the ancients had knowledge to measure time to the accuracy of within 2 seconds.

Name: Something Tookish
Title: Remarkable astrology devices
Review: These are solar devices built to track the heavens for the purpose of astrology. Remarkable large and accurate observation devices. Clean, well maintained grounds with descriptive signs at the devices. Worth a stop.

Name: singhasam
Title: A Tale of Two Sites.
Review: MONEY can be life for a country's great archaeological sites....but lack of it can be death.Of all the places I visited during a fantastic holiday to India it was Jantar Mantar that brought home to me the fine margins between deciding what to preserve of a country's history and what to abandon to the elements and encroaching undergrowth.First I'll give you the good news because much money has been lavished on Jantar Mantar to ensure that this large site containing nineteen astronomical instruments is preserved for future generations to enjoy and appreciate.It was completed in 1734 and deserves its place as a UNESCO World Heritage site.Among the instruments I strolled round were the world's largest stone sundial.For those of you who don't know -- and that included me because I had to look it up -- Jantar Mantar literally means "calculating machine".This astronomical observatory  touches everything from star and zodiac signs to time, the sun and the location of the Pole star.To show you how good their calculations were, the best instrument can calculate the correct time accurate to within two seconds.Now we come to the bad news.A short time later in my holiday I climbed all the way up to the Sun Temple overlooking Jaipur.Along the way my guide pointed to the left where a farmer wearing only a loin cloth was stood near a big pile of cow manure feeding leaves to his animals.Very nice, I thought, and prepared to walk away, but my guide shook his head and pointed again. This time I saw what he meant.Beyond the pile of manure and almost swallowed up by trees and thick undergrowth was a smaller version of Jantar Mantar.We stumbled our way through thorny growth, grass and tree roots and the deeper we got the clearer our view of the astronomical instruments became.Many still had their original curved marble marked out in sections for calculations, but some had been damaged or looted, other had been destroyed altogether and it was clear that Nature and the passage of time had not been kind to the site.So why am I mentioning it? Because this site is older and, therefore, historically more important than Jantar Mantar.Its downfall lay in its size. It was built in the very early 1700s but was much smaller than Jantar Mantar, so when restoration money became available the authorities opted to spend it on the much larger site. To me it is a bit like renovating a football stadium while leaving the Colosseum to crumble into ruins.What anyone reading this review could do is pay their own visit to the Sun Temple and then stop off and view this astronomical site for themselves. If enough tourists mention it then perhaps the Indian authorities will spare a bit of money to preserve this site as well.Jantar Mantar is a wonderful and fascinating site to visit, but spare a thought for its smaller poorer brother on your way up to the Sun Temple.

Name: Aseem
Title: Cool
Review: Super monumnetal design beautiful and worth visiting. Area is nice and good exploring it. You must visit here at least once in lifetime opportunity. Histltoric value which gets multiplied after visiting. Knowledgable

Name: Shwetha
Title: Fascinating Jantar Mantar
Review: Fascinating experience!! Huge revelation about the scientific acen of our ancestors. To be able to predict the position of the sun without the computer, hundreds of years ago nearest to 2 seconds is no little task.Visiting this place with a guide is essential to learn more about  this place. It houses the largest sun dial in the world.

Name: Rakesh A L
Title: Astronomy and Astrological Instruments
Review: Amazing instruments which we made in the 17th Century. Used for Astronomy and Astrology purpose. Please take a good guide as he will clearly explain how each instrument is used. Make sure that you go in a Sunny day as you need bright sunlight to use all the instruments.

Name: Vandana
Title: The most accurate of the 5 jantar mantars in India
Review: This is a must visit on a clear sunny day . A guided tour is advisable so that you get to understand the instruments well. Very accurate.

Name: Mukesh B
Title: Auditorium session a must
Review: Royals are not for the luxurious life, their battles, the size of their state, their palaces and the wealth they amassed. Not too many Kings are known to be involved in science and scientific experiments. But Jai Singh of Jaipur was different. He understood the growing population of his state and shifted from his ancestral Kingdom Aamer by creating a complete new city called Jaipur in the early 17th century.The boundary walls were created with pink stones hence the name Pink City.The king had planned the city in colonies and the roads of each colony is cross crossed exactly in 90 degrees. You would never be lost in Jaipur city, ant street you are in will connect you to the main road exactly in 90 degrees.That's science used in planning the city.Coming to Jantar mantar. It is another masterpiece of science and understanding of heavenly bodies.In the days when watches and clocks were not available, Jain Singh with his men created the perfect Sun Dial. No one would have thought that sun and it's shade can be used to locate the currect time of the day minute by minute.There are other set ups created in Jantar, all to do with the study of heavenly bodies and their connection with human life like the zodiac signs.I strongly suggest one should visit the Auditorium in Jantar Mantar first. An half an hour audio video session gives you a clear understanding of each and every set up created inside the Jantar Mantar. Once you have known how each one of them functions, the way you look at it changes completely.It is no more a piece of ancient monuments to you but the science. You start analysing it in the same manner it was designed for.You tend to think like a scientist and not a mere spectator or visitor.Unlike the monument in other cities, this place is laced with green garden and trees. It gives you relief from the scorching heat from the Sun. The washroom is well maintained.All in all a great place to explore of our ancient science at a very affordable ticket price

Name: Noam B
Title: Unbelievable!
Review: Impressive set of cutting-edge sophisticated astronomy and astrology devices made huge to improve resolution. Local guide is recommended, but make sure he knows to explain the principle of each device/

Name: shwetarose
Title: Wheelchair accessible Jantar Mantar Jaipur
Review: Wheelchair Full Accessible. Hire guide for sure to know the entire site in detail. Its interesting how people used traditional watch, by Sun Shadow.

Name: Arpit Agarwal
Title: Jantar Mantar - Jaipur
Review: At first glance, Jantar Mantar may look to be nothing more than a bunch of larger-than-life abstract sculptures. But this is not an art gallery‚Äîit's a special collection of astronomical tools started by Rajput ruler Jai Singh II to measure the heavens nearly 300 years ago.The observatory consists of nineteen instruments for measuring time, predicting eclipses, tracking the location of major stars as the earth orbits around the sun, ascertaining the declinations of planets, and determining the celestial altitudes and related ephemerides.

Name: RIDHI AGARWAL
Title: Need of scientific guides
Review: It was interesting to get to know how things like time and all are calculated over there,would have been better if they had a bid scientific guides there

Name: Raushan
Title: Truly it is a historic place with lots of natural values. Good arcitecture, easily aseseible and worth visiting with everyone. J
Review: Truly it is a place with great architecture and natural values. A must visit place once you are coming to Jaipur city. Nicely done and worth

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Children will love the place
Review: Good place to view astronomical instruments made hundreds of years earlier and to read the science behind that.  The worlds largest sundial is also inside this place.  Its adjacent to the City palace.Half day sightseeing can cover city palace, jantar mantar, hawa mahal.

Name: exploredaunexplored
Title: Must visit
Review: I am completely bowled by this place. What amazing science. All made  300 years ago. It's so damn interesting. I visited this place via airbnb experience with a guide. He explained how to read the time without any machine only by observing the shadow of the sun. Must visit place for any age group. Do visit with a guide, a good guide explains you the working and its super interesting.

Name: aditya j
Title: Impressive
Review: Truly impressive. A must visit place. Amazed by the scientific research we had in ancient times. Make sure you hire a guide who can explain everything. It will help with proper guidance and insight of the place

Title: Super amazing
Review: It really nice place to visit in pink city I really like tihs place janter Also I see Delhi janter but I really like jaipur on i really recommend this place

Name: 779sanjay
Title: Its awesome
Review: One of the best place to visit in Jaipur. How amazing that someone have made clock years back. Other things also have their own charm. must visit.

Name: Muqaddas
Title: Jantar mantar
Review: Jantar mantar was awesome palace. There are all facilities are available. Located middle of Jaipur. Fantastic trip in Jaipur

Name: ARABAJ K
Title: Fantastic palace
Review: We really enjoyed at jantar mantar . Very famous palace in jaipur city . We take lots of pictures here and enjoyed that day

Title: So much fun

Name: Azam K
Title: It was nice
Review: It was great experience in Jaipur city. I saw jantar mantar it was very nice I took lots of pictures there.highly recommend this palace

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: Mathematical marvel
Review: This monument showcases the rich heritage and talent of our ancient Indians. This is the proof that Indians are far ahead of western people in knowledge. A must visit place. Suggest to engage a guide to know about working of each yantra in detail.

Name: Dhwani D
Title: A must visit
Review: Such insightful visit. was awestruck seeing the accuracy that the equipment depicted. our ancestors were genius

Name: Hyoga83
Title: Amazing

Name: Arun Kumar
Title: City palace good
Review: Amazing City Jaipur vary good said singh  jantar mantar vary good naic experience jaipurEnjoy jaipur

Name: lulu
Title: Went in 2019
Review: Visit the observatory only if you‚Äôre interested in horoscopes and astrology otherwise it‚Äôs hard to understand what‚Äôs going on.

Name: Sid
Title: Astronomical experience
Review: It is a bit smaller than the one in Delhi but well maintained. And not a demo site. Was fascinating to see how science has evolved right from reading stars, measuring geometry to now where kids google (including us :) for everything. Does that mean the people of yesteryears were more intelligent than us. Could be a good debate Q !

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Nice Place
Review: There is a collection of 19 astronomical instruments used in those days to determine the positions of celestial objects like the sun and the moon. It is very similar to the one located in Delhi. Visit this place only if you have an interest in knowing these instruments.

Name: DKAN
Title: If you have interest in Indian history then visit this place
Review: If you have enough time then can plan for this place.If limited time then this should be last in your list.

Name: gautamroy2000
Title: No doubt India was so advanced earlier.
Review: Sun-dial for accuracy of time is unbelievable. Do hire a guide. It's astonishing advancement India made in Astronomy.

Name: KALA Nikhil
Title: Good informative place
Review: Will be interesting only if we hire a guide.very good informative place.We reached there around 9.00am and no guide were available.we tried to understand the structures by ourselves ,but was in vain..then after half an hour we got a guide,charges for guide was displayed there.We got a very bad guide,who didnt explain properly and we were not able to follow what he was saying

A guide is must if you are planning to visit here because only a local guide will help you in knowing all the details about those astronomical instruments which are installed there... So In my advice there's no use of visiting this place without a guide

Name: JayeshLC
Title: Not a must visit
Review: You can avoid this site if you are not interested in astrology and do not have the knowledge about galaxy and universe.

Name: mayank k
Title: quite good place to visit
Review: interesting place , historical visit ....one can really learn a l√≥t about ancient architecture and methodologies the way they used to find accurate time , star signs etc

Name: Where_to_travel_next
Title: Many structures to look at
Review: Very interesting to see all the different structures to read time, astronomy instruments.  I believe around 13 or so built around 1723.

Name: Vinay B
Title: Must visit place in Jaipur
Review: Very interesting..specially my kids who are around 10 years was a good experience for them. The local guide was very fluent in English and explained very nicely

Name: Arnab_phenomenon
Title: Must visit UNESCO World Heritage Site !
Review: The¬†Jantar Mantar (literally meaning 'Calculating Instrument') is a collection of 19 architectural astronomical instruments built by Raja Sawai Jai Singh the 2nd, the founder of the city of Jaipur. Completed in 1734, the UNESCO World heritage site features the world's largest stone sundial. It is a well maintained site and is a must-see tourist spot.

Name: CCC
Title: Interesting Finds
Review: A must see. Very interesting to see inventions of years ago. Reasonable entry fee. Takes about an hour to view.

Name: VINITGADRE
Title: World Heritage Site
Review: The Jantar Mantar located near City Palace Jaipur is a collection of nineteen architectural astronomical instruments built by the Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh I, the founder of Jaipur, Rajasthan. The monument was completed in 1734. It features the world's largest stone sundial, and is a UNESCO World Heritage site.You need a guide to tell you about all those astonishing large instruments.

Name: Vinay K
Title: The real jaipur
Review: Place where u can see real jaipur and what jaipurs art from a long time in history , timing information is available.on the site please check before visiting

Name: Meander With Mer
Title: A surprisingly interesting and educational  experience!!
Review: Science as a subject in school was never really my thing, but I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this site.  It was like an ancient science experiment come to life.  Built between 1727-34 AD it has a noteworthy collection of traditional astronomical instruments.  I recommend a guide as most of the items would be impossible to determine what they are/were or used for.  If science isn't your thing the angles and geometry if the instruments also make them very photogenic, the while place was a great unexpected surprise for me.  I wish we had had more time there.

Name: Rajas
Title: Great
Review: Best observatory in the world & very well maintained. Here I came to know that in old times how people knows the time

Name: PhilthetravellerXI
Title: Fantastic experience of early science.
Review: This site is a must when you are in Jaipur but do take a tour otherwise it is near impossible to understand the complexities and science of the site. It is the largest observatory in India. We were expecting to see telescopes but the area is dedicated to shadows and movements of the sun and stars with shadows cast as the sun moves around at various times of the day indeed months and year. It is amazing how the early Indian scientists, going back 300 years, were able to document and predict times and locations based on the solar system. Horoscopes are catered for and all the astrological signs are there. To look at the park it appears more of an amusement or architectural centre until one has the explanations  about the geometry and lines of shadows and light. Quite amazing. A modest entry fee applies and we took a pre-booked tour which lasted around an hour. It is also worth buying the guidebook which explains more about the science and history of the observatory.

Name: Alice L
Title: Interesting but 'not my cup of tea'
Review: A set of 19 massive astronomical instruments built by the Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh II.  It is a very educational site, as each piece is unique and has its own purpose such as measuring time & predicting eclipses. There are not much shady area, be sure to wear a hat, put on sunblock, and bring a bottle of water.

Name: Exploration276081
Title: Educational
Review: The most widely known astronomical sites in the world are the observatories of Maharaja sawai jai singh (1688-1743) of india . T he observatories with their monumental instruments, built in the early 18th century,have fascinated the scientists and layman alike more than 300 years. What  makes them fascinating that they were built in a day and age when astronomy had ceased to be medieval, and great strides had been made in devolopment in Europe.Newton already had published  in 1685 his PRINCIPIA which provided a solid basis for the theoritical aspect of celestial mechanics,In 1656,HUYGENS invented pendulum clock for accurate time keeping. John Flamsteed published  his  calibrated catalog of stars with unprecendented accuracy of + 10 of arc.micrometer and crosswire fitted telescopes were a common sight in observatories.      Jai singh, unware of devolopments in Europe. erected naked eye instuments of masonary and stone,in the tradition of medieval astronomers such as Ulugh Beg. Jai singh's instruments still exist at Jaipur, Delhi,Varanasi, and Ujjain.

Name: gundeep singh
Title: Jantramantra
Review: ¬†It features the world's largest stone¬†sundial, and is a¬†UNESCO¬†World Heritage site.It is located near¬†City Palace¬†and¬†Hawa Mahal.The instruments allow the observation of astronomical positions with the naked eye.The observatory is an example of the Ptolemaic positional astronomy

Name: AZCasualTraveler
Title: An Astrological Marvelous Place
Review: Jantar Mantar is like an outdoor museum or observatory with a collection of a number of astrological instruments that was built in about 1734.  One of the instruments happens to be the largest stone sundial in the world.  The Jaipur Jantar Mantar has been designated by UNESCO as a World Heritage Site.  It is interesting to walk around this area and see the different types of instruments for telling time and/or the movement of the earth - interesting!

Name: Skeney57
Title: Astronomy & Astrology
Review: These amazing creations were built for Sawai Jai Singh back in the mid 1700's and still work & function today. This site is the largest out of 5 that he had built ! He loved his star gazing I think ? A lot that I read & saw went over my head as maths was never my strong point but the brilliance that went into these time pieces & astronomical sights is stunning. Well worth a visit for sure !

Name: R1chardN
Title: An impressive collection of Astrological Instruments.
Review: We included this as part of our guided tour of Jaipur.  At the last minute our guide rearranged our itinerary as the day we were due to go was very overcast.  You get most benefit from the sun dials when it is sunny! It is a UNESCO World Heritage site and houses two large sundials, accurate to two seconds, and a wide collection of other 18th century astrological instruments. Our guide explained how each worked - it is simply incredible.  The instruments were all built on this site - they have not been moved to get everything at one location.You need a good guide to understand the importance of astrology in Hindu life.  for example it is still used today for business, politics and assessing the compatibility in marriage arrangements.This an intersting collection and a must for any visit to Jaipur.

Name: MWandAW
Title: Unexpected interest
Review: Jantar Mantar is an astronomical observatory used to measure the distances and positions of celestial objects. This monument was completed in 1734. It consists of 19 large instruments each serving a very specific purpose. The most significant among these is the Samrat Yantra which is the largest sundial in India. My wife and I visited this tourist attraction as part of our luxury tour of India. We are so glad we could see all of these scientific instruments with their amazing accuracy. We learnt about the significance of the zodiac. Our private guide explained about the workings of many of the instruments and the commentary proved to be quite interesting.  A visit to this monument to astronomy and astrology is highly recommended.

Name: kstephiek
Title: Unlike anything I have seen before
Review: My husband and I were glad we added this stop onto our list. It is a collection of huge astronomical instruments that make up this observatory. The size of the sundial alone was very impressive. Watch out for random people who will walk up to you and offer a tour - and then want money.

Name: DP1066
Title: An impressive collection of astrological instruments.
Review: A UNESCO World Heritage site, the site includes a large sundial, accurate to two seconds, and other 18th century astrological instruments.  This collection is impressive both for its demonstration of scientific knowledge at the time and also its construction.

Name: annehA4231CL
Title: glorious afternoon
Review: i did not know what to expect of this but really enjoyed the visit on the most beautiful afternoon, sky blue and such an interesting place to explore all laid out in a delightful way. There was a video in english explaining the background in the information centre and explanations on the exhibits themselves. All quite fascinating.

Name: ABDESH
Title: Excellent place
Review: Jantar Mantar is an astronomical observatory used to measure the distances and positions of celestial objects.It has many  architectural astronomical instruments.It is UNESCO World Heritage site. We can see many unknown Mathematical and Scientific Collection.

Name: mikef888au
Title: For the budding astrologist
Review: An amazing collection of sundials under differing formats, and some linked to the zodiac. There are "guides" available for tour, however are very expensive. 250 rupee entry fee, and another 250 for the short tour. Take your time of birth also, and you'll get a "reading" of your attributes....LOL.

Name: PRASAD S
Title: A great place to visit.
Review: Jantar Mantar is a sort of a lab of the ancient astronomy scientists where various experiments were carried out. I was astounded to see the various things these great minds built to forecast astronomical events. I highly recommend to have a guide while visiting this monument. A must see for anyone visiting Jaipur.

Name: David63Johns
Title: Amazing place
Review: This is an astonishing scientific piece of construction. It shows how measurement of time and seasons developed and has the biggest sun dial in the world that measures time to 2 second accuracy - not bad for a pile of stone work

Name: gfsc5
Title: Astronomy
Review: This place is heaven for lovers of astronomy and sundials.  The observatory has been in place for many years and contains some amzing pieces.  A sundial accurate to within two minutes, for example!  Great to do a tour with a guide as they will be able to explain in detail what the various pieces are for.  Our guide threw in some astrological readings which were very interesting.Probably more for the officianado than your everyday tourist.

Name: Ajai Atal
Title: A True Marvel
Review: Anyone interested in Astronomy  just has to spend time here and see and understand this amazing observatory. It's a one of a kind anywhere. It's all the more amazing considering it was build nearly 300 years ago. A Must see of Jaipur. Youngsters would do well to experience this place.

Name: Pankaj
Title: Best city
Review: Very good view and good for photographery and food also very good like the city as well people are very nice with tourists

Name: MamaT23
Title: For all you horoscope lovers
Review: This observatory is truly phenomenal. Answers of  questions about astronomy and astrology. Just the fact that this was invented 300 years ago with no up to date technology and skill , is what makes this even more fascinating.For  horoscope and astrology lovers.. make sure you have a guide to explain to you how they can read your sign, personality and use these devices to give you a compatibility match with different signs. Such a fun stop.

Name: Linda L
Title: Group visit
Review: We visited this on a group tour at the end of a long day.We had a guide explaining everything in addition to our own guide.Some people found it interesting however I didn't to be honest but that is purely a personal taste.I did appreciate how the various displays worked and the grounds were nice.There is also a coffee shop.

Name: Masher
Title: Proud of our Heritage
Review: We visited the place as one of the places of Tourism. It was an experience which can not be described in word's. It's an Engineering and Astronomical marvel from the ancient times. Anybody who is interested in our Civilization, must visit and spend a good amount of time. Make sure you have a good Guide.

Name: Zebanuck
Title: Go with a guide who knows
Review: This is a great place to go if you‚Äôre into science or astronomy but you really need a good guide who can explain what all the devices are.

Name: Wen-D K
Title: Mind blowing
Review: Truly mind blowing to think these instruments of astrological measurement were designed some 300 years ago and are still accurate. Fascinating place.

Name: Dennis P
Title: An interesting masonry observatory
Review: These stone intruments from over 300 years ago were built on the inspiration of the young Maharaja Jai Singh who was passionate about astronomy. While it was fascinating to find out that a huge stone sundial could measure the accuracy of time to within 3 seconds in in all honesty became a bit bored with all the contraptions and went to find a place to sit in the sun while awaiting the rest of the group.

Name: Morris
Title: Even if you're not interested in astronomy this place is mind blowing!
Review: Sun dials have always interested me but seeing this collection of every size(some 5 feet tall up to as tall as a three story building), shape and style of object used to measure the earths movements is truly astounding. We did have a guide to explain each structure and how and what it measured with the earths movement so I"m not sure it would have been as informative on your own.

Name: Steven_Teo
Title: Marvel the ingenuity of old
Review: If you are interested in history, astrology, or anything that has to do with timekeeping, this is the place to visit. Then you will need a guide to take you through this amazing place. I could not help but marvel how the scientist of old could figure out all the contraption in this place.

Name: SalimM
Title: Just an amazing place
Review: The Jantar Mantar was constructed by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II who from a very young age was fascinated by the movement of the celestial objects.  He built five of these of which the one in Jaipur was the biggest.The Jantar Mantar in Jaipur consists of 19 large instruments each serving a very specific purpose. The most significant among these is the Samrat Yantra which is the largest stone sundial in the world and is now also a Unesco heritage site.The instruments at the Jaipur Jantar Mantar are made of stone and are very large structures. To ensure accuracy the structures were first made out of wood and the measurements were adjusted. Once the dimensions were perfected the construction was replicated in stone to give us the magnificent Jantar Mantar.To fully appreciate the wonders here, you really need a guide who can explain what is what so you can see exactly how they work. Absolutely jaw dropping to see that these instruments were build over 300 years ago.

Name: Hardeep N
Title: Feat of science
Review: Personally I found this to be quite interesting because I had a tour guide with me, who was able to explain what the different parts were and how they would have been used when first created. I do question how interesting I‚Äôd have found some of this without a guide. In any case, a lot of what you see is a feat of mankind and how it has created, and that‚Äôs worth the ticket price if nothing else.

Name: SallyRY
Title: Interesting
Review: Interesting for a quick look around with amazingly accurate sundials. Unless you have a particular interest in the history of time telling though it will not take too long to see.

Name: Iqbal M
Title: Great
Review: Jantar mantar is jaipur one of the historic place for space lovers i totally loved the science items there

Name: Enkhtuya
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: the arts inside these buildings are breathtaking. real masterpieces. i would stare and admire them for hours.

Name: Prasad M
Title: Amazing monument
Review: This place is amazing.  It is simply jaw dropping.  How could kings of olden days construct such civil structures in stone, marble and bricks with such accuracy.  Absolutely precise astronomical calculations with such huge structures! Their knowledge of astronomy is truly remarkable.  In fact, the guide could tell the time by showing the shadow of a static object, accurate to the minute.  You can check your watch. This more extensive than the one in Delhi.  A lot more insreuments.

Name: KKaran
Title: Amazing
Review: It was a very interesting and amazing to see how people in old time use these things to find time & solar syar

Name: Vivienne M
Title: Astronomy and Astrology lovers dream site!
Review: Very interesting. Especially if you‚Äôre a follower of astronomy or astrology. 19 fascinating astronomical instruments with the largest sundial in the world, it‚Äôs a UNESCO world heritage site. Quite fascinating.

Name: emanmahmoud1
Title: Boring+++++
Review: This visit was part of our G Adventure golden triangle one week guided tour. You can only visit if you like astrology or astronomy. You need the sun to understand the demo but our day was extremely cloudy and dull. Our guide was like a physics or maths teacher giving us lesson and quizzing us as if we were school kids. The photos on tripadvisor are photoshopped, the place is pale and bland. Not my cup of tea.

Name: Fraser66
Title: Biggest Sundial in India
Review: This is an observatory with the biggest sundial in India. Our guide explained in detail how each part of the observatory functioned and how the dials and timings worked.The astronomers in those days were so clever to work out how to read time and seasons as well as the zodiac.Worth a visit if you like science

Name: Philip P
Title: Interesting to intriguing visit.
Review: Once more, please take a guide (at least an audio guide)! I paid about 25-30 ‚Ç¨/USD for 4-5 hours and several monuments, not more, and it give not only valuable info but also spares time at ticket offices, ...This observatory looks attractive but you need the sun (what we missed), some time, and preferable some basic info about astrology (what I miss...) rather then of astronomy.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Ancient scientific place
Review: We visited this place with kids, as they had learnt about Jantar mantar in school books. we wanted to experience first hand, how in olden days they used to calculate time using sunlight. Good informative and learning center for all public.

Name: Akshay
Title: A good place to visit in Jaipur
Review: If you're from other city..then this should be in your bucket list when you are planning to go Jaipur.You should also visit City Place which near to this place.

Name: Kamlesh N
Title: Informative
Review: If you are a science student its a must to visit place in Jaipur. Quite informative and really amazing science. Take a guide to understand.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Great place to visit and see ancient systems
Review: Fasciniting visit to the place, a guide is a must as he/she will walk you through wih various system. It is built with seconds precision, where based on Sun and Moon movement, one can check the time and predict the horroscope.

Name: Richard B
Title: Wonderful outdoor astronomy and sculpture park
Review: A must see for anyone who loves science and art.  Built in 1726 this is a beautiful display of both abstract  sculpture and accurate astronomy measuring devices.  A remarkable synthesis of art and science

Name: Philip_Marsh
Title: Quirky
Review: If I hadn‚Äôt been told that it was an observatory I would have guessed that it was a sculpture park. The site houses a series (19) of architectural astronomical instruments built by Maratha Raipur King Sawai Jai Singh II. These were completed in 1734. When their functions are explained they make sense but don‚Äôt ask me to repeat the explanation.Most visitors seemed to be somewhat bemused.As it‚Äôs located in the centre of Jaipur then it‚Äôs worth a visit whilst you are there.

Name: Paulo
Title: Incredible
Review: A most incredible place  to visit as we had a friendly guide .Nice to know about old way of calculating time.

Name: Aikenfans
Title: Do not miss seeing this absolutely amazing astronomical observatory, next to the City Palace!!!  Get someone to explain.
Review: This place is unbelievable!  It is amazing how it was designed, and constructed - and with such accuracy.  You need to find someone to explain it to you.  It is really worth your time!Prepare to be astonished!Don't miss seeing this!

Name: abhishek telang
Title: Stunning scientific observatory!
Review: This place is a large solar observatory with massive tools to accurately read the time. Jantar Mantar proves the scientific astronomical prowess of the great Rajasthani Maharajahs!It‚Äôs a must visit place!

Name: postal49740
Title: Very Observational
Review: Incredible sundials and quite a Park. Well worth a visit. Loved all the cool displays   Early science is fascinating for sure

Name: Kate R
Title: OK
Review: To make any sense of it you will need a guide to explain how each part works.I personally found it boring and would have preferred to opt out of this tour.Very popular with the locals as they put a huge influence on their astrological readings when entering into arranged marriages.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: good place to visit
Review: its one the unique place to visit there is a BIG sun dial and apart from sun dial there are many other observatory instruments works on sun,air and wind directions are available there

Name: David D
Title: Probably the most iconic sight in Jaipur.
Review: The Hawa Mahal is a beautiful and iconic sight. It is a series of 365 latticed windows created in a harmonious whole soaring up from the streets. It was to enable the ladies of the palace to gaze out into the town rather than being entirely secluded. It is well worth seeing. Be advised though that there are a lot of tourist shops on this street.

Name: Raghav
Title: Magnificent
Review: An extremely beautiful site . I love the windows of Hawa Mahal. It is so magnificent. In the night it so Adorable

Review: Agree this is a landmark but very poorly managed. You can click pics from outside and inside tour can be skipped. Single ticket window. Long queue. Nah. You can miss it.

Title: Best viewed at night
Review: This is the landmark of Jaipur and a must visit. The place is the heart of the city and many other attractions are just near by.Even few of the best markets are at walkable distance.

Name: Arun Mani Kanta Gunda
Title: Superb
Review: It is the must visit place in Jaipur ,the architecture had no words to explain, really excited seeing this place energy is cool

Name: Vijit B
Title: Where and when of nice photo short
Review: Nice place for photo, shopping around.The best time for photo is early morning 6-7 am, which no people on road infront of it. The afternoon time is peak clouded, should go to the roof top Cafe in the opposite site ( Tatto Cafe) you will get stun view for portrait.

Its now only accessible to be observed from the outside roadside and to take photos. In the nighttime the lighting provides an awesome sight. Having a pre-arranged guide to provide the history and context is recommended.

Review: Beautiful Hawa Mahal in Jaipur located in the Jaipur city.its very old palace now only accessible from outside to take photos and shoot.inside they are not allowing.the beauty is more in the night as looks awesome in night with the lighting.its near city center. There are other famous places nearby hawa mahal.you can easily get rikshaw for 20 or 30‚Çπ for tour and other places to visit.You can see detailed information in my video

Name: AJAYAERON
Title: Historical Marvel

We didn't venture inside as people told us it could get very crowded in narrow passageways and there wasn't much to see past the facade. You can get some geat photos from cafe's across the street

Title: Huge and beautiful at night
Review: Hawa mahal is located centrally and is a huge structure with many windows making it extremely breezy! Right outside of the hawa mahal is street shopping that I found more interesting. The road is normally having traffic jam throughout and it‚Äôs best to take an auto when visiting this place as parking can get tedious There are caf√©s on the opposite side of the road that offer good balconies for clicking pics

Name: tarun9369
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: Most people didn't know that Hawa Mahal can be seen from inside also...and it's not just a wall of jharokhas but more than that...entry ticket is rs 50 for Indian adult...you can go to various towers but the stairs are very narrow and only one side entry is allowed so be ready for waiting time...once you get at the top u can see various parts of old jaipur including the amer fort and fort walls stretching across the hills....

Title: Gorgeous facade and story

Name: Mumtaazrs
Title: Simply stunning.
Review: Awesome and stunning monument, very much in the heart of the pink city. Specially in the night when it is fully lit up. Don't miss this place.

Name: singhasam
Title: Striking frontage
Review: WHEN I first saw Hawa Mahal I couldn't believe how bright, sharp and colourful the frontage was.It is also known as Palace of Wind or the Wind Palace and was built in 1799 from red and pink sandstone.I haven't counted them all but it is said to have 953 small windows decorated with intricate latticework for the ladies of the time to look out on passing life without being seen.The palace itself is a five-storey pyramidal structure the top three floors of which have the width of a single room while the first and second floors have patios in front of them.But it was the striking colours of the frontage I will remember. Definitely worth a visit despite the contrast between the palace and nearby heaps of rubbish.

Title: Hawa at hawa mahal
Review: An historical place but believe me what has been done to it and its surrounding. You have local vendors just sitting in front and around, highly polluted and difficult to approach.

Name: Aditi

Name: Tsturgess
Title: Beautiful building
Review: Best to go early in morning as gets crowded in front later on, it's just something to amaze at, you cannot go insideBeautiful building

Name: kim buay p
Title: Gorgeous pink city
Review: I did a guided live stream walking tour of the pink city of Jaipur with Dilip from Heygo.He was an excellent guide who taught us so much about Jaipur's history, architecture and way of life. After independence in 1947, Jaipur was made the capital of the newly formed state of Rajasthan. He explained why the buildings are all painted pink in the old town.  The city was painted pink to welcome HRH Albert Edward, Prince of Wales (who later became King Edward VII, Emperor of India), in 1876.  Many of the avenues still remain painted in pink, giving Jaipur a distinctive appearance and the epithet Pink city.   Even the buses are pink.  We also noticed that there are no policemen or traffic lights guiding the traffic on the roads but it works well among the citizens.  There was much honkings but it was not due to impatient drivers. It is just a way of life for the drivers to greet each other.  He showed us beautiful pink roadside buildings where the shops are on the ground floor while the businessmen and their families live upstairs.  He also mentioned that ladies in Jaipur like to dressed in bright colours to make up for lack of colour in the desert part of Jaipur.Even the street lamp posts are lovely.  When we reached the majestic and gorgeous Hawa Mahal, he explained that the facade with lattice windows were for the royal ladies to view the street processions without being seen.  There are many windows as in the past the Maharajas had many wives.  The pink colour for buildings is mandatory for the common people.  Dilip kindly allowed us to take very good postcard shots of Hawa Mahal.  However this rule did not apply to the Maharaja as we noticed the entrance to his Palace is not painted in pink.He also pointed out the flowers market near the temples as the flowers are used as offerings to the God,  Popular colours are red (which symbolises energy) and yellow (knowledge and wisdom).

Name: Vivek k aggarwal
Title: Amazing
Review: Very nice experience and too windy ! Loved this architectural excellence! Would like to visit more often to this place.

Name: Dulichand S

Name: Neha Jadhav
Title: Must Visit Place In Jaipur!
Review: Jaipur's Most-Distinctive Landmark "The Hawa Mahal" Or "Palace Of Winds" ‚ù§Ô∏è‚óæLet me tell you few facts about "Hawa Mahal", 1. It has 953 jharokhas (windows).2. It is extraordinary pink-painted, delicately honeycombed hive that rises a dizzying five storeys.3. The most shocking and interesting fact about Hawa Mahal is that this five story palace has no foundation. And it's considered to be world's tallest building without any foundation.4. It has no direct entrance. It's built on an edge of the city palace because it was built as a part of it.

Review: Good place to go with family and friends, very beautiful at night, must visit if going to jaipur ...

Name: rahilpanja
Title: Beautiful and simply spell bounding
Review: Don‚Äôt take this attraction less serious. Climb up the top and experience pink city - Jaipur views. Looks fantastic from outside, especially in the evening time.

Name: kashy08
Title: Beautiful
Review: Yes this place is amazingly beautiful... you can't get enough of it... mesmerizing view from inside and outside. A place you must visit if you are in the city.

Name: Jason Roy
Title: An Incredible Building.
Review: This is very nice but busy area of Jaipur. But worth taking the time this is an architectural wonder. The ambience inside    is Royal. you feel like a king walking inside the whole palace is visible from the rooftop cafe opposite to it.reminds you of the rich history of the place .A must visit place for all the history freaks. Fantastic experience in Jaipur city...

Name: AmitGanatra
Title: Amazing
Review: The cleanliness was good and the ticket prices was even good. The staaf was also supportive. We would recommend this. The place is very good

Name: ANIL SEN VERMA
Title: Anil Sen Verma
Review: Landmark of Jaipur Rajasthan Pink City,,,,an old building, Architecturaly strong message of friendship with natrue and air,,,a must visit and experience the air flow as well as the Architecture

Name: Nandini
Title: Visual treat by night
Review: During the day, due to hustle bustle and over crowded streets , you might not enjoy jostling through the crowd., I ceretainly did not enjoy that. Also, in that area, all shops have their names in Hindi which I think is unfair as you cannot expect all to read the names only in that official language.  The same area once the shops close is a visual treat. It was lit up and it can blow away your sense. The only jarring point was the huge banner displayed with the covid instructions and the CM's face.  That for tourists, that was an eye sore.  The illumination though , takes away all the negative aspects

Name: Exploration276081
Title: Wonder of Indian  architecture
Review: Palace of winds , a palace built by Maharaja Praatap singh in the year 1799 a.d.. I came to know during my visit that the palace which normally think and see is in fact the backside of the building , the frontside  is entered through Tripolia bazar and than we reach to a courtyard known as Rajendra hazari guards  now office of Jaipur Nagar Nigam. The Palace could be entered through a gate and than through a rampart could reach to the top to see the overlooking view of hawa mahal baza. I was told by our guide that the palace has 945 latticed windows  from where the ladies of the royal court could see the processions without being seen by public. I was also told by our guide that the widows have been built only with the help of lime only and there is no use of stone or bricks. The architecture is like a peacock feather because the Maharaja was devoted to Lord Krishna and peacock feather is the crown of lord Krishna.

Name: travelnomadNZ
Title: Stunning Sight Hawa Mahal
Review: Hawa Mahal - Palace of the Wind was stunning. I saw it by day on an Intrepid Tour. I believe it would be amazing by night. The road and traffic was very busy so we didn‚Äôt stop long.Hint: make sure you have a guide familiar with Hawa Mahal so they can explain the history. Suitable footwear and clothing. A good camera (video option) and sunglasses.

Name: Naresh Kumar
Title: Looks awesome by night
Review: One should make an additional trip by night to see it dazzle from outside, with the brilliant lighting.

Name: Arnab_phenomenon
