Title: Beautiful from outside.
Review: Hawa Mahal or The Palace of Winds was completed in 1799 and is made up of red and pink¬†sandstone. This popular tourist spot that you see in my pictures is actually the back of the palace. I didn't go inside, didn't need to, coz the view from outside is good enough :-) lovely place for a photo op. The shops on the other side of the Palace are worth visiting for clothes/accessories shopping

Name: DOUG and NIKI
Title: Secret Instagram Location!
Review: What an amazing place for the best Instagram pics!  We have some secret locations but you are going to have to reach out to us or check out our videos for that info.

Name: Roney B
Title: The wind palace
Review: Hawa mahal is a landmark of the pink city Jaipur. It is situated in the heart of the city attracts people from the main road....

Name: CCC
Title: Beautiful Sight
Review: Beautiful architecture in Jaipur. Perfect for taking photos. Drive by sight. Takes a few minutes to view.

Name: Satish Charanpahari
Title: Historical architecture
Review: Wonderful historical architecture monument, these are the assets of Rajasthan. Jaipur is famous for HAWA MAHAL.

Name: Coastal826245
Title: Hawa@mahal
Review: i think one should visit jaipur in rainy season when wecwere on top of hawa mahal. the view of jaipur was outstanding. When the winds blows in these jharakos. it feels lovely

Name: Virus King
Title: Pride of of the Pink City - Jaipur
Review: One of the most famous tourist destinations in Jaipur, Hawa Mahal, also known as the palace of wind, is one of the most prominent attractions in Jaipur

Name: lokendra singh shekhavat
Title: Mesmerising view
Review: Oh god what a view such an epic piece of art. Reminds us how talented were those artists who built it.

Name: Vinay K
Title: Heart of jaipur
Review: Located at rhe centre of jaipur a palace where u can find history and art of manufacturing builduings , hows at that time king has done this work

Name: RosemarieNorth
Title: Exquisite
Review: Although you get a sense of the palace from the road, it‚Äôs only by exploring behind the facade that you get a sense of this truly wonderful building. Make sure your phone is charged - this is one of the most photogenic palaces I‚Äôve ever visited.

Name: David D
Title: The palace of the old rulers and the current residence of their descendants.
Review: The City Palace is still occupied by descendants of the rulers of Jaipur. The palace is not run by the government and thus the prices are rather higher here than for other attractions in Jaipur. The palace has some impressive rooms and buildings. It is worth taking a guide here, as the stories are not obvious to outsiders. The huge silver jugs are said to be the biggest in the world, and were used to transport water from the Ganges for the ruler to drink while on a trip to England. There are painting and cashmere workshops in the building and these have generally good quality items for a reasonable price, however you should not feel pressured into buying anything. Overall, definitely a place worth seeing while in Jaipur.

Name: Trudy W
Title: Felt ripped off
Review: I had a terrible experience with my official guide thats why i give it a 1 star as it left me feeling ripped off.The palace it a small area to view but it is opulently beautiful. The inner courtyard has four doors which are lovely. You can only take photos in the courtyards not inside the buildings.My guide cost 400 for an hour. He was very rushed, then just over half an hour he took me to the tourist shop. I did not want to go but he said its part of the tour. In i went expecting exactly what was going to happen. Sat on the stool. Listen to the guy ramble on about pashminas and threading them through a string. Then lighting a thread and having to smell in. Then the hard sell. Buy this buy that. Buy something for your friend. This is the cheapest place in Jaipur. So out of curiosity asked how much the bed sheets were. As it turned out i had bought them much less in Udaipur in the local market. It was a tourist rip off. Came out the store annoyed. My guide was already getting the next customers. Came up asked for the 400. He left straight away off to do the next people. I looked at the time and saw i had not had anywhere near an hour. Went back to the main gate to complain. They checked my ticket and said i had not been taken to the weapon section. They said they could take me but after the tourist shop i was to annoyed and very upset with being ripped off i left. Not good.  Would i advise a guide. if you got my one then No.

Name: exploredaunexplored
Title: Culturally rich
Review: It seems when the king is in the palace, there are two flags hoisted and when he's out then only one flag. Beware of the artisans selling their art. It's good to see but exorbitant to buy. I got tricked into buying one. The museum a shop has much better stuff. City palace is full of colors. The gates depicting the four seasons - wow! So pretty and intricate work of art. There's a painting gallery as well but you can't take photos. To visit the blue mahal you have to pay extra.

Name: Sumesh K
Title: The Way the roayls are living
Review: Our first time in Jaipur and part of tour we visited the city place , it is a good place and while understanding the history it is really worth to visit. But they charge INR 3000 to visit inside and top of the city palace , which we feels that it is exorbitently high compare to the similer experances in India. So please be careful on that part while you are visiting this place

Name: Woodstag
Title: Jaipur Royal Palace must visit
Review: Highly recommend visiting the City Palace where the Royal Family still resides which has wonderful architectural buildings which contain the long history of the royal family dynasty, of ornate clothing, drawings and furniture. Within the grounds there are caf√© and restaurant to enable to enjoy the grounds.

Name: Leigh Hammerton
Title: City Palace - guided tour
Review: Highly recommended - very well informed and provides a fascinating insight into the history of the royal family and the City Palace - not to be missed while visiting Jaipur. It was a privilege to have Gajendra Hairpura as our guide.

Name: 123GYPSY
Title: Good place where lots of information
Review: We visited this place as a family with senior citizens and toddler - this place is very good and has information about how the kings led their life and displays their personal belongings too Just a point is that we booked a buggy thinking it will be easier for seniors but that Buggy wasn‚Äôt really needed - everything is walkable

Name: tarun9369
Title: Truly Royal
Review: City palace is in the old jaipur city...it is still resided by the royal family...there is parking available but it is prefered to get there by auto or e rickshaw....City palace, jantar mantar , hawa Mahal , local shopping area are all within walking distance...tickets are rs 300 for Indian adult and rs 150 for Indian student...Again the palace is very big and beautiful architecture....there r various sections and museum...u can also take a guide...approx two hours required....

Name: weiwei_sg
Title: An amazing peek into the lives of Maharajas
Review: We took the Royal Tour rather than the normal entry to the courtyards and galleries. The cost of INR 4000 per foreigner/INR 3000 per Indian resident compared to INR750 for the usual entry. The difference was access to the private residence and rooms not opened to the general public. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and catching a glimpse of how the Rajasthani royalty used to live. The demonstration of the sparkling lights at the Mirror Room, the opulence of the Golden Room, and the artistry of the Blue Room need to be seen to be believed. The guide was also knowledgeable and really added to the visit. It was well worth the cost.Pro Tip: students with documentary proof of student status and children below 12 pay INR 2000.

Name: Romain T
Title: Nothing special there
Review: Nothing special, after seing agra and Delhi this site feels expensive and not well maintained. I would recommend doing something else instead

Name: Wani Zahari
Title: A must visit place if you‚Äôre in Jaipur!
Review: A must visit place if you‚Äôre visiting Jaipur! A beautiful palace that is still quite well preserved. I was there with my family and we bought a private tour package, which also included visits to Jantar Mantar, Amber Fort, and a few other places. Our tour guide Satish was very knowledgeable (and he took really good photos! Highly recommended. Do contact him if you are looking for a tour guide:+91 98293 55664). We went when it was not the school holidays, so the crowd wasn‚Äôt that bad. But if you‚Äôre visiting during the holidays, I have heard that the palace can be quite crowded, so you may want to plan your visit earlier in the morning.

Name: Anirban Roy Gupta
Title: City Palace walk
Review: What a wonderful place of simple decor yet Royal feeling, MUST take a guide to listen to the rich history. Avoid buying in the shop inside

Name: R Goel
Title: A must visit place on a Jaipur tour
Review: It is a must visit place on a Jaipur tour. Sprawling place. Most of the exhibits display the lavish lifestyle of the kings and their families. The ticket is on the higher side, being a public property.Easy to access, being in the heart of the city..the city grew around it over the years. Many of the attractions such as Jantar Mantar, Hawa Mahal and Govind Dev ji temple are adjacent to our within walking distance of the palace.

Name: sayon s
Title: Best part of city spots
Review: Nice place to spend time if you like kings and stories. We took a guide but it was same was covered in the text in front of exhibits. There‚Äôs plenty to see . Keep time and preferably go early. After 12 it will be like a fair.

Name: santosh
Title: Good
Review: Beautifull place but entry tickets are costly , for one indian it is 300 and for foreigners it is just tripple , it should be affordable for every one .

Name: Suhas G
Title: Different museums here
Review: The different museums had Rjasthani textiles and clothes worn by palace inhabitants, jewelry they wore and the armaments they used.

Name: FlavourSeeker
Title: Not compelling enough, honestly
Review: Went here for a tour. The prices to get in are fairly high (400 for Indians, and 700 for foreigners), and there will be several people asking to be your tour guide, for a fee. In my opinion, this is not really necessary. The city palace is a very nice structure, but it seems that it has been allowed to deteriorate quite a lot, which is really sad to see. The artifacts are interesting as well, and the large silver bowls are impressive. You are not allowed to take photos inside, which is a shame, as the court or "Darbar" is photo worthy, but has not been preserved effectively. You are allowed to see some museum pieces, such as outfits worn by the various Maharajas, but there isn't enough in there to be very compelling. The private residence tours, which may have been more interesting are a steep price increase, at 3000 for Indians and 4000 for foreigners! I do not know if that aspect is worth it, as I did not avail of that.All in all, this could potentially be skipped.

Name: dr. Jijit
Title: Beware of traffic police
Review: Need two days to cover almost all if u have idea about wr to go. Beware of traffic police if ur vehicle is from other state  they bribe heavily even if u r upto date.food and stay are good and  average cost.

Name: Bebe
Title: A very beautiful palace
Review: My guide Gajendra Haripura was very informative, nice and very welcoming. Great talker and very friendly.

Name: Anita K
Title: Beautiful Palace
Review: Jaipur is a Tourist city, right from the driver to the guide everyone will tell you the story of the city and also guide you to the best places to shop.The City Palace is a beautiful palace worth paying the little extra, take a guide and visit the inside portions of the palace. It gives you an idea of how they used to live 300 years ago. The palace is well maintained and the Royalty still live in part of the Palace which is not open to visitors.

Name: ian m
Title: Another must-see in Jaipur.
Review: The palace and museum are well laid out and everything is explained very well I thought.A tesimony to what a family with both a huge ego and massive wealth does with their money. Witness the huge silver urns made to carry Ganges water all the way to England.

Name: Sophie U
Title: Worst place in Jaipur to visit as a tourist.
Review: Honestly the worst place to visit in Jaipur. This city has so much to offer and I only went to visit this place because of the reviews. How they were wrong. You pay more than double to visit as a tourist and they won‚Äôt even allow you to photograph most of the palace. Why? Because if they did people would realise there‚Äôs nothing to see here. Luckily my husband is Indian and can give me a real interpretation. So I‚Äôm telling you, do NOT come here. There‚Äôs nothing to see. You can pay the same to visit the amber fort or pay nothing to see the streets of Jaipur. But I promise you, the places you cannot photograph, you can only not photograph because there is nothing worth seeing and if the outside world knew this they wouldn‚Äôt bother coming. Just like I wish I hadn‚Äôt have.

Name: Shwetha
Title: Special palace
Review: Beautiful palace. The museum reveals a lot of insights into the royal family and their life. Paintings were fascinating. The largest silver pot is placed here for display..The Pritam nivas Is very impressive. Diwane e Aam was ao special.

Name: Roney B
Title: Royal tour
Review: Very good palace to visit.. Enjoy Royal city palace tour with us for the best feel. Witness the most beautiful part of City palace.

Name: DanWon74
Title: Nice palace (still in use) with good tour
Review: Had a very good guide to the palace sharing some background stories. The palace living quarters are closed to public but the tour offers many nice parts that are accessible to public. Impressive silver water tanks, armoury and cloth exhibition at guest house are a must. Much better than Hawa Mahal.

Name: Aparna
Title: Gorgeous and really interesting
Review: Didn't quite know what to expect from the City Palace, but it was really stunning. Particularly recommend some of the exhibits - could have spent hours at the art gallery. Do not miss the armoury, not so much for the displays of weapons as  the incredible painted frescos on the ceilings. For 3000 rs per head, you can also go see the residential parts of the palace where the royal family still live ( we didn't bother!). There's what looks like a nice restaurant in the Palace ( didn't try) and restrooms. Well worth the slightly expensive ticket.

Name: Noam B
Title: Some highlights, but generally speaking - a waste of time and money!
Review: After paying an exaggarated  foreighner's price of 700 Rupees we were first directed by the guards to one of the museum's shops, which made us angry. The Mubarak Mahal has nice architecture, and there is another museum's shop inside. There are some exhibits in the premises, but you are not allowed to take indoors photos despite the price you have paid. 2 costume-dressed guys told us to take photos with them, and then asked for tip, a behaviour that would have been accepted in the streets, but not inside a private palace. The huge silver urns are type of curiosity and the peacock-decorated arches in Pritam Chowk plazza are really impressive. The main palace is closed to regular visitors, but you can see some photos of the family, which not for this we meant to spend our time.Amber fort is much-much nicer. Visit city palace only if you have spare time (and money...)

Name: shwetarose
Title: Wheelchair accessible City Palace Jaipur
Review: Wheelchair Full Accessible City Palace of Jaipur. Hire guide for sure to know the entire site in detail. Very beautiful, very interesting.

Name: A_SK
Title: Absolutely must see this gorgeous palace, but we were disappointed!
Review: We were a group of five ladies who went to the beautiful City Palace for a tour. The Royal tour was an additional Rs. 3,000 per person for a ticket but that included a tour of the Royal quarters with the beautiful Lalique dining table that a few of us had seen before. Upon going in, while we did see the gorgeous Sheesh Mahal and  Neel Mahal (with our amazing personal guide we had taken there) we were told that since the Maharaja is at home we can‚Äôt see the other floors (including the dining room). We were all most disappointed. The Royal Grandeur tickets were not worth it at all. Overall, of-course the palace is a must see but either the tourist needs to be informed that the tour isn‚Äôt possible or price the tickets accordingly. Certainly not buy the tickets and then feel short changed.

Name: Stefan
Title: Not worth it
Review: Underwelming, overpriced, bad tour guide, unstructured, bad presentation of the few interesting objects and pictures not allowed anywhere inside.

Name: Texas2Wanderers
Title: Great Experience
Review: A complex of courtyards, gardens and buildings, the impressive City Palace is right in the centre of the Old City. The outer wall was built by Jai Singh, but within it the palace has been enlarged and adapted over the centuries. There are palace buildings from different eras, some dating from the early 20th century. Despite the gradual development, the whole is a striking blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture.

Name: Savita kumari
Title: Great architecture
Review: The architecture of the city palace is beautiful. A part of the palace has been converted into a private museum by the royals. The entrance fee is exorbitant but the collection inside is unique

Name: Adrian Kj√¶rran
Title: A fine tour
Review: Had a great tour with Gajendra haripura, a knowledgable guy that speaks great english! Thanks for the experience

Name: Travel with AJ
Title: unforgettable
Review: city palace of Jaipur  is also one of the major tourist spot. former royal family lives here and this palace is marvelous and galleries are excellent.

Name: VidPamsKris
Title: Great monument, let down by govt
Review: City palace entry ticket costs INR 300 per person amd is the most expensive entry fee for any Jaipur sight seeing location....and at that price, the facilities provided by the govt are dismal. There is no description anywhere, so you are at the mercy of a guide not knowing whether he is giving you the correct information or not. The museums have great collection of arms/paintings but there are no facilities for the visitors - No AC, rickety noisy fans that wont let you hear anything that guide is saying....no description anywhere...and lousy guards glued to the mobiles. Its clearly overpriced for what you get and not worth it at all.

Name: Aniket Patil
Title: Beautiful Palace
Review: Beautiful palace, amazing architecture must visit place in Jaipur. Take a guide to understand the history of the palace and king

Name: Kitty B
Title: Stunning Views
Review: The city Palace in Jaipur is so stunning. The pink city is definitely one of my favorite places I visited during my time in India, and the Palace is not to be missed. There is so much history, I would advise you go with a guide and they can tell you the rich intricate history of beautiful India and Jaipur.

Name: Gufran
Title: City place
Review: Everything is fine but the City place entry tickets is so expensive in side the place have very beautiful arts

Name: vivek0210
Title: The City Palace, Jaipur
Review: The City Palace is one of the must visit places in Jaipur. The entrance costs about Rs200. The other option is to  pay Rs.3000 to see the luxury and grandeur of the  private rooms of the palace.  The royal families in Rajasthan lived a very lavish and indulgent life surrounded by beauty, art, traditions and aesthetics. Every room, corridor, garden has a story. Always hire a guide while visiting any palaces in Jaipur.

Name: kevin g
Title: Outrageously expensive
Review: Way too expensive for foreign tourists.  $60USD for the palace and museum.  Hawkers everywhere and no photographs.  Save your time and money and see something else.

Name: Rajinder
Title: Jaipur
Review: Fabulous place for visit with friends and family. These mostly areas used as museums, provided for weddings and party functions. Cafe also available inside the palace. Great experience must visit once.

Name: Film G
Title: Not Bad, Not Terrific
Review: The building itself is interesting enough, and there are several small galleries/museums on site worth a look. Should you visit? Yes, but don‚Äôt expect to be wowed. Lousy toilets.

Name: Rimsha S
Title: Pam
Review: It‚Äôs really interesting place to see in Jaipur we‚Äôre you can see royal family I see art wow it‚Äôs amazing place also tickets

Name: indiatravel35
Title: Must visit place in jaipur
Review: Very well architect palace in jaipur located near jaipur main market. . It will taje 2 to 3 hours to cover this place. As per guide, king family still stay in one part of palace. Ticket cost is 300 per person

Name: drkakkar
Title: Must visit..Perfect blend of heritage and luxury
Review: Sheeshmahal, The Blue Room mesmerized us about the thoughtfulness of the construction and use of science in daily living in those times.

Name: froufroutravelling
Title: WHO CAN AFFORD IT?
Review: We were really disappointed. The museum includes some interesting displays, the courtyard and one nice interior hall for the VERY EXPENSIVE price of 700 rupees. But, to see any of the more opulent interiors, you have to pay the SHOKING amount of 3500 rupees !!!!!!!!! For a couple that would be 7.000 rupees !!!!!! We did not enter in the Palace, just the museum, and instead browsed through the photos in the internet.

Name: ajay
Title: Palace with royal family museum
Review: Very well maintained and clean palace though a bit expensive to shop and the entry is also on the higher side.

Name: Annapurna Nikam
Title: People are on tip of their toes to make you spend money on useless stuff by quoting art
Review: The place available for public viewing, which has entry fee of rs 200, is useless. The place very badly maintainedYou need to pay rs 3000 for visiting sheesh mahal with guide. It‚Äôs worth taking photos thereThen the guide forces you to the shopping centres inside the palace where they show you pashmina shawls and some Rajasthani dresses. These are of such low quality and the people here are looting the tourists like anything in the name of royal family trust. The price are 3 to 4 times higher and you can easy tell that from the quality of material.The people in Rajasthan are noted for making business, which is a known fact and are also noted for taking advantage of tourists and looting themes selling poor stuff. This is evident thought out the state.The Bandhu I sarees that you see in any city of Rajasthan have much better quality and are available in lesser price.

Name: George W
Title: A must stop while in Jaipur
Review: No trip to Jaipur is complete without a stop at one of its beautiful palaces, and my trip to City Palace was absolutely fantastic. Because of my tight travel schedule I didn‚Äôt have an entire day to spend exploring the palace and it‚Äôs rich history, but luckily my guide, Gajendra Haripura, was amazing and efficiently used all my allotted time to teach me about the history of the buildings, it‚Äôs royal family and we still had time to do some shopping in the artisans area and he was kind enough to be my Instagram photographer for some truly great photographs.

Name: Ajay Singh
Title: Great history but needs renovation
Review: Very rich tradition, awesome a royal architecture but needs immediate renovation.To start with parking area of the palace is no better then a sabzi mandi. It‚Äôs not even paved, forget about being with basic amenities. It‚Äôs very poor optics that outer courtyard is so badly kept.

Name: james
Title: Wow
Review: City palace of jaipur most beautiful palace in Jaipur. Our guide Abdul gived us right information about this place

Name: Eileen G
Title: Yet another beautiful Palace
Review: There is no shortage of palaces to see in India, and this is one of the best. We had a private tour guide who is a Jaipur native. He knew all about the buildings and the royal family.

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: One of the finest must visit places in Jaipur
Review: This is one of the major attractions of Jaipur. One needs minimum 2hrs to explore this palace. Better to engage a guide but tell the guide that he should not take you around in hurry as they generally do. Guide charges are fixed and displayed at the ticket counter. Better to visit in the morning session.

Name: Zibu
Title: City palace
Review: City palace of jaipur amazing. Lots of historical things there. All facilities were available there like guid restaurants.

Name: TSD64
Title: Royal tour
Review: There are two types of visits to this city palace, Jaipur. One costs Rs 200 and gives you an access to the museums while the other is the royal tour to the private parts of the palace and costs Rs 2000. I took the royal tour out of curiosity and had a guided tour of the golden room and the blue room among other things. Amazing experience with the guide helping you to click pictures of you in these grand rooms and sheesh mahal. One is made to feel like a royal. Amazing experience, albeit a bit too heavily charged for it.

Name: Shravan B
Title: Visit the place to know about the history,culture and traditions of the Jaipur Maharajas!!!
Review: This is a relatively small place compared to the other forts and palaces(Nahargarh,Jaigarh and Amer)It has just 3-4 hallways having exhibits of the Maharajas clothes,armoury,textiles etc and can be finished off in just 1-2 hrs .Recommended to hire a guide to explain the various artifacts and items on display

Name: Shakeer K
Title: Good place
Review: Good place. To see. To feel the real royalty of Jaipur.to feel how real Heritage of Rajasthan we are Luckey to have such a place in Jaipur

Name: Alexander Zingman
Title: It's OK
Review: During the trip of the I (Alexander Zingman) and Sarah Mark visited the city palce . It's Ok, but it is not as per my the expectation i think that there is totally a royal attire but it was absent. I thought they welcomed by royal traditions but  there is a single guard there. Photography is also not allowed in the city palace.

Name: Sunil Verma
Title: Amazing structure
Review: Amazing structure....beautifully done...surprised to see the engendering knowledge of our ancient scholars.

Name: Sid
Title: Worth a visit !
Review: My best was the armoury section - great display of weapons used which I had read about in history books. The courtyards were nice too.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Beautiful Palace
Review: The palace complex consists of several buildings, courtyards and galleries. Don't miss the two sterling silver vessels which are actually the world's largest sterling silver vessels. One hour is required to visit the entire complex. Photography is not permitted in some places.

Name: Jaipurtale
Title: Example of Jaipur Royal Fmaily
Review: Through visiting the Jaipur City Palace, you will be the example of the Jaipur Royal family. City Palace is such a great place to know about the history of Jaipur city. It includes halls, a library, an art gallery, kitchens, etc.

Name: ccpdm
Title: Royal Splendour Tour
Review: The tour is great if you want to see parts of the palace rather than just the Museum. Bear in mind that they do take you to the shops at the end of the tour and once there, it is quite a a hard sell. We did buy a few things and it was stuff we liked so no complaints but it‚Äôs good to bear in mind so you know what to expect.

Name: KALA Nikhil
Title: Must visit
Review: Situated within city premises.Entrance fee,guide charges were comparatively higher than other places.

Name: Prakhar M
Title: Must watch in Jaipur
Review: Visited this place with my family and it was damn too good. First thing first, do take a tourist guide. I know it sounds insane, but I am happy I took one and he makes the trip much better. He was knowledgeable, clicked some great family shots & shared multiple interesting as well as fun facts about palace & royal family.About palace, you have to walk good amount so please be prepared for the same. Have great history within it & showcase artefacts gifted to royal family. Artisan museum has some great purchase options as well with authentic handmade work.If you are in Jaipur, don't miss this....

Name: punz jain
Title: Princely palace.
Review: Right in the centre of old city jaipur this old palce still stand strong and high. Two entry gates.i suggest entering from jantar mantar side. Ur guide can suggest u on combo tickets.well manged by the royal family it is better than many other places. It needs restoration at some places.guide is amust if u hv small children. Royal horsecart ride with trumpets by ur side is also avlbl at seprate cost. Enough to see and listen to if one is genuinely inrested.

Name: JayeshLC
Title: Skip the Visit
Review: If you are interested in just seeing the old clothes and armory used by the Kings you can visit the Palace as it has not much history. There not much photo options here as inside the palace premises in the various rooms photography is not allowed. Also there are life size paintings of all the kings displayed in meeting room but again no photography. Guides are available, but you can bargain and in current situation a guide can be available for INR 100 and show you the palace in an hour.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Living Royal City Palace of Jaipur
Review: It's a living palace as the Royal family still live inside the palace. The king is 22 year young who was crowned few years back. The visitors can either visit the museum areas (entry fee Rs. 200) or to the selective palace area (Ticker Rs. 2,000).

Name: Gaurav M
Title: Pashmina & Jaipuri Rajai Fraud at Sovinour Shops
Review: We went there in Jan 2021 & our guide took us to this Sovinour Shop inside the city palace. They sell Jaipuri rajai & pashmina shawl stating that its made at Maharaj's factory itself & its a factory outlet. They started with 5000 but we were not interested then they gave us 25% discount stating that its due to covid. We bought Rajai & Shawl at 3300/- each. But these are definitely not worth the claims made by the shopkeeper. DO NOT BUY THESE.  If you really want to buy try reaching some of the real factories which are many in Jaipur. Buy from them directly.

Name: Barbara A
Title: A very good place to walk around
Review: Loved the building and the collection of textiles and weapons. We bought the total package and If I had to do it again I would only buy for this site

Name: Repertoire Events & Mice Pvt Ltd
Title: The Royal Adobe of His Highness of Jaipur
Review: The most amazing fact about this place is the Royal His Highness still resides here. You can book a room for an experience through air bnb. If I am not wrong it‚Äôs 10k USD a night. It has four quarters and huge vessels of silver in which Maharaja of Jaipur once took Ganga jal with him while he used to travel to foreign countries through ships. The palace cafe is a must visit. See the interior work, good silver ornaments, old clothing and fashion. Hire a guide it will be worth.

Name: Hemant Sharma
Title: One time visit
Review: The place will take you back 200-300 years. Things were well maintained. The weapon section is really great. 1 star off because there was no hospitality, like you feel in Jodhpur and other places in Rajasthan.

Name: rahilpanja
Title: Well maintained and good artefacts
Review: Place will take 2-3 hours to visit. Lot of information of all the kings of Jaipur. The currently royal family stays at inside of the palace. Gives detailed information of the lives of Jaipur kingdom. The best was Sabha Niwas, articulate painting and walls.

Name: Male Massage therapist
Title: Male massage therapist
Review: I was there to give massage to my client beautiful lady in her mid-40s perfect ambience to stay there and food are really very awesome especially you can try mutton korma very delicious staff of staff very friendly and cooperative located in the heart of the city

Name: Ananya Shree
Title: Great experience.
Review: The City Palace, Jaipur built by Maharaja Sawai Man Singh 2nd. There are huge entrance gates, beautiful doorways, murals, and enticing palaces of the Jaipur City Palace is worth a visit. The Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum, part of which is also open to the public. Entry fee for Indians: 75 Rs. Entry fee for Foreigners: 300 Rs.

Name: Rajesh Ranjan
Title: Nice experience
Review: Good to see that history of City and the royal family. Good experience. Good food at the restaurant Baradari.

Name: Priyanka C
Title: Nice place to visit if you are in Jaipur
Review: It is just opposite to Jantar Mantar. It has entry fee of 200INR. Nice palace.   Current king, Maharaja Sawai Padmanabh Singh of Jaipur still resides in city palace.

Name: Rajat
Title: Good place
Review: If you hire don't hire a guide, you can complete the visit in about 15 minutes but there are just a few information displays , so hiring a guide here would be wise as then you would understand what all is shown in the museum part or the palace complex..The tickets can be booked at the entry gate for the palace, and they are providing plastic handgloves  to every visitor due to Covid, with sanitizer dispensers scattered inside the area

Name: Arnab_phenomenon
Title: Beautiful Palace
Review: The City Palace was set up by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh the Second, around the same time he shifted  his residence & court from Amber to Jaipur. Jai Singh the Second is regarded as the founder of Jaipur. Until 1949 the City Palace was the ceremonial and administrative seat of the Maharaja of Jaipur.¬†The Palace has beautiful attractions like the beautifully ornate gates, especially the Peacock gate, the arms & armoury gallery, the hall of audience, the Sabha Nivas & the silver urn that contained holy Gangajal. This one's a must-see for anyone visiting Jaipur

Name: Anindita G
Title: Popular sightseeing
Review: It's okay not so great or any different from other fort museum you may completely skip it. If you go without a guide you can complete everything in 15 mins with a guide the same will be 2 hour affair ofcourse they will enrich you with the facts and history

Name: Exploration276081
Title: EXPENSIVE PLACE WITH LESS EXHIBITION
Review: For the price which they charge from the tourists is exhorbitant and not  value for money. A good collection of royal treasures but poor exhibition needs to be revamped. For the amount of tickets they should an art gallery to exhibit the best collection of original paintings of jaipur and moughal paitings. THE SILEH KHANA IS CLOSED PLACE AND VERY VERY HOT TO VISIT.tHIS COLLECTION ON GROUND FLOOR.

Name: &‚Çπ#Raavan&‚Çπ#
Title: Marvelous
Review: Marvelous place.. Really amazed to visit this place. I recommend everyone to visit here atleast once.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Beautiful Palace of the Maharajas of Jaipur
Review: The royal palace of the former Maharajas of Jaipur after they moved their capital from Amber to here. A very beautiful place, especially the Chandra Mahal and the Sarvato Bhadra courtyard.

Name: Jeana
Title: A Very beautiful Palace
Review: There was a group of middle age children dancing & singing on an outdoor stage when we 1st went in. They had a lot of chairs set up outside & we right away found a seat in the front. A boy played a guitar  & they had a keyboard off to the side. It was an enjoyable dancing  performance. Then we explored the beautiful palace. There were some ladies doing henna for a reasonable charge & we had our hands done in very pretty patterns that we both got to choose. We walked up to the top & the view was spectacular. I highly recommend seeing the palace.

Name: Meander With Mer
Title: It's Ok, but I think we just tried to squeeze too much in and we didn't enjoy it.
Review: I have been just palace, temple or building'd out by the time we stopped here on my tour, but I could have skipped it.  That also played into our decision to just do the "composite" tour.  While we enjoyed our brief visit there it just wasn't really what we were in the mood for by the time we got there.IF this is something you really want to see make sure you plan your day of sightseeing so you're not too tired like we were. I can understand why others really enjoyed their time there.

Name: Rajas
Title: Great
Review: One of the best museum I have ever seen in my life. What a collection of guns & swords they have. This is residence of Jaipur king also

Name: Prabhanshu
Title: Amazing Place
Review: We loved this place - great museums in the old palace rooms of arms, costumes and more. Huge silver urns for the water the Maharajah took to England with him - didn't trust foreign water! Lovely ornate doors. Huge durbar hall where the Mountbattens were enthroned. Fascinating place.

Name: Gl0balCitizen2013
Title: A great place to visit in Jaipur
Review: The City Palace of Jaipur is beautiful inside. It's Rajasthani architecture is all around to see and there are several museums one can visit. The textiles and garments that the kings and queens of Jaipur wore are quite interesting. There are also two gigantic silver containers that the Maharaja used to carry the holy water of the Ganga , all the way to the UK on his visits. It is a bit of a tourist trap and you will be pestered by guides. The little food kiosk had overpriced things and they didn't look appetising at all. The shop assistants are a bit on the rude side (read nice to foreigners whom they can fleece, than to the natives). At least you can take some very good selfies inside. We did the ordinary tour and not the more expensive Palace tour, where you can see the living quarters of the current Maharaja. I don't believe we missed out much, since I don't think that the special tour is value for money.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Tour Plus Shopping
Review: The City Palace in Jaipur is an exciting place to spend a couple of hours watching some of the historic artifacts and buy some authentic pieces of handicraft and fabric. It is very important to get a good guide in order to understand everything. One can even get inside the living quarters of the Royal Family by paying more.

Name: Smokey128
Title: Magnificent Architecture and frescos
Review: Loved this Building from the minute you enter through the Tripolia Gate, walking through a small variety of shops and then through the beautiful Virendra Pol flanked by carved elephants you come across the arched and colonnaded Murbarak Mahal which houses a lovely display of clothing worn by Royalty of the Mogul era. Stop of a lovely lunch in the shade of parasols at the newly opened Palace Cafe. Wonder around the hall where beautiful paintings are sold and then back through Virendra Pol to see the beautiful pink and white open courtyard displaying two huge silver urns. At the rear of the palace is another large courtyard where the ladies used to dance and this is flanked by four magnificent gates representing the season‚Äôs. Behind this courtyard you can see the Chandra Mahal where the Royal Family still live

Name: Cindy M
Title: SPEECHLESS VIEW!
Review: The art and architecture of this building shows through by day but the night show gives it a new radiance. A breathtaking experience that will leave you speechless.

Name: zegna
Title: Good for a quick visit
Review: This palace complex  is located in the hear of Jaipur and morning is the best time to visit as it get crowded towards the later part of the day.There are two sections to the palace and the first section entry is only INR 200 and the other more beautiful section requires seperate fee of INR 3500 as it is partly occupied by the royal family and entry restrictedThere are three palaces in jaipur two of which are repurposed to five star hotels 1)City palace2)Jai Mahal palace Hotel3) Rambagh palace HotelThere is also a photography point at the entrance which i found quite interesting as you can wear the tradition rajasthani headgear and click couple of photos and then pick it up while leaving the premises.A good restaurant and couple of gift shops are also inside the city palace .Noteworthy is the famous peacock doors and few other photography points within the premises  and the visit could take  one to two hours

Name: gundeep singh
Title: The place of artifacts
Review: It is in the pink city where many artifacts are placed ... also this is the place to must visit to get the though of the era of the kings and how they lived

Name: AZCasualTraveler
Title: Lovely Palace at Jaipur city center
Review: The City Palace of Jaipur was built by a Maharaja who had moved from Amber city to Jaipur in 1727.  This Palace is nicely constructed with some ornate architecture.  Located within the City Palace are several places of interest:   Chandra Mahal, Sarvatro Bhadra, Clock Tower and Mubarak Mahal.  Nice, historical place to visit while in Jaipur city center.

Name: Karen P
Title: So many beautiful doorways to admire with elegant staff to give information
Review: I loved slowly wandering around the rooms and alleyways of this palace complex but I found the cost of entering the palace itself a little steep. Happy to just view the architecture surrounding it.

Name: Skeney57
Title: Interesting Complex
Review: Some great buildings and continuing the pink theme this Palace has thankfully been retained and is a pleasant way to spend an hour or two exploring. Again no cameras in the main meeting hall but very interesting. Beware taking photos of the guards as they demand rupees afterwards ! I had nothing on me I'm afraid except Visa !

Name: MWandAW
Title: A Palace in the city
Review: Research shows that the City Palace of Jaipur was established at the same time as the city of Jaipur, by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II, who moved his court to Jaipur from Amber, in 1727. Until 1949, the City Palace was the ceremonial and administrative seat of the Maharaja of Jaipur. The Palace was also the location of religious and cultural events, as well as a patron of arts, commerce, and industry. It now houses the Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum, and continues to be the home of the Jaipur royal family.  My wife and I continue on our 3 week luxury tour of India by visiting this beautiful palace.  The time limited tour with a local guide included mainly external areas, with a few internal rooms and corridors.  We visited  late in the afternoon and many of the exhibitions were closing.  A nice museum, if you have the time to see the Hall of Audience, the Textile gallery, the Arms and Amour gallery,  the Painting and Photographic gallery and the Transport gallery.

Name: R1chardN
Title: Another magnificent Palace
Review: The magnificent City Palace is near the centre of Jaipur and dates back to the 18th century.  The Palace is still lived in - the living quarters are sealed off.The Palace is beautifully decorated and houses an exquisite textile museum and displays of armoury and art exhibits.  It is a large Palace with many buildings and with the help of the pictures it is possible to imagine the pomp and pageantry of the life of the ruling classes.There is also a gallery where local artist are working and will create some bespoke art for you or you can but one they 'made earlier'.This is an essential visit for anyone touring Jaipur.

Name: DP1066
Title: An interesting collection of textiles and arms
Review: Right in the centre of the old city, the palace complex now houses two museums with a collection of costumes and textiles and arms. The guards in traditional dress are more than happy to be photographed for a small consideration (INR100).  At the end of the tour one of the guards showed us how to put on a turban.

Name: InnaYYZ
Title: Lavish lifestyle of past Kings of India
Review: Well worth a visit to this awesome museum palace. The palace and its many artifacts give visitors insight as to how the Royals of this palace lived.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Sheesh Mahal Hall of Mirrors Amazing
Review: Sheesh Mahal is absolutely stunning and amazing designed building. Its walls and pillars contain small mirrors which reflects the lights and sun rays plus your own reflections at an angle.

Name: gira p
Title: Jaipur sight seeing
Review: AMAZING!! This Mahal is absolutely stunning. The walls and pillars have small mirrors and the reflection of the sun of the mirror is just astounding! A must see.

Name: Prasanna
Title: Sheesh Mahal. Brilliant.
Review: Wonderful place. A wonder and genius creation. Take a guide here. He will explain the history and rationale behind the structure, besides, he will be a good photo guy.

Name: jsthouston
Title: A lot of work
Review: I can certainly appreciate the amount of effort that went into this building but can not say that I think the results are all that special. Probably just not to my taste or perhaps I was expecting more.

Name: Rajinder
Title: Nice place
Review: This is the most beautiful place to visit. Great place with all the modern facilities. The management is very accommodating. Perfectly built  and located for modern stylish weddings. Must visit with family and friends.

Name: Kamajit
Title: Sheesh Mahal
Review: A small room all made of broken mirrors very colourful inside....No photos to be taken inside.....A bit of history is told inside verbally.....

Name: nazeem k
Title: Nice place
Review: It was amazing place beautiful nature guide facilities are available there a big canteen and restaurant also there nice

Name: Bhoomita P
Title: Beauty of the Jaipur
Review: Excellent place to visit and see the past rulers of jaipur history and architectural beauty. The mirror work is excellent and very good for photoshoot. overall great place to visit.

Name: chetan s
Title: Sheer Art
Review: Beautiful place ,its a must visit place if you are in Jaipur.The work done by the workers in the past is really amazing .I was amazed seeing the sheesh mahal

Name: Varuna K
Title: Breathtaking!!
Review: Breathtakingly beautiful and a fine piece of intelligence and brilliance from one of the past rulers of Jaipur!

Name: JayeshLC
Title: Best Artwork
Review: Here you can experience ancient artwork and the life style of Kings. The mirror work is excellent and very good photo stop. It's inside Amer Fort and not a separate tourist site.

Name: madhurii2021
Title: Amazing experiance
Review: its a breathtaking beauty!! we never ever thought that our royal families are living luxurious life that is everyone dreaming about. how intricate mirror work done. This art work is unique in world. our guide explained us with some interesting photo angles. It is a confluence of luxury with science. Amazing experience.

Name: sudhanshusing
Title: Sheesh Mahal (mirror palace)
Review: Sheesh Mahal (mirror palace), the mirror mosaics and colored glasses were a "glittering jewel box in flickering candlelight".Sheesh mahal was built by King Man Singh in the 16th century and completed in 1727. It is also the foundation year of Jaipur state.However, most of this work was allowed to deteriorate during the period 1970‚Äì80 but has since then been in the process of restoration and renovation. The walls around the hall hold carved marble relief panels. The hall provides enchanting vistas of the Maota Lake

Name: Somnath
Title: The highlights inside Amer
Review: There were Sheesh Mahal in Agra and Delhi. However, today you don't really get to see them. But the Sheesh Mahal of Amer gives us a glimpse of how they might have been. It is breathtakingly beautiful! Take your time and watch around. If u have a guide he will probably help you with some interesting photo angles and also share few tricks. For example, throw your mobile's light on the mirrors and see what happens!

Name: Vinay K
Title: Mahal for rani sahiba
Review: Actully when we goes some.repairing work is there but after that they have given us a nice introduction with a movie... Various glasses in various views u can easily spend u r time by thinking that how and from.where science was so great at that time

Name: AZCasualTraveler
Title: Visually Stunning - Hall of Mirror
Review: The Hall of Mirrors (also called Sheesh Mahal and Palace of Mirrors) is located within the walls of the Amber Fort Palace.  This is a visually stunning area of the Palace that have many small pieces of mirrors that are artfully embedded in the walls and roof of this section of the Amber Palace.  Very nicely done artwork using these small pieces of mirrors.  Prior to entering the Hall of Mirror, there is a very nice garden/courtyard area at the entrance to this area.  Very nice area to visit and enjoy this artist creation.

Name: DP1066
Title: A magical experience!
Review: Located in the third courtyard of the Amber Palace, unfortunately it is not possible to enter the Hall.  However, the inlaid panels and mirrored ceilings are visible from the outside and are stunning. This is one of the most beautiful rooms in the palace and a great photo opportunity.

Name: Iqbal M
Title: Wow
Review: Sheesh means mirror and its one of the best part in this mahal sheesh mahal is great location plaelce .its a palace of mirrors

Name: shivani m
Title: Best place of amber fort for photos
Review: When you visit amber fort spend a good time at Shis Mahal. Take guide. The guide have training for a week. Apart from history they do very good photography.They know every angle.

Name: MamaT23
Title: Stunning
Review: Absolutely magnificent room in the Amber fort. Just the thought of the King lighting candles at night with one of his Queens and the entire room would glow... What romance!

Name: Dennis P
Title: A sparkling display !!
Review: If you can get near this amongst the visitors it is well worth taking a few photos as this is a stunning display of design and colour combinations.It would be lovely to see the candles lit in the evening with all the reflections that they must cast !!

Name: Steven_Teo
Title: Amazing innovation
Review: It reminded me of our equivalent of a nightclub. The hall has mirrors embedded into the walls and ceiling. When the Moghul entertained his guests at night, the mirrors will give the effect of lights reflecting all over the hall. Brilliant architect.

Name: SalimM
Title: Just magical
Review: Sheesh Mahal or the Mirror Palace is the most beautiful part of Amber fort.  The ceiling and the walls of this hall are encrusted with many pieces of mirrors and you can even spot stunning floral paintings on them. It is said that the king ordered the construction of this hall as his queen loved the shining stars but she was not allowed to sleep on open air. When candles were lit in the room at night, their reflection showed in the mirrors and it looked like the ceiling mirrors were stars. You cannot enter the hall but the can see inside plus the mirrors are also on the outside walls.

Name: Mandeep Mehta
Title: A marvelous creation
Review: Beautifully designed, containing intricate designs and colour combinations. An exquisite piece of art to enjoy and marvel at. Definitely worth seeing it.

Name: Philip P
Title: One of the most beautiful parts of the Amer Palace!
Review: The amount of mirrors - the guide said coming from my homecountry - is amazing, not for their size but for their positioning and great effects that they creative. An overall experience!

Name: Abhishek
Title: True Beauty
Review: It is a part of Aamer Fort but can be confusing, as often comes across as an additional point of interest. It is wondeful to see how this was build back in the days. Amzing to see the reflections in the mirrors, a top notch quality work.

Name: Shoyab Q
Title: Amazing
Review: Visiting many times each time I just love it , excellent place to excursion I was surprised to see beautiful architecture.How done this outstanding work.I would say "wow"

Name: Bhuvanendra B
Title: Awesome!
Review: While the Amer itself is a huge fort palace, each of the public quarters is just awesome. The intricacy of design and workmanship is exquisite.the sheesh mahal is the centre piece of attraction. With lot of Turkish influence, it is a wonder by itself. Government should protect the roof as I found some of the embedded mirrors are spoilt by moisture.

Name: Lakshmi N
Title: Don't miss this inside the Amer fort
Review: This is a Queen's palace inside the Amer fort. You cannot miss this while you are in a visit to Amer fort. The symmetry in which the sheesh mahal is built is simply awesome. The mirrors used and the angles in which it is placed are engineering marvel exhibited 100s of years ago!!! Dont miss taking some photos with the mirrors.

Name: ARUN M
Title: Sheesh Mahal
Review: Sheesh Mahal in Amer Fort Jaipur a masterpiece of Rajasthan Royal Family. There are thousand of mirror on the wall if someone focus light on this place it become illuminated and looks beautiful.

Name: Farhana
Title: Just Beautiful
Review: A must see when in India. It is truly breathtakingly beautiful. So much history as to how it was built and the purpose. There are tour guides available outside and they are very cheap and speak different languages to accommodate all. Very friendly and know the history well.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Excellent experience
Review: Wonderful place. Must visit. Easy access. Unique displays & technology of olden days. Amazing experience.

Name: Travellinggoalgent
Title: Mirror mirror on the wall
Review: On of the most stunning parts of the Amber Fort. Thousands of mirrors have been used just like mosaics and make up a wonderful part of the fort. You can get some good selfies here. Try to look your best as you are reflected about everywhere with all these mirrors.

Name: Indiana_Jonesse
Title: Quite the Elegance
Review: Located inside King‚Äôs palace, the mirror palace was built from thousands and thousands of glittery pieces and mostly imported from Belgium. The king only stayed here during the summer season. It is pretty impressive. Ever wonder where the adage came from, ‚ÄúLiving like King and Queen‚Äù, this is why. The lavishly decorated palace is only a part time use for the almighty.

Name: Sukesha D
Title: Innovative monument
Review: Beautiful architecture and very innovative way to view oneself  from various strategically placed mirrors.Must be really romantic back in times with candles n divas illuminating and reflecting back.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Palace of glass mosaics
Review: The Sheesh Mahal is a palace in the Amber Fort complex and decorated with coloured glass to form mosaics, much of it of floral patterns and geometric shapes. Definitely worth visiting when in Amber fort.

Name: Marathon_Dreams
Title: Beautiful Palace but are not allowed inside the rooms
Review: This is inside Amer Palace so ideally can not treated as separate attraction. It is one building as part of Amer Palace complex. Beautiful mirrors in intricate patterns. Amazing detailing in putting together such vast number of mirror/glass pieces together. People are allowed to walk in outer corridors of the building but not allowed to enter inside the rooms. Room doors are open but entry prohibited. So one can take photographs of the inside of beautifully adorned rooms but can not enter to see it from close quarters.

Name: Kelleydawn
Title: Fascinating level of detail
Review: Definitely hire a guide so that you can learn of all the ways in which their natural resources were used to heat and cool the palace. Also, to learn about the 12 wives and the role karma sutra played among them.

Name: NachiketKelkar
Title: Impressed
Review: We visited at night , so the lighting was amazing . Really made us think, what was the level of artisans of that period

Name: V K Sharma
Title: Hall Of Mirrors- a unique workmanship and craft ship of Rajasthani artists
Review: Visiting Hall Of Mirrors- gives you a great feeling of proud and accomplishment by seeing  a unique workmanship and craft ship of Rajasthani artists

Name: Minal M
Title: Vacation
Review: Simply amazing its a must see and highlight of the palace .Hire a guide to understand the intricacy of the architecture

Name: 592abck
Title: Amazing place
Review: This is amazing place and must visit in Amber fort. It gives an idea of how royal life would have been.

Name: Nadeem
Title: Awesome
Review: Very nice Palace I visit in November very beautiful art is different Hindu and Mogul architecture I like it

Name: Remotelyworking
Title: Impressive &  meticulously  detailed work. Must beautiful. Part of the Amber Fort it‚Äôs most definitely  worth seeing.
Review: Part of the Amber Fort - it‚Äôs most definitely  worth seeing. Worth getting guide or hiring audio to make sure nothing is missed,

Name: 832vgs
Title: Wonder with Mirrors!
Review: Sheesh Mahal is located within the Nahargarh Fort area of Jaipur. It is constructed with 40 pillars and all those pillars are decorated with thousands of glass pieces in an unique and exquisite manner. Due to unique position of these glasses/mirrors, even a single ray of light creates thousands of reflections. One has to buy a ticket to visit the Hall of Mirrors alongwith the Wax Museum and you are asked to hear an audio description of eight minutes; before you are left on your own to enjoy the beauty of the place. Truly worth the visit.

Name: Maryam
Title: Sheesh Mahal ... dont miss it
Review: Mirror Palace within Amber FortNice and impressive, great detail work with mirror pieces; must see during trip to Amber Fort!

Name: jazsacher
Title: an Amber Palace Highlight
Review: One of the true highlights of visiting Amber Palace was our stroll through the Sheesh Mahal Hall of Mirrors.  It was a truly a stunning spectacle to witness the detail and brilliance of the mirror tiles on the walls of the hall.  We visited here 2 separate times during our Amber Palace journey.  The first time was absolutely packed with people and it was near impossible to get a private photo with the Hall of Mirrors in the background.  However, we visited again later in the day and were surprised and delighted to discover that the place was nearly empty.  We quickly took advantage of our good fortunes by taking some amazing photos.  And we absolutely loved the stunning garden adjacent to the Hall of Mirrors.  Our visit here was certainly the highlight of our visit to Amber Palace and we will not soon forget our amazing experience here.

Name: Marie D
Title: Truly Stunning!
Review: The intricate designs were truly amazing to look at! I found the craftsmanship to be even more amazing than that of the Taj Mahal.

Name: swati
Title: Mirror Mirror on the wall!!
Review: It is located within the Amber fort in Jaipur. It is also known as the palace of mirrors.The beauty of this place lies in the fact that even if a petite ray of light enters it, it naturally lights up the whole palace while reflecting in all other mirrors.To enjoy the splendor of the  Mahal you must take a guide along.

Name: ThenWestwardHoe
Title: Magical
Review: Mirrors were used a lot by the early rulers of Rajasthan. (And not on ly Rajasthan, also the Taj Mahal has a mirrored hall). It is a totally magical experience when it is dark and candles evoke a starry sky.

Name: S C Mishra
Title: Visit to Sheesh Mahal
Review: The experience of the visit to SheeshMahal was unique and interesting. TheWorkmanship of the house of glass isreally amazing. The interior design of thedecorative glasses are nice. Overall the place is worth-visiting.

Name: Malab S
Title: Marvellous!!!
Review: The Sheesh Mahal is a part of the Amer Palace. Although I failed to understand the purpose of the mirrors on the walls, it is a sight to behold.

Name: Orchid4841
Title: Impressive ....
Review: Definitely one of the best things to see in the Amber Fort. Mirrors used in a truly artistic way, to fill a space with light. Lots to photograph here so don't go without your camera.

Name: Ann C
Title: Sheesh Mahal inside Amber Palace
Review: The Hall of mirrors is located inside of the Amber Palace.  The walls are lined with numerous small mirrors that if even one ray of light hits one of them the whole hall will be lite up with light from the reflections.

Name: silverspectacles007
Title: Dazzling highlight of your visit to Amber Palace
Review: Easily the highlight of your visit to Amber Palace, this is a structure in the centre of the palace, it's walls and ceiling is made out of mirrored tiles. Idea behind it was to have a "sky filled with stars" for the queen at any time of day. Though entry inside the structure is restricted, we were informed that even a small source of light like a candle would light up the entire place.

Name: Ian T
Title: Interesting building. Worth a visit
Review: Covered in marble and small mirrors.  Spectacular building worth a visit but on this occasion you may not require a guide.

Name: Pooja S
Title: Sheesh Mahal
Review: Sheesh Mahal is located inside the Amber Fort and it's beautiful with mirror interiors. You cannot go to the core of the sheesh Mahal but you can see it from the outside.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: House of mirrors
Review: Sheesh Mahal literally meaning Hall of Mirrors is built inside the Amer fort. The entire palace has pieces of mirrors which reflects the light from the lanterns in the evening & starts glowing. It provides a mesmerizing picture to be behold.

Name: Valisa
Title: Beautiful
Review: It is not a seperate place.  It's inside the amber palace.  It's beautiful.  You will njoy visiting this.  You are not allowed to go inside..  You can click few pics here.  It's beautiful.

Name: AnilChadda
Title: Truly beautiful
Review: The Sheesh Mahal is truly beautiful, it has millions of mirror set flawlessly.Beind decades old, but is still in pretty good shape

Name: Denis
Title: Class apart
Review: The Sheesh Mahal is one beautifully build wonder within the fort, it's a master class once you see the detailing

Name: Ramkishore
Title: Beautiful!
Review: What a fantastic place to visit! Sheesh Mahal is the best place inside the amber fort! Hire a guide, apart from the information/history they share, they also take the best pictures inside sheesh Mahal!!

Name: kekelism
Title: Romantic story about the Sultan and Sultana
Review: Based on the guide explanation, this room was made for Sultana because she want to sleep outside to see stars in the sky. But because she is Sultana, the rules forbide her to sleep without roof, so Sultan made a beautiful mozaic ceilinv from glass and let the candle reflect the fire and look like a million stars.

Name: Monica Feldman
Title: Go hard or go home tour
Review: Absolutely beautiful.  The workmanship is amazing.Wandered around fascinated by the magnificent work of the people of the time.

Name: Achal
Title: Beautiful
Review: Nice design and artistic work.  So many mirrors look so beautiful in form of a palace interior design.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Amazing:
Review: Sheesh Mahal is part of the Amber place Jaipur. inside the Amber fort ,is the hall of mirror. We enjoyed there. Nice place.

Name: Tatts l
Title: Beautiful place  in an amazing  fort
Review: Glittering and highly decoratedAnd near the garden which softens all the red stoneThink it may not be so enjoyable at a busy time june was a good time to come if you can stand the heat

Name: IntrepidNomad
Title: Magical
Review: Inside the Amber Fort, is the hall of mirrors. You can Imagine when this was built, the use of candle light and the reflections bouncing from mirrors and mosaics.Magical and well worth a look.

Name: Sravan
Title: Excellent experience
Review: I have visited this place recently with my friends, I have got an amazing experience with thrilling views of this place.

Name: Traveler
Title: Travel Guide Took me üáÆüá≥üë≥üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüáÆüá≥üë≥üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüáÆüá≥üë≥üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èüáÆüá≥
Review: Beautiful Historical Amazing how the Moghuls and Raj‚Äôs lived Amazing hand crafted architecture Worth visiting

Name: Ivor S
Title: Quite lovely
Review: The first time I visited the hall of mirrors back in the early 1980's you could actually go in.  Now unfortunately it is cordoned off so only glimpse from afar

Name: Christine A
Title: Gorgeous
Review: Just imagine all these small mirrors reflecting back the flicker of candle light.   It must have looked other worldly and magnificent.   Part of the Amber Fort and worthy of a seat on the step to stop and stare.

Name: June N
Title: A must see
Review: The Hall of mirrors was the highlight of the day.  The work is mesmerising, all credit to those that have preserved and maintain this beautiful piece of history

Name: Borntobewide
Title: Magical
Review: Definitely worth a visit. Imagine candles illuminating the whole area, only one word for it - magical.

Name: Travellingmonty
Title: A Must Vist Place
Review: Superb food at Sheesh Mahal in Jaipur. I Enjoyed a lot. Comfortable luxury stay. comfortable mattress, helpful staff elegant flooring, Chef creates Magic with food provided phenomenal experience and a very memorable trip. Good food and I enjoyed so much lovely trip.

Name: Mel C
Title: Amazing experience
Review: We loved India, the Sheesh Mahal is amazing. The work and maintenance to allow us mere mortals experience this treasure is well worth it. Worth visiting when in Jaipur

Name: lsanjose
Title: Very beautiful and interesting.
Review: The prettiest part of the palace.  Our guide managed it so we were in this area when there weren't many folks.  Loved the history and perspective of being one of the ladies of the court (harum) and the life they lived...

Name: Renuka Raul
Title: Awesome experience
Review: The Sheesh Mahal at Amer fort is an incredible architecture. It has beautiful intricate mirror work, carvings, paintings and embedded gemstone colors. It is also known as the Palace of Mirror.

Name: Lech B.Kowalski, LLM
Title: Sheesh Mahal is worth to visit.
Review: The complex of Sheesh Mahal is behind Jaipur boundary. The place is very interesting and I have found, as many other peopleas worth to visit and walk through the Rooms and corridors.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Hall of Mirrors
Review: Sheesh Mahal is located inside the Fort in Jaipur. One can take a guide who will guide you duting the tour. In Seesh Mahal one can see how king used to have a lavish life without much of the modern amenities.

Name: nelgnotron
Title: Amazed by the Mirrors!
Review: So much history embedded in this amazing piece of architecture. Around every corner, behind every wall, through every doorway and arch was another feature to see. The gardens, the inlay, the parapets / domes, the gables and their gargoyle type finishings. It was well worth the effort to experience the splendor of times past.

Name: Charvi_Shah
Title: Very Nice and Picturesque place for Pic lover
Review: If you are visiting Amber Palace then I must recommend this place to everyone this place is worth your money and time.

Name: vivek_agr
Title: Overpirc
Review: While the place is good but the 500/-rupee entry that is charged is quite steep. The entry tkt is to be bought separately inside the Nahargarh fort. Photography not allowed inside the seesh mahal.

Name: mauricesweeney@hotmail.co.uk
Title: impressive
Review: A must visit when in Jaipur to see impressive mirrors and colours and great building, but can be busy and very hot so go early.

Name: Lawyer/Exporter
Title: Sparkling!!
Review: Of course you will go here when you are in Jaipur and it is just beautiful. Marvel and enjoy it as much as possible in case you don't return soon.

Name: RugbyDave50
Title: Awesome part of the Amber Fort
Review: Look up to the ceiling and discover the palace of dreams.  Visit when cool as the palace traps the heat.  A nice little photo opportunity.

Name: Alistair P
Title: Stunning
Review: This is worth visiting and taking in the impressive features of the mirrors and colours but gets very busy

Name: Clare
Title: Hall of mirrors
Review: We spend quite a lot of time exporing this beautiful mirror palace with its astounding art. I suggest paying for a guide who can help you see the finer treasures that you might miss by going without one.

Name: Jewel236
Title: Lovely
Review: Lovely history of how it came to be. You'll get true "night sky twinkling stars" if you shine a couple of torches onto the ceiling.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Hall inside the Amer Fort with stunning mirror work!!
Review: Located inside the Amer fort the place is exquisitely designed with mirrors and gives an amazing feeling of grandeur and royalty.

Name: Ralph Wilhelm
Title: One of a kind; truly spectacular, must make time for this
Review: The Sheesh Mahal in the Amber Fort Palace is worthy of being called out by itself; totally unique and special.  This Hall of Mirrors was constructed on its own inside the Amber Fort Palace and stands as a memory that you will always have.  A guide is essential here to understand the construction.  But note that the small mirrors attached to walls and ceilings throughout the structure allow for unique "magnification" and multiple light and reflected images to be reproduced and highlighted throughout the structure.  Hard to imaging the complexity of the methods used to construct this structure.  Note that this Hall was constructed/begin in the 1500s and was completed in the 1700s.

Name: Tham
Title: Best
Review: I have never seen or been to such fort the mirror work is just fantastic. I can only imagine what was the life of these people living here. Simply outstanding!

Name: Aveek B
Title: Awesome and breathtaking view of the Mahal
Review: Sheesh Mahal though has now some restricted entry but its a must visit inside Amer Fort. It has a history associated with the mahal plus the reflection of the mobile torch light is a wonderful view.

Name: BeingSakshi
Title: Must visit
Review: This hall is inside Amer fort and a must visit, you reach here via gate known as Ganesh Pol. It has one very well maintained garden view.

Name: Musafir98
Title: Heavenly
Review: Too beautiful to look at. Probably the best of Amer fort. Don't forget to take pictures. Awesome view from top

Name: theflyingdoctor
Title: Highlight of the tour of Jaipur.
Review: To think that the emperor‚Äôs bedroom was covered in mirrors! Beautifully ornate and gives fantastic feeling of space . This is probably the best ‚Äòroom‚Äô in Jaipur‚Äôs tourist sites.

Name: Traveler_AshP
Title: Interesting insight on how people used to live without electricity
Review: A marble palace studded with mirrors, the marble carvings are also beautiful. Hire a guide who can show you how the light was reflected by the mirrors and appear as stars.

Name: S B Khare
Title: A magnificent architecture
Review: It is situated inside the Amer Palace. By far it is the most eyecatching buildng in the palace. The building these days can be seen only from outside from a distance as it is now surrounded by iron railing. It is covered with glass pieces and preceous stones. The reflection of light is what makes it so enchanting. There are paintings on the wall and roof which have survived the time. The Rajsthan Government has maintained it well.

Name: Ilkleygirl
Title: Lovely
Review: Another must whilst in Jaipur. We hired a local guide who was friendly and helpful. As with most tourist spots in India sons great photo opportunities.

Name: AAKPA
Title: Best part of Amer fort
Review: The sheesh Mahal was extremely beautiful and made the visit worth of Amer fort. Otherwise Amer fort is below average place.

Name: Shwetha
Title: LakshmiNarayana temple
Review: Huge temple where pooja is done ceremoniously. Vishnu and Lakshmi grace us in this very well maintained temple. Clean and spic span, this temple is a must visit in Jaipur.

Name: Rakesh A L
Title: White Mesmerising Birla Temple.
Review: Must see Birla Temple. Pure White Marble used everywhere. Very well maintained by the Birla Trust. The temple idols and really beautiful.

Name: Subrat Saurabh
Title: Peaceful place
Review: A very peaceful place which is in the heart of the city and close to a known Ganesh and hanuman temple. Photography inside the temple premises is strictly prohibited

Name: Priyanka
Title: Extremely beautiful
Review: Beautiful, spcly in the night time. Calm n serene place. One of its kind. Worth a visit if u r new to Jaipur. Also visit moti doongri next to it.

Name: Jonesamer
Title: Birla mandir
Review: Nothing is unique all is normal pandit say give a money for a Puja I think is a scam please alert all tourist then you go there but the birla mandir is so beautiful

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Nice lighting
Review: Famously referred to as Lakshmi Narayan Temple in Jaipur. Birla Mandir  is dedicated to god Vishnu and his wife goddess Lakshmi.Its near Ganesha temple.Car parking place is common as both are on two sides of the parking.

Name: Mihir K Tiwari
Title: Visit
Review: I think that place too good all temple design are very nice i was go there in evening calm and clean place this temple is belongs to God Radha Krishna

Name: Fardeen K
Title: Great temple in Jaipur
Review: One of the best temple in Jaipur is birla temple located middile of Jaipur. easy to reach there by texi or by bus most beautiful

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: Well maintained holy place
Review: The temple is well maintained. A very good place to visit to have a holy experience. The deity looks amazing.

Name: dillsefoodie
Title: Beautiful Temple with Greenery
Review: The temple has some nice carvings and it's really beautiful. Visited this temple during my Jaipur visit. There is a park surrounding the temple. So quite a lot of greenery also. The statues of Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi are pretty magnificent.

Name: Prakhar M
Title: Beautiful temple, Must Watch
Review: Located in centre of city, beautiful temple having some great artistic impression all around.Area around temple is also beautiful and have great views.

Name: Exploration276081
Title: To pay homage to a beautiful edifice of white marble
Review: Basically the name of the temple is Laxmi Narain temple built by  Birla  family a rich merchant of Nawalgarh Rajasthan once manufacturing Indian car Ambassador in Calcutta.The land was donated by Erstwhile Maharaja Man singh of Jaipur and the Hindustan charitable trust built the temple in 1985. The temle has been built on Nagara style the famous architecture  style of Vedic Cult.The temple has Panchayan  style construction meaning therby the temple has five organs as defined in human body. The temple has been built of white marble of Makrana and maitained by  the trust. Since the temple is dedicated to Vishnu cult hence  has five times Arti  like wakeup, brakfast , lunch , Brunch , dinner, sleep like human being . The dressing of Vishnu and and his Wife Laxmi is also like a human being and change as per seasons. The glorious jewellery and clothing is worth admiring. If you are in Jaipur make it a point to visit the temple.

Name: Vinay K
Title: White mandir üòä
Review: A temple that too all.coverd with the white marble , greenry and things manageed very well u can view from.out side easily on the road of jaipur univercity

Name: Bholu
Title: Birla Temple
Review: This is a very neat and clean temple where no offerings of 'Prasad' or flowers can be offered to the God except your silent prayers. No photography is permitted. Constructed in white marble on the hill of 'Moti Dungari" and in the vicinity of famous Ganesha temple , this is perfect sight for spending your evenings .

Name: zegna
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is a lovely place located in the hear of Jaipur and full done in white marble and good for a quick visit  if you are in Jaipur

Name: Akshay
Title: Must visit this place
Review: One of the best attraction spot for tourists. This place is famous for it's unique architecture. And it's situated next to a famous temple of Lord Ganesh Moti Dungri. So you can visit both the places at a time.

Name: DP1066
Title: A modern Hindu temple.
Review: Built in 1985, this is beautiful building which embraces Hindu, Christian and Islamic architecture.  No photography is permitted inside, but the exterior can be photographed.  Shoes must be removed prior to entering the Complex.

Name: mikef888au
Title: Marble marvel near local bazar
Review: Beautiful white marble temple. Shoes off, wash hands, and no photography once past the gates. Pity because the view from the forecourt at the front, is spectacular.Go down the stairs where you can click away.....10 rupee for the shoe storage

Name: Minu T
Title: Quite place to sit in silence and connect to God
Review: Birla Mandir is a beautifully carved white marble temple of Lord Vishnu & Goddess Laxmi.Our experience of the Birla Mandir Temple was great since we reached there in morning for Aarti and there was not much rush.  After aarti & darshan of lord we sat inside the temple in silence for a while then strolled in the garden space outside the temple.Its a bit on elevated place.  Just before the gate on the left is a Ganpati Temple too, which too is very nice place to visit.

Name: Mandeep Mehta
Title: Divine experience
Review: The experience is absolutely divine. You feel connected with the divinity. The place is well maintained and very beautiful.

Name: PRASAD S
Title: A sublime experience.
Review: This is a Laxminarayan temple built and maintained by Birla Charitable Trust. Centrally located, this marvelous structure with intricate sculpture work inwhite marble is a welcome peaceful place. With peccable maintenance like any other Birla temple, it is worth visiting.

Name: Steven_Teo
Title: All white
Review: We just arrived  in India the previous night and when I found out we need to remove our foot ware to enter the compound, not just the main building, I thought; "forget it." I viewed this building from outside the perimeters of the building. So, this review is from the outside.

Name: Pankaj P
Title: Mandir with timings
Review: Note this mandir is closed 12 till 3. Lord knows why.  Big structure from outside but not missing much inside.  Guards have real attitude pushing everyone out on a rude manner at 5 to 12.  No courtesy for anyone coming to give 5 minutes extra or even wait to close on time.  Only gave it 3* as it has interesting photos of the Birla family downstairs.

Name: Lisa W
Title: Beautifully ornate
Review: Built out of white marble surrounded by lush gardens and situated at the foot of a fort, this exquisite temple is a must visit. Leave your shoes at the designated place to walk barefoot and take in its beauty.

Name: Johnson
Title: White gold
Review: It is made of white marble. Temple of Shri ram with Sita ji. Beautifully carved. Nicely build no entry ticket

Name: Philip P
Title: Take out your shoes!
Review: Wow, so beautiful and clean. More than worth the visit! Beautiful coloured windows; beautiful in- and exterior. Perfectly maintained gardens.

Name: Carlos R
Title: simply amazing
Review: The temple is simply amazing... a giant temple for several godess, hundred of tourists with typical clothes from India and inside a lot of paintings and glass decoration... the altar is simply fantastic but can not take photos inside... There were also some weedings to make this place even more amazing.. Also we visit the museum of the Birla family and have fantastic things from this family.. highly recomended to start the trip in Jaipur!!!

Name: Kamlesh N
Title: Peaceful
Review: Very peaceful devotional place, a must visit in Jaipur. Beautiful place. Very good for meditation. Needs a visit at least once.

Name: jony toi
Title: Cool visit'
