Name: Tina
Title: Will never forget laddu
Review: My family and I (7 of us) went to Elefun on October 6, 2022. We contacted Mr. Aftab (77370 91222) who was so helpful and gentle. He's the caretaker of Elefun. From the time he received us till we left the Elefun, he was helpful and polite. We were very apprehensive about entering Elephant Village since we read many bad reviews about how tourists are exploited by some of the elephant parks inside the elephant village. But we met the perfect person Mr. Aftab who was fair to inform the prices to spend time with the elephants in the beginning itself when I messaged him over WhatsApp while booking in advance.Our 3 hours' experience at Elefun was fantastic. We spent time with a 31 year old elephant called Laddu. We gave food to it. Then we drew on the elephant. Then we gave a shower to Laddu and vice versa by sitting on it :) Then we went on a 45 minutes' ride. We could have spent more time. Mr. Aftab was kind enough to give us ample time to spend with the gentle beast, Laddu. We loved Laddu so much that it will be in our memory for very long time. The mahout, Faizal was also a wonderful boy. We understood how he cares for his elephants like his family members. He helped us in conversing with Laddu in the words it could understood and explained a lot of things about elephants. Another wonderful person was Mr. Aslam who is fondly called Mr. Bean for his similarity in looks with Rowan Atkinson. He served us with good masala tea and gave us couple of water bottles whenever it was hot. If you are looking for a perfect place at a reasonable price to have a lifetime experience with elephants at Jaipur, then it has to be Elefun taken care by Mr. Aftab.

Name: Elefun

Name: traveller20002
Review: Our group of 5 adults and 2 children arrived by a private bus and were immediately greeted by a person in charge and introduced to 2 elephants and their handlers. The introduction was done slowly and carefully, the elephants and the humans (us) were given plenty of time to get used to each other.The care of the elephants, the running of the facility, and the future of the entire project was discussed at length during a lovely teatime outdoors. We were able go for a very long walk riding the elephants, after which the kids painted them with washable paint using bamboo sticks - apparently they tickle theanimal, then washed them and fed them a bucket of bananas. The biggest thrill for the kids was sitting on the elephant's neck being sprayed with water coming out of her trunk. There was a photographer available that was taking very professional pictures, but the handlers and the guide also took our videos and pictures with our own cameras. The entire facility is very clean and we saw several other elephants with other groups of people being treated exactly the same kind way. For us, this was one ofthe most memorable experiences we had in India.

This was, by far, one of the best experiences of our lives. I went to Elefun with my husband and 2 little daughters. We were excited to see elephants, but we didn¬¥t expected to be as magical as it was. We went for them but ended having the time of our lives! The people from Elefun was extremely nice, specially Aftab, the owner, who started this Elephant oasis with care and love, to protect them and to create a space of meaningful interaction between humans and this amazing animals. The experience blowed our minds, it was PURE MAGIC! Definitively a MUST if you go to Jaipur.... Been able to wash, feed, paint, massage and ride a beautiful elephant, was absolutely stunning. Best experience ever!

I have passed on your generous appreciation to All my staff & family members for whom it has been a great source of encouragement to continue in their efforts to exceed guest expectations.
We value your patronage and look forward to welcoming you back to the EleJungle soon again. Kind regards, Imran EleJungle

Name: John M
Title: Great service and pieces
Review: Awesome art pieces and service here at the Mukesh gallery. They stayed open late for me to arrive and provided great attention to detail. Definitely visit if you‚Äôre in Jaipur

Name: Bhim
Title: Paintings
Review: Among experience and most helpful staff with enormous varieties of paintings found nowhere in Jaipur. One should definitely visit.

Name: Pratik K
Title: Beautiful paintings
Review: Beautiful paintings, lots of variety from rajasthani to abstract.. Rohit is amazing and very helpful. One place to find so many different paintings - looking forward to coming back here again

Name: Rajul
Title: Mesmerising collection
Review: Beautiful gallery that‚Äôs treat to the eyes all 5 floor flooded with paintings n art pieces that are rare master pieces one must come here for experience of the life time that‚Äôs so rare n beautiful

Name: Himanshu Maheshwari
Title: Astounding collection of paintings and handicrafts
Review: This gallery is in the south of jaipur (less than a km away from the airport). They have an astounding art collection spread over various floors. Apart from paintings they have a separate floor for handicrafts as well. Prices are reasonable and staff is patient.

Name: rr50
Title: Good place to buy high quality artwork for home!
Review: Read about Mukesh art gallery on this platform and decided to visit with family. This place is filled with high quality artwork. Like any art gallery or shop one has to look for that piece which is special for themselves. A very large collection over several floors. If you are interested in buying Indian art for your home then you won‚Äôt be disappointed. Go with a lot of patience though as there is a large stock.

Name: Pradeep M
Title: Spoilt for choice
Review: Not commercial. A wholesale treasure trove spanning five floors that has all kinds of paintings be it miniature, traditional folk, contemporary and super realistic oil paintings as well. Highly recommended for art lovers! One of a kind in Jaipur.

Name: Pooja Karan bafna
Title: Amazing and stunning art piece found
Review: We recently bought an absolutely stunning painting from Mukesh Art Gallery. We are from Chennai and we have been looking for a masterpiece since a long time but we finally we found it here. Also thank you to the entire staff here who are patient enough to guide us through every bit

Name: Chavi gupta
Title: You can't miss it
Review: Visited the Mukesh Art Gallery in Jaipur. They have a fantastic collection of  paintings of various art forms . Was very difficult to select a painting from the vast collection . Absolutely  loved their collection .

Name: Mitali G
Title: Amazing Experience!!
Review: Stunning art pieces at this gallery! Owner and staff are excellent and showed us so many varieties of paintings for our house.They are very courteous and knowledgeable.Great prices too for the quality of original art

Name: Sanjoy G
Title: Excellent art gallery for all kinds of arts and handicrafts
Review: Amazing and extensive art collection with very reasonable prices. All styles of paintings and handicrafts. Very knowledgable and friendly staff

Name: Joe Cooke
Title: Highly recommend
Review: Brilliant experience shopping here - great paintings by local artists, friendly staff and fair prices

Name: Nina Cooke
Title: Fantastic choice of art at reasonable prices
Review: Great experience viewing and buying art here. Styles to suit every taste with reasonable prices and superb, non-salesy service. Highly recommend.

Name: Sarah D
Title: Lovely paintings
Review: Great variety of styles and sizes with friendly staff. A short drive outside of central Jaipur. I would recommend.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Great experience and collection
Review: Great collection of various art forms. Staff is welcoming, knowledgeable and the owner himself is a great guide. They patiently spent time with us , helping to uncover our needs and showed several paintings , multiple times with great detailed overview of each. Extremely satisfied with our day spent at the gallery and the unique purchases we made !

Name: Shubh G
Title: AMAZING
Review: Really good collection and variety of paintings and other crafts. They have exclusive pieces that can‚Äôt be found elsewhere. The staff is so friendly and Mr. Rohit was very hospitable. We will make sure to go back!

Name: Rahul Rachamalla
Title: Show me a better hidden gem in Jaipur than this
Review: Who knew that we'd purchase one of our best art collections from a nondescript place in a seemingly mundane location like this gallery. Rohit was extremely pleasant to interact with and shares a great taste in art. He was genuinely helpful in closing a great deal on a collectible piece. Me and my wife can't wait to frame it and hang it in our home in California. If you are looking for something more than a run off the mill type of art work, this is your place.

Name: OnAir638788
Title: Best paintings
Review: Amazing place. Brilliant collection of paintings. The staff was extremely cooperative. Unbeatable prices

Name: Divir J
Title: Amazing gallery - a must visit in Jaipur!
Review: We absolutely loved the Gallery. The collection of art here is exquisite and carefully curated over the years under the watchful eye of the Gupta family. We were attended to very enthusiastically by Rohit Gupta - the proprietor himself who also happened to be my junior from school! We ended up buying a large piece of art for our living room in London. This is something for which we had searched quite a few galleries across the UK and India but our search finally ended at Mukesh Art Gallery. Highly recommended for all art enthusiasts and investors who happen to visit Jaipur.

Name: trishala shastri
Title: Mesmerizing art
Review: Astounding art collection! They have a great and huge collection of beautiful paintings, loved it üôÇ. Must visit place!!!

Name: Richa S
Title: Exceptional Service
Review: Must visit when in Jaipur! I spent almost 2.5 hours here looking at the amazing collection they have. The staff patiently responded to all my queries and I finally ended up buying not one but four madhubani paintings. The owner of the store also came and provide his suggestions. Classic example of great customer service.

Name: Rachita Maheshwari
Title: Good collection, welcoming staff.
Review: Mukesh art gallery is truly incredible, with impeccable collection of artwork. Looking at all their jaw dropping artwork just makes you feel alive! Amazed by their collection, under one roof you can find varied forms of art. Very knowledgeable and welcoming staff. Had a good interactive experience with owner Mr.Rohit Gupta, Thank you Mr. Rohit for helping me in final selection. One of the best art galleries, highly recommended place to go.

Name: Peter W
Title: Great and varied collection!
Review: Wonderful gallery with knowledgeable, accommodating staff. We were interested in Rajasthani miniatures and they showed us many options of various ages and types. We were able to find what we liked and will gladly return next time we are in Jaipur.

Name: Santana K
Title: A very satisfied customer !
Review: It was so easy getting our precious paintings framed here - definitely the fastest high quality framing service that I have ever encountered ! Great suggestions, patient and courteous staff and overall just a wonderful experience. Do visit my favorite art gallery in Jaipur !

Name: Dinesh
Title: Delightful
Review: Mukesh Art Gallery brings you some of the finest work from the industry. You can check ample of amazing work actually before you buy one that you love! Staff is supportive and professional that makes your experience delightful.

Name: Khushi pathak
Title: Great
Review: It was great visiting here. Very beautiful pieces n artwork under one roof. Undoubtedly the best place for art lovers in jaipur.

Name: Siddharth Pathak
Title: Excellent experience
Review: Huge Collection of Modern Arts Wide variety and pocket friendlyHandicrafts and wide range of deity collection

Name: Sandeep M
Title: One Stop Gallery for all your Art requirements
Review: Amazing collection with highly skilled and well informed staff to guide and advise your best buy. Bought an outstanding work of Pichwai art'painting which was simply a masterpiece found here with Mukesh Art Gallery, Jaipur.

Name: Pablo
Title: Exceptional paintings, for every taste
Review: Wonderful art of different styles. Staff very supportive, if something is missing they can help finding it for you. Get some space in your apartments because you will want to buy something!

Name: Tanvi
Title: Impressive gallery.
Review: The art gallery has a wide range of paintings and it is very impressive. Must visit if you want to buy paintings for your house, work place or for gifting.

Name: Purvi J
Title: Authentic, Elegant and Most Adorable  and affordable gallery of Jaipur.
Review: I bought a painting for my house in Dubai. And everyone coming to my house, simply loved it.Must visit this place. An ultimate gallery in Jaipur.

Name: Ekanisha Maheshwari
Title: Mesmerizing collection
Review: Mesmerizing art collection... perfect place for art lover...they have every kind of collection..as a interior designer I'm loving it....their collections creates a mood for every corner for your house..

Name: Akshita Airan
Title: Fill your house with the amazing paintings by Mukesh Art Gallery. Must visit !
Review: Perfect place in the city of Jaipur for art lovers. Vast collection of paintings, one can definitely find the perfect taste for themselves. Got few for my newly designed house. Beautifully curated store. And I was surprised to see the collections ranging from modern abstract to traditional to contemporary. Fill your house with the amazing paintings by Mukesh Art Gallery. Must visit !

Name: Lochan Gupta
Title: Never seen so much of art at one place
Review: Amazing collection, perfect place for art lovers . Got one for my living room from their European art collection . Must visit place, value for money

Name: Surbhi Rajpal
Title: Awwesoommee Art Gallery with unique collection of paintingsüëçü•∞
Review: A superb beautiful collection of paintings with a huge variety and varied concepts. A treat to eyes & a rainbow of Colors to add to your home & anywhere.Museum quality canvas created with Colors & digital effect which is the first in the country conceptualised. Must visit to the store to view the collection & add to your home.

Name: SANJANA
Title: Amazing
Review: Exclusive collection of art itrms ad paintings. All at very reasonable price.Good collection of artwork

Name: Anu
Title: It was easy to find a royal baraat painting given how much detail oriented I am with intricacy of art. Great staff too !
Review: Great place with plethora of art collections . I am buying a royal baraat painting and it looks very classy .

Name: Surekha
Title: Wonderful experience
Review: Beautiful art work and showpiece.wonderful range in all categories. A must visit. üòÄ Enjoyed shopping and wonderful customer experience.

Name: Megha Ramani
Title: Great place !
Review: If you‚Äôre looking for one stop shop for all types of paintings that you can find in india, THIS IS THE PLACE !Great staff, very knowledgeable and gives each client attention to whatever their requirements are.  I personally bought 3-4 paintings and the price was amazingly competitive. They have all sorts of paintings like pichwai, modern pichwai, Tanjor etc. the kind that you see in elledecor india and archdigest india. Best place for paintings in town.

Name: Ebi P
Title: Most Amazing Art Shop
Review: 4 floors of the most amazing arts and crafts, from classic gold leaf to modern. What a wonderful art gallery

Name: girish k
Title: Worth the effort...
Review: Had to sacrifice trip to Chokhi Dhani to visit the place on last evening of Jaipur stay. But it was worth it. It was easy to locate the shop. They have Huge collection of more than 15000 pieces.  Paintings were amazing and there were huge options in all price brackets and types. Gemstones art peices were great. Retail business is not there forte, but then also owner Mr Rohit and entire staff were very cooperative and patient. Bought few peices for my new home. Staff polietly did secure packing for onward journey. Drawback is lack of online presence and photography is also not allowed. They don't do much bargaining either.

Name: Ambassador367425
Title: Awesome experience‚Ä¶
Review: Excellent collection and really nice and friendly staff. Owner was really helpful and honest. I found exactly what I was looking for. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for something unique. I would say one of the best art gallery in Jaipur. Delightful experience.

Name: Roy
Title: Excellent collection
Review: Excellent collection, variety of paintings collection of different designs and history of Rajasthan.

Name: Ram
Title: Temple for all art lovers!!
Review: Excellent collection !! While each piece of artwork can evoke a different feeling or make you think a certain way, the entire collection is truly amazing.Must visit art gallery in Jaipur.

Name: Arpit A
Title: Awesome
Review: Great collection backed up by excellent customer services.Best in North India for paintings and handicrafts

Name: MB
Title: Phenomenal collection - highly recommend it!
Review: We recently visited Mukesh art gallery and would highly recommend that you visit as well. Our experience was truly fabulous. We were a few people and there was something to match each of our tastes and budget. Not only that the collection is phenomenal, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The owner is also always present and patiently guides people towards understanding art.  This place is a ‚Äòmust visit‚Äô when you are in Jaipur. In a gallery that spans several floors, we found an outstanding collection of paintings from new and established painters, miniatures, and paintings from different parts of India that reflected old and evolving art forms and techniques. The founder/owners had a vision about promoting art and artists and this place reflects their passion. In some sense, the collection gives a glimpse of India. We enjoyed visiting the gallery, seeing the collection, and buying paintings there. Highly recommend it ‚Äì it will be truly worth your time.

Name: Ramjas Swami
Title: A must visit place
Review: The gallery houses thousands of paintings and handicrafts on display. All unique and beautiful  pieces. Prices are very affordable as well. Special mention to the staff for being very patient and friendly

Name: Seerat saini
Title: Awesome place to visit
Review: Very nice collection and polite behaviour of owner and every employee working out there. Affordable prices too

Name: Sunita
Title: Show stopper in jaipur art work.
Review: My favourite part was the range of art work available here.This place caters to the needs of all sorts of art work in terms of costing and assortment of work.

Name: Amit Ahuja
Title: Nice collection
Review: Very nice collection and friend staff patiently showing all the paintings. Prices are also reasonable.

Name: Shrikant Bagal
Title: Fantastic Place.
Review: A must visit place when in Jaipur.Amazing collection of paintings and other art items. Its almost 6 floors of mind blowing experience.

Name: Suchi
Title: Awesome!!
Review: One of the best art collections I have ever seen in Jaipur. The collection includes art pieces and all sorts of different paintings. The frames do the justice to all the hard work done by artists.Rohit helped us to find what we wanted. From now onwards this place is a ‚Äòmust visit‚Äô @ each India trip.

Name: Dr.Deepak
Title: Exclusive place for art paintings and gift items
Review: Mukesh Art Gallery is definitely one of the best art galleries in not only in Jaipur but I would say in Rajasthan. Must visit place to buy art paintings, gifts, other monumental items.Happy Customer.Dr.Deepak

Name: vivek s
Title: Awesome place
Review: Excellent place to be in if you want to be surrounded by art. The gallery has art work that would interest amateurs as well as established art collectors. Huge collection of over 16000 paintings and artefacts  which has been put up as a walk through spread over 6 floors. Ambience is comfortable and staff is very polite. I would (and already have) recommend this place to people I know. I will be a return customer, for sure!

Name: gaurav agrawal
Title: Worth a visit!
Review: Tremendous Collection of Paintings and Handicraft which Spread across various floors, Beautifully Displayed. The staff was very polite and attentive. The Price Range is also according to everyone's pocket. Strongly Recommend...

Name: Sudhakar
Title: Worth visiting a place!
Review: Best collection in town.Value for money. Excellent behaviour of staff. Really hard work done on every art peace. World class collection.Best wishes.

Name: Saumya G.
Title: Fantastic!
Review: Brilliantly curated collection! Had a lovely experience. Always found something incredible to take home!

Name: Ritu Chaudhary
Title: People are really welcoming and warm. They helped me a lot to select the exact paintings i was looking for.
Review: The collection here is exquisite. They do have really affordable collection as well. All the paintings here are absolutely stunning.

Name: Mukesh
Title: "Best art gallery"
Review: One of the best art collection ever seen.... Very helpful staff...great experience ... highly recommended.

Name: Satyadev
Title: Art  heart of Pink City
Review: It's an wonderful and mesmerising visit to Mukesh Art Gallery. The only place in pink city where  you will find all the solutions regarding art weather It's ur home ,office ,work place or any spiritual place. Very close to fortis and walking distance fm Mariot and Tapri. You must visit and find all ur solutions....Gd day....

Name: Subhash Ghotwal
Title: Massive collection
Review: It was a great experience shopping here. Massive collection of paintings and handicrafts spread across various floors. Would recommend anybody who is looking to buy affordable art.

Name: Ankur G
Title: Wonderful experience
Review: The art collection at Mukesh Art Gallery is amazing, across all tastes and budgets. Its normal to get confused with so many options, but the owner and the staff were very patient and guided us through selection and provided right inputs. We wanted to get the paintings delivered at Mumbai, and that was also arranged at reasonable cost. Finally our beautiful paintings arrived, in best shape, safely packed and delivered before the promised time.Over all a wonderful and warm experience.Must visit for art lovers or otherwise, you will definitely find something for your favorite corner in home.

Name: Syed Adeel Naqvi
Title: Heaven for art lovers at affordable prices
Review: They offer wide collection with humble and courteous staff. Located at one of the most prime location of jaipur. Indeed a great experience. The best is the reasonable price they offer along with great quality. Highly recommended. Must visit place.

Name: Prachi
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Amazing collection they have..I will highly recommend visiting there place if u r looking for unique and genuine work..üòä

Name: NandKishoreMeena
Title: Nice hidden Gem
Review: Good experience overall. Good collection to explore. One can buy paintings and other things as per their requirements. Staff was polite and courteous enough to show you each floor they have. I will definitely recommend everyone to explore this place when in Jaipur

Name: neenarzu
Title: Marvelous piece for art lovers worth a visit
Review: First time I saw a large and such a fantastic collection of artifacts and paintings which have varied taste for all cultures and religions. Very affordable and tastefully done up. As a tourist from Maharastra visiting Jaipur, this has been my one of the most memorable experience. God bless you all

Name: Piyush
Title: Unique place for art lovers
Review: Unique place for classical Indian paintings, contemporary paintings originals, licensed copies,  expertise in Rajasthani paintings. Great collection and very large inventory maintained.

Name: Surbhi surana
Title: Awesome experience
Review: Its amazing and unique art collection of handmade paintings and handicrafts. Best ever seen art gallery. All the articles were very well segmented as per the affordability of the customers. The staff was really courteous. It was very delightful experience. Must be visited by tourists who would like to carry a souvenir from jaipur.

Name: Pranay P
Title: Must visit authentic art
Review: I‚Äôm amazed to such a huge collection of beautiful paintings across different genres and mediums. Shopped for my house and picked quite a few pieces. The owner gave a good deal too!

Name: Bhaskar Y
Title: Great
Review: Looking for antique stuff and paintings for home decor or any other purpose ,Mukesh art gallery is the right place for you.Amazing collection with a lot of variety .You can get various products with reasonable prices Especially the paintings are too good,I have never been to such an amazing place.Friendly staff, Kudos to their work. Just awesome üëå

Name: Raj
Title: Wonderful collection
Review: Wonderful collection of paintings and handicrafts. A must visit for all looking for great art work.Courteous staff and well maintained art gallery.

Name: Nikhil
Title: BEST
Review: Overwhelmed with the amount of attention and level of comfort which was showered on us here. Can't believe we get to see such huge collection of paintings here. The owner Rohit Gupta Ji helps you to choose the best with his expert design advice.Cooperative staff, always smiling. Best part is that selection of such masterpieces take time and all of them were patient enough to let us choose accordingly. 100% Recommended.

Name: Gift_Gift_Gift
Title: Art Haven- A paradise for art lovers
Review: We were attended by Mr Rohit on our visit to this art haven. Rohit was kind enough to show us around the entire gallery comprising of 6 floors, housing different styles and subjects of paintings. I'll stress here by saying that this is by far the most comprehensive art gallery I have ever been to. They have a massive-massive collection of paintings of all kinds like traditional Indian, Spiritual, Modern, vintage, watercolour, acrylic, sketches etc. You name it, they have it. They have paintings and prints within all budgets. I, personally loved the luxe section which displayed one of a kind paintings and also the Pichwai section is the most intriguing one as it housed a colossal collection of Pichwais. This is a must-visit place if you are an ardent art lover, and in case you aren't, you definitely will leave the gallery turning into one !!! Apart from holding masterpieces, which one would love to acquire for their homes, they also house a wide variety of paintings and prints that can be gifted too...Be rest assured about their authenticity, quality and services. Glad that the owner was keen and enthusiastically answering all our questions and educating us about various art forms all throughout our time there. A must-visit for those who wish to acquire something that would last them a lifetime and beyond.

Name: Mahesh
Title: Affordable and genuine art
Review: Excellent collection! amazing place to be. Affordable rates. Its a must visit if one is looking for affordable genuine art!

Name: Raj Singh Rathore
Title: Loved it
Review: wasn't expecting such a huge collection of paintings under one roof! It is a hidden gem in Jaipur! Must visit

Name: Mukesh Singh
Title: Fantastic collection
Review: Fantastic collection. Every floor has a different variety. Thousands of paintings are displayed here! Must visit if in Jaipur

Name: Jay Murjani
Title: Mesmerizing pieces of art!
Review: The gallery has a beautiful and mesmerizing collection. Best part is they have every kind and type of painting one can imagine! Do visit if looking for Indian and contemporary art.

Name: VIJAY BALHARA
Title: Precious gems - Indian Art
Review: Breathtaking & Treat to Soul. Ethinic & delighted to see Indian Cultural Heritage depicted through the strokes of artists. Aesthetic Lovers can't step out without a purchase,I bet. A Classy Place in  The Land of Maharaajas

Name: Mukul M
Title: Unique stuff
Review: I always love visiting the gallery. The paintings that they have are very unique. Their prices are pretty reasonable as well!

Name: Sarthak Arun
Title: Wonderful experience!!
Review: Got everything we needed for our house under one roof. The ambience was amazing, notch product quality and amazing variety!!

Name: Inspire813124
Title: Ginormous stock!
Review: It's a ginormous art gallery with literally thousands of paintings and handicrafts. The gallery is a hidden gem in Jaipur! If someone is looking for affordable art with a lot of variety then this is a must visit! The best part is they are employing mainly the local art community.Note: It is best to visit with a prior appointment.

Name: Yogendra Maheshwari
Title: Fantastic experience! Very affordably priced!
Review: Fantastic experience! Huge space with ample of paintings and handicrafts. Staff is also very polite and patient. We bought few pieces for our house in the US!

Name: Niharika Singh
Title: Breathtaking Collection
Review: The gallery has a beathtaking collection of paintings. Thousands of pieces are displayed here. All are beautifully framed as well. Coming again for sure!

Name: Sunita Choudhary
Title: Mind-blowing painting collection
Review: It is indeed a wonderful art gallery. Superb collection. Whenever I visit this place,I am always mesmerized with their quality collection.I am a regular visitor of Mukesh Art gallery from last more than 15 years.The owner Mukesh Gupta ji is a very humble and he greets all visitor with smile.The after sales service is also  very good and is attended with great gesture and anyone who is looking for beautiful painting, artwork must visit this Mukesh Art Gallery.

Name: Kritika C
Title: Amazing experience
Review: One of the best art gallery i have come across. Amazing collection. All varieties are available here.

Name: Vinita kumari
Title: Superb collection
Review: Superb gallery with thousands of paintings displayed in a huge area. One can be spoilt for choice! Loce spending time here!

Name: Ankita kumari
Title: Jewel of Jaipur!
Review: Its a humongous gallery with thousands of framed paintings and handicrafts on display. I bought few contemporary paintings and I am surely coming again!

Name: Adwait Ranjan
Title: Mesmerizing collection
Review: I'm always mesmerised with their collection. Everytime I visit their store, I find something unique and different. One cannot come empty handed for sure as they have something for everyone! Kudos to the team for maintaining such huge stock of paintings and handicrafts.

Name: Sony C
Title: Fantastic experience!
Review: Superb collection! Thousands of paintings are displayed on multiple floors across all mediums and styles. They are mainly into affordable art! Overall, it was a wonderful experience. Staff is also very polite and helps you choose the best of the lot.

Name: Bimal C
Title: Superb Experience
Review: Wonderful Art Gallery! I am a regular visitor of Mukesh Art Gallery from last 20 years, Everytime I feel amazedWhenever I am in search of artwork or any framing need, I blindly visit this place and get 100 percent satisfaction. Owner Mr Mukesh Gupta has now become our family friend because of long association..

Name: AlokBansal
Title: Must visit if looking for affordable art
Review: Amazing collection!!You can spend whole day here looking at the variety of Arts available at the Gallery.Simply Passion at Work..

Name: Rajkumari Sudrania
Title: Don't miss it by any chance.!
Review: Beautiful collection of paintings and handicrafts. I personally love their Tanjore collection. Prices are pretty reasonable and staff is also very cooperative.

Name: Shruti
Title: Beautiful handicrafts
Review: Amazing and beautiful place to get the best handicrafts at one place. 5 star for crafts, services, maintenance and staffMust visit üòçüòç

Name: Mansi Agrawal
Title: Beautiful Art Gallery
Review: Amazing art Galary. Beautiful Collection. Co-operative Management.It's a must must visit in Jaipur.Very Beautifully Managed and maintained.Thank You.

Name: Dinesh Meena
Title: Worth visiting
Review: Its a fabulous place with ample of variety.  I bought a beautiful ganesha painting and my friend bought a miniature painting. Prices are very resonable and staff is also friendly.

Name: Rajan Sodhi
Title: Worth a visit!
Review: Loved the collection. Bought a few paintings for my house in Delhi. The prices are very reasonable and I think their collection is the best in Jaipur.

Name: Reena Sodhi
Title: Hidden Gem
Review: It's a huge gallery with thousands of paintings. Bought a few pieces for my house from here. Very friendly and patient staff. Definitely coming again!

Name: Ritu Maheshwari
Title: Fantabulous
Review: Awesome collection. A must visit gallery. Picked a Tanjore shreenathji painting for my house. Must visit if in Jaipur.

Name: Rahul
Title: Fantastic..
Review: Nice collection of handmade arts.Large range of varieties  as well .Antique pieces. must visit place for handicrafts , gemstone etc

Name: shalbha
Title: Great collection
Review: Great collection of paintings and artwork. Highly recommended. Have some extra time in hand to explore fully.

Name: Shashank Dixit
Title: Heritage, Historical & Highly Recommended Museum Of Pink City "Jaipur"
Review: The¬†Albert Hall Museum¬†in¬†Jaipur is the oldest museum of the state and functions as the state museum of¬†Rajasthan. The building is situated in¬†Ram Niwas Garden outside the city wall opposite New gate and also Jaipur Zoo and is a fine example of¬†Indo Sara Scenic architecture . It is also called the Government Central Museum.The museum building was designed by Samuel Swinton Jacob in Indo-Saracenic architecture with Rajput influences.Check out the review photos for the ticket prices and operating hours.

Name: RajaAjay
Title: Cool
Review: Good visit to a historic place. We liked the gloriful atmosphere there. Nice and good places to see and memorize for reference. Was impressed by the amount of items they keep for viewing. Very knowledgeable and great remembrance it is. Nostalgic

Name: Juliana S
Title: Romantic property
Review: It is a beautiful property with interesting artifacts exposed. I do recommend this place for history and architecture lovers.

Name: Rakesh A L
Title: Visit to Albert Hall Museum
Review: We visited the Museum and were very impressed with the collection. The carpet collection and the weapons collection is amazing.

Name: Vandana
Title: A must visit
Review: The only place in India to house a real mummy. The carpets,wooden ,stone ,pottery collections  will definitely take your breath away.

Name: JSarna
Title: Dusty Treasures
Review: A rich legacy of art & treasure - neglected underneath a thick coating of dust - is the only way to describe the Albert Hall Museum, Jaipur. A fairly good, eclectic collection - including an unexpected Egyptian mummy - the museum boasts of a sprinkling of antiques from around the world but is unfortunately being left to rot under dust & zero housekeeping. The only saving grace is the air conditioning. Highly recommend a spring cleaning of the exhibits

Name: Paramjeet Singh
Title: A must visit place in Jaipur
Review: Remarkable structure.. when lit-up in night, it looks mesmerizing.. The place is very easy to find, situated in centre of Jaipur. A lot of good eating options nearby

Name: Harshit S
Title: It was a wonderful visit with a wonderful guide(Ram Mishra).#mustvisit
Review: It was a lovely day and we learn a lot about the museum.It was the oldest museum of Jaipur and the museum staff was very good amd the museum was also very neat and clean.I also inspired by our guide because he was very knowledgable,exploring and experince of 25 years at the museum and he also visit us entire Jaipur and his name is Ram mishra.We really enjoyed with him while travelling.

Name: Frank
Title: Amazing place and Amazing guide
Review: We visited Albert hall museum in February 2022. Our guide was Mr. Ram Mishra and we were really fortunate to have him on board with us. Albert hall is a wonderful space offering a combination of history and art. I was mesmerized to see the shields with epics engraved, the sculptures of abhaneri and the mummy. With the help of our guide who was fluent in french and english, it became easier to understand everything. We were taken care of with utmost attention. Albert Hall museum is also very beautiful and we enjoyed every moment there!

Name: Sneha_Pingle
Title: Collection of ancient artistic work from around globe
Review: Its a place which has lots and lots of artistic collection from fabric to pottery to stone work, gems.It also has a mummy kept for display.Take a guide to understand about each section and artifacts kept there. Guide charges are apporx 250 Rs.

Name: VidPamsKris
Title: Best museum ever
Review: The best place to visit in Jaipur is Albert hall museum. The collection is amazing and whats even more fulfilling is the fact that there is a description for each and every artefact (unlike city palace museums which is not worth at all). Additionally the entire museum is Air conditioned which was a relief in the sweltering heat...you can spend time here comfortably. Of all the sight seeing places, this is the best in Jaipur at a very minimal entry fee of Rs50 pp. Go for it !

Name: Murtazakarim
Title: History place
Review: Very good time it is to visit this place. Full of people who come to see the monuments sculptures lots of historical things of Jaipur And rajasthan. Musemum is well kept and having lots of areas to explore see and remember. You need to have more time to visit this place

Name: ajay
Title: Excellent Museum
Review: Loved the museum even the building can be considered as heritage itself the museum is a great and must-visit place in Jaipur.

Name: Chayan Kanungo
Title: Great place for love history
Review: The Albert Hall museum Jaipur is Great place for those who have keen interest in historical things. You will get all the historical items and ancient time products and a lot of information about history. You can also find a mummy. It looks great during night.

Name: DisplayName
Title: Great Museum, Horrible Mask Enforcement
Review: Admittedly I should have known better going to an indoor museum, but have to point out for others that very few guests were wearing masks, and despite signs posted staff were not enforcing and often not wearing masks themselves. Oddly enough the outdoor staff were all masked and asking others to do so. All that aside, the Museum is fantastic, wish we could have stayed to see more of it.

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: Heritage building hosting historical items
Review: Museum is well maintained and having good collection of historical items. It may take around 1hr to complete your visit. Mewar history is well explained here.

Name: Gem testing laboratory
Title: Beautiful Albert Hall
Review: Beautiful place to visit in jaipur for family and kid with great knowledge and photography   location is wov must visit Albert Hall in Jaipur

Name: TSD64
Title: Lovely artifacts well maintained
Review: This is worth a visit if you are in Jaipur. It contains beautiful artifacts, both old and new which are mesmerising. The miniature paintings in Rajasthani style are really a feast for an eye.

Name: Devendra G
Title: Amazing collection
Review: Albert hall museum has a rich collection of artifacts including paintings, jewelry, carpets, ivory, stone, metal sculptures, and works in crystal. The collection includes coins from the Gupta, Kushan, Delhi Sultanate, Mughal and British periods. An Egyptian mummy is the main attraction of this museum. It is nice place to visit in evening. Would recommend to take a guide along for better understanding.

Name: fozjon
Title: amazing landmark in central Jaipur
Review: the building itself is gorgeous. The rest of the displays probably depend on the amount of interest in museums. It did seem to be an excellent collection. We're very glad that we visited.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Fantastic Collection
Review: One of the best museums in Rajasthan. The building itself is wonderful depicting Indo-Saracenic architecture. It has a very good collection of sculptors, paintings, weapons, musical instruments, etc. The main attraction is an Egyptian mummy. One can easily spend an hour here and photography is permitted.

Name: BloggersWithoutBorders
Title: Must Checklist For Jaipur
Review: It's a museum in middle of city and I will highly recommend this place and after this you can visit to famous market area of Jaipur city. It was a concert hall which was converted into museum later. You have a good parking space and entry ticket is minimal. This museum will show you some artifacts which is preserve in it and this is something which should in checklist of Jaipur. Authorities are following all the safety measures for visitors. Best time to reach later evening to click some amazing pictures for your social media.

Name: mrunal_shah
Title: Good visit with kids above 8 years
Review: We visited this museum with our son who is 9 years old. He enjoyed the collection. The museum is not very big so 1 hour is good enough unless you want to spend extra time here. There is a CCD in the compound and good toilet facilities too.

Name: Barbara A
Title: The building is impressive
Review: The building is vey impressive and a great architectural interest. I found the layout a bit not planned out in which direction they wanted you to go and we wound up having to double back.

Name: Coastal826245
Title: Good
Review: Its a english time building beutifully crafted is now a museum. They have a 3000 year old mummy & many other things

Name: Rajas
Title: Great
Review: One of the best museum I have ever seen. It is having a mummy also there. It's a British time created museum.

Name: Prabhanshu
Title: Albert Hall Museum
Review: Albert Hall Museum is one of the Jaipur's best kept secrets and a place worth visiting. It is wrong. Musuem has great collection of thnigs to see, even an Egyptian mummy. It took us 1 hour to visit the whole musuem, but one can stay there much longer.

Name: Gl0balCitizen2013
Title: Excellent Museum- A Must Visit
Review: Albert Hall Museum is an excellent museum with wonderful exhibits from all over the world. The ancient Indian sculptures, artefacts, carpets, textiles, texts, paintings etc are quite impressive and one can while away many hours at the museum. We could only spend an hour or so at the museum, but to do it true justice, you need to browse slowly.

Name: Satveersingh
Title: Excellent museum
Review: We  visited this museum and its really good. I was impressed with the collection of historical artifacts.

Name: Manoj S
Title: Superb Building and artifacts
Review: We passed the museum a few times going from our hotel (Marriott) to the Amer/Amber Fort.  The architecture looked fascinating from the outside so we visited it.  Mid-February was a great time to visit Jaipur because it's near the end of the tourist season but hasn't really warmed up.  The museum has artifacts of all sorts.  From clay models of people at work (really fascinating) to clothes and manuscripts and paintings.  Without having to deal with jostling crowd we spent a pleasant two hours at the museum.

Name: Johnson
Title: Great museum
Review: It's a British time museum. They have a mummy also. In evening it is illuminated with lights & looks amazing.

Name: Philip P
Title: Spoiled by the pigeons...
Review: Impressive building looking like a dove's cage. People selling food for the pigeons. This degrades completely the value of the exterior impression of this museum. I didn't enter.

Name: Lakshmi N
Title: A good one
Review: The museum has a huge collection of ancient items. A must visit for the art lovers. They collection of anything and everything. From pottery, statue, painting, weapon, cloth, carpet and what not!!!!Its very well maintained one. Kids may not like it.

Name: Love to Travel
Title: Beautifully lit up at night
Review: Although we didn't get chance to visit the museum we did view the outside at night.It is lit up using changing colours and looks very impressive.

Name: Bharat J
Title: Couple of hours well spent amongst Maharaja class artefacts and collectibles
Review: We visited the museum in Jan 2020. It is centrally located in Jaipur, well connected by public transport. The building itself is ornamental and selfie buffs would love it.The museum galleries are well laid out in three spacious levels with magnificent display of metal craft, arms and armour, pottery, miniature paintings, jewellery, musical instruments, coins, carpets, ancient scriptures, and the most beautiful sculptures in metal and stone of Hindu Gods and Godesses from 8th century onwards, with exquisite ornamental crowns, subtle smile & features. Other sculptures include Bodhisatva, Yakshi, Chaturbhuji Vishnu, Vaman Vishnu, Mahishasur Mardini, etc, which make every Indian swell with pride. The gallery is home to an Egyptian Mummy of the Ptolemaic Era and certain facts and details about various mummies found in Egypt. It was an overall treat to view and capture the art on display.A must visit place in Jaipur.Family loved it. A delight for your visual senses.

Name: Himanshu Bhatt
Title: The Well maintained museum
Review: the museum is situated at the heart of the city and very well maintained and managed by museum authorities. there are multiple galleries available which you can visit.

Name: Florian254
Title: Impressive, informative, too much repetition
Review: The building itself and the surrounding garden are nice to look at and enjoy, the inside has a very generous architecture and contains lots of exhibits about Indian and Jaipur history and tradition, the arts and the religion with a lot of explanations. But my recommendation would be not to loose yourself in the details which can easily happen as they are believing that repetition is the mother of all learning.

Name: Rodkoi
Title: Museum Visit
Review: A lovely museum in the centre of Jaipur with a wide variety of Indian and other objects to see. You have to follow a specific route, but lots to see and well worth visiting.

Name: mrinalinibatra
Title: Looks majestic at night
Review: We landed at the site accidentally - our driver took us to the Coffee Day on the premises as we were craving our morning fix. Did not go inside the museum as it had not been on our agenda but drove by there a couple of time. It looks majestic at night - all lit up! This was a day before Republic day so the building was beautifully swathed in the colours of the Indian flag.

Name: phil p
Title: Interesting Building with nice history and exhibits
Review: We popped in for a couple of hours and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the exhibits and the really nice building. Its well organised and you can walk around it in a couple of hours.Worth the time if you can spare it

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Architectural wonder
Review: An architecture to be admired. Light show in evening is very attractive. Easy access. Ample road side parking available. Must visit

Name: Vijayaraghavan S
Title: One of the best
Review: This was a pleasant surprise quickly qualified into a must do in JaipurOne of the best museums I visited so far. The collections are really good and the place is maintained spotlessDo visit in the evening. They close at 5:00 and reopen again with fancy lighting at 6:30 pm. The tickets are slightly expensive in the evening (100 rupees per head compared to 40 in the morning) but they place had few visitors in the evening and much more peaceful

Name: bhavnabkumar
Title: An average experience
Review: Albert Hall Museum is a very regular museum with weapons, pottery, ceramics, crystal ware, daily use items from olden days, statues, textile, paintings, coins from different eras. It has an Egyptian mummy too. The entire visit took about 1-2 hours. There was nothing spectacular about this museum. However, the museum lights up very beautifully after sunset. That pretty sight is a must see from Bapu Bazaar. It is visible from one of the gates there.

Name: SibsagarVish
Title: The Museum with the egyptian mummy
Review: The museum has many nice collections of pottery, ceramics, textiles, weapons and many more of this region. The museum at night in varied colours is a treat to watch. Above all, this is unique for the collections from Egypt in a separate section at basement including the egypt mummy ..few thousand years old preserved here.

Name: Shobha
Title: Not so good
Review: It needs some maintenance. It is not clean . The only thing that I liked was mummies except that it is waste of time .

Name: Pintya
Title: Needs better maintenance
Review: The museum is based in an old building located in the heart of city. Historical weapons, crockery, clothing, art is on display. Main attraction is Mummy. Photography is not prohibited.

Name: David O
Title: A comical museum experience
Review: The man at the ticket counter handed me a student ticket instead of a standard ticket. It was by pure chance that I noticed the discrepancy between the amount he charged and the receipt he handed over. The guards seem to all be in the game, as I have never been to another museum where they‚Äôve checked the ticket so carefully. This was probably the most interesting ‚Äúexhibit‚Äù in the museum.Rather stupidly, there are no toilets inside, so if you need a toilet you have to go through all the remaining rooms and the exit and go some distance further. (Don‚Äôt mention disabled access). The exit turnstile does not allow re-entry; the entry is on the other side of the building to the exit; the ticket is of course one use only. Luckily, there is not much inside worth seeing anyway.  In a country where 250 rupees buys you 45 GB of 4G data, 300 rupees apparently gets you access to a few glass cabinets with old carpets inside and a mummy.Two stars for the gorgeous exterior and some interesting cultural incidentals: a school group was performing on the front steps, a couple were taking pre-wedding photos with the building as a backdrop.

Name: rbs02
Title: Lively museum
Review: Located in heart of city , in an old building with excellent architecture. The exhibits are weapons, crockery, currency, paintings, Egyptian Mummy, brass handicrafts, marble carvings .. a unique antique collection ..

Name: desairak
Title: More dust inside than outside
Review: All item inside cover with dust not maintained at all all very poor conditions you will not missed anything if you don‚Äôt go

Name: Samir S
Title: Albert Hall Museum - Jaipur , India - Rich collection of Rajasthani culture.
Review: This is one of the oldest museum in Rajasthan also known as  Government Central Museum . The building was designed by Sir Samuel S Jacob, assisted by Mir Tujumool Hoosein. It was opened for public  in 1887 .This museum has enormous collection includes folk arts, miniature paintings, textiles pottery, traditional costumes, marble carvings, coins , Mommy , musical instruments, ivory, and visual explanations of Indian culture and traditions. A must visit place . Photography is not restricted.If you are art and culture lover have sufficient time in hand and visit .

Name: Arvind
Title: I would visit again
Review: Albert hall museum is not included in city tour. It is shown from outside however I thought of exploring it and I am glad that I visited this place. It has everything from carpets, paintings, pottery, idols, metal objects, weapons etc. I have visited many places in the city. I would rate this the best. It is easy to reach too. Please visit Albert hall museum. The architecture of the hall is also good.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Worth visiting in Jaipur
Review: This museum is probably the best of Rajasthan or at the very least Jaipur. There‚Äôs a rich collection of mainly Indian exhibits pretty much from the entirety of the history of the sub-continent. Though the star attraction seems to be a mummy from ancient EgyptWorth visiting in Jaipur

Name: Girraj Sonkhiya
Title: Museum and sightseeing
Review: Its one of the best museum with best architecture building. A lot of there is in the museum related to history and everything, a history lover must visit it, also it has side which is famous for photography and feeding the pigeons. Pigeons, clouds, birds, sunset and sunrises make the place so beautiful. There is a garden also where you can walk play and hangout with friends and family.

Name: aishwarya m
Title: Hoard of artifacts around the world!
Review: The museum is unique in terms of its historic architecture and houses collections from all over the world, especially an Egyptian Mummy!

Name: rogerl044
Title: Excellent Museum in a grand building
Review: We left our visit a little late and had to rush a bit. There was so much to see - we like museums - and we had to miss out on several sections that would have been interesting.Not quite sure why the Egypt section was there but I suppose it demonstrates the Victorian fascination.I found it very illuminating on all the periods of Indian history and well worth the visit

Name: SreejooSree
Title: Indian and International Culture
Review: It's good place to reach easily, i have taken  300rs ticket from the Alberto Museum itself, so v don't want to buy tickets for few other places under the archeological department,

Name: Madalyn H
Title: Interesting museum
Review: An interesting building of its time, and a fascinating collection of artefacts, modelled on the Victoria and Albert Museum in London. The Egpytian mummy gets a lots of interest. Some of the early coinage is interesting, together with various ceramics and textiles.

Name: juvlemm
Title: Amazing
Review: The museum has beautiful building storing items like carpets, clothes, utensils, weapons, etc. There is Egyptian mummy to our surprise at the basement. Photography is not prohibited. Lighting makes it more beautiful at night.

Name: Vaidehi J
Title: Nice architecture
Review: They charge Rs.40 per head for visit. But there is nothing great to see except the mummy. Carpet, weapons, crockeries, uniform etc are found in all the museum. Photography is allowed. Open garden is there outside.

Name: Musafir_shimoga
Title: Beautiful illumination at night
Review: I was bit late for the entry as I kept this in the end and by then visiting hours was over. But the building which looks majestic palace like structure gets even better with the colourful lights being focused to illuminate and its worth visiting to see the museum at night.

Name: Chetan Shroff
Title: Albert hall museum‚Ä¶.Egyptian mummy in Jaipur
Review: We visited this museum as normal museum but it had a surprise for us. It is housed in a nice building with your usual museum stuff like clothes, arms, carpets, jewellery, books, coins etc. But the surprise was Egyptian mummy. In basement of building, there was Egyptian artifacts and we could see Egyptian mummy. I guess it was the only museum in India which has Egyptian mummy. So I and my son were delighted since wanted to see Egyptian mummy.Outside this museum there is yummy street food at Masala Chowk

Name: coll612
Title: Nice place and worth it if you have time in Jaipur
Review: Great history but include this in one of your guided tours !Well worth the visit and I‚Äôd rate it a 8/10

Name: Maggy T
Title: Non- visit because of wrong advice!
Review: Trip Advisor can give out the wrong advice! The Albert Hall Museum is closed Tuesday's NOT Fridays'! Very annoying as we  checked before going and changed plans, now won't have a chance to visit

Name: Leslie L
Title: Interesting museum
Review: I visited Albert Hall museum on a day tour of Jaipur with Royal Majestic Tours. The tour guide, Mukesh was excellent, friendly and very knowledgeable. He pointed out the interesting exhibits in the museum as we walked through all of the rooms. The architecture of the building is also very impressive.

Name: staledale
Title: Don't go when you're tired
Review: Family of four, arrived after a long morning of seeing other sites. Being tired, it was difficult to pay 700 rupees (about $9.75USD) each to enter. Then, we found out that it would be an additional 10 Euros (about $11USD) each to go further inside where the King's area was. Pretty expensive for India. Don't go when you're tired, and you'll probably have a great experience.

Name: Brun066
Title: Museum that doesn't fear comparison with the major art museums of the greatest Indian cities
Review: This museum dates from the late nineteenth century. It's therefore following the era that saw the foundation of the great European museums, undoubtedly the model for that product of modernity: ie the practice of ‚Äã‚Äãgathering in a building and opening to the public the highest evidences of culture, coming from near or far territories .However the second half of the nineteenth century is also the period (in the wake of the Universal exhibition in London, 1851) in which space is also given in museums to the phenomenon of the so-called "Industrial Arts" (German "Kunstgewerbe", French "Arts d√©coratifs", Italian "Arti applicate"), that is, the arts producing artifacts not only for contemplation but also for everyday use.This museum in Jaipur reflects this cultural atmosphere. Alongside sublime and traditional works of art (I mention only the gallery of ancient Indian sculptures, or the famous "carpet of the Persian garden"), there are ample collections of objects of practical - or "even practical" - use: like music instruments, jewels, furniture, weapons, etc.If the collection can appear "chaotic" to an inexperienced eye, keep in mind the idea underlying this museum, I mentioned above; and you will find (as I found) that this museum doesn't fear confrontation with the major art museums of the greatest Indian cities (in this trip we have seen those in Delhi and Kolkata).

Name: Ankit S
Title: Albert Hall Museum
Review: A small museum. Artefacts, statutes, paintings and jewellery. It is a picturesque monument to be visited in evening .

Name: jazsacher
Title: a nice museum
Review: We toured here for about 90 mins. today and were impressed with the collection of historical artifacts.  Also, I was equally impressed with the architecture of the museum itself which displayed an impressive style reminiscent of the Moor architecture of Spain and Northern Africa.  Museums are really my thing unless I have a tour guide which we decided not to do.  However, despite the large crowds visiting we felt we got a good taste of the items displayed and the history of the time period in only 90 mins.

Name: Ashish Jaiswal
Title: Fine display of historical artifacts
Review: I belongs to Jaipur and have visited this place multiple times. It never disappoints me. This time I visited Museum with kids. They were excited to see historical artifacts like guns, shields, swords used in 18th century. Well preserved beautiful potteries . Every artifact is well documented and provide you a context in which these things were used or developed. Main attraction is the mummy located in the basement of the muesuem.

Name: Radi
Title: The lighting at night
Review: The lighting at night was amazing, it was continuously changing colours. In the morning one can get inside but we were not able to manage time for that

Name: swati
Title: By the time we reached there, it was closed!!!
Review: We couldn't get inside this museum as it was closed by the time we reached there. so we took some photos outside the museum. It looks magnificent from outside and I am sure it the same in the inside too.

Name: thamarai
Title: Wow collections
Review: What a collection of artefacts! Great architecture. There's a mummy too. Overall a great experience Only if it can be maintained a bit cleaner, so much of dust  accumulating. And a board of ' silence' in each room required. There are police in every room, our people also should be more polite and responsible!

Name: Malab S
Title: Marvellous!!!
Review: The museum houses a number of important items all segregated and placed categorically. Lots of work on textiles, artillery, arts, music and culture are available for display.The architecture of the building is itself a sight to behold. A light show is displayed in the evening that can be viewed from the streets.

Name: Sandra Artist
Title: Educational museum
Review: An interesting architecture, this building was designed to showcase a variety of arts from India,and comparative exemples from some parts of the world.The textile section had  lights in the display cases but they were not switched on! The rest was poorly lit too,and generally badly lit.Nonetheless it is still a cultural gathering of potteries, bronzes, Mughal miniatures, musical instruments etc...Worth to spend an hour away from traffic.

Name: Pooja S
Title: Lights at night
Review: I have been to Albert hall museum during the day but watching the colorful lights this time was a true delight.

Name: silverspectacles007
Title: Heritage Visit
Review: Great place to visit in the afternoon to avoid the hot Jaipur sun. Completely air conditioned museum housing some rare and historical items collected from the time of the British. The building itself is exquisitely built in marble. Has a lot of ancient weapons, pottery, jewelry, sculptures, paintings and other heritage items. Highlight display at the museum would be an Egyptian mummy housed in the basement of the building. The building itself is lit up at night, looks really good. Note that the museum is open only till 5 PM, information provided on the official site is false.

Name: u_ajay
Title: Visit only if you are a hishtory Enthusiast!!
Review: Looks intersting for those who love history and how the earlier royalty lived!! lots of weapons, clothing and other accesscories are in display

Name: Pouya S
Title: Worth the visit
Review: Nice museum with nice art. Not so expensive with some cool stuff. There are some old paintings, weapons and statues in this place that are interesting.

Name: Narendra K
Title: Great place
Review: A really good place to learn something not only for children but also for adults! Its really educational!

Name: John Nikos
Title: Shandaar
Review: Jabardast Place....... Must visit along with family and friends. Highly recommended for those who come from out of Rajasthan to visit jaipur.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Beautiful inside & outside !!
Review: The Albert Hall museum is an architectural marvel from the outside comprising of Mughal & British architecture. The inside provides glimpses of the local art & culture from the years gone by. A very well maintained & clean place. Visit in the evening to view the beautifully lit up building in colourful neon lights.

Name: sanjeevkdass
Title: Best architecture
Review: The museum and the hall is one of the best example of British and Mughal architecture. The museum is well maintained and it‚Äôs AC. The items kept inside are worth seeing. Overall a clean place and a must visit. The mummy kept inside is too exciting.

Name: Dr Aniket joshi
Title: Hidden gem
Review: Albert hall museum is a must visit while in jaipur.It has some nice objects like musical instruments, vases, jewelry, weapons,coins but the most interesting is the mummy. The mummy is kept in the basement . The albert hall looks magnificent when lit up at night.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Wow experience.
Review: This place is full of art and crafts of local culture. Very well maintained and looks amazing, Must visit.

Name: Tanvi
Title: My kids loved it
Review: I visited here with my kids and my husband and this place was amazing. We loved the collection of paintings. Entry fees is also cheap .

Name: Nutan G
Title: A place full of the old artefacts of the kings of Jaipur
Review: The museum seems to be a forgotten relic gathering dust. It has a lot of artefacts but could do with some good anecdotes and historical facts to make them interesting. At night the place is lit up like a bride but in the daytime you can see that it could do with a coat of paint.

Name: BMadhav
Title: Not to be missed at Night
Review: This time we visited this state museum in the night. Looks beautiful under lights. Not to be missed Jaipur@Night tourism destination.You can spend easily spend a couple of hours looking through the sculptures, ivory art . We liked the miniature painting section and the ancient scriptures section the most.

Name: Manoj Agrawal
Title: Just love it
Review: I have always loved this building for it's location and planning ... simply amazing with huge gardens on four sides and beautiful building in center. I wanted a house like this!!The museum inside is very well maintained and is informative with paintings, royal time things, a mummy etc.

Name: Quinonostante
Title: It‚Äôs just ok
Review: Evenings mean you get to see the building facade lit up, and it‚Äôs quite spectacular.Inside guards are surley, rude.  Signage is limited and for some totally obscure reason you may take photos on a cellphone/mobile phone but not on a camera, the explanation given being ‚Äúyou can‚Äôt talk through a camera‚Äù?!?Some good pottery, lots of copies of items from other cultures. Coin room was interesting, and some of the pottery figurines are very good.Weapon display is quite extensive. Cheap entry but as usual be aware that as a white tourist you will find people taking your photo quite blatantly and without your permission, and it gets a bit tiresome.

Name: Shonil_B
Title: Nice Museum to visit in evening / after dark
Review: I visited this Museum in the evening after it was dark. It was well lit with colorful lights. This is worth watching. The inside of the museum is also open in the evening. If you go here in the evening it is less crowded and you can watch it peacefully. Photography thru mobile phone camera is allowed. Rest of the things to watch here is written by most other people in their review...no point in writing the same thing again.

Name: TripCrafters
Title: Oldest museum in Rajasthan
Review: Albert Hall Museum is supposed to be the oldest museum in Rajasthan. It has an assortment of rare and beautiful artefacts on display including metal and wood crafts, carpets, pottery, textiles, paintings, flora and fauna of the state, arms and weapons,  dolls, toys, etc.

Name: IntrepidNomad
Title: Albert Hall Museum
Review: The historical Albert hall was built during Queen Victoria's reign and named after her husband.It was later converted to a museum with many collection artifacts including paintings, jewellery carpets, ivory, stone, metal sculptures, historically carved furniture and works in crystal. There is also and Egyptian Mummy showcased here. The visit is systematic so you can follow the path from start to finish. If you enjoy history, and museums, than this is worth a short trip.

Name: Vijay75
Title: Splendid Architecture
Review: The architecture of the museum is very nice and splendid. The historic Albert Hall has been converted into museum. The museum has a rich collection of artifacts including paintings, jewelry, carpets, ivory, stone, metal sculptures, and works in crystal.

Name: babita13
Title: Beautiful museum
Review: Visited this museum yesterday. Very neat and clean place. although outside it was very hot but inside it was pleasant.Beautiful building in center of city through we use to  pass daily. Big hall and Good collection arranged meticulously. There is a collection of few items for Egypt and specially a Mummy of lady is there which attracts childrenFacility of audio guide in both Hindi and English is available and it is worth for money

Name: Traveler
Title: History of JaiPur üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥üáÆüá≥
Review: Worth a visit Dusty museum Full of historical treasures Beautiful building from the outside Labyrinth of rooms Mummy‚Äôs vault in the basement

Name: Sghosh1967
Title: Average museum
Review: The historical Albert hall has been converted later to a museum with some collectible items of local and other areas culture. The visit is systematic so you can follow the path from start to end. However many of the items looked like placed recently. Worth a short trip.

Name: Renuka Raul
Title: Worth watching
Review: Albert Hall Museum is Indo-Saracenic architecture. One can see rich collection of artifacts including paintings, jewellery carpets, ivory, stone, metal sculptures, old carving furniture and works in crystal. Coin collection includes coins from the Gupta dynasty,¬†Delhi Sultanat, Mughals and¬†British periods.Towards end is the main attraction of the museum. An¬†Egyptian Mummy and ancient Egyptian beliefs is showcased here.

Name: Charvi_Shah
Title: Amazing structure right in center of city
Review: This place is located near to all the famous market of Jaipur, this place light up specially in evening. This place attracts lots of photographers at early morning and in evening

Name: Sivajetu
Title: Great
Review: This is the first time we had seen mummy in india. This is a historical museum very well maintained. Located in main market

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Visited twice!!
Review: Constructed in the Victorean style of architecture its a building that now acts as a museum. Visited the museum in the morning but then came back again in the night to capture the night view.

Name: David D
Title: A large fort that dominates the skyline of Amer.
Review: Jaigarh Fort looms over Amer Fort and would have provided a last line of defence. The fortress is sprawling and has gardens and museums within. It also has a large cannon, the Jaivana Cannon, that is one of the larger movable cannons in the world. It also has great views overlooking Amer, which is very impressive. The only detraction to this wonderful place is that people insist on driving their cars inside the fort, which takes away from the experience somewhat.

Name: tarun9369
Title: Majestic Jaigarh Fort
Review: Jaigarh fort is in Jaipur ...near to Amer fort...it's like a defender fort for the amer ...it's approx 15 minutes drive from amer and situated on hilltop...the ticket for Indian adult is rs 150 ....u can take your vehicle inside the fort....it is recommended to take the vehicle inside , chargeable rs 100/ car...This fort houses the biggest cannon ...Jaivan...u can see the jal mahal from different locations of the fort...There are many things inside the fort...with beautiful picture spots...u can also see the majestic Amer fort from many sides of this fort...there is armory museum, canon factory museum, handicraft emporium, restaurant, etc etc...one section of the fort is like a maze...u can take ur vehicle to different spots in the fort....everyone will enjoy this fort...it takes approx 3 hours to visit this fort...nahargarh fort is approx 10minutes drive from jaigarh fort...Do visit if in Jaipur

Name: singhasam
Title: Mighty cannon, stunning views.
Review: A WEALTH of attractions lie in wait for any visitor who makes the effort to clamber about in this hillside fort overlooking Jaipur.It formed part of the city's defences and was built in 1726 to protect the Amber Fort and its palaces complex below.Top of the the list of things to see has to be the colossal 1720 Jaivana Cannon which, at 50 tons, is claimed to be the biggest in the world.This artillery beast swallowed 50kg cannonballs for fun and when it was test fired using 100kg of gunpowder it fired a cannonball 22kms. No wonder people didn't attack the fort!A museum area inside includes some of the cannonballs together with collections of weapons and other artefacts such as shields, helmets and arrows.For me the views stole the show, dizzying panoramas down to the Amber Fort below and across to more fortifications on the hillside opposite.I also loved the views down on the other side of the fort towards more fortifications waiting for restoration. No one was allowed down there because of the threat of collapse and the risk posed by snakes but you could see the network of defences created all those years ago.Jaigarh can be combined with a visit to the nearby Nahargarh Fort and provides a very useful guide to how defences operated when viewed below from the Amber Fort. Fascinating visit.

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Biggest cannon in the world
Review: Very nice fort.  4 wheeler can go upto the top of the fort.  Beautiful view from top and large cannon on top of the fort.  We had a nice time on top of the fort.   Combine with Nahargarh

Name: satish7113
Title: Jaigarh Fort
Review: The best thing to see in Jaigarh Fort is the Jaigarh Cannon. It is said to be the biggest cannon in the World, that can through cannons at a distance of 35 Km. It uses 100kg of gunpowder to fire a cannon. It needs the power of 4 elephants to turn the cannon.

Name: Himanshu B
Title: ‚ö†Ô∏è cartel of guide and shops
Review: Guide will not bargain on its fee because he will loot you by praising so much about shops product and will drag you into shop without completing tour. Product are fake and higly priced.  Don't come under their false claims and promises about quality and return policies.There is only canon otherwise it's average.

Name: ajay
Title: Rajput Fort
Review: Fort with the largest cannon in the world. The fort is a great example of preserved forts of the Rajput kingdom. The fort was constructed as an military fort for the protection of Amber palace. The museum inside the fort is interesting and also the shop by the Rajasthan government is good to buy stuff. The water storage tanks with the history of gold being stored are also very interesting.Taking Guide recommended.

Name: Lamberaj
Title: Beautiful place covered with thugs called guides
Review: The place is beautiful with a huge awe inspiring history but the guides are thugs. They give false stories and lead you to their internal shop of artefacts and manipulate you into buying. My strong suggestions dont buy from there. Go to only RTDC shops and buy as they loot you.

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: Very spacious fort that needs time to explore
Review: It is very spacious and large fort and needs considerable amount of energy, time and patience to roam around. Guides are available with fixed rates. It will take at-least 2-3hrs for checking out all major parts of the fort. Better not to go in a hurry schedule like 1hr or 1hr30min. in hand if you want to explore completely.

Name: Shravan B
Title: Visit to see the huge sprawling courtyards and world's largest cannon
Review: This fort has the world's largest cannon and the fort is one huge massive structure like a maze There is a lot of walking and it is recommended to club this fort along with Nahargarh fortIf you are not interested in seeing the coutyards and the inner structure of the fort ,can just visit the largest cannon which is near the entrance of the fort

Name: Abdulla P
Title: Jaipur ka Jharokha
Review: Jaipur ka Jharokha .......The view from the Jaigarh Fort ......It's timeless,  from my first visit sometime in 2007 and my repeat visits thereafter, it never fails to amaze and offer a new window (pun intended) for the scenic beauty it offers.A fort having the world's largest cannon which was never required to tbe fired except for a test fire which landed some 35 kms away and the crater is now a lake.A fort that was built to restrain any attacking army from reaching its ramparts, never had to test it's defence due to the alliances it natured with being the in laws to the Great Mughal Emperor Akbar to being the  alliances with the British and post independence providing the treasure which never was disclosed yet took a 50 days of search and blocking of the Delhi Jaipur Highway by the armed forces in 1977.A tale of how love conquers and alliances helps progress to how betrayal and deceit hampers legacy.... Its all wrapped for an interesting lesson from the pages of history which needs to be treasured as we "progress" .It was built in 1726 AD by Sawan Jai Singh II and sits at several hundred feet above the sea level. The almost-intact fort is enclosed by huge walls and is connected to the Amer Fort with subterranean passages. It is believed to be built to protect the Amer Fort and is one of the strongest monuments of¬†Jaipur.

Name: Subbukanyakumari
Title: A must visit fort offering scenic views of Jaipur city
Review: We visited the Jaigarh fort during last week of Sep‚Äô21 and the place was less crowded. The ticket to the Jaigarh fort costs INR 100 for Indian nationals and INR 50 for Indian students. The good thing is that private vehicles are allowed inside the fort at INR 100, otherwise it would have been difficult for us to walk such long distances under the scorching sun. This fort is managed by the Jaipur Royal Family. The Jaigarh Fort, located on the Aravalli range of hills provides an excellent of view of Aravalli hills and the Amer Fort down below. The view from fort is very amazing towards Jaipur city or Jal Mahal which is scenic beauty. The world's largest cannon on wheels, Jaivana is displayed here and is the main attraction. We hired a local guide and he told us stories of how Jaivana was test fired once which scared Mughal emperor Aurangzeb and the cannon was never used during an actual battle. The guide also told us about the treasures stored under the water tanks in the fort which was taken by Indira Gandhi during a search operation in 1977 during emergency, though there are no evidence for that. It must visit place if you are in Jaipur and can be covered along with Nahargarh fort and Amber Palace.

Name: Mohammed khan
Title: Waste of money and time
Review: Waste of time to go there see only cannon there nothings else to see there, be careful with chitter they ask to visit there shop to buy in triple price there product , and they waste your time and money

Name: fozjon
Title: great place for views of the city and Amber Fort
Review: it's a lot of walking, but it's an interesting fort with great views down over Jaipur city. Also amazing views over the Amber Fort.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Magnificent Fort
Review: The second most important fort to visit in Jaipur, this fort was built mainly to protect the Amber fort. The main attraction here is the Jaivana Cannon which was the world's largest cannon at the time of its manufacture and it was fired only once. The fort offers a beautiful view of the surroundings from the top. One hour is sufficient to visit the fort and photography is permitted.

Name: AMIT KUMAR
Title: Jaigarh Fort
Review: The Jaivana Canon in Jaigarh Fort is what that attracts tourists. Fort is well maintained and still the royal family lives there . From the hill top you see the entire Jaipur city!

Name: Rani75
Title: Fort
Review: Ancient Fort, they speak history of India.We have to walk but it's worth the explore.We get engrossed in the stories.

Name: Connector45197123546
Title: Fraud Guides cum Shop Agents
Review: Guys do not ever hire any Guide in any of the forts they are not more than agents of the Shop in fort..They will take 50-100-200 Rs from u in the name of fort tour but they will not even let u explore the whole fort and the fort trip ends at the shop of fort...Big Tourist SCAM!!!! PLEASE AVOID THESE FRAUDSTERS

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Mesmerising Jaigarh fort
Review: The Jaigarh Fort is still the property of the royal family of Jaipur. It's on the montain. It is well maintained and has lots of historical values. Since it's a privately owned property, thee are many weddings, movie shootings etc take place within the palace. From the back side of the palace the Amber fort can be seen.
