There is a tunnel which connects Amber fort with the Jairgarh fort.

Name: GAUTAM G
Title: The fort with a big gun and an army of monkeys
Review: This truly is a fort with a lot of trouble some monkeys constantly attacking tourists carrying food or teasing them so if you are any one of the above don't be.Be sure to have your own booked transportation as vehicle traffic is minimal and getting a ride back to the city extremely troublesome.Things to see are the massive cannon and the fort  museum which is currently poorly maintained by the current king and his trusts.This can be avoided if you are short of time but can be done in conjunction with the Amer fort visit.

Name: Vinay B
Title: Great fort and the local guide gave a good historical background of the fort....one of the good forts in Jaipur
Review: Great fort and the local guide gave a good historical background of the fort...one of the good forts in Jaipur

Name: Akhilesh A
Title: Worlds largest cannon in the entire history
Review: jaigarh fort was basically to protect the amer fort & it has worlds largest cannon inside it which has capacity to destroy the entire city in one go The cannon has not been used once even but its an treat to watch an massive cannon which is probably much bigger than ur suv cars Also the view from this place is so beautiful & try out the restaurant over there for some quick drinks with view

Name: Vinay K
Title: Canon fort
Review: Worlds bighest cannon that too target only.once in life , there u can understand history and manufacturing process of diffrent diffrent canons

Name: Bholu
Title: Jaigarh Fort
Review: For some reason not that many people go up here. That's their loss!This is a large historical military complex that is well worth exploring in full. The real highlight is right at the end high point with beautiful battlements encircling a lovely garden. Don't leave without finding it as many seem to do.One downside of this site is that they allow cars to drive in for a fee which somewhat spoiled the ambience of some of the more accessible locations.You really don't need a guide here as long as you do a bit of reading before visiting

Name: Prabhanshu
Title: Jaigarh Fort
Review: A very well maintained fort, where the King's guards still live with their families. Excellend millitary architecture - amazing the way soldiers in the 17th - 18th century used to evade enemies by using hot oil from the walls. The largest cannon in the world, weighing more than 100 tons "Jaivana" was amazing to see. Check out the amazing sarees and quilts available in the handicraft shop owned by the king, inside the Jaigarh fort.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Nothing in the Fort except Jaivana
Review: This fort has nothing except for Jaivana Canon which makes it worth a visit. The views frm the fort are also good, but the fort is not that attractive as  compared to Amber Fort.

Name: Akshay
Title: A good historical place to visit in Jaipur
Review: There is nothing much to explore but there is Jaivana cannon which is considered world's biggest cannon.You can also visit two small museum there. The roof site of this fort was amazing üòç for photoshoot. Remember Don't try to go there in a hot day you will get exhaust.

Name: Iqbal M
Title: Huge
Review: This is my forst trip in jaipur and jaiour is famous for its huge fort and so i visit to jaigarh fort .its huge fort such a beautiful built structure

Name: Johnson
Title: Fantastic
Review: They have the biggest man made cannon in world it lovely to see the old history. Amazing view from roof it's like a picnic spot also for locals

Name: SAURAV C
Title: Marwad Ki Shan.
Review: This place is one of the epic and is a Rajputana Aan Baan aur Shan ko yahan aa kar mahsoos kare. Makes you feel proud and inseparable part of magnanimous History we had.

Name: AJAYAERON
Title: Heritage FORT
Review: Must visit place if you are visiting Jaipur. Nicely conserved site with display of Arms & ammunition of Royals of Jaipur

Name: Lakshmi N
Title: A majestic fort
Review: A huge fort which hosts a huge huge cannon. You can walk along the magnificent walls of the fort and get a very good view from there. But except for the huge cannon and the view there is the nothing much to see. You either visit this or Nahargarh fort. Visiting both is not really worth it if you are on a tight schedule of day or 2 in Jaipur.This is usually deserted a little compared to Amer fort. So monkeys fill the space. Beware of the monkey menace. I recommend carrying a stick with you while walking along the fort walls just in case you encounter monkeys.

Name: The Wedding Vow
Title: Incredible View of a Mini "Great Wall of China"
Review: Went up to Jaigarh Fort to check out the view overseeing Amber Fort, and found out about this mini Great Wall of China (see picture). Beautiful walls, and when I googled, I realised there was actually a Great Wall of India located at Kumbhalgarh Fort. Too far from Jaipur - a 6.5 hr drive, hence this will do! :)

Name: Dr Sandesh Kedia
Title: Just visit Amber fort and you are done.
Review: Just visit Amber fort and you are done. No other fort can satisfy you if you spent a good time at Amber fort.

Name: camsandeep
Title: Nice place
Review: You can find world's biggest cannon; and the 60 gallon water storage underground tank and the Great Wall protecting the fort. If you don't have time, you can skip it as see other places.

Name: Vishal Shah
Title: Visit
Review: For indian nationality adult ticket is 70 rs per person.5 years old kids are free.and students id get have discount for entry tickets.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Good place
Review: Good for a short visit. Gun which was used by the Maharajas is displayed. Majestic piece of war equipment. Must visit

Name: mgaurav7
Title: Another Amazing Fort.
Review: Among many Forts, Jaigarh Fort just adds to the beauty of Jaipur.Located at the top, one can have an amazing view.

Name: Jeanine
Title: All for the views
Review: This fort is left to disrepair where we were repeatedly pushed to get a guide. The view however of Amber Fort were amazing and worth the 200 Rupees.

Name: wandererlust
Title: Excellent
Review: Amer gets spoken about the most, but all three forts are amazing. The views are simply mind-blowing and the restaurant there has the best of them. The food was also nice.

Name: Anil Shirole
Title: Don‚Äôt miss... fantastic heritage and genius...!
Review: The fort is at the top of the mountain and accessible also from Amer fort. Provide a whole day to visit Jaigarh and Amer Forts. It is a wonderful place and ‚Äòankh bhar ke dekh lo‚Äô.  The guides do injustice to these places, as they have to maximise the number of customers, so they are in a hurry to go to the next point, and give very little time... take an audio guide instead and go around the place fully. Alternative is to research on the net... before going to the place... go right down to the gardens and view Amer fort and surroundings from the top... start the day early at Nahargarh, come to Jaigarh and top it with Amer..

Name: Shobha
Title: My favourite
Review: It was my favourite in Jaipur . I visited here with my family. Entry fee is also not high it is around 25 . It was in word beautiful. Will like to visit here again

Name: Devendra G
Title: Beautiful fort - Very well maintained
Review: Jaigarh fort, which means the palace of victory is situated in Jaipur. It overlooks the amer fort. The fort was built by Sawai Jai singh. The fort features a cannon named "Jaivana"(Jaivana Cannon), which was manufactured in the fort and was then the world's largest cannon. Jaigarh Fort and Amer Fort are connected by underground tunnels. There are escape ways for the royal family in the situation of a war. The fort complex has a ram temple and a kall bhairav temple. It has a huge water tank to store water for the soldiers. The water tank is still in use.The views from the fort are stunning. Once can see amer fort and the entire old Jaipur city. Must visit once with a guide who can explain the monument in detail.

Name: prasanna n
Title: Stunning views!!
Review: This place probably has the best views in all of jaipur. Worlds largest cannon is an added attractionWould recommend driving up till the top especially with kids and elders

Name: S Verma
Title: Grand Fort and Beautiful View
Review: A beautiful fort with mark of grandeur all over it.. You enter the main visiting area of the fort through a labyrinth which gives you access to different parts like Kitchen, Dining area, Queen's palace etc. Although not much of the structure is left it gives you a perfect glimpse of what it had been in its full glory... Vast, beautiful and wisely designed for protection as well as public welfare (the water storage area for example). The view of the protective wall and pathway spread across multiple hills around and the Amer Palace below takes you back in history. There are ample photo opportunities so visitors keep your camera handy :)Couple of things to keep in mind, It is quite a long walk to cover the fort area so you might want to brief the senior travelersKeep an eye on the children (if you are traveling with any) as there is a labyrinth and some steep areas around You can take your vehicle inside the main entrance, ask at the ticketing officeGuide may not be required however absolutely upto you :)

Name: p g
Title: Only canon is attraction
Review: If you are not into visiting structure or old building then the only thing I liked is the biggest canon ...

Name: DDBTrip
Title: Beautiful defence fort
Review: It is not exactly a fort, it was built to protect Amber fort. It is famous as it houses the world's largest cannon on wheels, Jaivana. But not just this, it gives exceptional views of the Aravalli mountains and the city. There is a tunnel from Amber fort to this fort which is accessible, so it is easier to reach. Do visit if you have time and enjoy the views with less crowd.Also a song from Salman khan,s latest movie Dabbang 3 was shot here.

Name: Surendra RR
Title: Great Fort
Review: One of the historical places to visit in Jaipur. The right time to visit would be in rain or in winter .Good places visit with family and friends...

Name: Marathon_Dreams
Title: Real fort on the mountain
Review: Although there is nothing much remained on this fort,except the canon, but the fort walls and its vast expanse gives you an idea of how it will be when it was functioning. If you are looking for signs of royalty and their lifestyle symbols, don't visit this fort. This fort is built to protect Amer palace/fort below (Jaigarh fort overlooks Amer Palace). Once can visualize vision of the king which has built this fort and protective wall which goes around Amer (around 12km). Its open with lots of walking around the outer walls. The canon is also worth seeing. If you love photography, this fort provides amazing angles of various structures.

Name: Grumpy013
Title: Have to
Review: Just another amazing place to visit. You could spend hours wondering around. It is big too. A lot of history too. Must do this one & Amber Fort together in the same day. You also have a museum and an armoury exhibition.

Name: CleopatraLuxor
Title: Such a vast, dominant structure
Review: 200 rupees to enter. Go early morning as it gets very hot after noon. We took a tuktuk up and it felt a little 'hairy' in places but drivers are experienced so no reason to be alarmed. There's a small restaurant there (we didn't try) and a place selling spicy puff potato fare (20 rupees each). Views across to Amber Fort are amazing. Worth the money. Suitable footwear a must!

Name: dizzybl0nde
Title: Worth going
Review: Not as busy as many of the other forts. Definitely worth going. Was not expensive to go in and some good photo opportunities.

Name: Sandeep singh
Title: Fort is mainly famous for jaivana cannon placed here
Review: Best time to visit is monsoon n winters. Big fort. Jaivana is placed at one end of this fort. Jaivana cannon is good  background for photography.

Name: Ann C
Title: Jaigarh Fort Jaipur
Review: The Jaigarh Fort was built in 1726 and was never captured, it has withstood the test of time. You will walk up hill about 2/3 mile to reach the fort.  The watchtower offers stunning views.This fort holds the worlds largest wheeled cannon...it was made at the forts foundry.Inside of the fort is an armory and a museum.Fee: 200 rupees (about $2.75 USD)

Name: Sandra Artist
Title: Stunning views
Review: Warren and maze of corridors,rooms and staircases with little to see.The sunken is inaccessible because used for filming often,a shame...

Name: 832vgs
Title: A Defence Fort!
Review: Jaigarh Fort of Jaipur situated along the Aravali Ranges close to the Amer Fort and Lake was built by King Jai Singh II to protect the Amer Fort and its palace complex. Its uniqueness lies in the fact that an artillery Cannon called 'Jaivana'; which was manufactured in the fort precincts and is the world's largest wheeled cannon is located there.  A place worth visiting for its architectural and historical value.

Name: Sanjukta M
Title: Nice
Review: Nice experience! Specially the hilly way up to Jaigarh fort is  more interesting with peacocks running here and there - can take some lovely pictures.

Name: prasanthshenoy
Title: Must see after Amber Fort
Review: I would put this as a must see fort for 2 reasons, beautiful views from the top, biggest canon. Basically this fort was constructed for defense purposes and safety of Amber palace. Primarily used by soldiers and other commanders in those times. The views all around especially that of Amber palace, the Aravalli mountains and Jal Mahal from here are breathtaking. You can use your vehicle to drive to the top of the fort with some additional 100/- entry ticket for the vehicle.

Name: Pooja S
Title: Spectacular view of the city
Review: Jaigarh fort is the other way of Nahargarh Fort. Has a beautiful view and has a lot of plants everywhere. This is mainly known for a rooftop and it's view of the city.

Name: Shima
Title: Breathtaking
Review: You get to this place by walking through a tunnel from Amber Fort. The place is full of history and you get great views of Jaipur from several vantage points. It is well worth a visit, but be ready to walk. And you can either walk back, if you have the energy or you can take a tuk tuk.

Name: carleton23
Title: Fantastic fortress views
Review: If you have chance, drive up the hill above Amber to this fort which dates from 1726. You can see the world's largest wheeled cannon. Beyond that is a series of rooms and corridors, some containing the armoury and other artefacts. It opens out into a hidden garden and fantastic panoramas over Amber and the fortress walls, so you really get to see the scale of the construction.

Name: Valisa
Title: Nothing special
Review: Twhe main attraction of this place jaivana cannan.  I don't think this place is worth visiting..  Nothing special. You can easily skin this place.  There are many other beautiful places in Jaipur other than this

Name: Pouya S
Title: Beautiful view of Jaipur
Review: A nice place in North of Jaipur and a must, when visiting this city. Amber fort was larger but didn't have the same view of the city.I would recommend to visit both this forts. Because they complete each other perfectly.

Name: Chaitra U M
Title: Cannon Fort
Review: The biggest cannon is present in this fort,you need to visit the fort and check the cannon.The museum here has smaller cannons and spears etc. You can see peacocks on the way to the fort

Name: deepti
Title: Rajput Legacy
Review: Jaigarh Fort, which is a part of the same complex as that of Amer Fort, as the two are connected by a subterranean passage. The passage was meant to evacuate the royal family in case of an attack on Amber Palace. The 18th-century tunnel was thrown open to the public and has been made motorable. To facilitate the trip to Jaigarh, golf carts operate from Ganesh Pol to Awani Gate, the fort‚Äôs entry. The ride is very nominally priced at rupees 70 for a one way trip and rupees 100 for two way and operates from 9am to 4pm. Jaigarh fort can also be approached from the Amer Fort over a short climb along a steep hill track. The fort is named after Jai Singh II, who got it built to protect the Amer fort. Hence, it was actually a defensive structure rather than a palace itself. What really makes it famous is a celebrated cannon named Jaivana, which was then the world's largest cannon on wheels.  The fort never witnessed any major resistance, and therefore, despite the cannon‚Äôs exceptional record, it was test-fired only once. The fort museum is a testimony of this fort being used as a major center of artillery depository. Used weapons and other war utilities are preserved and displayed at the museum. The fort precincts also include Laxmi Vilas, Lalit Mandir, Aram Mandir, and the Vilas Mandir.

Name: Bhumika S
Title: Beautiful place
Review: It was an historic visit to this fort for us as everything is nicely preserved in the fort. The garden is luch green and the atmosphere is calm.I spent almost 2 hours here and it was really a memorable visit.

Name: Abhimanyu M
Title: Good Place to visit
Review: Visited Jaigarh fort and it was worth it. It is better than Nahargarh fort because of less crowd. One can buy the car pass and take your car right upto the fort canon. Luckily, it was cloudy and not hot which made my visit more memorable.

Name: jbschmor
Title: Don't miss this place
Review: If you have time, apart from the usual guided tours, a drive up to this place affords magnificent views, the best breezes on a hot day (I went near sunset) and a surprise gem of a place - a gorgeous garden with views of the mountains.  It looked to me like an impossible movie set.

Name: Sanjay Shaandilyaa
Title: Sabse Badi Top at Jaigargh fort
Review: This place is almost out of the city. While visiting this place must visit Nahargarh Fort & once you reach down go to Amber fort too it's only 5km from here. Must visit place.

Name: Daniela
Title: Interesting Fort
Review: Very beautiful and a huge fort. This fort is an amazing fort.there is lots of thing to see in the fort.

Name: Zara T
Title: Beautiful view
Review: I must admit the main attraction here was a slight disappointment. The canon had graffiti on. However from the other side of the fort you get the most stunning views of Amber fort which was really worth it.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Visit place
Review: Brilliantly designed!the largest cannon in the world. Carry water bottle,cap/hat sunglasses with you.  My friends and I enjoyed there.

Name: Aftab Ahmed
Title: Be ready for this visit
Review: Jaigarh fort is the major fort in Jaipur , it requires at least half of the day if you want to cover it fully. Carry water bottle, cap/hat, sunglasses with you , the place offers amazing views of Amer town,  Amber fort, Sagar and arravali range

Name: ANISH VERMA
Title: Must visit in JAIPUR
Review: Enjoy the hill drive in JAIPUR to reach this place!Jaigarh hosts Jaivana, the largest cannon in the world.Have a look at the city from the top of the hill, its beautiful. But do check the timings for the fort, before you organise the same.

Name: Shonil_B
Title: One more hidden Gem of Jaipur
Review: One more neglected by tourist place, or even if they visit, they just visit the Jaivana Cannon and go back. But this fort is much more than the cannon. It has fantastic view of the Amer gad, the great wall of Amer, the dark rooms complex structure ( the maze or bhulbullaiya), and walking on the walls of this fort makes your visit here a worth. Good place for photography too.

Name: IntrepidNomad
Title: Yet another breathtaking historic monument
Review: When reviewing a monument/historical attraction in India it is difficult not to seem like you are repeating yourself. Jaipur is an incredible state with so much history in this area. If you make the effort to visit Amber Palace/Fort then go the little bit further and see the Jaigarh Fort. The views are amazing and the the world's largest cannon is situated here as well.Jaipur is an incredible state and this Fort is one of the reasons why.

Name: RajShar10
Title: Nice views from the ramparts
Review: It is a bit away from the city but is worth the trip. World's biggest cannon is definitely a big draw. There is a tunnel that goes all the way to the Amber Palace. Looking at the forge that was used to build cannons is a must.However, the entrance is not well-maintained. One can definitely avoid rides on camels or elephants as it is simply a form of animal cruelty.

Name: Krishnapal
Title: Majestic fort
Review: Very beautiful and huge fort. One of the must see thing of Jaipur. Views from fort are heavily beautiful.

Name: Schanbis
Title: A Historic Fort
Review: Situated on the promontory called Cheel ka Teela, Jaigarh Fort is quite rugged. From here you can see Amer Fort too. There is a watch tower from where you can get spectacular views. A famous cannon called JAYVANA is an interesting exhibit here. Chaarbag Garden is beautiful, not to miss.

Name: Ashoksingh121
Title: World biggest cannon....
Review: Historical amazing royal place at jaipur , we feel proud for it and as we know at Jaigarh fort we found world biggest cannon and many more thing out there..

Name: Karen S
Title: Beautiful biews
Review: Had a lovely walk round here, amazing views interesting history, March is a lovely month to visit as it‚Äôs not too busy or hot. highly recommend a visit!!

Name: RobinLSK
Title: Amazing Fort on a Hill Top
Review: An amazing fort with beautiful view of Jaipur City. Once home to 10,000 soldiers guarding and defending the kingdom. It is also the home to the largest cannon built in India, that fired only once, where the soldiers had to jump into the reservoir due to the heat and noise generated by the cannon. Poor soldiers and I can't imagine the spectacle of this event! :)A wonderful fort to explore and enjoy.

Name: Shalini S
Title: Fascinating
Review: This fort was built atop a hill to defend Amer fort and houses the largest canon named Jaivan. The huge walls surrounding it and Nahargarh form the defense system for the living quarters of Amer fort. It is really fascinating to study the architecture and the strong defense mechanism. Must visit along with Amer and Nahargarh forts to have comprehensive view. Carry sufficient water as one gets thirsty after walking.

Name: Babu G
Title: JaiGargh fort.
Review: JaiGargh Fort, it means Victory of Jai sing.who become Greatest astronomer its reason he got very good knowledge in since and mathematics and have very good knowledge about Astronomical instruments. He born in Amer and he keep the foundation of JaiGargh fort 1036 century. This fort situated in Arawali mountain for defending to the Moguls. Its reason Muguls that time having Gun powders and Canons.but jai sing that time no any more this kind of techniques. So he built this fort for winning Battle. For memory of winning battle he built this fort.Ready now people can visit the fort and they can see panoramic of Amer.and there is largest Canon Jaiwan in world. Used for experiment 1734 once. 20 feet large barrel with Jack system four wheel Ahead 9feet back foot 5feet and 1feet wide 4 wheels. Capacity 50 killo iron Ball and 100 kilo Gunpowder. So Amazing.

Name: Soumyajit Saha
Title: Jaigarh Fort
Review: Jaigarh Fort is also located in Jaipur. From top of the Fort one can see the whole Jaipur city.It looks marvellous and awesome to watch.

Name: Dipendra R
Title: Grat tour
Review: It was great tour. My family member very happy. Sankar is a great person. He know evry thing. No need guide. Sankar is a honest person.Thanks

Name: rich005
Title: Nice spot for sunset drinks
Review: Our driver recommended heading up to see sunset from here. It didn‚Äôt disappoint. You can spend half an hour or so looking around the fort - free entry. Then sunset point has entry fee (Rs 400 or so for foreigners). It was worth it though, we found a nice seat and enjoyed looking out across the whole of Jaipur watching the sun go down while drinking Kingfishers. Stayed until it was dark then drove down again. We saw some tuk tuks make it up but we were in a car. Takes around 20 minutes from Pink City. Police were checking everyone on the way down to make sure drivers were not drunk.

Name: Charvi_Shah
Title: If you love ancient and historic place then this place is for you
Review: This place preserves one of the strongest weapons of the World in ancient times. The place provides a great view of the surroundings.

Name: vivek_agr
Title: Nothing major
Review: The only attraction of this place is the Cannon which is said to be one of the largest in the world.  Private cars can go right upto the courtyard(parking extra) of the cannon otherwise it can also be parked outside from where it is about 350metres walk.

Name: Asiiia
Title: Its not worth going up there...
Review: We went up to the fort and were a bit disappointed. It‚Äôs very huge and there‚Äôs actually not much to see. You can enjoy a nice view over Jaipur or the Amber fort but that‚Äôs it. The fort is old and not well treated.

Name: nosourgrapes
Title: Jaigar gets my vote
Review: This huge rambling fort is one of the most impressive in Rajasthan. might equals right and this fort was built to protect. the small holes to pour boiling water in the enemy are still notably there as are the slits for firing bows and arrows. any marauder who could break into this citadel would be tough and wily indeed. Jaigar is less busy than the other nearby but it is infinitely interesting. allow an hour or two to wander about and take in the atmosphere oh and dont forget to check the worlds biggest cannon that can hurl the 22 lb cannon balls an incredible 30-40 km!

Name: Johari Jaipur
Title: Jaigarh
Review: Historical place it's a fort built by King of jaipur main attraction of the fort is ancient ‡§§‡•ã‡§™ used in war

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Home to world's biggest cannon of its time!!
Review: If you have already visited Amer before this, then this fort will underwhelm. However, its now home to Jaivana - the biggest cannon of its time.

Name: Vivek Chaturvedi
Title: Magnificence personified
Review: a must visit on your trip to jaipur with some time on your hands.. especially great fun when visiting with people who has an eye to history.. magnificence of the bygone era is evident in every nook n corner of the fort.. pride of jaipur, must say..

Name: Aveek B
Title: Though its not spledid as Amer fort but its a must visit after Amer fort
Review: Forts in Rajasthan should be covered either in early morning (Jaigarh opens at 9.30 AM) or in late evening to avoid the sun. In Jaigarh fort one needs to walk long distance in order to explore the full fort. It was mainly the cannon making factory and soldiers used to stay in Jaigarh fort. The bhulbhulaiya inside is another notable place along with the largest cannon inside the fort. It is near to Amer fort and both are interlinked by a road for pedestrian though few take the road. The view from the end point of Amer fort from Jaigarh is a nice one.

Name: BeingSakshi
Title: Average
Review: A good place, little isolated now as compare to Amer palace. But you will get good view of Amer palace from here. Visit only if you don't have time constraint, else even skipping it won't hurt.

Name: Kumar A
Title: Fort visit
Review: What an amazing fort is this. It's very huge and require almost half a day to see it properly.Its managed by the royal family so very well maintained.

Name: ruchikachugh
Title: Great history and beautiful fort
Review: Our visit was made memorable by our guide, hansraj  gujjar, who offered us beautiful and detailed description of the this place.

Name: P P
Title: Hidden treasure wonderful piece of history
Review: The jaigarh fort is likely the least marketed historical place is town. That said I would strongly recommend it for the discerning traveler that likes to understand the role of history and historical actions in modern day world or specifically for rajasthan. The story and history around the cannon and the armoury factory is unique link to the Mughal rajputana diplomacy and the good and bad sides of the Man Singh and Akbar links. The tunnel connecting to Amer fort is worth a visit. Useful to take a informed guide to truly appreciate what was built a 1000 plus years ago and the foresight that went into it.

Name: S B Khare
Title: A magnificent legacy of Rajput kings of Jaipur
Review: This fort was a retreat of Rajput kings of Jaipur whenever the Amer Palace was under attack. Secret tunnels connect the Amer palace to the fort. The Rajsthan government has now opened one of the tunnels so that tourists now can go on foot from Amer Palace to Jaigarh Fort. The fort has an elaborate system of monsoon water collection, filtering and utilization, something worth knowing about. It has a very beautiful hilltop garden maintained even today. A guide is quite helpful and are quite informative at a small tip. The fort and the living quarters are connected with an intricate system of pathways. There is also the largest cannon of the world on display. Another very interesting display is the king and queen having lunch spread with their consorts.

Name: Ravi S
Title: Bandhini sarees and dresses
Review: Great experience to be here. Famous for its bandhini sarees and dresses apart from the block printed items

Name: Vedika Rao
Title: One shop. Many items
Review: One shop. Many items. Reasonable prices.  Must visit. From carpets to handicrafts,  jewellery,  textiles, leather.  They have all

Name: Abdul Karim Khan
Title: Very good shop
Review: Our visit to Jaipur was very good. We shopped at this shop for a few items. We spent some time here. There is a restaurant also. Nice food

Name: Sitaram Bishnoi

Name: Ajay Rana
Title: Very big shop

Name: Gopichand Tiwari
Title: My favourite shop

Name: Chandr_abhan

Title: Nice collection
Review: Good shopping place for all family members. Nice collection of textiles and jewelery.  Also the handicrafts is nice

Name: Ravindra Bhatt
Title: Textiles and handicrafts
Review: This shop is very good for your all needs of textiles and all other items. They have textiles leather items and jewellery. Also handicrafts

Name: Rssci
Title: Reasonable rates
Review: My family bought some jewellery and marble items and leather items from here. Nice items and reasonable rates

Name: Himanshu Choudhary
Title: Very good
Review: We all friends went to this shop for shopping. We bought sarees and dresses for our family members and some shirts and kurtas too

Name: Jonathan Mathrws
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent articles available in this shop. They have so many things in one place that you are so undecided what to take and not take.

Name: Kanhaiya Mishra
Title: Very attractive marble items /God idols
Review: We were a group of friends and we're searching for a murti, a statue of Hanumanji,  for our temple.  We went to many shops but selected the one at this shop.  The dimensions of idol was perfect,  the face attractive and price just right

Name: Shivani Ojha
Title: Very good items and good service
Review: We went on a shopping spree at this awesome outlet. We asked them to send all items to our address as we were travelling. We received the items in a nicely packed package. Everything was as we had selected and in good condition. We called and thanked them for the brilliant service

Name: Chandrakant Rao
Title: Reasonable prices
Review: Our trip to Rajasthan culminated in the Pink City. On our visit to the Amber Palace we were suggested to visit this shop where we did some shopping. The items were good and prices,in comparison to the local market, reasonable

Name: Grace Towers
Title: Vast collection of items
Review: A grand opportunity and a bigger experience of shopping in  this shop. I have had the opportunity of visiting many places in the country but never have I seen a shop so big as this and having such a vast collection of so many items under one roof

Name: Rajesh Sattam
Title: Awesome tie and dye dresses and sarees
Review: We were amazed to see the tie and dye  dresses. It was the first opportunity for me to see this awesome printing process.

Name: Rameshwar Singh Chouhan
Title: Awesome collection
Review: My visit to this shop was awesome.  I bought some Saturday and dresses for family members.  They have an awesome collection

Name: B B Narang
Title: Frequent visitor
Review: I am a frequent visitor to this shop having made more than a couple of visits and have found the products to be of very good quality. The first time I bought a small carpet a bit hesitantly. The carpet was appreciated by all and since then I have visited many times

Name: Sudha Srivastava
Title: Frequent visitor
Review: On our visit to jaipur we went to this shop for shopping. I have been visitig this shop for umpteen times and have been very much satisfied by the quality of their products and found them to be reasonably priced

Name: Joginder Singh Virk
Title: Excellent jewellery
Review: Excellent stuff available here. Especially the jewellery and gems section is awesome. I was amazed to see such a large collection

Name: heerusoni
Title: Very good carpets
Review: We bought a medium sized silk carpet for our house. The carpet was appreciated by all when laid I'm the house.  They have silk and wool carpets of all dimensions in very good designs

Name: Manohar Desai
Title: Many items in one shop
Review: Good shopping place for many things for all family members. Many items available here in one place like handicrafts sarees quilts dresses jewellery and many more other

Name: Dr Anantha Murthy
Title: Good shopping
Review: We friends came to jaipur for holidays at year end. Enjoyed the visit to the amber palace. After that we visited this shop for shopping on recommendation of some friends. Found in this shop really interesting things. Good shopping

Name: Vidyasagar Kamble
Title: Reasonable prices good quality
Review: The products are reasonably priced and of good quality. Highly recommended to visit this shop. Do not miss to see the juge Taj Mahal displayed there

Name: Mahendra Soni
Title: Magnificent
Review: Magnificent collection of jewellery and handicrafts. The staff is decent, well behaved and explanation of products is good

Name: Tracy Benjamin
Title: Amazing collection of gem stones and jewellery
Review: We were amazed to see the collection of jewellery and gem stones.  Never before have I seen such a huge collection anywhere. The saleman explained about the stones in a wonderful manner. Very informative. There was also a palm reader and astrologist. The consultation was free

Name: Soumajit Ghosh
Title: Fabulous shopping
Review: We did not expect something as fabulous as this shopping experience. We went on a shopping spree buying so many things until we exhausted ourselves.

Name: Vikram Arora
Title: Must visit
Review: We enjoyed shopping in this shop. The articles are nice. The prices are also okay. Whoever comes to Jaipur must visit this place

Name: Furkan N
Title: Authentic products
Review: Superb collection of jaipuri quilts and sarees. The products are guaranteed authentic unlike the ones available in the local bazaar.

Name: Upendra
Title: Decide for yourself. Don't depend on others
Review: I was impressed by the collection at this outlet though I was told not to visit this shop by a few people. But good sense prevailed. I checked out the quality and prices of a few products in the local market and found most less priced and of better quality here. So if someone tells you to not go there do your own research and take your own decision. Not all people are aware of this shop and it's quality products.

Name: Rajesh
Title: Store for all kind of Rajasthan material
Review: The showroom is having variety of items with reasonable prices. The staff and management is very soft spoken and humble. It‚Äôs a kind of family store and we enjoyed shopping at the store. When ever u visit, do ask for amazing ditto copy of Taj Mahal at store.

Name: Naveen Das
Title: Nice stuff
Review: Very nice shop in Amer near Jaipur. The stuff is nice. We bought some things for everyone almost. Nice

Name: Gomathy Srinivasan
Title: Incredibly awesome
Review: We went to see the Amer fort and also did some shopping in this shop. We bought sarees dupattas and lehangas etc. We liked the items and suggest everyone to go there

Name: Nirav Jariwala
Title: Wonderful experience
Review: We had a wonderful experience of shopping here. It is a shoppers paradise. Has all and everything in one shop.

Name: Ajit Nair
Title: Good textile items
Review: The textile section is huge. The collection of sarees is excellent. Designs of block printed and bandhini sarees are very good. The salwar suits are also nice. They also have the famous jaipuri quilts which are light in weight and warm. They also have shawls . Apart from textiles other items like leather, handicrafts and jewellery also available

Name: Ronny D'Souza
Title: Nice items
Review: The shopping experience here is good and the products are also nice. They have so many items on display like textiles handicrafts jewellery and leather items.

Name: Unnikrishnan
Title: vast range of items
Review: Excellent stuff available here. A must visit shop. The prices ate reasonable and affordable. So many articles to choose from

Name: Nikhilesh Khanolkar
Title: Check out yourself
Review: I went to this shop after reading a few reviews. There were good reviews and a few bad ones too. But after seeing for myself I was convinced that the items available were good and the prices reasonable. So my advice is to check out for yourself and not heed to the reviews

Name: Dr Pramod K Pulikkal
Title: Amazing jewellery on display
Review: We were in jaipur to buy some exclusive traditional type jewellery for my sisters wedding preparations.  By chance we went to this shop and saw the jewellery . We were amazed by the collection . The silver and gold jewellery and the gem stones collection is amazing.

Name: Sushmita Roy
Title: Best price shop
Review: The items available are excellent and the prices are affordable. All in all good products. My suggestion to all is to definitely visit if in Jaipur

Name: Patwardhan Anant K
Title: Everything under one roof
Review: You will find everything under one roof. Ranging from immitation jewellery, leather items, textiles, paintings, gem stones, handicrafts and much more. Excellent stuff

Name: PK Iyer Kochi
Title: Good reviews
Review: After reading reviews of this shop I was convinced to buy from here. The reviews are good and the products excellent

Name: Inder Sidhu
Title: Superb
Review: You may be surprised at the range of articles available here The articles are superb and the shop well maintained with good staff

Name: Pawan Sharma
Title: Excellent
Review: The experience of shopping here was excellent.  This is a shop  situated near the Amber Fort. It has a restaurant too where the food is vegetarian and good. The products are good and prices reasonable

Name: AK Tirpude
Title: Suggest to visit
Review: Chanced to visit this shop. It was not on our itinerary but someone suggested. The shop has so many items which makes it difficult to choose from. There is the art gallery with handicraft and paintings. Then there are the carpets, gems and jewellery and the Jaipuri quilts, sarees and dresses. Huge place.

Name: amar g
Title: FRAUD PEOPLE
Review: Don't waste your money, selling same product which is available at BAPU BAZAAR more than 3 times, I have purchased shoes of 2800 which is priced for 890 at BAPU BAZAAR ..same product same brand.. fraud people special Name of person NIRANJAN.. If you want to buy go to local market.. Don't listen guides or autowala Or your cab driver.. They took 30‚ÑÖ commotion  from tourists purchase.. Please don't go there.. No government market.. Totally fraud people.. If you see bill receipt behind they mentioned no refund no legal processing no police case etc.. Have ever read this type of communication on any bill about court police station judiciary.. They wrote becose they are fraud people

Name: Niti
Title: Best shopping place! Hidden gem
Review: Beautiful handicrafts and textiles. The people at the store are absolutely wonderful and are genuinely there to make sure you get the best quality. If you need clothing, jewelry, bedding, or any home decor, this is the place to visit in Jaipur! Make it a day trip and visit Amer fort in the morning and shopping in the afternoon. It is worth your time.

Name: Aartee
Title: Excellent Experience
Review: Excellent quality and wonderful people. This was hands down one of the most amazing experience of Jaipur. Got everything at one place. Lots of variety and really pretty.

Name: Mukhtar Singh
Title: Customise your visit to shop here
Review: This shop is so big that it takes a couple of hours or more to see or select the items. The shipping facility is good. The staff is good and helpful too.

Name: Suresh Saini
Title: Big Taj Mahal
Review: I liked the way the persons deal with the customers. I also liked the articles there. I purchased one marble ganapati. The big Taj Mahal is fantastic

Name: BHAVESH Karnani
Title: Don't heed bad reviews. It's the BEST
Review: I was amazed at the huge collection of so many different items under one roof. Even the jewellery is awesome. The facility of the astrologer is also good. I even checked the quality of products and prices in the local market.  The products are good and prices are competitive. We booked the items for delivery to our house address which were delivered on time.  I'm glad I bought products from this shop.  I highly recommend this shop to all

Name: Kasliwal Anand
Title: Frequent visitor
Review: I am a frequent visitor to this shop having visited many times. The products are very good and have never had any problems or complaint so far.

Name: Manoj Chandra
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent shopping plaza. The sales men are well mannered and the explanation of the products is good. A must visit shop if you are in Jaipur

Name: Aveek Das
Title: Best shopping
Review: Really liked shopping in this shop. Best shopping place in jaipur city. Prices are okay. Articles are nice. So many articles to choose.

Name: Mohd A
Title: Appreciate the service
Review: What I liked best in this shop was the manner in which all customers are treated. It was a great experience and we truly appreciated their commendable job.

Name: Samantha

Name: Meenakshi Patil
Title: Irresistible items

Name: Poonam Joshi

Review: Nice shopping experience. Great environment. Quality products. Best prices. Good helpful staff. Ample parking. There is a restaurant too

Name: John Trevor
Title: Wonderful
Review: We enjoyed shopping at this store. Wonderful stuff here. And the staff is well mannered and helpful. All in all great

Name: Aashish K Bunkar
Title: Best
Review: Nice shop to visit and buy best items at best prices. My friends and I purchased some items that we liked

Name: Washid khan
Title: Reasonable prices
Review: Incredible collection of handicrafts and textiles at reasonable prices. We enjoyed shopping at this place

Name: PSRathore india
Title: Nice shop
Review: Nice place to shop for your loved ones. We all bought sarees and jaipuri hand made shoes etc. The prices are reasonable. The staff helpful

Name: Balram
Title: Nice shop
Review: Nice shop. Good shopping place for all family members. Prices are also okay. Mostly all items are local made

Name: Uktravelthirst
Title: Scam
Review: After purchase, we were shown same items at Jaigarh fort shop at 1/2 the price. We realised that we have been scammed. Avoid.

Name: Rajesh Kumar
Title: Best shop
Review: Best shop in Jaipur for your families needs. Has a lot of options in the textile section like sarees dresses lehanga choli etc

Name: Chetan
Title: Incredible
Review: Since I am fond of art of all kinds I spent a lot of time in the art gallery. They have an incredible collection of handicrafts and paintings. Lovely and irresistible

Name: Abhishek
Title: Really scam don‚Äôt buy anything
Review: Really scam don‚Äôt buy anything, old people selling with so much politeness, with all fake stories, don‚Äôt go inside. I think this whole Rajasthan small scale industry is fake. They are formed to loot people in the name of Rajasthan culture,,,,worst ever place visit‚Ä¶

Name: Unnikrishnan N
Title: Not happy as no fixed price tagged on sareed. The saree price is 7500 which I feel is too high.
Review: We purchased sarees worth Rs 20000/= The price is not tagged on sarees and I felt it as cheating. What ever price the sales person says we have to accept. Even the bill is not computerized. It added to my suspicion. I doubt he money that I spent would have not gone to the weavers. The sales man and others would have shared a lot

Name: Dinesh Kumar
Title: Incredible and awesome
Review: Incredible collection of ethnic wear dresses for all ages. They also have an awesome collection of paintings, carpets and gem stones and jewellery. A place not to be missed on your visit to Jaipur

Name: Ravindra Singh
Title: Must visit
Review: I have visited this shop a couple of times before too and always found something new here. So many items on display here makes it difficult to imagine what you want or don't want

Name: sudheer r
Title: Scam Scam Scam !!
Review: Worst Worst Worst Worst Quality !! Scam Alert !! Over Priced !! Never buy from them !! We purchased quilt from them in store and also ordered few to be delivered at later date but when we started seeing fur coming from the quilt and all over bed. We reached them to cancel other order and they told they will not cancel.

Name: Amit
Title: Horriable experience! total scam here
Review: Total scam!!!All are requested to be careful.Do not enter this place and run away if any guide takes you there.They have average quality products with 3 to 10x markups.

Name: Yusuf Khan
Title: Best
Review: Best shopping place in the Rajasthan state.  Vast collection of paintings and handicrafts. Gems and jeweslso

Name: Dhirendra
Title: Awesome
Review: Awesome collection.  Great environment.  Reasonable prices. Helpful staff. Has big parking space so no problem to park your vehicle

Name: Suresh
Title: Scam claiming to be a cooperative society. Nothing but a private organisation
Review: Please Avoid this shop. Its nothing but a scam between the shop guide and driver. All highly priced. Can get better stuff at 1/3rd the price in the markets near hawa mahal.No price lists. Staff act very courteous but its only to gain your trust in them.

Name: Pradeep
Review: I don,t think this type of profile came to us i think so many shopkeeper,s are there and they're may be trying to distrub our name Or our market Because there are  so much compition so i humbly request to trip advisor managing centre please help us to remove this

I don,t think this type of profile came to us i think so many shopkeeper,s are there and they're may be trying to distrub our name Or our market Because there are  so much compition so i humbly request to trip advisor managing centre please help us to remove this

Name: Virender Singh
Title: Worth a visit
Review: A place worth visiting if you are a connoisseur of art. The collection of paintings and handicrafts are excellent.

Name: Bobby Kumar
Title: Best shop
Review: Best shop in the city of Jaipur. We bought many items for family and friends. Staff was also cooperative

Name: Ram Swaroop
Title: Fantastic shop
Review: Fantastic shop in the foothills of the Amber fort near Pink City having traditional articles of all kinds ranging from textiles, handicrafts, jewellery and carpets at very reasonable prices

Name: VKS309
Title: Bad Experience
Review: A really overpriced and blatant scam of a shop. Just saw the price of an emerald ring at a well known branded jewellery store where it‚Äôs in the range of Rs 20000. This group of cheats and crooks were trying to get us to buy a small emerald for Rs. 96,000-1,00,000. Cotton stoles are being sold as Pashmina in the range of 6,000-10,000. You‚Äôll find similar stoles in the local market for Rs.1000.

Name: Shiv Negi
Title: Wonderful
Review: A grand experience at shopping in this wonderful place for the whole family. We bought so many things from here.

Name: Inspire782517
Title: SCAM ALERT
Review: A consummate scam that starts with your driver and tour guide. You are told that this is a government run fixed price cooperative directly benefiting village craftsmen and weavers whenit‚Äôs nothing but a private store with no labels or price tags attached to any product. It‚Äôs supposedly a fixed price shop but variable prices are obviously quoted to different customers.You‚Äôve let your guard down thinking that this is a state cooperative enterprise. The store is full of overpriced quilts, jewellery, carpets, textiles, handicrafts and various other items. They show you a set of items, you select something and then you are quickly taken to some other counter to be shown some other products. They then replace the selected products with defective/ inferior duplicates, cover and pack them and send them directly to the payment counter. They also quoted a lower price when we were selecting the item and inflated the price when putting it on the final bill. You are charged GST but given a handwritten bill, the reverse of which has terms and conditions saying that no exchange or refunds are given.Then comes the biggest scam. A so called renowned astrologer, whose only purpose in the shop is to play on your emotions (read gullibility) to convince you to go and buy a precious stone that is supposedly the cure for all the problems that you or your family members might be facing in their lives. In our case, it was supposedly an emerald worth Rs. one lakh. At the last minute some good sense prevailed on us and we refused to buy the gemstone.We had in any case by now,  run up a bill of close to Rs 50000 for products that you could buy elsewhere for half the price. A lesson learnt the hard way unfortunately for us. It was only on arriving back at our hotel that we opened the  packed items and realised that we had been sold very poor quality stuff. Go in with your eyes wide open if you do choose to shop here and be aware of the organised scam that‚Äôs being run by the drivers, guides and shops offering all Rajasthani/Indian souvenirs under one roof and adopting names similar to government run enterprises.

Name: Go Hari India Tour
Title: Best shop
Review: My visit to Jaipur culminated with shopping at this store.  Bought some things for the family. The staff was helpful and prices reasonable

Name: Sahiram singh
Title: Huge shop
Review: An awesome place for shopping. You get whatever you desire at this huge shopping centre. The prices are reasonable

Name: Akash soni
Title: Exclusive
Review: Exclusive collection of handmade carpets. The designs and colors are very good. The prices are comparative to machine made carpets. They say handmade carpets last longer than machine made carpets

Name: Vinod kumar
Title: Best shop
Review: Best emporium in Jaipur for shopping  for entire family. You get jewellery of all kinds and handicrafts also

Name: Ashutosh pandey
Title: Recommended
Review: On my visit to Jaipur i got the chance to visit this emporium in Amer.  The items available were awesome.  I strongly recommend to all to visit.

Name: Suresh Saini
Title: Nice
Review: Very nice shop for shopping in Jaipur city  Very nice collection of  sarees and salwar suits‡•§   Also big collection of handicrafts and jewellery    Reasonable prices compared to other shops in city

Name: Mukesh kumar yadav
Title: Excellent
Review: Excellent shopping place where you find everything under one roof. From carpets textiles handicrafts and jewellery etc at very affordable prices

Name: Rina
Title: Very good place
Review: Great experience to be here with larg no of articals. Me and my friends enjoyed a lot here. Staff is so humble.

Name: Mukesh Sharma
Title: Nice
Review: Very good items are available here.  Prices are also as per quality.  Jewellery and handicraft   is also nice

Name: Ghanshyam Gujar
Title: Best shop
Review: Best shop in Jaipur for purchase of ethnic textile and paintings. Prices are reasonable and staff is co-operative

Name: Vishnu C
Title: Scam alert
Review: This is not  just about overpricing, they are running a scam . The guides in the forts will set the stage and they will give a feel like its an authentic handmade products selling shop.In this  shop they says its belongs to Rajasthan govt and it is not.There is no price tags in any of the products.Bills are written by hand and still they put GST.Please visit this place to feel the scam play and never buy anything from this place.

Name: Jugalchand
Title: Delightful
Review: My second visit to this shop gave me an insight to more than what I had expected from the people there. New arrivals in all sections were available which gave more choice for selecting items. In all a delightful experience

Name: Praveen kumar
Title: Great shopping experience
Review: Wonderful  experience awaits here for anyone who visits this shop to purchase any ethnic items of the state

Name: Suchi
Title: FRAUD ALERT! BEWARE!
Review: I hope this serves as a warning for all my fellow tourists and they don't suffer the same trauma we underwent. These guys sell substandard products at 2-5 times the actual price. This is a big group of people trying to scam tourists, starting from the cab driver to the guide. Please do your research and save yourselves the time, effort and money and visit Johri/Baapu bazaar instead. Trust me if you visit this place, u will be CHEATED. Just SKIP this, I can't stress enough. Nothing that I bought from here was worth the price we paid (and we spent a lot of money!) You would not want your trip get ruined just because of this one mistake you made by visting these scamsters. Just don't visit. Oh, and there are similar fraudulent stores near other historical monuments in Jaipur. Adding the RED SIGNS, their terms and conditions on the bill, just so you are aware. The bill that you would be handled at the last monent and that too folded, will mention that the goods won't be exchanged(even if damaged?) You wouldn't have the time to exchange anyway! Also read, that there is no guarantee on the colours of the garments, but they were confident that their vegetable dye would never bleed! Also, they call themselves a government established fixed price shop. But their products do not have price tags so the sales person just makes up a price. This is a well planned, multi level trap to cheat tourists. BEWARE!

Name: Rajiv N
Title: Excellent place to visit to discover the art of Fabric Block printings of Rajasthan
Review: Set in Amer just next to the Kheri Gate on the way to the Amer Fort, this place is a treat for anyone interested in the Rich Rajasthani art of Block printing. While we were conversant with printing techniques like Sanghaneri and Bhagru this place had a lot more to offer. It is set in an old bunglow and has rooms dedicated to each of the printing techniques. There is a master ji who taught  us how to do a block print. My younger daughter thoroughly enjoyed it. There is an artisan who showed us how to carve a block. The entry fee is just Rs.40 for an adult and there is a donation box in case one wants to donate. The most striking thing about this museum is the peace and quiet of this place. It has several rooms, niches and stairs which make the place intriguing. Its a must vist for anyone visiting Amer which is about 16 kms from the airport. This area is avoidable during the 26th of Dec to 7th of Jan due to the huge influx of tourists from Delhi. There is a small anokhi store which sells some garments and gifting ideas in block print. One  can buy a bag or a tshirt in white and try printing the same in block prints. The evolution of a grey fabric through the indigo dyeing process with a print are one of the many exhibits that one can see. The overall experience is enriching

Name: fozjon
Title: interesting interactive place
Review: Not necessarily my thing, but my wife and her friend LOVED this museum. I didn't find it intolerable, it was quite interesting. It's nice that they have little interactive places to try your own hand at blockprint.

Name: Bhaskar_10
Title: Excellent upkeep and preserving rich Indian history and craft
Review: Visited on 08/November 2022this place has a entry fee of INR 50/- per personthe 4 story place is very well appointed with the Rajasthani graft sector work and spreading awareness of the same among the visitors and tourists.The displays are very well placed with information boards providing all necessary details of the craft and the processes involved thus being of educational importance as well.Activities like block making, block printing are included in the visit experience with a little extra cost addedGreat exposure for students and youngsters to value rich Indian cuture and appreciating craft.I do recommend a visit to tihs place for young people, however, families with children and senior citizen may decide to avoid this place as no lift and high stairs will make movement difficult.

Name: beckynmax
Title: Love, love, love
Review: Love this place! See the history and process if making beautiful block print fabric & make one to take home. The building id gorgeous!

Name: Aparna
Title: Great Experience, Charming Museum
Review: Lovely little museum neart the Amer fort - set in a gorgeous restored Haveli. The exhibits are fascinating. And the top floor where you can try some block printing on cloth with some guidance is a lot of fun! Don't miss the shop, it has more interesting things ( albeit more expensive) than the regular Anokhi shop. Well worth a visit.

Name: praew
Title: 10 out of 10 l a must visit
Review: IMPRESSIVE. Exceed expectations in every way. Highly recommend A lot of museums have tons of things to display but don't know how to tell stories. That's not the case with Anokhi museum. They know what they're doing.***Easy access by public transportation. A short flat walk from Amer fort.They combined the gorgeous space with beautiful examples and good storytelling. History of old days, visualized and detailed methods and material, importance, examples, reimagining and surviving in modern-day, comparison, demonstration, workshop... you name it. Here you have it all. Plus proper info signage Some areas can use a little more light, stairs - not elderly/wheelchair friendly but overall is nice. User friendly, Better (by far the best) than most museums here. Whoever work for this deserve a raise and a big clapThe Museum shop is also very nice. I got some great books and textiles from them

Name: Wizziwoo803
Title: Excellent experience and very warm, welcoming staff
Review: We went to the Anokhi Museum having seen a flyer for it in the Anokhi Cafe. We didn‚Äôt realise it is closed from 15th May - 15th July and arrived anyway. Despite it being closed the staff there were so incredibly welcoming and friendly. We were not lucky enough to see all of the exhibition because it was closed for cleaning, fixing etc but the very kind gentleman showed us what he could and we still had a very interesting and memorable time.We really appreciated the efforts that the staff went to to accommodate us despite our mistake and are looking forward to visit next time when the museum is fully functional. A big thank you to the three gentleman there, I wish I could remember their names :(

Name: Film G
Title: Way Better than Expected
Review: Set in a fabulously renovated building ‚Äî itself worth the trip ‚Äî the exhibits are well laid out and have good explanations. Clean toilet. There are also artisans there showing how to make the wooden blocks used in the fabric printing, and doing the actual printing itself. You can join in, and get a souvenir. The museum store is also great, full of beautiful handmade stuff at a modest price, given the workmanship. Not to be missed. You might think ‚ÄòFabric Museum. Ugh‚Äô You‚Äôd be very wrong. Even kids would like the artisans.

Name: Eileen G
Title: A quiet spot in the city
Review: The museum was small and informative. We had a private tour guide who explained about haveli's and the restoration of the building. I wouldn't go out of my way to see it. But it is in a lovely quiet spot. I bought a few nice scarves in the shop.

Name: Chris W
Title: Beautiful handmade crafts and no pressured selling at all
Review: The museum is next to the Amber Fort and well worth seeing when you visit the fort.There are demonstrations of printing and woodworking being undertaken by the craftsmen at the museum. The variety and quality of the designs is excellent and better than those in local markets and shops.There is a shop at the museum and high quality printed fabrics and products are available at very affordable prices

Name: Florian254
Title: Fully worth the detour mind your head
Review: I was not impressed with the idea to visit a hand printing museum but I changed my mind. Put into a very interesting building (mind your head) it gives an interesting insight into a nearly lost tradition, explains the how to and history pretty well and show pretty and interesting textiles.Beware it can be too much information at a time.

Name: Travitravels
Title: A Brilliant Musuem
Review: A lovely museum holding beautiful exhibits of textiles and the techniques used to make them. Definitely worth a visit for what I remember to be a very reasonable price.Sits very closely to Amber fort so you could easily do both in a day.Brilliant shop inside aswell. Would love to see a bit more in the cafe as your some distance from shops but otherwise, brilliant.

Name: itchyfeetArizona
Title: EXCELLENT MUSEUM
Review: An outstanding little museum in a beautifully restored Haveli. Exhibitions are well laid out, displayed and explained. There's not too little to bore you, not too much to overwhelm, just perfect for you to gain a good understanding about hand printing and grow to appreciate, if not love it! The quality of the works are astounding. Mr. Pavan gave us a tour and he explained everything really well. The museum shop is delightful as well. The live demonstrations are fascinating. We love the dignity of this museum. Such a beautiful example of how to preserve tradition and culture without blatant commercialization. Very refreshing after the ugly commercialized Amber Fort. This museum is well worth a couple hours of your time!

Name: Brun066
Title: Here I really learned about entities I didn't know about before
Review: I asked our taxi driver to visit this museum, as my guidebook recommended it as an outstanding sight near Amber Fort. But I didn't know anything about it.I too was impressed by the skill with which the ancient "haveli" that houses the museum has been restored, and by the care with which it's maintained.The exhibition of the craft of hand printing by wooden blocks is also interesting for those who are not fond of fabrics: he / she will learn the essentials of both the different characteristics of fabrics and the ways of printing them.At the end of the visit, a craftsman printed a cotton handkerchief in different colors and patterns in a few minutes, and gave it to my wife, who still keeps it.After my visit to this museum, I learned that the name "Anokhi" is that of a local company that has a factory in Jaipur and employs many hundreds of workers in the production of fabrics printed by this traditional technique. And I also understood that this technique, which risked disappearing at the end of the last century, derives from a secular Indian tradition, in which Rajastan, and in particular the town of Bagru, west of Jaipur, excels.In short, I really learned about entities I didn't know; as it's obvious, traveling to a country like India, which for its size and the antiquity of its civilization has a "reservoir" of cultural accumulation among the very first in the world.

Name: aishwarya m
Title: Textiles, History &  Architecture
Review: A well maintained museum dedicated to textiles. The way to the museum amidst the lanes of Amber is equally enjoyable, especially if you are a lover of art and architecture!

Name: rogerl044
Title: Insight into the reason Indian textiles ruled the world
Review: You have to see the complicated steps needed to make the fabrics to understand why the fabric produced would be so sought after. It must have taken much enginuity to discover all the plants and processes necessary.Beautiful printing and wonderful colours.The "demonstrations" are really just a shop so be prepared.

Name: PKfamily
Title: Hands on experience at museum
Review: This museum is located close to Amer Fort and is excellent value for money (clean toilets too!). We looked at the exhibitions and then had a live demonstration of how to make a wooden block pattern to use as a print. We continued to another live demonstration of how to block print on fabric. We were able to have a go and were allowed to take our sampler piece away as a souvenir.A very quiet museum which is well worth a visit.

Name: Chetan Shroff
Title: Witness hand block printing
Review: This place is near Amer Fort. Jaipur is famous for hand block printing. We could see live demonstrations in this museum. An old haveli has been restored. There is permanent exhibition of hand block printed clothes and information about this tradition. The real fun is when you see how it happens. First artist shows how printing blocks are made. In next room, you can see how block printing actually happens. The artists allow you to do hand block printing. There is a shop selling these clothes.

Name: Diogo F
Title: Amazing place
Review: Great museum with a real social impact. Please keep up the good work we love your museum and your prints. Definitely a must do if you enjoy knowing about textiles and its history. The chai in the cafe was the best I had in a month in India!

Name: Harry A
Title: Wonderful block printed textiles
Review: The museum has a great range of textiles showcasing the various traditional Rajasthan block-printing styles. But the best part is the working craftsmen who are still cutting wood blocks and printing on textiles by hand using traditional tools. Fascinating!

Name: Sandra Artist
Title: Splendid museum of printing and haveli
Review: This beautiful haveli has been restaured with local materials,well worth a visit.The entrance fee is only 100 roupees each: there are very clean and beautiful toilets, a nice caf√© in the shade.The wood block printing technique is explained very well,and a few artisans show you how the sculpting of wood teak blocks,dyes and methods on cloth.It's excellent curating is educational, sponsored by a Japanese artist too.There's an extensive collection ofIndian costumes.Master Mujeeb Ullakhan and Mohammad Iqbal were lovely and proud to share their experience, thank you!

Name: Nidhi Jain Seth
Title: If textile or history interests you... don't miss this one
Review: Small little museum which is a must see place when in jaipur... Feels like everything to do with block printing history and process is captured in one place. After visiting the museum and looking at how blocks are made and how everything is hand made I have a new level of respect for all the block printing material. great initiative by Anokhi...

Name: malonemi
Title: Stay and do your own printing
Review: Great place to linger and create your own block print bag, kerchief or other textile with Anohki block printing artisans.  Language barrier no issue as all collaborate to create.  If you're not creating, wander the floors of the haveli. Lot's to read and learn about. Great collective effort to preserve and make relevant this creative endeavor from Rajasthan.

Name: Asian adventure
Title: "Very Good"
Review: An very good option for local shopping specially Jaipur block printing which is very popular in this area the hand block printing work.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: art
Review: This is a small textile museum located in encient old but beautiful building. There is small gift shop as well.

Name: Umang A
Title: Craft
Review: This is small textile museum dedicated to ancient art. Located in an old building with old city. There is small gift shot which houses variety of handcrafted items.

Name: Bianca
Title: Truly anokhi (unique)
Review: A one of a kind museum. Very informative with regards to preserving and educating people about a dying form of art of block printing. Enjoyed our visit and meeting the artisans.

Name: travellerY3298AY
Title: Skilled Block Printing
Review: The museum was founded by caucasian lady who still lives and who married an son of a local Lord. Founded to support the local artisans skilled in the art of block printing of various types . Lets you try your hand at it!. Also contains a museum with exceptionally fine examples of the above art . Some are for sale in the shop attached to it.

Name: Texas Traveler
Title: fabric museum
Review: I enjoyed touring in this museum of fabrics and history.  You can learn a lot about block printing in this place and even make your own small block print or watch it being done.  One thing is there are a lot of stairs to be able to move around and see things, so if you have trouble with stairs you may not be able to see much.  Also in summer it's very warm because there is no AC.

Name: Saverio1903
Title: A Most Wonderful Museum
Review: We very much enjoyed our visit to this quiet, pleasant museum. The exhibits of hand printing techniques are quite good, and include many examples of the tools used and the beautiful fabrics produced. We also saw two wonderful demonstrations of the technique used in this textile art, including a hands-on chance to try the technique ourselves.This museum is in the area near the Amber Fort and you could possibly see both places in the same day, though we chose to go to each place on separate days.

Name: Ashok M
Title: Block printing of Jaipur
Review: A museum depicting block printing  tradition of  Rajsthan an unique style of textile printing  known for its vegetable dyes and colors.

Name: vishphoo2231
Title: nice museum!
Review: Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing is hand painting museum very beautiful and unique art i saw  beautiful  paintings

Name: Ruthie17
Title: Interesting small museum of block printing
Review: An interesting museum, near Amber Fort, showcasing different block printing techniques.Many beautiful textiles and extensive explanations, and at certain hours a demonstration of multi colored block printing.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Very Nice Museum
Review: The Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing is located in small renovated charming Haveli close to the Amber fort. Here one can witness the local artisans use block printing techniques to create intricate and colorful designs on the cloth. The museum also has a gift shop where one can buy the finished products. Not many tourists visit the place.

Name: mnptrip
Title: Nice small museum. Very close to Amer Fort.
Review: I really liked this small museum that showcases block-printing techniques. It is run by Anokhi, which is a wonderful company that makes clothing popular with Westerners, that is trying to preserve the old block-printing methods and dyes. The museum explains the process of printing the cloth and showcases costumes and fabrics using techniques regional to the Jaipur area. This is very close to Amer Fort and worth a short visit. It is housed in a beautiful restored haveli and has a small gift shop. They don't give commissions to the many touts and guides so it is not crowded.

Name: nicabol
Title: Excellent exhibit and demonstrations
Review: This was among my favorite stops during my monthlong tour of northern India, thanks to artisans demonstrating their craft, as well as detailed explanations of the history and techniques of hand blocked fabric printing in Rajasthan.

Name: foxyloxyied
Title: Amazing walk through the history of block print
Review: As above well worth the visit if interested in textile designWonderful explanation and examples of early block print design.

Name: RonishBaxter
Title: Anokhi Museum
Review: Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing located in the ancient pink 'Chanwar Palkiwalon ki Haveli' also known as Anokhi Haveli.  The foundation takes cares of the talent and skills of the artisans and provides good employment opportunities. It also works on reviving the age old tradition of hand book printing which also includes traditional hand printing methods and techniques.

Name: LAAD_Scotland
Title: Interesting demos of block printing and have a go yourself!
Review: This lovely museum is at the end of Amber village, so it‚Äôs ideal to visit after the Amber Fort. It‚Äôs in a beautifully restored haveli which is part of the old town wall; it has a small caf√© in the front courtyard and is a haven of peace! If you are interested in textile history, the museum has fascinating exhibits of hand block printing from ancient to modern times ‚Äì but if you aren‚Äôt so interested in the history, then go straight to the top floor where real artisans demonstrate making the wooden printing blocks and making real block printed fabrics. You can even have a go at making your own block printed handkerchief under their expert and amused supervision! Entrance is amazingly good value at 80 rupees (less than ¬£1) and then you can support this good cause by buying a small handmade item from the shop. Afterwards you can visit the impressive and nearby stepwell (currently free)!

Name: Panisa K.
Title: nice hand printed museum
Review: There are a lot of old textile with hand printed which are display in the museum and also they showed the process of hand printed.

Name: Pushpa1969
Title: Beautiful Block Printing Museum
Review: We visited this beautiful block printing museum and had a wonderful experience and learnt about the ancient block printing techniques which is still used by the artisans. We got some hands on training with block prinitng, using different natural colours/dyes and also saw how the artist intricately carves these wooden blocks!! They have on display many fabrics and there is a shop as well.

Name: NettyRae
Title: Beautiful Museum
Review: Thanks to those responsible for providing this wonderful space to explore the art of block printing.  The restored Haveli is beautiful & textiles on display stunning.  Wonderful to see this craft alive and well.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: History of Textile Printing by Hand relived
Review: It is a rare opportunity to witness live creations in a Museum . You can witness how beautiful Textiles were created by hand printing , a specialty of Jaipur . You can even design and make a print fabric of your choice with your own hands and enjoy a unique experience .Amolak Rattan KohliFormer Governor of Mizoram

Name: Amanda T
Title: Stunning building, beautiful collection of textiles
Review: I really enjoyed our visit here, it is incredibly cheap to visit the museum (less than ¬£1) and for anyone interested in textiles or printing then it is a must.  Would definitely recommend.

Name: Barbara E
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: Caught bus out to Amber and walked to the museum which is housed in a restored havelli. Nice well labelled exhibitions and demonstration of woodblock carving and block printing where you can also contribute. There is also a shop and cafe. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Name: Laura Gillis
Title: Anokhi Museum
Review: This place was so fun! There were exhibits on the history of textiles in India and you could watch how block printing is done and even make your own to take home! The staff were very kind- they made chai for my friend and me while we waited for the rain to stop before leaving.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Good art work
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, we had visited the beautiful Amber Fort and this unique museum was located close by and so we decided to check this out too. This museum is located inside a traditional Rajasthani Haveli and showcases the art & heritage of hand printing using wooden blocks.We purchased tickets to enter the museum. We saw many types of traditional hand printed colorful dresses for male & female on display. We also saw artisans at work.

Name: SLPayne
Title: A fabulous place for the textile fans
Review: I wanted to visit this museum because I am textile artist and so I am fascinated to see traditional techniques. It certainly didn't disappoint! It is set in a restored 16th century mansion near Jaipur‚Äôs Amber Fort and it is a welcome break from the heat! It was quiet on the day I visited so I had the place to myself to enjoy the huge number of textiles on display. Everything was very well labelled, with explanations about the items themselves, how they are used in everday life, as well as how they are created and by whom. The block printing and block carving demonstrators were amazingly talented and it was definitely worth the entrance fee. It also has nice clean toilets which is always a bonus!

Name: PushExplore
Title: Exquisite Artwork
Review: The Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing comes highly recommended, so we went to have a look. They have quite a fascinating collection, mind you its not cheap and sort of catered to foreigners/expats. The service staff are friendly.

Name: delph1969
Title: love it
Review: This restored haveli is beautiful, the location near by Amber fort is peacefull and quiet and gives you some rest from the busy pink city.The museum is very well done, textiles lovers will appreciate to discover the story of block printing.You can go with groups, students (student in fashion should not miss it), children.I took some with me for workshops and they loved it.They made a piece of textile with blockprints with the very nice guide.The staff is nice and friendly. I go there every time i am in Jaipur and have in the courtyard a ginger drink or a tchai with their delicious fig cookies.The entrance fees are very raisonnable prices.Yo can reach this place by cab, then go to Amber fort by walk or cab.By walk you will see some friendly goats or cows on the way and could stop to a nice temple on the way.

Name: Naomi W
Title: A quiet gem amid the bustle of Amer and surprisingly family friendly
Review: We took our girls aged 4 and 7 here after going to Amber Fort. The museum is situated in a 400 year old building which is beautiful in itself. The museum was very quiet and incredibly cheap with no one hassling us or with any expectation that we would buy anything.The man at the front desk showed us around- it isn't a huge collection but as we'd seen and bought block print clothing it was interesting looking at the different styles. We spent quite a bit of time watching the demonstrations of block carving and printing in the cool of the upper courtyards- our girls were given the small flower block prints we saw carved and 2 block printed hankerchiefs they helped to print. You can pay to block print your own scarf, bag or t shirt (not advertised on their website oddly but a wonderful activity for children) but we opted to buy some block prints in the shop to make our own t shirts at home. The shop was a little more limited than I expected but there is a large Anokhi shop in Jaipur anyway. The shop does provide quiz sheets and colouring for  children which is a nice touch since sights in India do not always think of children. There is a cafe kiosk outside and picnic tables where it would be pleasant to sit. A definite for art lovers or to escape the hoardes! We wish we'd spent more time there.

Name: woodk8719
Title: innovative
