There is a trick, be calm, avoid the adults and the young will climb on your shoulder. Be calm and don‚Äôt look them in the eye. If you go right to the top which is about 10 minute walk above the temple the view is amazing. This place is marmite. You either love it or hate it. I love it, I‚Äôve sat quite happily with 2 monkeys on me feeding them peanuts. It was a joy.

Name: Shannon
Title: Fun experience
Review: A lot of fun. Rohit was our guide and made us feel comfortable and safe amongst the monkeys. He‚Äôs also a great picture taker, highly recommend him as your monkey man! :) don‚Äôt go into the temples if you don‚Äôt want to pay money. We went in and I actually enjoyed it. We got blessed and got a necklace and bracelet and he put paint on our foreheads, but of course you have to tip.

Name: Scott H
Title: Be careful
Review: I've been travelling in Asia for the past 3 months and spent around 5 weeks in India. During that time I think this monkey temple was one of the most stressful experiences we had.My wife and I initially got dropped off by a tuk tuk driver and were immediately mobbed by people insisting on selling us peanuts to feed the monkeys. It was a bit intimdating tbh. The next thing we know we are being instructed by our driver to walk up the hill with a 10 year old kid who would show us around and 'protect us' from the monkeys!A couple of observations:There are a lot of monkeys up there, they are very wild and some are quite big/aggressive. I've encountered monkeys on many occasions before on my travels, but this experience was not a fun one tbh. They follow you closely and are not afraid of you at all. I was glad to be protected tbh, even if it was by a kid.On the way up we were joined by a man who the boy claimed would show us round. He kept trying to put a monkey on my wife for a pic despite us continually saying no. Many of them do not look like the healthiest monkeys you'll see tbh, so we were a bit worried. Two eventually jumped on my wifes head and another tried to steal my bag.There's lots of dodgy looking groups of men hanging about on the way to the temple. We were followed a few times. There is also quite a lot of trash about. I wouldn't say it's a very sanitary place and it's certainly not well looked after.The temple itself isn't really all that special and we didn't feel all that comfortable being there tbh. Several guys asked us for money and one even told me to be careful with our 'guide' as he was not to be trusted and would try and rob/take all my stuff. This 'guide' later on insisted on me giving him a 'gift' despite the fact he hadn't been invited to join us and hadn't really shown us anything in the 10 minutes or so he was there.The kid that walked with us was lovely and was from a very poor family. I'd have happily given him some decent money, but I suspect (and he implied as much) that much of it would get taken from him by the men that 'organise' these tours and who sit all day drinking chai at the entrance. I made sure to give him money before we were in eyeshot of them. Had he not been with us it would have been a pretty terrifying experience in all honesty.Our tuk tuk driver feigned some outrage at our experience, but it's all for show really. I suspect there is a pretty long running and established scam here. Be mindful.Ultimately this trip was way more hassle than its worth. I've at times felt a bit unsafe at places in India, but this was the absolute worst. My recommendation for Jaipur more broadly would be to book trips via your hotel. It might be more expensive, but there is accountability and your time won't be spent visiting places such as this where it feels unsafe and you're likely to get scammed. It's an amazing city, but there are many tuk tuk drivers that will offer you cheap personal tours which aren't always what they seem. Ours gave us no warning or heads up about the temple whatsoever, he merely sat with his feet up talking to his mates at the bottom.If you must go here please be very careful. I just don't think it's worth it at all.

Name: JennRain
Title: Love this place
Review: Don‚Äôt listen to the bad reviews, this place is amazing, make sure you get the guide I will add a photo of him. Don‚Äôt go inside the temples they just want to convert you. Just say no to the beggars. Buy food for monkeys they are safe and tame. The history, and beauty.

Name: Lucy
Title: Avoid avoid avoid.
Review: I don't usually write reviews but feel I need to warn others. We went as part of a day tour, this was one of 5 or 6 places we were going. I assumed it was just some ruins and the monkeys would be playing or doing their own thing on the ruins and that we would just watch them. I WAS WRONG. I can see now that I was naive and made 2 mistakes:1) I didn‚Äôt buy any of the money food the beggars were selling. In retrospect having some food in my hand would have made it easier to get the moneys off me as I could have thrown it and they would have chased it, leaving me alone. 2) The children of the beggars run round you and harass you as soon as they see you, they try and sell you things or offer to come with you to ‚Äúprotect you from the monkeys‚Äù - I should have taken one of the children up on this as no doubt they‚Äôd have been much braver than me when the monkeys surrounded us. Anyway, we started walking up the hill and there was a row of little tents, there are some extremely poor people living on the side of monkey temple, not very nice to see. They had a pig and a cow mid way through giving birth with them so to someone from the UK this was a bizarre enough start to the visit. As we got up the hill and saw more monkeys, I unzipped my bag and got my phone out. I think the monkeys thought I was getting food out of my bag and they jumped towards us. Some of the bigger ones are quite scary, I saw one grabbing the nuts out of another tourists hand, they aren‚Äôt cute like you‚Äôd imagine. I was surrounded by about 5 monkeys and more were running towards me, one jumped onto the back of my skirt and was swinging on it. I ended up throwing my water bottle which they all chased and we promptly turned around and walked away as fast as we could. They aren‚Äôt intimidated by humans (which they are in the other parts of India I‚Äôve been to) as they‚Äôre so used to seeing them and grabbing food off them. They swiped and hissed at my partner.

Name: gary
Title: Monkey temple
Review: Wowwwww.,first time we visit place like this ,I have seen some photos of monkey temple in Instagram, it really look cool ,more then thousands monkey We enjoy lot

Name: Elliott
Title: Do not reccomend
Review: The whole place is filthy and run down, for the cost to drive out there and to get in the gate it is definitely not work it.

Name: MC0nT0ur
Title: A great visit
Review: A great relaxing walk after the hustle and bustle of some of the other Jaipur attractions. Brilliant views from temple. Opted to walk up to temple on my own after declining the offer of the accompaniment of the youths at the Tuk Tuk drop off point.the monkeys were well behaved.

Name: Asha Simunek
Title: We survived.. never again.
Review: Lots of fat monkeys which are used to get food from people, so they are everywhere waiting for it. Kids trying to sell you monkey food or be your guide. As a girl I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable being there, many guys are taking bath there and watching us very strangely. One of them asked us for donation, place is messy and unclean so for the money they could at least keep the place tidy. I didn‚Äôt enjoy this place and was glad being out of there. Maybe if you join some kind of ceremony with more knowledge then could be nice...

Name: Adar Giladi
Title: Must visit with Children
Review: We always were afraid of the monkies and at last with help of monkey master (300-500 rupee) we were able to take photos with them sitting on our shoulders.They are cute but you need to be carefull.We bought some peanuts outside and each child gave the monkies one by one.Be careful not to get near mothers with babies.The place itself is so beautiful...You can take a dip in the pool with all other indian visitors.Highly recommended !

Name: damiadvisor
Title: Good site, cheater guide ‚ÄúMonkey Master‚Äù
Review: The temple is great to visit.There are local people having holy baths and kids studying Sanskrit.Also monkeys are funny.I strongly suggest not to take guides, you can have the tour by yourself.We have been cheated by the ‚ÄúMONKEY MASTER‚Äù (in pictures) guide that was asking 1.500 Rs for the tour.

Name: Ashleigh Poole
Title: Gorgeous views and lovely monekys
Review: The most well-behaved monkeys I‚Äôve ever met! I was a little cautious of the monkeys taking my belongings etc. but they were just happily playing in their swimming pool, eating bananas, fooling around with each other on the steps. They were absolutely lovely!The temples are manned by ‚Äòmonkey men‚Äô who try to bless you and take big tips. You pay an entrance fee so these men are just hanging around trying to make a bit of extra money. We chose one to be blessed by and were given a bracelet and bindi, but if you‚Äôre not interested you just have to ignore them and don‚Äôt converse at all. There are also men trying to sell you nuts for the monkeys for a very high price. The monkeys will come close to you for photos without the nuts. Brilliant pit stop on our Golden Triangle tour.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Wonderful
Review: Very attractive and wonderful temple. You should visit here once in your life to feel very good.. Visited here with friends and all of us experience was excellent.

Name: Liv Mari S
Title: Amazing views
Review: The monkey temple is located in a small valley that you can reach by walking through the gate by the main road, then up the hill and down on the other side. On the way you will be able to see a great view, several other temples (the sun temple is at the top of the hill), and a lot of monkeys (hold on to your belongings). Once we walked through the gate a boy started walking with us, presenting himself, asking us questions and explaining things about the area to us. He was very polite and friendly, and we saw several other boys his age following other people around. We allowed him to show us around the area because he was so nice, but he also expected to be payed at the end, so if you want to avoid that you should let them know in the beginning. It is also good to know that if you enter any of the temples, the people there expect you to give a donation. We did not bring that much cash, so in one of the temples we only gave a few coins, and they were clearly angry with us for not giving more money, which was rather unpleasant. People also came up to us to make us hold one of the monkeys on our shoulders, and got quite angry when we refused to do it. A woman also walked right up to me to give me a red dot on my forehead, and when i tried to stop her she pushed my hand to the side, and demanded money from me before i could walk on. So the people there can be quite intense, and be mindful of who you want to give our money to. We were also a little confused because of the name of this place, but do not mistake it for the Khole Ke Hanuman Ji temple, which is in a different location and does not have monkeys.

Name: Skp23111195
Title: Galtaji temple
Review: Many temple are there.the monkey are the kings. It was old Hindu temple.monkey jumped here and there.high hill.veryy big temple.

Name: Greengrassbros
Title: Totally worth visiting
Review: You don't need a guide to visit the temple, just a driver and then purchase peanuts on your way in and enjoy!We went later in the day as the monkeys don't like to come out in the hottest part of the day. There were so many monkeys! A monkey jumped on my arm. They are pretty harmless but expect you to have peanuts and so are quite demanding. They will come and pull on your pockets to try and get to the food.They were adorable.It was also in an old hindu temple that was quite beautiful but not up-kept. There is trash there largely due to the fact that the monkeys run off with anything they can get their hands on.We saw so many baby monkeys and it's just unlike anything else you will experience.

Name: Deepti Mittal
Title: magnificent temple with lot of monkeys
Review: Amazing architecture, Good for sunset and sunrise, a lot of famous spots for photography, be careful with your belongings as the place is surrounded by a lot of monkeysThe most beautiful and magnificent temple.

Name: Soul Traveller3
Title: Awesome
Review: The site is beautiful with its rocky mountains. Many temples are there. The atmosphere is awesome. On the top, there is Galta Ji temple with a pool where the monkeys are the kings.

Name: Julie B
Title: Watch which Gate you enter by
Review: There are two entrances to this temple - one from the main road which is simple and straight forward, they other is via a steep hill climb, up and down which s very uninteresting and locals try to sell you a moto taxi. The temple itself was quite nice to walk around - plenty of monkeys there but quite dirty. The monkeys are obviously well fed and most definitely not scared of humans,

Name: Manoj Vapi
Title: Beautiful temple with lots of monkeys
Review: Here there r ard eight temples with lots of monkeys roaming everywhere. This place could be great tourist spot if govt try to keep it more maintain and clean. Beaware of your shoes or chappals as monkeys try to take away when going to temple for worship. Tirupati temple is worth visiting.Here is Ganga water but very dirty neats to be maintain. Can visit once.

Name: Christy A
Title: Monkeys ok
Review: Without understanding the full meaning behind the temple....I can only say structures are interesting to view and take pics. Of....lots of well fed Monkeys. Little dirty however, and they charge .50 rupee's to take pics for only using one phone. Very aggravating

Name: sh0nalin
Title: Disappointed
Review: Being a great follower of Hanumanji, thought of going to this place....was highly disappointed to see the upkeep of the place....it was really dirty....was disappointed to see the vicinity so untidy....was surprised to see so many foreign tourists visiting the place because it is situated amidst a rocky terrain....which is a great attraction but I sincerely feel we need to do something regarding the cleanliness ‚òπÔ∏è

Name: DonJoeyM
Title: Amazing visit...
Review: Had an amazing trip with the guide ‚ÄòRicky‚Äô - he took the best pictures, told some great stories about the monkeys and spoke great English. Wouldn‚Äôt have enjoyed this place or took anywhere near as many photos without the guide so thanks so much to Ricky. The monkeys are mischievous but definitely not dangerous so don‚Äôt worry about that. Had them on my head, shoulders, legs.. everywhere. They just want food!

Name: annetteapproved
Title: Beautiful and worth the detour
Review: May is in fact a perfect time to visit rajastan . No tourists! The temple was "ours" for a while.Nothing very impressive but special

Name: Harriet S
Title: Cannon balling monkeys are great fun but...
Review: It was great watching the monkeys jump in the water but I felt incredibly unsafe as a female (and was with my boyfriend) Someone tried to steal from my boyfriends bag while he was wearing it.The men got incredibly aggressive and disrespectful to me to the point of me feeling incredibly scared and uncomfortable and we had to leave - a real shame. (A lot worse than the rest of India) Would really not recommend.

Name: stenquist1
Title: Good place to see monkeys and absorb some Hindu culture
Review: The drive from Jaipur was about 15 minutes.  We bought our admission tickets and started to walk when a Hindu priest convinced us to go into his temple.  He did some arcane ritual with talisman over our heads, chanted some prayers, then had us pour a bit of water over a small altar.  We felt blessed.  We walked on and saw many monkeys and some great architecture.  Spending 45-50 minutes was enough and worth the price of admission. Some great photo ops.

Name: philipsK7729PY
Title: Blessings... at a price
Review: The temples here are important but not particularly attractive. You should know that you will be asked for a lot of donations, and not just the usual couple of hundred rupees. Some of the Brahmins do spend time.with you and tell you about their believes and the history of the place, so you.feel happy to give a nice donation. Unfortunately there are others who just want money, and as much as they can get.Dont miss the wonderful Sun Temple.at the top of the hill. The atmosphere there is totally different, full of peace and the love of God... any small donation is happily received by the delightful lady who watches over the temple.

Name: Christine K
Title: Sunset visit for great views over Jaipur
Review: Amazing architecture, very old and built into the valley/gorge. I wish I had a guide to explain what I was looking at, there are official guides available as you pay to go in. The most amazing sight was watching the monkeys swimming, diving and swimming under the water

Name: jayamrutiya4769
Title: galta ji
Review: momkey were very friendly with people we gave banana to them. they behave with us like our family member.

Name: cakewithaview
Title: Monkey business
Review: I liked this place despite the monkeys! I wouldn't recommend feeding them even though they didn't act aggressively but our guide said it wasn't advisable and, looking at them, I wasn't tempted anyway :) The buildings and temples look rather neglected but I found this added to their appeal. If you walk up the steps you'll come to a poor where the faithful bathe for purification and there's also a pool where the monkeys enjoy swimming and diving! We were lucky enough to see a group of people (I think they were Hare Krishnas) singing and dancing and this made for an enjoyable all round visit.

Name: SeattleNomad
Title: One of my favorite stops in Jaipur!
Review: I'd first learned of Galta Ji from the Wild India documentary and wanted to see cannon-balling monkeys. However, I was hesitant since I've been around aggressive monkeys before and didn't want to get bitten. My friend and I visited in the late afternoon and we were one of a handful of people. This was one of the highlights of our trip and we spent about 3 hours there being entertained by all the monkeys (and even had to hike out after the sun had set). If you stay past sundown, the paths are dimly lit (but are lit enough for you to watch your step). If you're solo, it's a lonely path, but we had a local walk with us half the way and he insisted it was perfectly safe for us (two women) to traverse alone. First off, if you're planning to rickshaw/Uber/Ola, make sure to hire the driver for the duration of your stay at Galta Ji or be prepared to hike up and out to the Surajpol Bazar Road & Route 248 intersection to find a ride (save your water as the hike out is steep!). There is minimal cell phone reception at the Hanuman Ji (eastern) entrance so calling for a ride is difficult to impossible and there weren't any rickshaws or drivers for hire. I'd recommend entering from the Hanuman Ji side and if you want to walk out, go up the stairs through the temples and then out to the west past the Sun Temple. We didn't mind paying the camera fee since it was a negligible amount compared to other sites around the city and it was nice it was a flat fee/no higher foreigner fees. We never ran into any aggressive touts and thought the monkeys were tamer than most we've seen elsewhere in the world and within India. Yes, they're dirty and some are unhealthy because they are WILD--they may be tamer and used to human interaction, but they are not zoo animals and are not anyone's personal pets. We weren't pestered for donations as other reviewers complain of, but we also live in Mumbai, so may have grown used to beggars and scams. The temples are run down, but it's India and I can only imagine the cost to maintain or repair the structures. If visitors want to help restore the temples, I'm sure they'd be grateful for donations. If you're a photographer, you'll love the monkeys...they were tame and used to human interaction and I got some amazing shots. However, you do have to worry about some of the more playful younger monkeys wanting to crawl up your leg while you're staring into your viewfinder. I only had one I had to dodge, but it made for a funny experience. I definitely recommend making a stop at Galta Ji if you're in Jaipur...it's probably the most unique attraction we visited and I'll definitely be back to take more photos.

Name: Gina M
Title: Don‚Äôt go!
Review: From the outset we were harassed by all the scams I had read about (‚Äútake photo with snake‚Äù, deformed animals, forced bindi blessing), all the while climbing along a very littered pathway. Once at the Monkey Temple (also very dirty), our 10 year old guide (literally), Ravi, was feeding a tomato to a smaller monkey when my friend was attacked and bitten by a bigger monkey.  We have, so far, visited three hospitals (scary indeed!) to get her the requisite series of rabies shots.  Tomorrow is the fourth out of five Indian hospitals we will need to visit before returning home to the US. Save yourself from wasting your time and possibly endangering yourself and do not go to the Monkey Temple.

Name: Kevin
Title: Beautiful place... But beware of the trap
Review: I'll start by saying Monkey / Sun Temple  is a must, and was arguably our favourite visit in Jaipur‚Ä¶ though visitors beware of potential scam. I'll jump to the chase, a smooth talking young man in his early twenties operates by offering you the chance to go with him to areas off the touristic map to buy some of Jaipur's finest fabrics. To put it simply, it's an outlet type shop that after our second visit was full of lured tourists with the same puzzled faces ‚Ä¶ Other notable offerings of the young man may include being invited to the wedding of an unknown person from 'the neighborhood‚Äô (of course an overpriced sarii for the occasion is highly encouraged), being on taken on a ride on the back of a moped through Jaipur's hectic streets (the most fun and dangerous part of the night), flooting the bill for petrol for a tour of Jaipur which will of course include another visit to the outlet shop and lastly a meal in a very very local restaurant where you will politely pick up the bill (including your hosts comission, note; he will most likely go back inside while you wait in the car to ‚Äòquestion the bill‚Äô aka collect his commission) There you have it. Research has shown he and young men alike operate as a gang and with the help of some police (note his 'father‚Äô is a policeman). I write this review / literary piece in awe at the smoothness of the operation, it's impressive. Luckily, we only paid over the odds for a few things, but I hope this message saves readers / potential victims millions of rupees in the futurePS. The real people of India don't give a monkeys where you are from, if it's their first or second question and are on 3 wheels or a nicely ironed shirt then ignore.

Name: Lawyer/Exporter
Title: Interesting.
Review: This is ok if you have the time but it is not great. It is a drive down a remote road which is interesting. Some people were holding the monkeys. DON'T. They can bite and cause infections. Even our guide said not to touch them.

Name: ludemann1
Title: interesting
Review: Interesting place to walk around for 30 minutes or so.  Lots of wandering cows and monkeys will join you. Costs  money to even carry a camera... Kind of dirty, but that seemed common in most places in India.

Name: daphne t
Title: Monkey temple
Review: The temple is quite far from the center but I recommend to all those who want to see other architecture.The view is amazing!Our guide was very professional and had a lot the knowledge about Jaipur

Name: usandy
Title: Interesting experience to see monkeys roaming free
Review: This may take some getting used to. There is a feces smell to the place, but if you're ok with barnyard smells, then you'll really enjoy the entertainment. A must for photographers! You can get some great shots here of simian antics, and the temple backdrops are really nice.

Name: Julie K
Title: Sunset over Jaipur
Review: Visited just before sunset and well worth it. Used a guide (monkey man) think we paid him Rps 300 but very informative about the history of the temple and it‚Äôs buildings. Also ensured we got to hand feed safe monkeys from our hands and sat on our shouldersIt‚Äôs a tough climb to the summit but worth it for the views over Jaipur Beware of going inside the temple itself as you will be ‚Äòblessed‚Äô and asked for Rps 500 donation (we only gave 200 but were frowned upon)

Name: Steve D
Title: A very charming experience
Review: Galta Ji is a large Hindu temple complex that lies 10km to the east of Jaipur. Galta Ji Jaipur is a Hindu temple built around a natural spring that has been channeled to fill seven large pools.called kunds.The largest, the Galta Kund, according to legend has never ran dry. The Galta Kund is the deepest pool and during important festivals pilgrims jump from the surrounding cliffs into the tank. There is no entrance fee to visit the temple.You can buy monkey food but take care as the monkeys can surround you. for the food. There are 200 hundred monkeys within the temple complex.Look out for the very colourful pilgrims and the large stelae adorned with Hindu gods.The complex is fascinating but has lots of rubbish scattered about.

Name: Ali Vaseghnia
Title: An average experience
Review: I was expecting more, but the temple was just average with nothing special. The monkeys were the only exciting part of my experience.

Name: Simon R
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Ok, so the temple gets its publicity from the monkeys. There are a lot of them, and can be entertaining. We didn‚Äôt experience any aggressive ones.However the temple itself is amazing, built at the bottom of a rock face, and ascending up it. There is a lot of rubbish around which is a shame, but I guess their funding is limited, as the fee to take a camera in is minimal. Donations are required to enter the various temples, but again it is up to you what you give.It is an unmissable part of the history of the region, and the journey there is an eye opener too.

Name: Edin Krnic
Title: Monkey temple
Review: I was not satisfied with Monkey temple in Jaipur. Monkeys are very aggressive and have to be careful. If you want to be good friend with monkeys buy nuts or bananas to gave them

Name: Henriksalling
Title: Dirty buy worth going
Review: Galta Ji or Hanuman Temple is an amazing place. Plenty of monkey to look at and to get really close to. They are not aggresive and if you treat them with a banana or a peanut they are happy to take them of your hand.Hunuman has a lot of charm and locals come here to have a bath.Dont know how Galta Ji is funded, but cleaning up the place could be a place to spend some of the money you pay. It is very dirty and it is such a pity that no one cleans up the whole complex.Entrance is free, but you pay 50 rupies to be alloved to take pictures. You spend around an hour and a half.Getting there is easy with a tuktuk. From the city around 300. Make sure that your driver knows the place. Getting back is somehow more exspensive and the drivers take atvantage of you beeing a long way away from you hotel. Exspect to pay double price on your way back.I have tried to change the location on Tripadvisor, since they had it wrong. Double check with Google Maps before you go.Summing up: Go there and enjoy the silence and the beautiful surroundings

Name: Kevin G
Title: Amazing
Review: Had never heard of this place before. Truly amazing structure with real relevance to the worshipers who come here to bath in the water from the holy spring. For a small donation you can get a blessing from the priest  at the top of the stairs near the original monkey rock and for a few rupees more you can buy some grass to  feed the cattle.One word of warning, as you ascend the stairs after the bathing pool be careful as razor wire is jutting out from the top if the fence and on the opposite side the cliff face juts out over the path so be careful you don't lose an eye on the wire or brain yourself on the rocks.

Name: Joep D
Title: Having the 'Monkey Wisperer' As Your Guide- A Great Way to Visit
Review: We visited the Monkey Temple near Jaipur and had the pleasure of having Kanhaiya Sharomg (The Monkey Whisperer) as our guide.  A very interesting complex of temples, an ashram and, of course, the 3,000 plus monkeys that make this area their home.  The sight is free to access with a 50 IR charge if using your camera.  Nestled into the hillside, the various structures are easily walked to.  The buildings are well kept as is the actual Monkey Temple.Our guide did a great job of explaining about the monkeys, taking excellent pictures for and of you using your own camera and has a real rapport with them as he has been with the monkeys and caring for them since 1996.  He was also involved with the Monkey Thieves series on television.

Name: Jeff H
Title: Great views. A good place to add to ypur itinerary.
Review: Buy some nuts and you'll be popular. Handy if you know something about animal behaviour so you dont cause fights or get bitten.

Name: Umang A
Title: Monkeys
Review: This holy Hindu temple is located at Galta ji. It is famous for lots of monkeys all around. Be careful and take care of your belongings

Name: Curiositytraveller
Title: Hare Krishna
Review: It is nice temple located next to city palace. We went there during in morning when prayers were going on. It is very spiritual.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Govind Dev ji Temple
Review: This is one of the ancient temples of Jaipur where the Royal families use to worship. The temple is adjacent to the City Palace from where the royal family has the direct access from the palace. The devotees visit the temple for the blessings.

Name: Akshay
Title: Very famous temple of Jaipur
Review: One of the famous temple of Jaipur and of ancient time. It is a wonderful devotional place ..lot of devotees r visiting daily. But very calm and peace feeling.

Name: Vineet Pareek
Title: Fag utsav
Review: Visited first day of fag utsav, beautiful rachna jhanki, amezing performance given by artists.... jaipur gharana kathak...Gulabo Kalbelia dancer,

Name: mheitner
Title: Visit during prayers
Review: The spiritual energy during prayers was quite amazing.It was easy to store shoes nearby to enter the temple.

Name: Pintya
Title: Devotion and peace
Review: This is krishna bhagwan temple. It is well maintained and decorated. All the devotees can be seen totally devoted in pooja and aarti.

Name: hitesh1304
Title: Sri Govind Ji Temple...Grand old Krishna Temple..Spiritual and Blissful experience
Review: Visited GovindJi temple on 2/2/20 ..Its in the johari bazar area of old jaipur, A religious and holy place , with a vast temple area below the hills,a magnificent idol of Shri Krishnaji , indeed a temple with lots of positive energy and high on spiritual relevance.The prayers,chanting and the aartis are worth a watch and full of vibrationsA must visit place while in Jaipur

Name: kishoreviriiyala
Title: Place of tranquil
Review: The place is held very high in religious circles... Has the old charm of royalty... the thin lanes of erstwhile era... the line of shops selling items required for the spiritual journey...All lead to the main temple... which is the abode of lord Krishna.. one sight of Him and u forget all other materialistic links.. its an instant connect with the lord... An experience which can't be explained, which can't be expressed, which can only be felt...

Name: Shobha
Title: Well maintained
Review: Temple is well maintained and clean . Felt good inside the mandir . Can feel the presence of shri Krishna here . Will like to visit here again .

Name: juvlemm
Title: Well managed
Review: The temple is nice and clean. There are separate lanes for ladies and gents. Mandap is big capable of accomodating good crowd for aarti.

Name: Aniruddh
Title: Very peaceful
Review: the Darshan was very nice, and the Aarti of GOD gives a satisfied environment, where all devotees are so involved in pooja

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Sri Govind Devji temple is a beautiful , powerful temple full of divine grace and devotion in Jaipur . The Lord blesses the devotees with darasanas in a beautiful way .

Name: sara
Title: Spirtual Tour with Thriillophilia
Review: We had a great time on this spiritual tour organised by Thrillophilia. Learnt a lot about the Indian culture and spirituality and the temple was really beautiful. A well organised tour.

Name: ritu sharma
Title: Spiritual tour
Review: Jaipur is really a spiritual city, the temples are so beautiful & magnificent and seeing how people truly believe in god & how they express their believe. I was mesmerised & was so filled with joy. My family & I really enjoyed and are really grateful to thrillophilia for amazing arrangements. Taking a guide was really helpful and turned out to be the best decision. Would really love to visit again

Name: khamoshratien
Title: Aaradhya of Jaipur..
Review: If you visit Jaipur, must visit place isGovind Dev Ji tample.Nice place situated in the heart of Jaipur.City palace, jantar mantar, hawa Mahal all are in same area.Beautiful peace of art.Full of devotees..Music all over the premises..

Name: Sanjay Kumar
Title: Very excited to visiting here
Review: We were very excited to visit here and finally we planned to visit here and we visited here on 16 August 2019 and we prayed here for happy and healthy life for everyone.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Peace.
Review: This is Krishna temple.hindu temple. Veryy famous Krishna temple in Jaipur. Free parking and shoe rack available there. Beautiful temple.

Name: Abhay Mehta
Title: The Lord of Jaipur City
Review: The idol of Radha Goving ji was brought to Jaipur from Vrindavan by the Jaipur king Raja Man Singh, who was his deity. The whole Jaipur is deity of Govind Dev ji and the chanting of bhajans in the campus makes the environment very pious and religious. One feels very calm and experience inner piece in the temple after Darshan.

Name: jayamrutiya4769
Title: holi place
Review: once we enterd in temple area we forgot every frustation. free parkinv and shoe rack available there approx 500 people praying at a time there.

Name: Dan_453
Title: Holy site!
Review: This famous Krishna temple is visited by hundreds of devotees everyday. An ancient hindu temple adjoining city palace the home and museum of royal family of Jaipur.

Name: Somya P
Title: Most peaceful place
Review: Govind Dev Temple is one of the very few places in Jaipur which will offer you complete peace. Just walking here makes you feel very light. All festival celebrations in the temple are must visit.

Name: arun sharma
Title: Nice place for worship
Review: Govind Devji Temple at Jaipur is a temple where one wants to go for prayer regularly. During darshan one gets piece of mind

Name: Swati Jethani
Title: Holi at Govind devji temple
Review: I went to celebrate Holi at Govind devji mandir. I visited 11 am to 12 pm jhanki which is a special on the occasion of Holi. This is year it is happening from 14th March to 20th March. We will celebrate gulal Holi on 20th March at Temple. It will include jhanki and Holi celebration with Govind devji. I have shared some pictures clicked during jhanki. Panditji was dressing up to good for Holi celebration then he sprinkled gulal and holy water on shradhalus.Pls follow my Instagram page for more beautiful pictures - photowalk_with_swati

Name: Manoj Agrawal
Title: One of best temples
Review: I have visited several temples across India but this one is really close to heart. Huge compound to accommodate thousands of people, very well organised shoe stands, drinking water, ongoing prayers and music, big gardens in backyard and temple location in centre of city. Darshan itself is beyond words to mention. I can recommend this place for people looking for dharmik place and to people who want local feel. Don‚Äôt miss laddoo Prasadam.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Krishna
Review: A krishna temple located inside the city papace and in the heart of city. Try out laddos here, superb.

Name: Nish0901
Title: Near City Palace
Review: Govind Devji Temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna. This temple can be covered with City Palace. This place becomes crowded during morning and evening aarti time. Nice place to go with family.

Name: Umang A
Title: Radhe radhe
Review: This is one of the most famous Krishna temple in India. Located in old jaipur. Legends says that the statue was crafted by grandson of Krishna himself

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Very famous and revered temple of Jaipur
Review: You will really enjoy the Aarti in the evening. This is a very popular and revered temple and devotees come in a very large number. We really felt blessed.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: Vimlesh Ranjan
Title: Nice place to go with family
Review: This place is amazing with traditional style for worshipping and must to go when you are in Jaipur. I have gone here many times.

Name: vishphoo2231
Title: Govind Devji Temple
Review: Govind Devji Temple holy temple ... really loved the temple has lots of peace and very beautiful temple it is

Name: Pravesh Goswami
Title: Spirituality at its best
Review: One of the most followed temples of Jaipur. Situated near city palace. Temple complex is huge. Quite neat & clean. Must visit, if you are in jaipur.

Name: Vivek K
Title: Jan 1 2019
Review: Its located in old Jaipur city , we took a Auto as suggested by Hotel coz place was too crowded due metro construction  , Holy place lot of devotees present , pls check Darshan timing before planning visit

Name: Rajagopal Subramanian
Title: Peaceful and pious worship place for Hindus
Review: Situated not far away from other famous tourists spots like Hawa Mahal, City Palace, etc. this temple is one of the important tourist attractions in Jaipur.

Name: SadhanaRakesh
Title: Most Famous Radha Krishna Temple for Divine Blessings
Review: While in Jaipur for attending a marriage function, our friends spoke to us about this famous temple of Jaipur and explained the divine blessings showered on devotees at this temple. They cited a few cases of their experience where their wishes were fulfilled by prayers here. We visited in the morning around 8:30 hrs when the Aarti was going on. We entered through Hawa Maha, walked a few meters, looked the palace on left side and reached the temple.  We were told that the Queen in the palace used to have a first look at the deity (in temple) from the palace each morning. The temple and the palace face each other. We removed our shoes in open area of the premises as people informed us that the shoes etc. are not stolen from here for fear of the Lord.A large number of devotees were there ‚Äì more than 200 in numbers, but no chaoes! All were standing as one group and praying. The temple attracts huge number of devotees on all days for divine blessings of Lord Radha Krishna. Devotees throng the deity with full faith and devotion every day. The temple area is clean and very well maintained. While entering the Temple premises, we noticed on left corner some small structure on which was written ‚ÄúMasjid‚Äù in green colour.  How come such boards be hanged on a small building in Hindu Temple area? Is it a calculated game of anti social political people? For sure, it is going to create communal colors in future. State Government and administrative authorities must investigate and do the needful.

Name: Saheli Pal
Title: Nice temple near City Palace
Review: Govind Devji Temple is a very nice devotional Hindi temple located very near to City Palace of Jaipur. Govind devji is another name of Hindu lord Krishna and the temple is dedicated to him. The place is quite clean and well maintained.They are several different timing for seeing the idol of radha-krishna. If you want to see them you should check out the timing before going there. Otherwise the temple remain opens till 9 o clock at night.If you are in Jaipur we shouldn't miss visiting Govind Devji Temple.

Name: Himanshi_Saxena
Title: Well managed and serene temple
Review: It is quite an old temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. One should definitely keep the timings in mind as no darshan is possible from 12 pm to 5 pm. The temple is very well manged and one should definitely visit this temple.

Name: FrequentTripster
Title: Fascinating cultural experience
Review: A highlight of Jaipur that is not to be missed.  Make sure that you go for one of the scheduled services to fully experience the temple and the local worshipers

Name: Sally m
Title: Interesting
Review: Small but well worth the visit although it was extremely busy when we went.  Like all of these attractions you wont get the benefit or understand the reasons behind unless you have a guide, although to be honest I can't remember much even though we did have a guide. So much to take in. Like all of the attractions we visited I think we would have benefited from some form of "take away" leaflet or something we could take time digesting what we had seen as you have to keep moving because of the every flowing stream of visitors behind you.

Name: dipali
Title: Govind Devi Ji Temple
Review: One of the most famous temples in Jaipur and is a must place to visit . The Vigraha is the one that has come from Mathura and is been made by Shree Vajranabh the closest relative to Prabhu Shree Krishna . The temple offers amenities like the parking and also the golf cart for the elderlies . It has multiple gates to enter and the temple offers multiple Jhakees of Prabhu Shree Krishna. The first Jhakee is at 4:30 am called the Mangala Arti and the last is the shayan Arti that happens at 8:30pm . This is the third Vigraha in line with the other two 1. Madan mohan jee at karoli, 2. The Gopinath jee at Gopinath jee mandir thikana at Jaipur and the third is the Govinddev ji at Jaipur . There is a story that it is very shubh that one does the three durshan starting from the Madan mohan ji at karauli followed by Gopinath ji at Jaipur and the Radhe Govind dev ji at Jaipur between the sunrise and the sunset of any day . You will find atleast 300 people who lineup everyday for the darshan at Govind devji temple at the time of mangala and are regular and never miss any mangala of Shree Govind dev ji

Name: Arun L
Title: A very popular temple dedicated to Lord Krishna
Review: One has to preplan the visit as the temple only opens the curtains periodically, that too for a limited time.However once the 'Darshan' opens up, it is advisable to move on the left side of the temple to question for free close up darshan.

Name: vaida17
Title: GOVIND TEMPLE
Review: This temple is a beauty, with Lord Govind and Devi Radha as main deities.  The idols are very beautiful, and nicely decorated.  large crowd assemble to have darshan of lord during aarati, the evening at 17-30 hrs IST. The deities can be seen from the main hall without hinderances since placed at a higher level.  The temple area a very large, and can accommodate huge crowds.   it has also prasad distribution counters and foot ware keeping stalls. chanting of lords name is continuously heard from the devotees.  A must visit for krishna baktas

Name: Brendan W
Title: Jai Rada Govindaji
Review: Wonderful devotion to the lord. These deities are from 5000 years back. They were brought to Jaipur to escape the Muslim hordes who were destroying Hindu temples around 400 years back.   Great temple. Great devotion to the Lord.  Go there let your eyes fall upon there lordships and take the blessing and offer your heart. Jai Rada govindaji

Name: axbisw2
Title: Must Visit if you are a Krishna Lover
Review: This Temple has a history. So that's one thing which is fascinating about this temple which I would like you to explore on your own. From Vrindavan to Kanaka Vrindavan and then to this temple the journey is alluring, enchanting and then having the Chaitanya Mahaprabhu photographs all over the temple has made a remarkable impact to the overall visit. Must Visit if you are a Krishna Bhakta or a Vaishnavas.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: If you wish to experience the beauty of Vrindavan ,the abode of Sri Radha Krishna ,in Jaipur itself , you must head to Govind devji temple . Very well maintained with pure chantings of Krishna chants emanating every second , it's a devotees paradise . The deities are beautiful and very nicely decorated on pious occasions . Aartis too are great to watch .

Name: mathurshradha19
Title: Govind Devji Temple
Review: My experience of visiting Govind Devji temple over the last 20 years (being a native here):1. Follow temple timings from the website. Timings differ during summer and winter and special darshan timings are during Janmasthami.2. Lots of florist and puja item shops outside the temple. So no need to bring anything from home.3. Systematic entry and exit. Place to keep shoes in return for token. Do not keep shoes randomly anywhere as dogs and monkeys are in plenty here.4. For best darshan try to squeeze yourself for the front row. Camera is allowed!5. If you want to go inside the temple near the radha krishna, then talk to the pujari. Remember to dress in suit/saree if you want to go inside.6. Try to get tulsi and chandan offered to govind devjji. 7. If you want to conduct any special puja/darshan, talk to the puruhit and go in off season (not during bhadoo month/near janmasthami) due to crowd.8. Before the temple is a place where you can feed grass to cows. Also, you can feed pigeons. Considered pious deed to do so. All grains and grass available there itself.9. Separate counter for collecting prasad. 10. Near to the temple is City Palace and Jantar Mantar which are also good to visit. Just check timings, whicha re usually before 4pm. So plan trip accordingly. 11. Also, Hawa Mahal is walkable and so it JOhri Bazaar which are famous for shopping. 12. Just a few kms before is LMB Restaurant which is perhaps the oldest and safest place to relish traditional rajasthani food, jhewar, ladoo, phini and churma. Note: Parking is problematic. Take a cab/taxi to this place.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Devine !!
Review: One of the most famous temple of jaipur situated in city palace  .. it's believed that it's idol was sculptured by the great grand son of lord Krishna ...

Name: Puha P
Title: TThe Vaishnava temple Govind Dev Ji
Review: The Vaishnava temple Govind Dev Ji is situated in Jaipur!  It is located in the City Palace complex. Heavily adorned by myths and legends, the Temple, is a famed Hindu Pilgrim centre. The Temple is renowned for its ‚ÄòMangala Aartis‚Äô which take place every day. The mythical and calming aura the temple imparts in its devotees is mesmerizing.

Name: Krupali S
Title: old temple
Review: This is 18th century old temple where main lord is Krishna. It is popular among tourist as well local people. This is holy and peaceful place of lord krishna. A huge garden surrounding the temple. Do not miss the beautiful temple and prasad too.

Name: sofiachanel1
Title: must visiti temple
Review: so good energie and a must visit temple.best temple and so many people , see opening time mornings are good

Name: Stupid E
Title: Govind Devji Temple
Review: My closest friend took me here and I was blessed to come here. Here's the blessing of Govind Dev Ji who blessed me and you should go.

Name: neelanjana s
Title: Jaipur's Soul is in this temple
Review: when you visit Govinddev ji Temple, you are not just submitting to a God but to an atmosphere of peace. the gardens surrounding the temple and the view of Gadh Ganesh Temple is not only surreal but very heart Warming. There are two entrances to the temple. And also, For children there are swings and a park to play in. The architecture of the place gives you an immediate palatial feel.

Name: vmsatheesh22
Title: Good
Review: Govind devji temple, good and best atmosphere for relaxing and pray, a different type of temple compare with kerala

Name: AkhileshM9800
Title: Close to the Gods !
Review: A great place to visit to see the beauty of Lord Krishna. Visit during the aarti and feel at peace in the large hall with other devotees !!

Name: Hitesh S
Title: In search for holiness
Review: I was travelling in Jaipur and then came across this beautiful structure carved with stones and hard work.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Very revered Temple of Jaipur
Review: Jaipur people will always suggest you to visit this temple because local people have immense faith in this Daity . You come back with renewed confidence after your visit .Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: Anshul
Title: Very peaceful place, neat and maintained.
Review: Very peaceful place, neat and maintained.But at time of aarti there's a mess as there are lot of people.But you'll get a lot of positive vibes.There are a lot of kiosks to buy from and a lot of parking space.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The deity of the city !
Review: This temple a place you can find people dancing , singing here  in  ecstasy here at the time of arti . The people who are visitors and the regular local strong this tempke in morning and more in evening s . There are timings for the  arti . The deity of this city resides here . This tempke is old and was a regular temple for the jaipur royals when they ruled here . No dress code here . Beware of pick pockets .

Name: webetutorial
Title: good templae
Review: webetutorial team visit this place and found good and peaceful environment which remove the all stress from the mind.

Name: SameekshakSACHIN
Title: Sameeksha By Sachin - LargeTemple Complex
Review: I visited the temple with my family and attended the evening Aarti. When you enter the temple there are many Prasad Shops on the left and right side for taking Prasad to offer to Deity. After entering the main complex you will see shoe racks at your left hand side, when you move further there are Prasad windows on the left hand side and you can get Prasad on payment basis after the darshan for yourself. Shoe racks are available free of cost. There is nice arrangement for Prasad distribution and there are separate lines for male and female devotees for taking Prasad.  There is shaded line arrangement for Darshan also in case of rush in the temple. We felt blessed to have darshan in the temple. Must visit place, highly recommended.

Name: Smruti B
Title: Serene
Review: No words can explain the serenity of this temple.A must visitand if possible attend the aarti.The place is a little crowded to park your vehicle ut eventually u get space.

Name: 789skc
Title: Must Visit !!!!!
Review: If you're in Jaipur and if you love Lord Krishna,then must visit this place.This temple is belongs from Jaipur Royal family.Now a days this temple is open for every body.At Aarti time the place is filled by the devotees.The place is very well maintained by the trust

Name: Footprints727663
Title: Royal Temple
Review: I went to Govind Devji Temple. Govind Devji Temple Jaipur is believed to be the most royal temple on earth after Vrindavan, especially for supporters of Lord Krishna. The entire place expresses divine feeling and give peace and satisfaction to the soul of visitors. It is great place to go.

Name: He52
Title: Nice place ,must to visit here if you are in Jaipur ,govind Dev ji bless us all
Review: Awesome place to visit ,if you are in Jaipur ,then leave all first you visit this temple, very nice temple

Name: Abd
Title: Fine place
Review: I have visited this place for attending prasadi's of dal bati churma. You will always find people visiting this place in large numbers to seek religious pleasure & attain calmness. I agree to others that this place is actually divine & gives you a sense of calmness in its own way. You feel happy & relaxed after visiting this place.

Name: Deep C
Title: Beautiful and Holy
Review: Very beautiful.One must wait to watch the aarti at about 6pm. Very beautiful experience.Close darshan can be done in a cue in the mandir but it may take anywhere between 20 min to an hour.

Name: N. Shah
Title: Can visit if in the area
Review: It is not a magnanimous temple, but a nice one to visit if you are in and around the area. Lot of belief though.

Name: shweta m
Title: divine place
Review: It is a great place so divine and utterly beautiful. You will feel peaceful and relaxed. Enjoyed the place.

Name: Seatraveler2
Title: Lovely welcoming community
Review: This lovely Buddist temple was made lovelier by the warm welcome of its' faithful toward us tourist. Located only a few minutes walk from the City Palace, a visit is a great way to start the day in the 'pink city'.

Name: Abhishek G
Title: Dont miss in jaipur
Review: Peace of mind.The place I think compulsorily to visit in jaipur, is the temple of Govind devji The structure of temple is also worth watching. However evening Aarti is the thing I like most

Name: gmwallstreet
Title: peace of mind
Review: Great place of worship, lots of people coming regularly as per schedule of darshan.Beauty of this place is their stating Aarties, which always sing by people.They sing different Aarties or Bhajan at the time of be-gaining.

Name: Jitendra Singh
Title: Place for Peace
Review: This is the temple dedicated to Lord Krishna. Reugar Darshans are available of the lord from a distance. One is not allowed to touch the Lord. If you spend some time you really get peace of mind and eternal pleasure.

Name: cferey54
Title: MORNING WORSHIP WHEN FRIENDSHIP MEETS FAITH
Review: The 7.39 am darsh is very well known among the Jaipurites and gathers a lot of people in a friendly and authentic devotional moment

Name: FLworldwanderer
Title: Beautiful temple ....
Review: Govind Devji Temple, is located in the City Palace.  People from Jaipur, as well as the royal family, are devout worshipers here.  The temple is dedicated to Lord Govind Devji (known as Lord Krishna).  On special religious holidays and festivals, thousands of people will come to visit, taking part in prayer (Aarti).  Hope this helps with your first visit.

Name: HrideshSharma
Title: Again start of day with God
Review: It was not planned but in jaipur planned to visit small circuit around JantarMantar,  500 Mrs away is the Govinda (Lord Krisna ) temple. Nice clean there are caravan timings and in morning get close by 11:30 am

Name: alpha08
Title: divine place
Review: Located in centre of city named chardivari. Must see as this temple is famous for lord krishna and story associated with this idol

Name: Umang A
Title: Divine...
Review: Located in the heart of city. This temple is famous for the story associated with the idol. It is said the idol handmade by grandson of Krishna when Rukmaniji told him how Krishna used to look

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: A must in Jaipur
Review: Givind deo ji temple in Jaipur is a very old Pushti Margi temple. Lord Krishna and Radha are the main deity. Morning, and evening time thousands of Jaipurites and tourists can be seen here. You can stand in queue and  purchase Laddu Prasad, limited to 4 Laddus per person. There is a very large garden attached to this temple, and you can find many families having picnic here. Red face monkeys are in plenty and one has to take care from them.

Name: Aneesh S
Title: Hare Krishna
Review: This is a beautiful temple devoted to Lord Krishna situated within the city palace complex near the Hawa mahal and Jantar mantar.This is one of the most important temples besides Vrindavan for Krishna devotees.The temple opens multiple times during the day for arti (7 in total.starting at 4-30am) and rest of the times it is closed.

Name: KeswaniGaurav
Title: Radhe Radhe
Review: Visiting the Govind Devji temple is always the peaceful and calming experience. It brings in peace of mind. Very near to City Palace gates, A must visit during Aarti, if possible attend early morning aarti's.

Name: jonesharma29
Title: Govind deviji temple
Review: govind deviji temple is famous temple of jaipur.beautiful and well managed.temple is devoted to lord krishna and radha ji

Name: Sweta P
Title: Lovely
Review: Spectacular Murti or Lord Krishna and decorated in a brilliant way, very lovely experience to see this Temple.

Name: Thomas D
Title: Great experience
Review: Visiting the Govind Devji Temple dedicated to Lord Krishna was a very impressive experience also for a non-Hindu. Went there in the late evening.

Name: Sudha2410
Title: Good
Review: Went to Govinda Devji temple. When we entered the security at the entrance told that the temple would be closed soon and to hurry. It is some distance from the gate, so ran inside. Managed to see the aarti. Then the temple was closed for the afternoon. We were lucky to get the darshan.

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: govind devji mandir
Review: its near city palace dedicated to lord krishna where you can feel energetic an powerful an go in lap of god

Name: Kushagra
Title: Beautiful Radha Krishna Temple
Review: Govind Dev ji temle is quite old and very very popular among the locals. Though you can visit the temple anytime you want (during the temple hours) but early morning darshan/aarti is the best. This place is magical, soothing, refreshing and wonderful. Do visit .

Name: Mona C
Title: Darshan
Review: Amazing temple. A must visit for morning aarti when people come for the darshan of the lord and energize themselves.

Name: Kumkumjaipur
Title: Amazing temple
Review: Govind Devji temple is located behind the city palace and is actually the personal temple of the Maharaja.

Name: dave w
Title: a nice temple
Review: it is a nice temple. beautiful but in india we saw lots of temples that were stunning but got over so many.

Name: HOMPRS
Title: Very popular among locals
Review: The temple is just stone throw away from hawa mahal and is a very popular lord krishna temple after mathura. One must start their tour to jaipur with this temple. Hugely popular. Must must visit

Name: Ajitku
Title: Temple
Review: This is a temple. Here Lord govind get worshipping. It is a tourist attraction. The design of the temple is amazing

Name: AAA
Title: It's Great
Review: I had visited this temple with my friend. This is very big and magnificent temple. This is very peaceful place. I think you must definitely visit.

Name: darshcv
Title: A Royal temple
Review: Visited this temple in the morning with my family. The temple is quite a big place. It has a huge compound  and big Katha Mandap. The Idols of Krishna is cool.

Name: Sumana A
Title: Trip to Rajasthan
Review: Very nice temple. Tucked amidst the busy market place, this is a surprisingly very big temple, with a vast space for pilgrims to sit and pray. Very neat  and organized.

Name: Vidya Anil D
Title: Peaceful transcending end to the day
Review: I am from south India, and this temple was very different from the temples here. We went in the evening about 6 o clock, we walked from hawa mahal, after finishing up visiting it. But this temple is close to city Palace and jantar mantar. But since temple don't have time constraint, we went to hawa mahal after jantar mantr and then walked back to the temple.Visiting the temple is a good idea as after looking at the tourist attractions, in the evening you can visit the beautiful temple.We sat in the temple for a while, the atmosphere, chanting was mesmerizing. They close the curtains in front of the God at around 6:45. We walked around the temple there is lake behind and nice view of nargad fort(not entirely sure if it was jaigarh or nargadh). All in all nice end to out evening. We bought bead sheets outside the temple in the market complex, the quality was great it was priced at 1500 rupees, but we found other places selling it for much lesser, so you may want to look out for that.

Name: JD2807
Title: Excellent feeling at the time of Darshan of Govind Devji
Review: Out of the world feeling at the Govind Devji Temple. Huge devotees base in Jaipur. Daily 5 aarti's and each Aarti gives a different feeling

Name: pkaran
Title: Famous holy temple in Jaipur
Review: Govind Devji Temple is located in the City Palace and the royal family is a great devotee of this temple, so as hundreds of thousands of people of Jaipur. It is dedicated to Lord Govind Devji (Lord Krishna). The murti (idol) was bought from Vrindavan by Maharaja Sawal Jai Singh II. During festivals, the temple is heavily crowded as hundreds of thousands of people visit here. There is daily aarti (prayer) at different times in a day which is also specially attended by people. It is worth visiting this temple while in Jaipur.

Name: cbk2911
Title: Govindji temple - Landmark temple of Jaipur
Review: We visited this temple to take darshan of Lord Krishna which is extremely crowded always. Its situated near city palace. The temple has an idol of Lord Krishna with Radha.

Name: PoojaSi
Title: Blissfull !!!!!!
Review: Temple is so beautiful with beautiful deities of Shri Radhe Krishna Ji...!!!!!!Attending the Mangla Aarti in the morning is so divine and peace giving that one can get lost in Radhe Krishna for that time.Jai Shri Radhe Krishna !!!!!!

Name: devs224
Title: God
Review: Lord Krisha and Radha both deity are very beautiful. We both feel relax over there. That temple with very quit.

Name: PurPar
Title: Divine
Review: This temple is a must visit. check timings on the website before you plan your visit. Temple invoked a feeling of devotion and love

Name: –í–µ–ª–µ—è—Ä –°
Title: Greatest adventure
Review: That was an amazing experience.Very beautiful place and professional staff.Elephants are clean, kind, and so friendly.It‚Äôs seems like they are really happy in this place. Special thanks to the owner of the place!Pushar is amazing man. I was happy to meet him. Totally recommend!

Title: Best experience ever
Review: Me and my friends went to Jaipur last month  one of my friends recommend to eleday and I went there We did elephant ride , painting, feeding, bathing  we are very happyAnd I highly recommend to eleday must visit..

Title: Best day activities in Jaipur
Review: What an amazing place it is i enjoyed quite a lot with my wife and kids. There are several options we could choose to interact with elephant but we choose elephant washing and feeding Banana to the elephant. We spend almost 4 hour and our time was quality time. We learn as well lot of things about elephant. I will say people should go and visit this place. If you don't do any another activity with elephant, than you don't need to pay anything. That we like because other companies asked us price in advance.Meet Mr. Push there he is founder of eleday. Nice guy.

Title: Fantastic time with Radha
Review: We had the best time at Elefun! The elephant, Radha was one of the highlights of our trip. We cannot get over how kind and gentle she was; we haven't stopped talking about her since we return home. The staff was very helpful and friendly and made us feel very comfortable. We would recommend this excursion  to anyone looking to spend quality time up close with the elephants!!

Name: Pushpendra
Title: VERY DISAPPOINTING AND  A BAD EXPERIENCE!
Review: Me and my family and gone for the eleday programme one year back and thoroughly enjoyed. Infact you might find my review somewhere here below.This time I arranged my parents to enjoy the festival of Holi here arranged by the organisers as ‚ÄúEleholi Festival 2020‚Äù. But It was a disgusting experience for them. (1)We were not informed about cancellation of the event due to Coronavirus (2)Infact when we called for confirmation of pick & drop , we were again not informed about the cancellation (3)We were obliged to get the pick up and drop but that was the only good service BUT even the pick up guy didn‚Äôt inform that such event was cancelled (4)On reaching there my parents were informed about the cancellation and about them sending emails to all participants which I disagree of getting (5)I had selected the highest placed ticket but no one bothered to call us informing about the cancellation (6)These kind of organisations are the best examples for us Indians going complacent with their product and service when they start getting a good name. (7)Very poor behaviour of the staff as well for giving out lies to my parents about the whole situation

Name: orchid
Title: Elephant ride
Review:
Dear Guest 

Due to COVID we didn't organize holi with colors but insist that we organized holi with flowers. 
I would like to give some of the answers to your question. 
1. We mentioned it that there will be no colors at the festival but there will be flowers insist of colors. 
2. We called your parents one day before and explain all situations and also told them everything but they still told us they wanted to come and experience the holi with flowers and elephants.
3.  The driver was hired, and we already talked with your parents then why would the driver speak about it again. 
4. on reaching the Holi festival we again told them that if you want you can have a look and go back we will refund you, but they said" we understand you cant organize a festival with colors, and we are more interested with the elephant so we would like to join.
5. This I already answered you previously we called a day before holi festival to know where they are staying or interested to visit or not. 
6. Don't mind you are a good example of a person who just wants to enjoy everything and at end of the day want your money back. As you can write anything does don't know what happens exactly.
7. I feel disappointed when you wrote this cause I was here most of the time with your parents and I did my best to make them feel good. I still remember that they needed tissue paper and water bottles. Even there was a counter and self-service but I run and get a water bottle for them. It's so easy to write that the behavior of the staff was not good. 

I even spoked with you over on phone but you weren't ready to listen to the situation after all you will listen to your parents. you should be.
Maybe now you could understand. The only cause of COVID we couldn't organize festival with colors.

Thank you and regards 
Eleday

Review: My mother and I visited this place as part of our tour to Jaipur and were delighted!I rode a gentle elephant named Leila and we both got to feed her afterwards. Such a majestic and gentle animal.W learned alot about these animals as well.We both adored the experience and it ended up being a highlight of our trip.Would strongly recommend if you are an animal lover.

Name: Pushpendra
Title: Best Experience
Review: Visited ELEDAY with family in January 2020 . The fee was quite expensive. The area didn't seem suitable for elephants to live. No water for the elephants to splash in (which I know elephants love to do ). The area was very dry, very limited food for them. They just stood still and lonely. (The elephants were the ones they use for tourists to ride up to Amer Fort and Palace), such a shame! The elephants looked sad and unhappy. The one we had to paint and interact with was blind in one eye. I noticed she had a very big cataract in her left eye. When i questioned one of the fellows there, as to why they haven't done anything to remove it, the reply was "but she can still see!". 'and she may not go through the operation'.  I said, 'that's not the point and she should  have been attended to and not left like that" I don't know why the owners have kept her in that condition , (the cataract didn't happen overnight) it must have been growing for quite a while and never checked in time. It doesn't seem to me that the owners care for these beautiful animals properly and SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN . That was so sad to see. I think they will lose money if they  lose an elephant. That's cruel I think!, They are only looking how much money they can make out of these poor unfortunate lovely animals and lose the tourists at the same time!  i ADVISE NO ONE TO ENCOURAGE THE OWNERS TO CONTINUE RUNNING THIS PLACE BY VISITING OR WRITING GLOWING ACCOUNTS OF THEIR VISIT! They don't deserve to be operating.

Name: Daniela Castro
Review:
Dear Noel M

We appreciate your concern and feedback, but we want to tell you that you went to another place there are so many touts that misguide tourists and use our organization's name

Our elephants are fit and in very good condition There are some rescued elephants as well.  There is plenty of food for the elephant and the only industry is elephants that feed the everyday fruits.
As you wrote we are expensive then you should check on our website which is also the only website with mentioned the fees. which is 3500 INR per person

Thank you and regards
Eleday

It is amazing to meet such impressive animals close up. The main one we had on our visit was so patient and serene. However, the animals still work part of the day doing the standard fort runs on the road and then just transport us tourists round a 200m route in the field. They don't look badly treated, but each of our 2 animals did have a couple of cuts/sores. We got to meet, ride, paint, wash and feed them and the kids loved it, but my wife was a little upset. It's a very expensive visit and the handlers will ask for extra money in tips.

Dear RSD78

Thanks for your feedback. We have some rescued elephants you might have seen time they rubbed with the trees so they have some cut marks. We give special treatment in that case.
With money, we charge 3500 INR, which we never pressure to spend. many other organizations ask for 5000 as well. Tips are gratitude which is not included in the package it all depends on you if you want to give or not.

Thanks 
Eleday

After spending some time with the elephants and their caretakers I noticed the use of the word LE so many times. LE in Hindi means Have iT. Why they use iT so much? Because elephants need to eat 16 hours a day! Every elephant has his own caretaker and feeds the elephant for hours and hours every day. I was happy to see these beautiful animals are well taken care of. The people working there are very Nice and welcoming and the boss is a very special excentric person who you Should definately meet. Eleday is super close to the Amber Fort and easy to combine in 1 day. Bahut dhanyavaad people and bad mein milenge!! üòâ

Name: Travel To Jaipur
Title: Very nice palace
Review: Very nice palace i will  recommend this for  everyone to visit this monument highly recommend this pis near by amber fort And palace

Name: exploredaunexplored
Title: Photostop
Review: We went in the afternoon and it was a bad time to visit this place. Scorching heat. Go early morning or in the evening. You can't go down. You need a special permission if you want to go down. It's nice but not well maintained.  The water is supposed to have medicinal properties but I'm not sure if it still holds true.

Name: Michael
Title: Beautiful historic location
Review: Fantastic place to visit during sunset. Highly recommend!Do not walk into the steps though as the security guards will be watching.There is a temple right next door which makes it even more picturesque.

Name: beckynmax
Title: Interesting architecture
Review: Worth a stop if you are in the area. About 5 minutes unless you climb down. Pretty step well with a nice old, abandoned temple across the road.

Name: FLnurseER
Title: Hidden architectural gem
Review: On the way to the Amber Fort our guide had stopped for a little surprise visit here. The 450 year stepwell is an eight story staircase architectural gem that does not take a long time to see, but the pictures from here are simply stunning. What a marvelous public gathering place it must have been in its heyday.

Name: vivek0210
Title: Architectural brilliance of Step wells in Rajasthan
Review: If you visit the Amber Fort don't miss the famous Panna Meena Ka Kund. It a simple square stepped well that take 10 minutes to visit. If you want to experience and understand the architectural brilliance, symmetry and science behind the Kund (stepped well) you should spend over an hour.

Name: goanjock
Title: Absolutely Fascinating
Review: Absolutely fascinating stepwell with stunning backdrops in all directions. It is nice and peaceful and whilst close to the Amber Fort is off the main tourist track. We spent about half an hour just wandering round whilst soaking up the atmosphere. A definite must see when in the area.

Name: Eileen G
Title: Nice Views
Review: This stepwell is in a lovely spot with great views of the fort and surrounding buildings. Since we had already seen the Chand Baori this stepwell was slightly less impressive. But it is worth seeing, especially if you haven't been to Chand Baori.

Name: Rahul Mishra
Title: Hidden Gems of Old Amer City
Review: When you walk inside the city of Amer, you will find that history and archeology is scattered there. whose most beautiful pearl is this place.

Name: Deb
Title: Hidden Gem
Review: A hidden gem and a must-explore place. One of the most Instagram-worthy places. A bit of better upkeep and maintenance is required though.

Name: ShyamKasturi
Title: Historic step-well
Review: This historical step-well is located nearby Amber Fort. You have to ask your vehicle driver, during your visit to Amer Fort, to take there, otherwise, they will skip it. We were not allowed to go down on steps. We can only see from top and take some snaps.

Name: Joanna H
Title: Best city tour - no sense of being rushed
Review: Nizam came to take us around Jaipur at short notice, my friend could only travel by car - a very clean and comfortable car with bottles of water for us,  We went on a city tour to Gaitor Tumbas - I had never been before despite going to Jaipur more times than I could count. Then Nizam drove us to Amber Fort and waited while I looked around.  Then we went to Panna Meena ka Kund, I'm most interested in the Baoris in Rajasthan Nizam was curtious and polite he had interesting things to say about the places we visited.  He stayed with us and made us feel very safe. The water Palace is so beautiful we had a coconut water there just to enjoy it for longer.We wanted to buy textiles and asked Nizam if he knew a good place. Mina sat in the work room and the men ran textiles to her there while I went into the main shop. I found it to be very reasonable in rates and fast for making up the clothes. Well done Nizam - much better shopping experience than usual in Jaipur! Like Victor Kiam, I liked the trip so much I bought a company!!!10/10 Nizam

Name: JayeshLC
Title: Nice Photo Stop
Review: This is in AMER Fort and very nice place for photo opportunity. You cannot climb down the steps and if you want photography done for any special occasion, you need to take permission as it is under UNESCO. It is very good site for Pre-Wedding Photo shoots and lot of film shootings have happened here.

Name: angelacollins3
Title: Close attraction
Review: Nice looking stepwell, would have enhanced the experience if we were able to walk down. The attraction is worth stopping at on the way to the Amer Fort

Name: Gl0balCitizen2013
Title: A fascinating, historic stepwell
Review: This is a fascinating stepwell, which we found quite interesting, since we had never seen a stepwell before. It is an example of the extraordinary ingenuity of Indian people, who thought of this innovative way to store & utilise water in the arid lands of Rajasthan. It is well worth a visit, just because it is so different and unusual an architectural form. What is truly remarkable is that it was once bustling with life, the place where women gathered to get water from for their daily needs.

Name: Dennis P
Title: Very interesting !!
Review: It seemed to be abandoned as there was nobody there in charge of entrance or anything. It is a fascinating piece of architecture and the steps would be quite dangerous if you attempted to go down them.  The water is covered in algae but you could imagine what it was like when it was fully operational.

Name: Wen-D K
Title: A Sight to See
Review: I had read about the amazing stepwells of Rajasthan- but these go way beyond any written description. Truly something to see - incredible architectural fete and a brilliant concept used in the past to gather water. As the water level dropped, you would simply walk down to the next level. Used in the past for both water and social gatherings.

Name: luka
Title: IT'S  NOT GOOD..
Review: Stepwell it's not good because of To Dardi better than you can go another stepwell in this town another one step well it's so beautiful he is 400 years old anther  stowell

Name: reefdiver702
Title: One of India's Classic Stepwells
Review: Walking distance from Amber Fort. Easier to take tuktuk or have own driver.Can't go down stairs. Worth the effort to find and visit.

Name: Kanchan M
Title: Beautiful !!
Review: This place is not well known hence is not yet super crowded. Very beautiful architecture, going down the steps is not allowed but one can still easily admire the beauty of this step well. If you are visiting Amber Fort, this place can be easily visited. No designated parking area, No entrance fee.

Name: MartinG1
Title: Interesting
Review: Historically fascinating but you are not allowed down the steps. If you are heading to Agra, Chand Baori is better.

Name: fitbhifoodiebhi
Title: Photo shoot
Review: This place is near by amer mahal.Nd i like this place for mostly photoshoot.Nd thts also comfortable area for couples..There are also Guards To look that no one steps inside it.Bt yes finally its vry beautiful place nd peaceful area.

Name: Christina
Title: A breathtaking sight.
Review: A must visit as it's near to the Ameer Fort .It's definitely out of bound now for tourists to attempt the steps.Amazing architecture!

Name: Shobha
Title: Nice but one is not allowed to step in
Review: It is very beautiful but no one is allowed to step in . There are also guards to look that no one steps inside it . But overall it is good .

Name: sturains
Title: Stepwell with Indian Moments
Review: We visited this Step-well as part of our Golden Triangle Tour with Indian Moments (see separate review ) and then visited Amber Fort both well worth the visit Indian Moments provided a guide who was very informative

Name: Jacqal
Title: Fascinating insight into the past
Review: This is one of those sights that deserves a stop but only justifies a few minutes because, as others have pointed out, one can only view the stepwell from the top. Nonetheless, it is a fascinating insight into the past and we are glad are guide made the effort for us to stop for those few minutes.

Name: curious_and.curiouser
Title: Beautiful stepwell but you can't go down the steps
Review: Beautiful stepwell! Unfortunately, unlike in Jodhpur where there's a similar stepwell (Toonwar Ji Ka Jhalra) that's been cleaned up and opened to visitors, the government of Jaipur is unable to appreciate this beauty and doesn't seem to be maintaining this place. Visitors can only view from the top and are strictly not allowed to walk down the stairs, there are guards to enforce this. Pity!

Name: Myrna R
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: Almost felt like I was trapped in a Escher painting.  Couldn't take my eyes off the dozens of stairs that make their way to the emerald green water.  Compared to other step wells  in India, this a small step well at the foot of Amber Fort.  It's a nice place to sit and contemplate on what daily life may have been like hundreds of years ago.  I would not venture down the stairs...can't imagine what's growing in the water, best to appreciate from afar.

Name: DDBTrip
Title: Picturesque symmetrical staircases
