We did a 45 minute ride through the desert jungle with a "driver" which was 3000 rupees each (we did it with 2 people so I'm not sure how the price would change for a different size group). This included time with the elephants before, a 45 minute ride, painting the elephants after, and lots of pictures. We booked this the day before. Tours do not start until 10am but they run through dinner. I would recommend calling rather than booking online. I'd also recommend wearing pants/shorts rather than a dress/skirt.  It was truly the highlight of my whole 2 week trip to India!

Name: Stay93783
Title: Birthday surprise
Review: We booked this excursion at the last minute because we were let down a couple of days before we left the uk. How pleased we were that our previous booking was cancelled. We were welcomed into the park by the elephants and their mahouts. The staff couldn't do enough for us. We set off and were welcomed at the end of the journey by a tented pavilion with staff and a truly delicious buffet. The elephants had been rescued from the city and given a lovely life in much better surroundings. The owner/manager explained that it was the nearest he could give the elephants to a natural life as they had been bred in captivity. The family also have organic vegetables in another area which they use. This exceeded all our expectations and would, absolutely, recommend this excursion.

Name: HONORIA1
Title: I admire the work they do here...don't do any other elephant related activity.
Review: I am very concerned about the way animals are treated and elephants are of great concern in India. Seeing the poor elephants taking people up to the fort in Jaipur was quite upsetting and I would urge people to NOT USE THESE RIDES as they are cruel to the animals. The Dera Amer safari has a small number of rescued elephants. They only do one or two walks a day on sort sandy ground with one or two people on board maximum? They aren't poked with spikes to make them walk faster and respond to vocal commands and squeezes from the handler. We had a brief amble around the countryside for half an hour then had a drink and a supper by a brazier which was very nice. They grow the food themselves where possible and the cooking was v good.I'd recommend it as an evening out of Jaipur.

Name: Jo Self
Title: Out of India
Review: Loved this place! The grounds are so lovely and the staff friendly. There were three elephants available for rides. They appeared to be well cared for and the rides are brief. We were treated to lunch out of doors and it was some of the best food we had in India! The food is local and organic and delicious. Our service was impeccable. The experience is pricey-particularly if if you forego the elephant ride but I am so glad we went!

Name: auntieshaz21
Title: What a brilliant way of getting to know about elephants!
Review: I have always wanted to touch and get up close to these wonderful creatures and here my dream came true.  Rungmallah our 32 year old female elephant was everything I imagined - kind and gentle. As I got up close and stroked and hugged her trunk she looked at me with her tiny but kind eyes.  The ride through the jungle was relaxing and the evening BBQ tasty.  If possible spend more time here than previewed, either bird watching or relaxing with a cuppa or something stronger on their terrace soaking up the atmosphere.

Name: GirlInPink2014
Title: Fantastic time at Dera Amer where animal welfare matters.
Review: We chose Dera Amer, because the elephants and other animals are well looked after and respected.   My 2 sons and I had a brilliant time visiting Dera Amer, feeding, stroking and getting to know the elephants and the camel.  We then went for a leisurely ride around the farm, before sitting down to a great lunch.All the staff were lovely and in particular, the young manager, could not have been more attentive and kind.I didnt want to leave and wish we could have spent the day there.

Name: phil v
Title: Too expensive
Review: The man picked us up from our hotel on time, and we travelled to the elephant sanctuary, the ride in the back of the jeep was awful the ride was far to hard played hell with my back.On arrival we were meet by a guy who spoke perfect English and told us all about the elephants, especially our one that we was going to ride and paint. He took my camera and took loads of photo's of us with the elephant which we much appreciated, there was some nice photo's, we went for our elephant ride which was good, on our arrival back we was greeted and shown to our seats by a log fire where we had a drink, then we were shown to our table, There was a good selection of food which you help yourself too. all in all it was very nice but i felt it was expensive.Half the amount would have been plenty.

Name: shomidas
Title: Great place for an elephant ride. Children will also enjoy painting the elephant including her toenails!
Review: A delightful secluded place with a elephant ride  for all through a jungle. Children will enjoy painting the elephant Lakshmi. A beautiful girl with a wonderful temperament. They will also enjoy feeding them bananas. The property has a lovely restaraunt and also wash rooms. They can arrange picnics in a jungle setting where you can see wild pigs, monkeys, blue bull and mongoose.

Name: ewatak
Title: Romantic dinner with a difference
Review: We were a little unsure about whether we should go on this trip, but "when in India...", and are very glad we did. We were not entirely sure what to expect. Warmly greeted, as it was sunset/dusk, we climbed the elephant steps and began our journey on Mochti as the sun set and darkness fell. It was a journey just long enough, as the howdah was not the most comfortable. Back at the place we started, we were shown to a private area where a fire had been lit, and we enjoyed a glass or three of wine, with Indian snacks. We were then invited to move to our table a few feet away. We appeared to have a completely private area, and were waited on hand and foot. The food was slightly disappointing, and all of it served rapidly, which because of the falling temperatures, meant that it was cold before too long. However, the atmosphere and the friendliness of the staff made up for it.

Name: yowimp
Title: Elephant rides, Rajastan entertainment and buffet dinner
Review: Went for dinner with Explore India tour group.  Rode elephants for about an hour. Had buffet dinner with typical Rajastan entertainment - flame acrobat, dancers balancing pots on their heads.  Funny old band leader blarring on a tuneless horn.  Too much smoke from kerosene lamps used to light the stage.  Suggest using an electric light.

Name: fairplay01
Title: Not what we expected.
Review: Our review maybe a little harsh because we were expecting something very different. In essence its an elephant ride around a farm followed by lunch. Didn't float our boat at all. we were under the impression it was a trek through villages etc. It was not that! we stayed an extra day in Jaipur for this and in our opinion it wasn't worth it. Having said that I am sure it would be good for kids.

Name: LynneGosport
Title: Beautiful surroundings and well cared for elephants
Review: This is such a lovely place and we enjoyed our 20 minute amble through the countryside on our elephant. I could see that all the elephants were well cared for, unlike some tourist attractions. We had a splendid lunch afterwards. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Name: wakosh
Title: A well needed rest
Review: After a couple of hectic days India my girlfriend and I checked in at Dera Amer and boy was it worth it. It was such a well needed rest from the chaotic big cities.We had booked the full package. When we got to ride an elephant, feed, wash, and paint her. She was really calm and you could get really close to her and even hug her trunk. We felt perfectly safe the whole time. No need to worry about safety.We had the whole tent-campingsite to ourselves and had a personal servant. When it got dark the staff made us a small bonfire and a couple of delicious snacks. Then we had a romantic dinner with lit candles and lanterns. The next day we took a ride on a cart dragged by a camel to a local village where we got to see how the villagers lived. It was really interesting to see. We also had a walk in the area and did a bit of bird watching.All in all it was a really relaxing experience. Everything was so quiet and tranquil. The staff made sure that everything was in our tempo and that we were comfortable att all times. I can't recommend this enough!!! It is really worth to stay a night in one of their beautiful tents. Don't hesitate to book!

Name: tahlishepherd
Title: Brilliant surroundings as well as the gorgeous elephants
Review: Perfect for our children who are 3, 6 and 8 years old. I searched over the internet for a really unique experience for us as a family and Dera Amer do it very well. On a setting of 180 acres it's a India that everyone should see. You get to feed the elephant, pat and wash and paint so very hands on.  We loved it and the food was amazing too.

Name: TravelOn9928
Title: Remember How Lucky You Are to Travel...
Review: Sometimes there are events in life that make you sit back and say, ‚ÄúGee, am I ever blessed.‚Äù  For me, being at Dera Amer was one of those experiences.   We were told that the owner, Udaijit Singh, is an organic farmer who is taking the elephants and camels from the city to live in a more natural setting.  It was obvious from the get-go that the animals were well cared for and treated with dignity and respect.The road to get into the site was a bit rough, having been a bit washed out from the rains, but we saw different wildlife such as a fox and a variety of birds.  We were introduced to our elephant and then had a chance to feed her a couple of bananas to develop our friendship.  Then we cleaned up and went for our ride through the jungle, where we saw camels, a variety of birds and butterflies, and heard the calls of peacocks.  We passed by a temple and were entertained with singing and drumming.  After about 45 minutes, we sat on a veranda enjoying drinks and appetizers before moving into an air conditioned room to eat a delicious Indian buffet meal.  The service throughout was superb and the whole experience was excellent and very peaceful.  This was my favourite experience while in India, and I would recommend this trip in a heartbeat!

Name: Becsaboodle
Title: A magical experience
Review: We went to Dera Amer as my daughter wanted to see elephants. It was very important to us to choose somewhere that had high welfare standards as we've heard so many horror stories. Dera Amer arranges for you to be collected from your hotel and you are driven up past the Amber Fort  into the peaceful hills above Jaipur. We fed, watered, washed and painted the elephants. They were so calm and sweet natured and it was obvious that they are not just well cared for, but they also have a good relationship with the people that look after them. A 40 minute ride into the jungle, past an old temple and then to a beautiful building where you have drinks and snacks and watch the sunset before going in for a buffet dinner. It was very well run, clean, informative and enjoyable. I would thoroughly recommend it.

Name: oumanota
Title: Both Authentic and a bit unsettling -especially for the elephant!
Review: If you're into elephant rides, a stop at Dera Amer is a must: animals seem to be treated a lot better than at the nearby Fort and other touristy places, there are a lot less people around and ultimately the ride is both fun and enjoyable, away from it all. Well, sort of. At the end of the day it is still a ride that has no other purpose than satisfying tourists' curiosity. It's not taking you form A to B but on a -nice- loop, back to A.  The day we visited we fed the wrong elephant by mistake before mounting another, and no one bothered to give us another banana for ours. It sounds trivial but our ride was quite upset about it the whole time, which should not be underestimated. Those are wild animals and accidents do happen. We felt our guide was a bit tense because of it as well, trying to constantly comfort the elephant while we were already on the tour, which didn't help. So, while we really liked the ride, lunch and spending some time in the quite and beautiful setting, we did feel a bit guilty about hoping on an animal's back that was not really happy about the whole thing.

Name: Paula P
Title: Out of the box experience
Review: What a spectacular way to spend a beautiful sunset? Riding a well cared for and loved elephant through the Indian jungle. Our mahout was lovely. He chatted away pointing out the wildlife. After the ride we had a buffet dinner which included traditional Indian food. The lawns were so free and cool. Such a relaxing evening, a real out of the box experience and I can highly recommend.

Name: XXX2588
Title: Had the most relaxing time here
Review: Udjit, the owner is super nice and very accomodating. We had a 40min Eelephant ride on one fo 2 elephants they have. They actually are best friends as they speak to eachother while we walk. It's so funny and these animals are so impressive. It's a little hard to find but once you get there it's like an Oasis in the desert!! No joke! It's beautiful! They even have luxury camping tents with a toilet and a shower: they call it GlamPing. I'd totally would have stayed there had I known before I got there but next time....We visited the tents out of curiosity. There are 4 if I rmemeber correctly and they are a little remote (7min walk) away from the main restaurant. They put torches to light the area up at sunset. It's really amazing! The lucnh was not spicy or hot, just perfect and very relaxing. Loved every bit of it.

Name: zoe
Title: A little gem !!
Review: Right from the beginning this was a great experience . The booking with Udaijit for the Rhythm of Elephants was easy and straight forward through email and as promised was picked up from our hotel in Jaipur . On arrival we had our first meet with Laxmi and fed her bananas . We were then taken to the house for drinks ( all soft drinks , beer and wine are included in price ) and too cool down as this was a hot day . When Laxmi was ready for bath time we handed water and scrubbing brushes and this allowed us to interact more and gain the trust of Laxmi . Yes we got a bit wet but that's part of the fun !!! When Laxmi had dried off we painted our own design , with natural colourings . The staff were all so friendly and nothing was too much trouble . They were on hand with information , photo taking and drinks when required . We were not rushed and spent as much time as was wanted with Laxmi . When Laxmi was due for a break from the heat we also took a welcome break . The safari ride was good with the mahout checking we were comfy and pointing out any other animals on out travels . Again , drinks were offered half way round which we thought was a great added touch . We said our goodbyes to Laxmi after the ride and arrived at our private dining area which was just beautiful . Lit with candles , cold drinks and staff on hand for literally anything. Starters , the buffet and dessert were amazing , we even watched our bread being made . All the food is fresh produce . Possibly the best meal I've had in India . Again , there was no rush and we didn't feel as though the staff wanted us to go . Overall , an amazing experience that I would recommend while in Jaipur.

Name: Anand D Nanavati
Title: Ganesha temple near birla mandir
Review: Its near to Birla mandir.  Same parking space with birla mandir.  We visited as this was near Birla mandir.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The place to seek blessing
Review: This best known temple is in heart of the city . The Ganesh temple in this area of Moti Doongri is crowded  most of the time but the since the pandemic the protocol of mask , no offering of out side sweets and social distancing is strictly followed . The opening hours of temple from 5 am to noon and again in the evening are strictly followed . Generally people come here with invitation card of wedding , engagements and to do puja for their vehicles . the newly weds are brought here after marriage as a couple to seek blessings of the lord Ganesha . No entry ticket .no paring .

Name: Devendra G
Title: Ganesh ji temple
Review: Moti dungari is a temple of ganesh ji and it is adjacent to birla mandir in Jaipur. I visit this temple whenever I visit Jaipur. The energy level in the temple is excellent. You feel instantly connected to the divine as you enter the temple.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Divine experience
Review: I had visited the temple for the blessings of Lord Ganesha. I have old association with this temple as have been visiting this temple since 1970

Name: dillsefoodie
Title: Mesmerizing Lord Ganesha Temple
Review: It's a very famous Lord Ganesha temple in Jaipur. Currently because of Covid, you can't take any prasad or puja items inside the temple. There is a prasad directly available which can be bought from priests inside the temple. The Lord Ganesha statue is quite magnificent.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Mesmerising Ganesha Temple!!!
Review: This is one of the oldest temples in Jaipur City. The residents of Jaipur city invites Lord Ganesha for any pious celebration in the family like weddings etc. Also while leaving Jaipur for the journey the devotees have blessings of Lord Ganesha before leaving and likewise when they return to Jaipur, they first take blessings and then proceed for their home.

Name: Pintya
Title: Well maintained
Review: This Ganpati temple is comparatively small, but clean and well disciplined. It is famous among locals and worshiped for every new beginning.

Name: TiddfullTalks
Title: Peaceful
Review: A nice and clean temple compound. Have a big sized Ganesh ji's statue. The compound has a shoe facility, parsad shops nearby, proper railing for demarcating crowd, security force outside, parking etc.

Name: Vaidehi J
Title: Beautifull
Review: The temple is located very close to Birla temple. The idol of Lord Ganesha is big. Temple is very old but well maintained.

Name: juvlemm
Title: Ganesh Temple
Review: The temple is famous for fulfilling wishes. Devotees have put in threads in token of their wish. Hall is small, but the god is beautiful.

Name: Chetan Shroff
Title: God who fulfils wishes
Review: Moti Dungari is Ganesh temple and it is full of local devotees. The locals offer first invitation card of marriage to lord Ganesh. When they buy new car, they visit the temple to seek blessing of god. There is nothing spectacular about architecture.

Name: Vipin Arora
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Very nice temple of Lord Ganesha ,in Jaipur. Very well managed and quite a rush of devotees on weekends . There is a temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman and Goddess Mata just nearby which too is a must visit

Name: Sanjay Shaandilyaa
Title: Regards & Worship of Jaipur
Review: This is one of the spritual place in Jaipur near Rajasthan university & Birla Mandir. Closes 1pm to 3pm after open until night. Whenever I come near around definitely come to Ganpati Ji...‡§ó‡§£‡§™‡§§‡§ø ‡§¨‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ üëêüëê

Name: Sanjay Kumar
Title: Memorable moments
Review: I am always interested to visiting a holy place where i can feel stress free life.During visiting at Jaipur with my wife we visited many Temple and we also visited this temple, temple decorated very well.Temple pujari Behivour so good, pujari ji Behivour very very good.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Sidhi vinayak Ganesh temple
Review: Shree ganesay namah: very famous ganpati temple in Jaipur. Old Hindu temple. It has Magic. Beautiful temple dedicated to Lord ganesha

Name: SameekshakSACHIN
Title: Sameeksha By Sachin - Beautiful Temple with Historical Importance
Review: Moti Dungri Temple is almost 258 years old temple constructed by the then King of Jaipur. The huge Idol of the deity Lord Ganesha is believed to be more than 750 years old. The idol was brought by the then King from Udaipur in a cart and the cart stopped at the foot hill of Moti Dungri and thus Kind ordered to make a temple and to place this great idol in this temple. It‚Äôs a beautiful temple with Rajasthani Architecture. It has three entry points all in one direction. One has to climb few staircases to reach the entry point. The covered area just outside the temple and staircases have barricading‚Äôs for que management. Prasad Shops are just adjacent to the temple. Shoes stand is on the right hand side before covered area. A fair is organized on every Wednesday as Lord Ganesha is considered the Lord of Mercury. Wednesday is considered as the most auspicious day for the Pooja Ceremony of Brand New Vehicles. The temple is just few meters away from Birla Mandir. Temple remain open from 5:30 am to 1:30 pm and 4:30 pm to 9:00 pm on all days and there are 7 darshans during the day. This temple is very beautiful and worth spending time. Highly Recommended to visit.

Name: Foodisbaetravels
Title: Peace!
Review: For peace for mental health for wishes for everything I ought to come to this temple.It has magic. My wishes are always fulfilled!

Name: Abhay Mehta
Title: First god of Jaipur
Review: Ganesh is always worshiped first according to Hindu mythology. So all the Jaipurites come here to invite Lord Ganesh for any auspicious occasion in the family. The large statue of Ganesh is very attractive and you may feel positive vibrations in the temple.

Name: jayamrutiya4769
Title: jai ganesh deva
Review: the temple is well organised by local police and pandits. too much crowd but management was so good to keep calm everyone.

Name: NikhilGS
Title: A must visit - Ganesh Temple
Review: This temple is quite famous & is a must visit during your trip to Jaipur. It's just next to Birla temple & is generally crowded on Tuesday & Wednesday. While the darshan happens quickly ileven if it is crowded but you need to plan your travel accordingly.There is Prasad available outside which cna be purchased as per your willingness. There are local shoe vendors to keep your shoes/ chappals safe.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Very old temple with a rare statue dedicated to Lord Ganesha!!
Review: This temple houses the Ganesha idol with the trunk turned right. As per the Hindu tradition, its one of the stricter/difficult to please forms of Lord Ganesha.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: A rare Statue of Ganeshji and highly revered
Review: A very ancient and revered temple of Ganeshji, situated close to Birla Temple. If you pray with full devotion,it is said that your wishes are fulfilled. A must visit place for your own good.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: wishu334
Title: Lovely
Review: Very serene  & big you can seat and spend time there. walking distance from Birla mandir and open till 9 pm

Name: Neeraj Johar
Title: Ganesh Ji Temple
Review: The main Ganesh ji Temple of Jaipur.A Must place to visit....very old temple..It is said if you visit this temple and wish Ganesh ji fulfills it...The staute is big and sitting one..a rare one...Open all days and from early morning till late night

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Bappa
Review: This is the most famous ganapati temple in jaipur. Located on jln near birla temple. Try pnadit pav bhaji here

Name: Umang A
Title: Bappa
Review: The most famous ganpati temple of town and all auspicious works starts from this place only in city. Try pandit pav bhaji in evening here

Name: Dee
Title: old temple
Review: good hindu temple of Lord Ganesha.you can visit for + :) :)I love this place.its near by Birla Temple

Name: Foodisbaetravels
Title: Lord Ganesha!
Review: This is my magical place in the town! No matter what problem you are facing or no matter what your wish is Ganesh ji tends to fulfil it for me. Lord Ganesh is famous for his divine powers and I truly believe in his powers since childhood he is my favourite..don‚Äôt forget to ask Panditji laddoo Prashaad.

Name: Anshul
Title: Positive vibes
Review: Peaceful temple of shree Ganesh Ji, famous and in top 50 places to visit in Jaipur.Ample of parking space nearby and birla temple is walking distance from there.On Wednesday it very crowdy otherwise its all normal.Must visit.

Name: HMathur
Title: "Ganpati Temple"
Review: Beautiful ganesh temple,very big statue,so many people comes daily to pray.vey tasty besan laddu prasad.

Name: Dilip Sutar
Title: Morning Visit
Review: The temple is open early morning this is a beautiful temple of lord ganesh , early morning on 5 am the 1st arti is done .

Name: Jaideep Singh Rathore
Title: A must see, religious place.
Review: This Ganesh Temple is one of the more popular temples to visit in Jaipur, just walking distance from the Birla Temple. The area is often crowded but you get places to park your vehicle after a bit of struggle. The view of the main deity is amazing, very unorthodox design of the premises, very open in the area and doesn't feel cramped when more visitors arrive at the same time. A must see.

Name: vishphoo2231
Title: holy place !
Review: Moti Dungari Temple is old temple at jaipur , I had recently visited here ,I must say one must visit here at least once

Name: Pravesh Goswami
Title: Spirituality at best
Review: It is one of the most followed temple in Jaipur. Located near Birla mandir. It is devoted to Lord Ganesh. Temple complex was clean. Lot of sweet shops for buying Prasad there. Parking is constraint but one can park near birla mandir, which is just walkable.

Name: Ashish J
Title: Worship Place
Review: very pleasant worship place for God like Ganesh Ji.. Hanuman Ji.. Durga Ji..Must visited place in Jaipur provide pleasant to heart and rest.

Name: Saheli Pal
Title: simple temple amidst of the city
Review: Moti Dungari temple is situated in the right hand side of the city palace, jaipur. You can take an auto after visiting janttar-mantar and city palace to reach Moti Dungari Temple. This temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesha which was situated by Rajasthani Majaraj. Apart from lord Ganesha there is a shrine of lord shiva in the temple. The architecture of the temple is nice but if u have  a very tight schedule you can skip it.

Name: SadhanaRakesh
Title: Spiritual Visit For Divine Blessings
Review: It is a must visit place for divine blessings while you are in Jaipur. The temple is situated near famous Birla temple (Laxmi Narayan temple).The temple attracts huge number of devotees on all days for divine blessings of Lord Ganesha. Devotees throng the deity with full faith and devotion every day. Dedicated prayers to Lord Ganesha fulfill your wishes here. One can also bring homemade Prasadam (Ladoo) and give them to the priest for Bhog and a part of it will be returned to you. There are many shops in the area selling ‚ÄúLadoo Prasadam‚Äù.Most of the big Industrialists, Businessmen, students have visited the temple and sought divine blessings. Look for car parking near Birla Temple or nearby.

Name: Jitendra Singh
Title: A Place of Dedication and Prayer to  God of well being Ganpati
Review: The Temple dedicated to Ganpati is very revered. It is centrally located on Mti Doongri Road off JLN Marg.You get good feeling and positive vibrations in the temple.

Name: Arun L
Title: A clososal Statute of Lord Ganesh
Review: This temple too is amongst the popular Jaipur visits.The Prasadam is a special Laddu and a must buy.The temple is quite comfortable in the Darshan.

Name: Piyush A
Title: Must visit if you are around Birla Temple
Review: A place of big faith, a temple of Hanuman is a must visit if you are around Moti Dungari or Birla Temple. The place is very crowded on Tuesdays Wednesdays and a visitor should plan it either very early in the morning or around mid afternoon.

Name: Wander829530
Title: Ganesh temple
Review: Temple of lord ganesha its Very good place to visit with family or friends. So visit with family or friends

Name: Diwakar S
Title: Visit to Moti Dungari Temple of Sri Ganesh Ji
Review: I was in Jaipur in 1st week of August2018, and on the 2nd day of my tour I visited this temple with my co-travelers. The Temple is very much devine and evoked lots of positive fibs in me.

Name: Tarun K
Title: Spirituality and Peace
Review: A popular Ganesha temple in Jaipur is considered very important from a religious point of view. The spiritual charm of the temple is second to none and devotees throng the deity with full faith and devotion.

Name: mathurshradha19
Title: Moti dungari Ganpati
Review: As a resident of Jaipur and frequent visitor, here are my experiences:1. Avoid Wednesday, which is the day of the deity as crowd density might not let you take proper darshan.2. Go for early morning darshan3. Lots of ladoo shops nearby though you can also bring homemade ladoo and give them to the priest for bhog and a part of it will be returned to you.4. No system of putting tilak here which I don't appreciate. In most majestic temples, all devotees are atleast put tilak by priest on their forehead5. Terrible condition of footwear kept outside the temple, better if you leave them in car/hotel/etc6. Wear daily chappals and not expensive shoes as there can be wear n tear7. Try to negotiate with the priest to give you some sindoor on plastic sheet which has been put on Ganpati8. Lots of beggars that can be avoided9. You can talk to the priest if you want to donate chola and clothes for Ganpati10. Limited space for parking. You might have to look for parking near Birla Temple or elsewhere. Go by Cab/bike/walking.

Name: Prashant Kulshrestha
Title: Very Famous Temple
Review: I always feel good & happy when visit this temple. if you want to visit avoid Tuesday as there will be too much crowed.  This is next to Birla Temple so you can club both.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Bappa moriya
Review: Very famous ganpati temple inJaipur city...  Located near by birla temple.. Have Pandit ki pav bhaji in evening here...

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Divine & Peaceful
Review: If you are visiting Jaipur, then this is must see place which is very popular and has reputation of fulfilling the wishes here. Its divinity is well known among the city dwellers and even foreign tourists come to see this interesting place. It was built in 1761 under supervision of Seth Jai Ram Palliwal. The idol of the Lord Ganesha is said to be more than five-hundred years old & was brought here in 1761 by Seth Jai Ram Pallival who was accompanying Maharaja Madho Singh I, from Udaipur. Originally it was brought to Udaipur from Gujarat. The temple is situated near famous Birla temple or Laxmi Narayan temple built of white marble. Overall the divinity, popularity of the temple attracts huge number of devotees on all days & especially on Wednesday's. Aum Shri Ganeshay Namah!

Name: Pp_ggn
Title: Must Visit temples of Jaipur
Review: Almost 250 year old Temple of lord Ganesha.Situated on a small Hillock of Moti Dungari.Lots of other fine temples in the vicinity.Must visit temple in Jaipur.

Name: Priyanka
Title: Serene n peaceful
Review: A must go to place if u r in Jaipur. My visits r sure incomplete widout dis one visit wen m in d city.

Name: NaareshVyass
Title: Icchhapurti Ganesh Temple
Review: Located near Birla Temple. Its famous for Icchaapurti(Fulfilling wish). Wish comes true. in the Jaipur.

Name: KVKulkarni
Title: Unexpectedly cool
Review: This one temple near Birla Mandir turned out to be unexpectedly beautiful. It was closed when we had gone but we could see one third of Jaipur city from there. Comfortable climb with lots of green plants and multicoloured flowers..... Do visit

Name: Mayank S
Title: Nice temple
Review: Very close to the main road, peaceful time not much rush on a weekday evening.Had been there with family

Name: Jaya K
Title: Pinnacle of faith !
Review: Lord Ganesha temple ( Moti Doongri )  is situated in the heart of jaipur and easily accessible from any rook and corner of the town. It is the abode of renowned Lord Ganesha, the bestower of all that is auspicious and the Lord first prayed to ...by the Hindus... is majestically seated in all glory...adorned in saffron colour and the temple is most reverred to the Hindus.. where about nine feet high statue of The Lord is located .A must visit place to see the vibrant colours of Rajasthan and deep entrenchment of Indian religious faith and devotion...

Name: pushpeshpulkit123
Title: Holy place
Review: This temple is on the left of birla temple and very near to world trade park.this temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesh and was constructed by raja bhagwandas before laying the foundation of jaipur. When you visit the temple you will find a shop selling perfume which is the only thing really offered to god and all other things are returned to you. There are also idols and Lord Ganesh's wives riddhi and siddhi and his sons shubh and labh.  If you give the priest 51/- you will get a ladoo as Prasad.In front of the temple there are temple's of Lord hanuman, goddess Durga and radha Krishna.Overall it's a good place to visit and is not very crowded

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The historic temple !
Review: The temples  at the base of Moti Doongari are the best known temple of the city . Ganesh temple is generally more crowded during the wedding seasons . Early morning starting at 5 am people start coming . It is believed that in any auspicious occasion people come here to invite the lord Ganesh . More crowded on Wednesday‚Äôs . There is also a Hanuman temple with five faces of the lord within walking distance . Tuesday‚Äôs are special here . Nearby , also is the another famous Birla temple which opens at 6 am during summer months . The deity of Laxmi Narayan is bewitching and brings devotion in anyone who enters it . The white marble temple is an attraction if the city . One can do the all these temple in a coulpe Of  hours . Best time visit is mornings - earlier the better due to crowds during day time . No strict dress code followed  but moderate covering of the self is recommended . Beware of pick pockets in these temples .

Name: Umang A
Title: Morya
Review: Most famous ganpati temple of Jaipur. Located near by birla temple. Grab pandit ki pav bhaji in evening here...

Name: Abd
Title: Very famous
Review: This is one the most famous temples in Jaipur. You will hear about this temple frequently if you are in Jaipur from almost anyone to everyone. One can plan a visit if visiting near or on tonk road or Jln marg.

Name: akshat c
Title: Peacefull
Review: I went there in january with my family.Wonderfull pilgrimage place.The moment i enteres , i felt so relaxed.

Name: PrashantTN
Title: Big Ganesha...
Review: It‚Äôs an ancient and famous Ganesh temple. Big idol here. Locals normally do there new vehicles puja here. The temple is good with 3 lanes to control crowd and surrounded by lots of sweet shops for prasad. Had they kept some space for devotees to seat and pray for few minutes that would have been wonderful. It is close to another beautiful temple Birla temple.

Name: Desiglobal
Title: Divine
Review: Nothing more peaceful and divine..situated in the hustle bustle but a 500 year old Ganesh temple at the foot of moti Dongri hill just walkable distance from Birla temple...it is surely a must visit !

Name: AAA
Title: Peaceful, Great, Must Visit
Review: This is ancient temple of Lord Ganesha. Its remains quite beautiful. My heart was comforted by going here. You must all definitely visit here.

Name: Aneesh S
Title: Pearl Hill aka Moti Dungri
Review: This temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha is situated at the best of Moti Dungari hill and is nearly 250 years old.This temple is a popular tourist attraction in Jaipur and revered by all.Also the temple is located very close to Birla temple.There is a temple on top of the hill dedicated to Lord Shiva and being very unique in that the temple opens once a year during Maha Shivaratri.

Name: MarcinDrP
Title: Unique...
Review: I do not want to discuss religious feelings / beliefs. We ended in this temple during a religious ceremony and it was a unique experience, for sure... I am not sure if one can recommend a temple (working temple) to visit... but this one is very local and tells a lot about the culture...

Name: 207niravp
Title: Excellent temple
Review: Lord ganesha temple with deep faith is situated. Koti Koti namaskar to lored ganesha. visit to see lord ganesha

Name: hitesh s
Title: Jai Ganesh Deva
Review: Great Palace in Jaipur. Visited this place so many time and found peace of mind here. Visit this place if you are coming to Jaipur.

Name: jonesharma29
Title: Moti dungari temple
Review: Moti dongri temple is a famous temple in jaipur. devoted to lord ganesha. beautiful and well managed temple.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Beautiful Ganesh murti
Review: This temple is just opposite the Birla temple entry. The idol of Ganesha is huge. I have never seen such a big and beautiful Ganesha idol. It feels pure joy being so close to such divine Ganeshji..

Name: 75jayaraman
Title: Ganesha Blesses
Review: Great temple and a must to visit for anyone coming to Jaipur. The ambience is great and the aarti is really soothing and provide a devine feeling

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: moti dungari temlpe
Review: it is on jln marg near to birla mandir dedicated to lord Ganesh here you can feel positive vibes and peace

Name: Kushagra
Title: My favourite Ganesh Temple
Review: Moti Dungari is a Ganesh temple very close to the famous Birla Mandir in jaipur. The temple is very popular among the locals. It gets extremely crowded on Wednesdays but still there are lanes to manage the crowd. Beautiful place with lot of positive energy and a big Lord Ganesha's idol.

Name: Kumkumjaipur
Title: Lovely Ganesh statue
Review: The Ganesh temple at Moti Doongri is a must for Ganesh worhippers. There is a lot of rush on Wednesdays. The statue is huge. Lovely nagada beats during the Aarti ceremony.

Name: Amit K
Title: LORD GANESH TEMPLE
Review: Very  Good Temple And Peaceful Place  And Every  One Know God is Great who knows which temple is complete your wish pleace must visit

Name: Deep_Indore
Title: Grand old temple
Review: This is very old temple and the place has very nice aura. Very conveniently located near to Birla Temple and can be covered along with it.

Name: Ajay Arora ( Food N Travel Diaries )
Title: Blissful Temple
Review: Moti Dungari is a Lord Ganesh Temple and is right next to the Birla Mandir. Though a small temple but equally impressive in appearance as the Birla one. The idol is adorned beautifully and prayers are performed with utmost faith. No Entrance fee here. There is another temple right opposite to it and do make it point to visit the same as well.

Name: Vijay Tour Guide
Title: The first and foremost in Jaipur
Review: The most famous Lord Ganesha temple in Jaipur, located near Birla temple in Jaipur. The temple remain close in afternoon time except on Wednesday.

Name: JD2807
Title: Feel top of the world
Review: Lord Ganesha's Moti Dungari Temple is Centre of devotees for Jaipur. Most of the people start their day with a prayer there.

Name: SonuBatra20
Title: Jai Ganesha
Review: Jai Ganesh Deva. A different idol of Ganesh Ji Viraajmaan in sitting position.The Temple is well organized and Darshan was convenient.

Name: Ankit
Title: Ganpati Bappa Moraya
Review: Ganpati Jee Temple situated in the center of Jaipur city. Very famous temple of Jaipur and one should plan for this temple when in Jaipur

Name: Sandeepkumar Modi
Title: Pilgrimes
Review: Very renowned temple in jaipur were it is believed that your wishes come true, a must must visit place in jaipur , it is situated on small hill. be their & seek its blessing ( Vighnaharta & Sukhkarta )

Name: cbk2911
Title: Lord Ganesha temple at Moti Dungri Hill
Review: Its one more prestigious temple and is situated on small hill in Jaipur called Moti Dungri and is a replica of scottish castle. It has colorful decoration & has beautiful idol of Lord Ganesha.

Name: LKEHRAAJ
Title: Moti Dungari Temple
Review: Lord Ganesha TemplePatrons prefer to visit here to get there new car worshippedGives you good flower mala for 20

Name: JainManoJ
Title: A wonderful temple of Lord Ganesha , adjacent to Birla Mandir
Review: A temple of Lord Ganesha , adjacent to Birla Mandir . you would love to visit. Visit also nearby Lord Hanuman temple.

Name: vinodajoshi
Title: Lord Ganesh Temple
Review: Lord Ganesha always a worship place to be visited. Temple is close to Birla Temple at walkable distance

Name: CindyEyler
Title: Loved this Experience
Review: being among the locals, it was an authentic temple visit that was my first experience with any temple in India. I loved it. The local women loved that i was wearing a sari but wondered where all my bling was lol. it was wonderful energy and i loved the bells upon entry and the Ganesh statue. great time.

Name: JainSakshi11
Title: Most spectacular Ganesh temple I have visited!
Review: It is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Jaipur and flocked by tourists all through the year. The temple is dedicated to Lord Ganesh. It's a must visit for those who want to savor a bit of cultural heritage of the city.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: great temple
Review: place to visit and have more peace of mind. Good place to visit and have a different experience. Centrally located

Name: babita13
Title: Ganesh Temple
Review: this temple is situated on the JLN road. The temple is the one of the most visited temple by locals. whenever any any one in city by any vehicle they visit this temple for Pooja. On Wednesday there is huge rush and one has to wait in line for some time.The Modak Ghankee before Ganesh chatoorthi is very famous and very fascinating.

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: Temple of Lord Ganesha
Review: Near University of Rajasthan, very close to Moti Doongri , This Lord Ganesha temple is very famous and devotees in large number visit it every day. Number of visitor swell to couple of thousand on Wednesdays and on special days connected with Lord Ganesha like Ganesha Chaturthi. Visitors come here to place invitation cards to invite Ganesha for any ceremony in the house. Also they bring their vehicles for Ganesha's blessings before putting them on road. Suggest not to venture on special days to avoid crowd and avoid waiting in line which may some times take more then 3-4 hours.

Name: Navigator691429
Title: Excellent pooja
Review: We bought our new car and went there for prayer.  Pundit ji perform an excellent prayer. We had a nice time there along with all the rituals which pandit ji made.

Name: Om Joshi
Title: Moti Doongari  Temple of Ganesh
Review: Ganesh is known the god of welfare and success, All vehicle buyers first reach to temple with vehicle particularly cars and other new vehicles. Ganesh has elephant head and people believe that success is attached by visiting his temple. Sweets and Laddoo are presented to the temple.  it is most Popular.

Name: Surendra143
Title: A must visit for Ganesh Devotees
Review: We learnt about this temple when we went to Birla Mandir.It is a very nice temple - great vibrations. Located next to Birla Mandir.On  wednesdays there are more devotees and hence a bigger crowd and some parking restrictions in the vicinity. One can first visit the Birla Mandir  where one can park and then walk across to this temple.A most satisfying visit

Name: anjuanjali
Title: great ganesh mandir
Review: this is famous temple of ganesha. it is near birla temple. we heared about this after reach birla temple. wednesday very crowdy

Name: Doney R
Title: very nice temple
Review: its a very nice temple of lord ganesha. those who worship lord ganesha, its a must visit place. lovely

Name: rahuljasrotia
Title: Lord of Jaipur
Review: Moti Dungari Temple is devoted to Lord Ganesh , Recommended to attend Aarti during morning and evening hours , peak time are crowded but it worth to visit temple on Wednesday.

Name: rpandey2017
Title: Good place to visit while in Jaipur
Review: Dont go in peak times but this is good and clean temple.Parking may be issue some times therefore as said earlier avoid peak days and festival season.

Name: rajeshsharma1296
Title: lord ganesh
Review: jaipur had two mazor temple moti dungari and birla mandir if you are in jaipur must visit at moti dungari

Name: Shyam J
Title: Shubh Kaam ki Shuruwat, Ganesh Ji ke aaye bina adhuri hain...
Review: initiation of any auspisious or business or social event at jaipur, starts from here. anyone can`t imagine an initiation of his work without his attendance here. Very calming place. but on occasions heavy rush found here, so please take care and stay blessed here...

Name: Abd
Title: Divine
Review: Very beautiful place this is. One must visit this place for complete divine feeling. Any1 & every1 can visit this place.

Name: npsindotin
Title: Most Popular Shri Ganesh Mandir of Jaipur
Review: Beautiful place surrounded by the beautiful Moti Dungri hills. Main attraction is Sindoor Shri Ganesh Murti.

Name: Abhay Mehta
Title: Large idol of Ganesha
Review: The famous temple of Ganesha is just near the Birla Mandir. Residents of Jaipur offers first invitation of marriage in the family to Lord Ganapati. One must visit the temple to seek the blessings of Ganesha. Parking is not a problem except on Wednesday.

Name: Linda A
Title: Delhi's best attraction
Review: The temple is beautiful, one of the best attractions of Delhi. Please do not visit on a weekend night, its too crowded and the queues for the cloak room and security are too long. Mobiles and cameras are not allowed so if you can do without your mobile leave it at home to avoid the cliak room queue. The fountain light and sound show is popular hence evenings are busier. The metro has a stop walking distance to the temple. Worth a visit.

Name: Charles Schnaider
Title: Wonderful
Review: Wonderful experience with lots of walking and admiring. Complex is just awsome and stunning. Modern, clean and worth going there with your family.

Name: Deva
Title: Memorable evening @Akshardham Temple.Jaipur
Review: Very clean n holy place. You will find urself there. The dedication and worship will be fallen as blessings from God. One of the best holy places in Jaipur.

Name: Amber T
Title: BEAUTIFUL temple
Review: This was am amazing find. Easily my favorite part of the trip to India (even better than Taj Mahal). Be prepared you can't take cameras on the grounds but it was still amazing to see. The craftsmanship and sculptures and the light show are AMAZING!!!!

Name: Pintya
Title: Excellent
Review: The temple is beautifully constructed and well maintained. mobile phones and cameras are allowed inside. The carvings are remarkable. Restaurant and gardens inside the temple are worth visiting.

Name: Vaidehi J
Title: Evening outing
Review: The temple is beautiful with enough space for relaxation in surrounding gardens. The facilities are nice and good arrangements are made for devotees.

Name: juvlemm
Title: Well maintained
Review: The temple has nice architecture and it is maintaiend well. Surrounding gardens offers relaxation to kids and elderly people. Overall must visit for peace of mind and relaxation.

Name: REVIEWS
Title: Amazing temple..
Review: A fusion of different beautiful stone built .the South Indian food in the restaurant inside the temple .I ly the place. Many tourist are come to visit this awesome place.

Name: yugandhar balaraju
Title: Nice Architecture
Review: Not like delhi akshardham, but if you have not seen it in delhi, Should not miss in jaipur. Architecture is wonderful in the temple, ambiance is also great. Also can find the south Indian food in the restaurant inside the temple. Finally if you visit jaipur akshardham is a must.

Name: Sleepy Treakker
Title: Breathtaking Moment
Review: Magnificent temple premises. A fusion of different beautiful stone built. Intricate carvings. I felt so happy went there. its construction is mind blowing. can't explain in words.must go there.

Name: tush736
Title: Temple..
Review: Temple is very nice to see...for all age of people..carving on stone here is done awesomely...Nice place to have. photography..

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Modern yet peaceful!!
Review: The architecture is simply stunning. The popularity of this place is more due to its architecture than being a temple. Its a beautiful building and as soon as you are inside the gates you feel a sense of peace and calm.

Name: bournemouthbabe87
Title: One of the top 4 buildings in the world !
Review: Yes, it is modern. If you are looking for a 16th century temple, this is NOT it. But what it IS is truly incredible. How they built something on this scale with the beautiful carvings they did, defies belief. The cost of building this today in the West, would be tens of billions of US$ - it could NEVER happen. I had been to the Taj Mahal the week before, and I thought this was even better - not as pretty, but far more incredible. This was the highlight of my 6 week India tour. Entry to the temple itself is free. The sound and light show, (at barely over 1US$), was well worthwhile too, but get your ticket as soon as you get into the temple as it sells out.

Name: Dimple Sharma
Title: Peace of mind.
Review: This place really gives you peace of mind. I suggest all the youngesters to visit this place with friends.

Name: TravelbuggIndia
Title: Akshardham Temple
Review: Akshardham Temple is a very popular temple here. I liked the beautiful ornate design. It has calm vibes too.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Beautiful
Review: Akshardham temples are famous for their beautiful constructions, stone carvings and huge premises. Jaipur is no different.

Name: Umang A
Title: Huge..
Review: Akshardham temples are famous for beautiful construction , amazingly crafted idols and huge set ups.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Experience peace and tranquility
Review: This is an architectural beauty and marvel. Once you are there you enjoy peace and tranquility and you love to be here.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: travellerY3298AY
Title: Amazing place
Review: The carving in marble and sandstone is very intricate with chasing in gold as well in the central mandir ( temple) . There are exhibitions showing the life in  ancient India and the development of Swaminarayan religion and its philosophy of helping everybody irrespective  of caste and religion when there is need. There is a very good light and water fountain show in the evening .

Name: Vimlesh Ranjan
Title: Peaceful
Review: Its not big like other Akshardham temple in India but very peaceful and amazing place for everybody. Its not far from center of city. This is must place to visit if you are in Jaipur.

Name: vishphoo2231
Title: holy temple
Review: Akshardham Temple , is temple of jai shree swami narayan bapa, very beautiful temple one must visit here

Name: HMathur
Title: " Beautiful"
Review: Beautiful temple, wonderful architecture ...looks amazing..small restaurent is also there...u can get gujrati food here.

Name: Rayomand P
Title: Worth a visit
Review: The temple is situated in a nice and peaceful area. It is extremely well maintained. Suprisingly mobile phones as well as cameras were allowed however this is not the case in the temple at Noida. It is a very small place and has a nice museum, the entry for which is INR 20 and thankfully there is no dual pricing for foreigners like other places in Jaipur. Nice to visit and spend an hour.

Name: Venetos A
Title: TOP SIGHTSEEING IN DELHI
Review: I didn't include in my sightseeing program the Akshardham temple , but by chance i did visited , and IT WAS MAGNIFICENT !  The art ,the technique ,the set up , the aura of this place was something beyond description, you need to include in your tour in Delhi.

Name: KIDZEE NIRMAN NAGAR
Title: VERY PEACEFUL PLACE
Review: i always love to visit this place in evening when ever i get time .One can spend 1 to 2 hours here in evening .well maintained park and clean temple .

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Akshardam Temple
Review: The Akshardham temple in Jaipur is a modern temple. The temple within its compound has well laid out green spaces and also a restaurant where food can be had at reasonable rates. we found the experience of visiting the temple to be very good.

Name: Shyam B
Title: Beautiful architecture marvel
Review: The temple has marvellous stone carvings which leaves one spell bound. This has small landscape with beautiful garden, intricately & beautifully carved temple. This place is indeed very peaceful.

Name: Odyssey43852174668
Title: Lovely place
Review: It's a nice temple nice view it's a best place to enjoy your holidays overall we all are very very happy with this tour

Name: Vinay S
Title: Miniature version but still very brilliantly designed
Review: This is quite small as compared to the Delhi Akshardham temple, however, this is equally well designed and laid out. Gardens, cafeteria, children's play area all are there. The food at the temple restaurant is affordable and delicious.

Name: gutteridge
Title: OK if you like crowds
Review: Went here for the sound and light show. Literally hundreds of people queueing, the control was with ropes to hold back the crowd and lots of shouting. We missed the 7pm show and the 8opm was in Hindi, so we enjoyed the video which was impressive, but understood little of what was going on. I hated the experience, my husband thought it was great! Make your own mind up!

Name: GlobeTrotting825044
Title: Good temple
Review: Very good experience....really enjoyed here will recommend to other people....Thank you Will come Delhi next time

Name: Tarun K
Title: A new addition to the city
Review: A good architectural and religious center that has come to the city recently. It makes for a good visit given the popularity from two earlier versions and also the religious importance.

Name: Dave C
Title: A modern wonder
Review: Amazing architecture and even more so when you realise its hand carved and not very old. Take a guide with a good level of English with you to explain the displays under the temple.

Name: aliflaila
Title: Best place to visit in Delhi
Review: This is one of the best place in Delhi to visit. It will take nearly more than half day to visit this place. Dont miss fountain show in the evening.

Name: Biswadeep M
Title: Well maintained temple in vaishali nagar
Review: One of the best place to visit if you are around. Well maintained place, very peaceful, with lots of greenery around. Parking is also available.

Name: P P
Title: Hey! Let's create a Indian Temple Theme Park!
Review: Go on a Weekday - this theme park monument is closed on Mondays. Whatever you do, do not go on a Sunday.Akshardham is where "tour groups" go to see something textbook "Indian". In that way the Akshardham does for Indian Temples what Remix/Mashups do for Old Songs... It's like the phrase you say when someone asks you "Say something in Indian" (yes - that happens here in the USA and yes I have instantly judged them - lol!)Imagine if Disney decided to create mini versions of the Great Pyramids... You could eat, buy your souvenirs and never have to go to the real thing... That's what these guys have done with the is modernized reboot of ancient India. It's nice but there's not journey involved just a metro token!This is not ORIGINAL art. It is a cornucopia of Indian architecture  in a theme park-ish setting with light shows, exhibition and food court! So while it is a way to kill boredom in Delhi (why would anyone be bored in Delhi is beyond me) - and even better way for tour groups to get an instant WOW from the tourist... is is not as "rich" at the original.The originals were create in the 16th century in all white marble - they are best examples are found in the Jain temple of Rankhpur (1.5 hrs outside of Udaipur). Go there and be amazed...Anyone can recreate the Great Pyramids or Taj Mahal  and theme park the hell out of it - but they can never replicate the energies that are still there to this day...

Name: Sandy_JSR
Title: Attractive Architecture & Crowded
Review: Visited on a Sunday evening travelling good distance from our hotel at Amer Road with high expectation, but that didn‚Äôt fulfil. The temple is comparatively small and situated in a small ground surrounded by residential / commercial buildings. The architecture of temple is attractive and under illumination the temple looks delightful. When we visited, the place was crowded; hawkers were selling pop-corn, ice cream, etc. inside the campus, it was more a fair like atmosphere. To me, it is good to see but not must see in Jaipur for tourists.

Name: karan a
Title: Peace of mind!!
Review: You will get peace of mind here!!Best thing to get inner peace and rest of mind here!This place has something which cools your soul and freshens you!!

Name: Rajesh Bhukar
Title: A place to be at  anytime of the Day
Review: The temple is so beautifully made and very neat and clean. One can virtually feel peace in the surroundings.

Name: Umang A
Title: Akshardham....
Review: This panth has created their own legacy in building huge and beautiful twmaplea across India. Be it Delhi, ahmedabad or Jaipur.... Each one is master piece.

Name: rayw62devon
Title: Include this in a half day site view
Review: Added this tour half day, picking up several sites rather one. It was a good time to go and those people visiting the temple wanted to explain what was there and details of what was being celebrated over the coming days.

Name: 30poojas
Title: Nice temple
Review: This temple is small but it‚Äôs beautiful and calm. It has overnight stay facility and really moderate price and  Premvati restaurant on site which offers very tasty food at very cheap prices. Well maintained temple.

Name: akshat c
Title: Must visit it
Review: Although it is not as great as the one in Delhi.But must visit this temple.We loved it and will come again

Name: poorvipatel85
Title: Very nice family friendly temple.
Review: This temple is quite small but it‚Äôs very beautiful and the atmosphere is very calm. We stopped here on route to Akshardham Delhi. We stayed overnight here and we had dinner at the Premvati restaurant on site which offers very tasty food at very cheap prices. There is a bookstall and shop on site where you can buy religious books and items. Very clean complex and well maintained. The gardens are very beautiful and a pleasuren to walk through.

Name: Atul S
Title: Best place to visit with family in Delhi
Review: I have visited here with my family, and we had an amazing experience to remember.We liked light & water show here which was the best among all.

Name: alpha08
Title: nice place to visit
Review: not good as compare to delhi but decent place to visit if you are living near this area , as in jaipur distance is too much so for this visit its not worth

Name: Ktishan Kant Lavania
Title: Good Temple to visit
Review: If you are in Jaipur please don't miss to visit Akshardham Temple, Crowded Temple, but worth to visit.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Far more human friendly than Birla temple
Review: At this temple you will not feel that you are unwanted. There are temples for wich land was procured from Government on throw away prices in name of creating facilities for public but later on tourists were treated as unwanted intruders. At Birla temple, Jaipur one gets mistreated right from parking lots, At Birla Temple, Jaipur one is not allowed to walk on lawns, one is not allowed to sit in garden, etc. The shoe locker facility is available on payment at Birla temple whereas at Akshardham it is free.  Here at Akshardham one can sit or stand almost at any place of your liking- in temple, open area near temple, garden etc. There is no restriction on photography. Here you dont feel that you have come to house of a dictator where you are unwanted. I will stop going to this place when they the management imposes restriction and no longer maintains it as house of God. There are ice cream and juice stalls just facing temple and no one creates any fuss if anyone enjoys a cup of icecream while appreciating beauty of temple.

Name: MarcinDrP
Title: Worthy visit if...
Review: The point is... do you want to get a feeling of the culture? Then you can go with monuments / history or you can go with living culture... visiting temples and trying to understand is the second way... this temple will give you a piece of India today....

Name: jonesharma29
Title: Akshardham temple
Review: Akshardham temple is famous temple of jaipur. beautiful and well managed.nice to sit here and relax some breath.visiting during evening is amazing

Name: Sweta P
Title: Beautiful
Review: All of the Akshardham Temples within India are highly maintained and really beautiful one and this is also beautiful, loved to visit this Temple.

Name: shirzadi7
Title: Amazing
Review: I think it was as beautiful as Tajmahal, it was so crowded but for foreigners , there is a seprate line . So we don't need to wait so long.

Name: V√§√§ru√†n B
Title: Great temple
Review: one of the best temple dedicated to Lord Swami Narayan and is one of the most popular tourist destination. you have to take 5-6 hour time to visit everything like boat show, movie, water fountain, multiple small type of jhaki.  all are seeing in nominal cost. amazing place

Name: AAA
Title: Must Visit
Review: Akshar dham is a great temple. Well made. It's temple and location is very beautiful. Must definitely visit once.

I visited in the evening after sun set and the atmosphere there was peaceful and serene even though you could see hundreds of locals and tourists stinging around the temple complex.

Name: melisabatrol
Title: very well maintained
Review: Akshardham Temple is a perfect example of great temples, We enjoyed alot there, Very huge garden. Love to visit again there.

Name: cbk2911
Title: Architectural Marvel - Most beautiful temple in Jaipur
Review: We visited this temple which is one of the most beautiful temple dedicated to Lord Swami Narayan and is one of the most popular tourist destination. One can see carved artifacts, paintings, which reflects rich culture, royal history of Rajasthan.

Name: gireesh s
Title: Akshar dham jaipur
Review: Good place to fall in lap of God where you can feel energetic and peace good place with beautiful idol

Name: Yun L
Title: Truly worth
Review: This is the best place I have visited in India. It has lots of stone carvings and carved buildings depicting ancient deities etc. Their prices are NOT inflated and they sell the same product to locals as they sell to tourists. I have found most tourist places have a much inflated official price for foreign visitors. You should spend at least 5 hours in this place (including watching their movies) to give justice for its creation. The food in their food hall is also amazingly good and cheap.

Name: ctcmanila
Title: Most beautiful hindu temple
Review: Awesome.  Most beautiful and biggest temple compound. A fusion of different beautiful stone built. Intricate carvings. Camera not allowed inside compound. Shoes not allowed inside main Temple.

Name: Snurps D
Title: A very magical place...Magnificent Temple...
Review: So far, the best temple I've visited. Super love it! Beautiful Architecture with brilliant intricate carvings inside. Majestic structure! There was this heavenly feeling while inside the golden temple. I really felt relieved and at peace here. While inside, I was rotating on the floor like a  child while looking up the very  magnanimous carvings above and around me. A must-see temple once you're in New Delhi.

Name: eitancohen1
Title: nice to see
Review: clean and beautiful but mostly for touristthe fountains show was very nicealso the boat tourthe price was high

Name: Arun K
Title: Very Peace and Beautiful Temple
Review: I went many times here and every time i have some special feeling. It has different kind of stone which used here . I will recommend here to every one.

Name: 671rajeshwarm
Title: Beautiful temple, a must visit
Review: If you have already visited akshardham temples in Ahmedabad or Delhi, you would find this one in Jaipur smaller as compared to others but the same reason makes it so much more attractive. There is no advance planning or booking required for a visit, you would find ample parking space without any hassle and the temple architecture will match that of other bigger temples. Best time to visit will be in the early morning at 6am for the arati. I attended the arati at 7.15 am and liked it very much.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Festival LOOK
Review: Great place to visit in the evenings.Gives a festical loik.Place woth visitng.Parking facility and also for fast food snacks.No entry ticket.Great place

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: mind blowingTemple
Review: Akshardham temple is fantastic temple of Jaipur .this Temple has wonderful architecture. This temple is so beautiful and also peaceful .

Name: Amen E

Name: AzadAjay

Name: princ512

Name: Yashwantpandey
Title: Beautiful Temple

Name: Jeff M
Title: Ancient temple

Name: kvnreddy96

Name: Harendra S

Name: Anshuace
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: This Temple is Near Form My House And Always Come In Temple Its Really Nice And Beautiful Place . a Lovely Garden There Every inches of the temple,it's structure and architecture is a piece of work by almighty god himself.

Name: sam7sky
Title: Peaceful Place

Name: TCMAP
Title: India meets Disney
Review: We enjoyed our visit to Akshardham but be warned it is not your typical India sightseeing tour. It has large chunks of a Disney feel to it, large screen film show, mini boat trip through indoor rivers & displays (small world style) & a very good light show in the evening.The temple is modern but impressive.Well worth the visit but historic India it is not.

Name: Anshu M
Title: Very Small as compared to all Akshardham temples

The light show is great but it's better with people being able to translate for you !Some of the stories  sound a bit like brain washing. I would advise to skip the 50 min movie (number 2) for this reason. But vibe is great all in all :)

Name: Paridhi7392

Name: Paul J
Title: Worth the visit
Review: New temple in traditional style, quite amazing, no handbags or backpacks allowed inside, leave them at the hotel to avoid long lines at the cloak room, also no cameras or electronics allowed, for about 4 dollars they will take and print your picture with the temple as a background, bring a pair of sock to go inside , no shoes allowed

Name: relaxtripp

Review: Swami Narayan Mandirs will display a great zeal of architecture anywhere in the world. Dont think of Akshardham delhi when u visit this temple. It is only 5% of the show there. But a peaceful, marvelous and splendid architecture you can witness here too. Get blessings from Lord and Guru here.

Name: Pradeep N

Name: hosseinkhaniniloofar

Review: Akshardham Temple is good place to see as far other temple are more beautiful rather then jaipur Akshardham temple., If you wanna visit akshardham temple them must go to Delhi

Name: Seema C
Title: Beautiful Temple!
Review: We visiting the Ashardam Temple complex in October. It was absolutely beautiful. There was an exhibition on the life of Swami Narayan which had an English or Hindi option. It is beautifully done. Following that we watched an informative movie and then watched the laser light show which was definitely the highlight of our visit. The boat ride was also fun. Kids had a great time. Highly recommended.

Name: Shubhang M
Title: Peaceful place
Review: this is very beautiful and peaceful neat n clean temple . so many peoples are visited daily, i am also visit regularly . temple is looking very beautiful . big garden and jain food restaurant here. easy to approach .

Name: sarminderkaur82
Title: Clean and nice
Review: this temple is really very huge, clean and nice, very well oranganised, We love the atomosphere here.

Name: pradeep_parhi
Title: Gorgeous Temple - Not to be missed while in Jaipur
Review: I along with my family had visited Akshyardham temple at Jaipur on 12th Nov 2016 during our holiday trip to Rajasthan. This is located at Vaishali Nagar. The temple is gorgeous with modern architecture. This temple has idols of Swaminarayan along with Radha/Krishna, Ram/Sita and lord Shiva/Parvati/Ganesh. The garden in front of the temple is superb and amazing. The ambience is neat & clean and the floor is made up of marble.The exhibition hall was also good. Entry fee for the exhibition hall is Rs. 20/- per person. This hall depicts the life of Swaminarayan through audio and display of the exhibits. It will take around 1-2 hours for visiting the temple and taking photographs. This is a very peaceful place where one can sit for around one hour. This is a must visit place and not to be missed during Jaipur visit.

Name: Vikramaditya C
Title: Superb Architecture, Peaceful
Review: U may find a lot of historical monuments in Jaipur which are famous for their architecture. But, if you wish to see modern day structures with jaw dropping architecture, it is the best place in Jaipur. This temple is dedicated to Swami Narayan Ji and is the only temple of BAPS Swaminarayan Sanstha in Jaipur. The temple is known for its beautiful architecture, adorable idols, wonderful sculptures, and carvings.The temple is made up of sand stone. The carvings on sand stones used in the temple is spectacular. Further, idols of deities in the sanctum sanctorum are so beautiful that you will just keep on adoring them.Also, there is a very beautiful garden and a restaurant in the temple complex. "Prem Rasoi", the restaurant in the temple complex offers very delicious delicacies, specially the "Daal Khichri".In short, this place is one of the must visit places in Jaipur.You may use this link for the exact location of temple - https://www.google.co.in/maps/place/BAPS+Shri+Swaminarayan+Mandir/@26.9021076,75.7060039,13z/data=!4m8!1m2!2m1!1sakshardham+jaipur!3m4!1s0x396db4979bfaaaab:0xf327bf3573201a4e!8m2!3d26.9021076!4d75.7410228

Title: Amazing temple
Review: This temple is situated in Vaishali nagar, our hotel is also very close this temple, Very well maintained.

Name: Ramkumar K
Title: A day with elephants
Review: We were in Jaipur for 2 days and this was the best thing we did during our stay I had contact Farhan just one day tour near to our visit and he managed to organise a trip for our group for 3 adults and 3 kids at very short notice Farhan made as as soon as we arrived and told us about the elephants at experience farm we were then introduced 22 elephants 52 year old Lakshmi and 25 year old Rani we failed the elephant sugar can and then painted them with non-toxic vegetable best colour following this we were taken for M elephant ride you have the option of riding wear back through which is truly an amazing experience the kids enjoyed every activity at elephant farm there uh aah quite of few elephants at elephant farm and they all seemed healthy and cared for each elephant has a strong quarter at joining that of the earth and his family the compass even has a school for the Mahu children we were told that more qualities facilities are being created for the elephants including a bathing pond on the the premises so future visitor may have the opportunity to bath the elephants for haan and his team provide us water and bananas and even chai aur coffee is also thanks mister Farhan

Name: eleexperience
Title: I love the experience
Review: Went to Ele experience Farm today with my family and 3 year old kids was greeted the founder and owner himself (Farhan Khan) quiet and knowledgeable Gai and very soft spoke doesn't like tourist things allowed which was very good for us because my son was with me through in 100 questions of him and he will answer each one of them clearly and in-depth he considers his job oppression and he enjoyed doing it you will see that when you meet him he loves his animal he had had arranged cold drinks and milk for us hospitality at its best then came the elephant what a Majestic animal she was Sonia was her name I had never been so close to one and was particularly scared a little at first but all your spheres go away when you touch the elephants we hugged her said her sugarcane juice and green vegetables played with her and we painted on her body yes you can Paint on animal in fact they love it because they don't use normal Paints brush they use brush with which are made from bamboo stick which üòårelax. The colours elephants and the colours and harmful as they are organic and get easily washed away after painting we had elephant safari where to set on the elephant and took a ride we suggest for their back ride if you are with family or if you are with the kids you can go there.

Name: AlbertT
Title: Happiest day with elephant
Review: The elephant safari in elephant village is a relatively new edition to the Jaipur tourism and we are lucky to experience one of this during our last visit to Jaipur. Actually we were going throught the options of such adventure close to nature and we were lucky to get this contact of "Ele Experience Farm"contacted by Mr Farhan Khan. To begin with they do have the option of hotel pickup and drop. After entering the premises which is very close to the Amber fort the first thought which comes is "WOW".. we felt us if we were actually entering and elephant Kingdom Mr Farhan Khan was there personally to introduce us to the concept behind this new Ventures he same to be an elephant lover himself with gave us a good feeling over all the facilities were there to make us most comfortable even thought the village is still being developed by the authorities one should not go there with the expectations oppo A5 Star experience because it actually is a hands on experience of being close to an elephant the gives you an option of choosing your activities and rates are divided accordingly we decided to go through the full package elephant ride on a chair since we had at 2 year old kid elephant feeding painting on the elephant with natural colour and stick and finally giving the elephant a bath the activities were carried out with the atmos care and guidance of the team of "Ele Experience Farm". Most importently now were in between we failed that sum of force on the beast animal and infecked the story behind these elephant present in experience farm is heart warming most of them are rescued from the hardships of a circus Amer fort sawari is etc the team of Ali experience farm to take a lot of care of these elephants and infect are doing a kind of social work which is very appreciated we allow the experience and hope to enjoy it again when we will come village is fully build up by the coming here thank you for the memories.

Our trip to the elephant farm was fantastic. Me, my wife and our two year old had the time of our life. We spent a lovely morning playing with Laxmi, the extremely well behaived, kid friendly and docile elephant who allowed us to feed her loads of food (to the absolute delight of my daughter), colouring with safe washable colours on her legs and posing for photos with theatrics worthy of a circus. We highly recommend visiting the farm (tip - go early in the morning to enjoy a relaxed morning with the elephants).

Name: eleexperience
Review: A starting with a warm welcome at the farm of Ele experience farm and was amazed to meet the elphants an incredible feeling. Before the walking with elphant  (which was a great fun)i got the opportunity to paint the elephants. They were so calm and it was so much fun,i'm in love with the elephants. After the walk i fed them bananas and other fruits.i also had a chance to cook round breads for them which were big and elephants love them.i was happy seeing them eating my cooked breads,was a nice feeling.Then the crew member took me to the pottery and i made some nice cups,with the help of the potter,i still have them with me as a special memory from jaipur and from Ele experience farm.The elephants are very sweet, amazing!the crew members are so funny,they made me laugh every minute...yes,i'm still smiling guys ,they also showed me jaipur and some amazing places,have given me an unforgettable time and i know many more travellers will love the experience they offer.And you will feel safe and comfortable in Ele experience farm.I do highly recommend for ele experience farm.

Name: eleexperience
Title: Amazing elephant experience!
Review: This is truly a great experience. Faran went out of his way to make this a memorable day for me and I can't thank him enough for that.You can feed, walk, and paint the elephants at the farm (you can't wash them in the winter unfortunately) and the staff did a great job answering any question I had. The elephants were rescued from circuses from the south of India and are therefore not able to adjust to life in the wild. All the elephants were very affectionate and sweet.Faran picked me up from Amer Fort and on the way back we stopped off for some chai and he introduced me to his friends who were practicing for the kite festival that is happening in a couple of days. It was a great local experience and I would recommend anyone to spend a day here.

Name: WICK ‰∫ó
Title: TOILETS ARE HELL.
Review: What is wrong with all toilets, they are extremely used and you can see toilets in super bad condition, cleaner, housekeepers they never clean these toilets. Those are commodes (english toilets) so you won't imagine sitting on them at all. Those toilets are complete sh*tholes. Do not visit if you like hygiene free environment. I repeat do not go there, Toilets are hell, and you can't even visit there with kids or toddlers, no clean place to take care of them.

Name: Eagle eye
Title: Mask or scraff
Review: Wtp guys  why you guys are not allowing people whose mouths are coverd with scraf .  Covered mouth  is mandatory but it's not mandatory that you are allowed only if u wear mask. .Secruity not allowing people with scraf covering there mouth why ?Even our senior politicians uses the gamcha or scarf to cover face .In other malls people are allowed with scrafs

Name: Philip P
Title: Futuristic monument, luckily outside of the city centre.
Review: Only viewed from the exterior: little to add apart from the title. I like this style very much but it integrates difficult with the majestic historical buildings.

Name: John H
Title: Escape the madness of Jaipur
Review: It's a western style shopping mall which is great for westerners looking for a little respite from the madness of downtown Jaipur

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Couldn't find my favourite brand powerbank in that big mall.
Review: It was a huge complex or mall with lot of stores that include electronics, that include small to big stores and even Reliance Digital. I tried for power bank few brands at Reliance. The prices are too high. And couldn't find the wanted brands like Asus or Microsoft. So couldn't buy the power bank. So just roam around and finally felt hungry and had pastry.. There was an exclusive store for cakes and pastries. The chocolate pastry was tasty. Shopping experience was OK. But not satisfied with shopping experience particularly about powerbank.

Name: rohit arora
Title: Trip to world trade park jaipur
Review: World trade park is one of the best shopping malls in Malviya Nagar Jaipur . You can have great shopping experience as well as it has great food court . But I find Gaurav tower Malviya Nagar much better as it has all the brands open food court with great brands like HP world . Lenovo Exclsusive store , Asus Exclsusive store , dell exclusive store a great digital experience with digital dreams Jaipur

Name: dipesh k
Title: Huge property
