Review: Huge property but needs to be maintained and there is not much clarity of why and how the mall has been done. Thats fact

Name: Shutterbug_Iyer
Title: A Mall like any other
Review: For tourists to Jaipur, there is nothing interesting here. What attracted us was the unique architecture and the nearness to the airport. We had one hour to spend on the way to the airport and we decided to visit the mall. Inside it was like any other upmarket mall with some prestigious brands and food court and cineplex.

Name: Sagar
Title: Best mall to visit in Jaipur
Review: As I live in Jaipur. Oftenly, I visit to WTP (World Trade Park). It's the only mall in Jaipur that looks good and gives you a pleasant vibe. You may find rush on weekends but you wouldn't find this as difficulty. Mall is too large in width than any other mall in Jaipur. You can find multiple shops there to fit your shopping needs. However, this is not a grocery shop. So don't expect D-Mart alike shops. There are good clothing shops, food shops (like pizza, kebab, KFC, etc.) at food court. There is good capacity of parking with complete security at most of the entrance. Mall is equipped with automatic doors, security cameras, detectors, clean public restrooms, clean floors, lifts, elevator, Cinema Hall, Food Court, Toy shops, Gaming mania, Luxury electronic devices showroom, Branded Wears, Cafe, Restaurant, Book shop, Artificial Jewellry, etc. However, near WTP you can find other malls such as GT, Central GT, etc. But you may find too much rush there on weekends. Also, parking is not free. What might be annoying are beggers trying to sell Rose. You can also hire cabs, rikshaws, bikes,etc. to visit this place.

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: World Trade Park
Review: Multi Branded Mall for Best Shopping Experience in an Excellent Location with Lots of Parking and Several Eateries and Cinema for an All Day Pleasure

Name: Jitendra singh
Title: Unique built.
Review: The world trade park is built in a very large area and it looks fabulous from outside and can attract any person towards it very easily. There is a Dubai bazaar inside it for. Shopping and a large food court.

Name: Tedd
Title: Jaipur
Review: Really good had good experience This travel company helped make my recent trip to Australia the vacation of a lifetime!  I am so glad I chose to use their services - this was the least stressful trip I have ever taken and that truly added to the enjoyment factor a lot.They guided me through the whole planning process with ease, and made sure

Name: Shorya
Title: Bad experience
Review: When first time i saw the building i thought that it is very nice building but i went inside for 2-3 times and all the time ac was not working in entire mall , washroom facility is not available in every floor . for going one place to another place it takes long time and we have to ask from many people . i really tired that time . i will suggest that other malls i have visited was far better in compassion of management .

Name: Manoj Agrawal
Title: Modern Jaipur
Review: Jaipur being a culturally rich city with lot of royal heritage attracts several tourists, lot of businesses groom here as well. World Trade Park fits extremely well in this situation where people can go to a modern shopping mall and shop the brands they need. Very well built and maintained, food courts have lot to offer.

Name: SameekshakSACHIN
Title: Sameeksha By Sachin - Big Mall with Luxury Brand
Review: This Mall is quite big. This has 2 Block which are interconnected with each other from their top floors. It has showrooms of luxury brands. Affordable brands are missing. Overall good place.

Name: Alok2108
Title: A good place
Review: Went there for a casual outing and it  was a pleasant experience...although it is a  shopping complex it was not crowded and one could move around easily...went to the food court for a brunch and it was quite nice..the food court was definitely in demand as there were quite a few people there...there are number of outlets there with different kinds of cuisine and it looked interesting...the only problem was with the escalators as couple of them were not working and one had to either take the lift or go by stairs...a good place if you want to hangout with friends or family and try things and spend a relaxed weekend...

Name: Dhirendra S
Title: nice place
Review: Nice place to visit & tour with friends, variety of food is good also the cinepolis mivje theatre is good & treat to watch.

Name: Mimi
Title: Review of world Trade park jaipur
Review: Amazing place to visit. Food sites are also there. Food n bar is here which is amazing. A dubai bazar. Good stuff is here like traditional n western both. U can also made tattoos.. A clean n beautiful place to visit with your family, friends or couples

Name: 1Anurag
Title: Casual Visit
Review: Was visiting Jaipur on some work and was staying close to the WTP. Visited the place one evening and was impressed with its design and huge spaces. Fountains and selfie spots was nice to sit around.The highlight of the WTP was the huge Food Court with plenty of sitting options. Variety of food is available from local cuisine to Kebabs, Street food and South Indian snacks to Pizzas and Milk Shakes etc. The Dubai market side of the food court is where I bought some cheap but very nice shirts and tshirts.Go in the twilight time and spend the evening there, its a nice place to go.

Name: Rojmira
Title: Much better than other mall in Jaipur
Review: Pictures not allowed not even in mobile Some of the international brands are there Dress comfortably to avoid people staring Very good building Nice architecture Good place to eat

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Best Shopping Mall in Jaipur
Review: It is the best shopping mall in Jaipur located in JLN Marg. You can eat lot of variety foods here and enjoy shopping üõí. I tried to buy a powerbank from Microsoft or Asus. But I couldn't find them here. But you have Reliance Digital Showroom also available  in the mall.Overall its a nice shopping mall. The building also attracts lot of viewers.

Name: harshdudhani
Title: Best architecture in the City
Review: This is one of the best and greatest architecture in the City. Located on JLN Marg. Looks great in the night

Name: Ayan Segal
Title: An amazing place to visit
Review: World trade park is an awesome place to visit. One can get all type of things you want in here. From cinema to food & from cafeteria to tattoo artist search for what you want.

Name: mishi
Title: Best Mall in Jaipur
Review: Its a huge Mall with nice brands to shop from and a very good Food Court with a lot of options. A futuristic mall

Name: Andrew F
Title: Disappointed
Review: Went their with my wife who is a wheelchair user. Not particularly user friendly, lifts very small and no clear indication in lift as to floor numbers. Ramp we had to negotiate was quite steep. Many small shops with familiar brands but nothing to shout about. Had a snack in Food Hall which is on top floor. Was OK. If you are in India for cultural visit, it‚Äôs not worth coming here. We visited more out of curiosity than necessity and won‚Äôt be returning. OK for wet or cold day.

Name: manish J
Title: Wow..
Review: A mall which is having all tha things a tourist wants in jaipur. Full shopping , masti and food with so many options.  Neat and clean , well maintained.  Probably one of premium malls in India.

Name: Animesh A
Title: One of the Best Mall
Review: This is new mall, and one of the best mall I've seen in India. Well constructed, aesthetically beautiful, good services. BUT  washrooms need better maintenance. It is near airport. Food court, and mini Dubai market is exceptionally good.

Name: Gerard
Title: A touh of modern india
Review: Interesting architecture with two towers of shopping ( 4 floors each).  A good respite away from  bazaars.  Prices were reasonable. There wasnt much  human traffic inside when we visited - which made it a welcome change from the tooting and pushing, outside.  Worth a quick visit.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Nice nice
Review: WTP at JLN has almost all branded outlet, food court , Selfie corners etc . . It is decided into North and South Zone ..so it's always good to check before enter into the tower .. Nice shopping experience .. branded as well as local stuff is good at reasonable price .. Dubai Bazar is there where u can get local stuff  . . Shopkeeper do bargain so ask for fair price .. Ample of parking area which too at reasonable price ..

Name: Viraat
Title: Delicious Food at KATHI JUNCTION
Review: Had lunch today at the Kathi Junction in the Food Street of the World Trade Park. Ordered a Chicken Biryani with Mutton Curry , Naan and dessert . It came in a small Thali tray but it was a very substantial helping . The Chicken Biryani was delicious and the mutton curry was out of this world ! At Rs370/- it was a meal worth having ! Highly recommended.

Name: Jaskaran singh
Title: This place
Review: This place is good for small shoping and if you wana buy good stuff you can easily visit wtp location is also good behind gt matket and have proper parking

Name: Peregrineri
Title: Modern mall, not particularly interesting
Review: I wouldn't bother unless you happen to need something you can only get in a big mall like this. It's certainly not what travelers come to Jaipur for. When there are so many wonderful bazaars in Jaipur, it's hard to see why you'd go here. There's a mediocre food court and a movie theater.

Name: Luigi X
Title: Great variety
Review: This big shopping mall is also nice to see from the outside, it offers a variety of both local and international products

Name: Smit
Title: Only lifetime of Jaipur
Review: What to say about this place. this is the only place in Jaipur where you can go to spend time every Saturday and Sunday and daily if you are from Jaipur. this is the place which comes to the centre of the city. this place is full of all the brands that are sneaky these days but to be honest they are much expensive also.

Name: Vipul G
Title: Too much expectation
Review: Well I went to mall with huge expectation,  I mean in a city as diverse as Jaipur something on 19th no. To do . Well despite huge building shopping area is way too small. There are two different block connected by food court. It is cumbersome specially if you have a wheelchair.  There are not too much option for shopping.  For food there is just one food court with limited option.  Only silver lining is dubai bajar which trades in local stuff n with reasonable price. Rest they have named different market .  Roman street , fantasy bazar.  But that all is merely names n little . Well this is an average mall .

Name: bg23121995
Title: Gaint mall and a must visit place
Review: I have been to jaipur many times but once i have visited this extremely big mall and i think whoever go there must check out this.All is available from locals to international brands.

Name: Anjana J
Title: Holidays
Review: We went to Jaipur with family... wonderful trip ...we saw this mall..the biggest mall of Jaipur...very good ... ambience , the interiors...the chandeliers...the concept ..dubai section..fairy land section...all was too good ...the food court üëçüëç

Name: Simmurani
Title: iconic
Review: The structure is iconic and one of a kind, over multiple levels of the building you can find everything that you need. We went on to watch a movie and for KFC

Name: Mohmmad S
Title: Awesome
Review: This is Jaipur‚Äôs pride. And a delight. A mall with a definite personality of its own. It has everything that all malls offer, but it has its own unique contributions too. Such as the Dubai Bazaar, the Fantasy world, it‚Äôs food court, and a local curios market done up in a special setting. It has become a tourist attraction more than just a shopping place.

Name: Gaurav C
Title: nice mall
Review: one of the better indoor places in jaipur...you can pass time easily...the food court at the top is the center of action...quite a variety of restaurants here ...shopping wise also the mall is nice...

Name: Vishal Gautam
Title: Good Place to Visit
Review: Nice place to visit. Stores & Brands are almost same at all places. The place is divided into two parts.Good Fun.

Name: akjalewa
Title: Overall fun and food ...highly recommended
Review: I have been here many a times but let me tell you every visit is full of fun and satisfaction. All popular food outlets , best shopping brands, best movie experience , leisure out just everything including best selfies locations... you can spend hours without getting bored. Not costlier than outlets in city, ample parking (40/- for 4hrs for a 4 wheeler). If you are short of time dont waste it searching a nice place to visit. Just be here and you will not regret. Dont forget the 10-12min full body massage @120 on 3rd floor , outside north end of Dubai Bazar. You will thank me for that.

Name: ominvent
Title: Modern Landmark in Jaipur
Review: This place is all in itself.There are shops from gadgets to clothes to small stalls.You can enjoy movie and fast food too.The place is point of attraction for many youngsters.You will certainly need more than a half day to explore it all.

Name: ganesh b
Title: Lovely modern Mall
Review: This is a great modern Mall in Jaipur, has plenty of shops. We watch a movie and went to the food hall. All round great place for family entertainment and shopping.

Name: tandonmayank14
Title: Good place for shopping and spending time.
Review: WTP is well maintained mall in Jaipur. NIce place to do your shopping as all major brands are present there. Also have a food court.

Name: nitiappki
Title: WORLD TRADE PARK JAIPUR
Review: It is the best mall in jaipur ie it contains all major brand shops, local shops, restaurants, theatre, etc. so its a kind of mall where u get all the stuff u r looking for.

Name: saurabhmlvbhilwara
Title: Love to food
Review: All the various food at a place with different brands , loved it with cousins and family friends. Must enjoy once

Name: Pongpol S
Title: Modern shopping mall, interesting stop before leaving to airport
Review: The location is only a few minutes drive to the airport and Patika Gate. This is one of the biggest shopping mall in Jaipur, with modern cafe and restaurant. The place is clean and comfortable for relaxing after tired day cruising around!

Name: Ankit S
Title: Very Big Mall. Must visit if you are visiting Jaipur
Review: It is a big mall containing all the major Brand Shops. The cafeteria is at the top. It is a great place. Although, everything is costly.

Name: AKSHAT J
Title: Nice looking & best shops
Review: I was visited last day in world trade park or wtp  this is very fabulous. When I hear for it  first I went to WTP I see it first time in my life. I suggest you you should go there and enjoy it yourself.

Name: Sandeep Yadav
Title: Land mark of jaipur
Review: I have been there more then 100 times and you can say every weekend we visited there for the shopping, food and many more. This is modern jaipur and you should be there if you are in jaipur.

Name: Manjulajarial
Title: World trade park, Jaipur
Review: It is very good place for shopping. All brands are available. Variety of food and coffee shops. There are benches to sit. It is place to visit. The mall with very different architect . I liked the place.

Name: Hitesh S
Title: Movie at cinepolis
Review: Good and maintained movie hall in jaipur where sound and picture quality is as perfection. Recommend it.

Name: Himanshu Doshi
Title: Huge mall with limited shopping options but a great food court.
Review: I visited this mall with my family on 28th April 2018, Saturday. I was told this is the most happening place in Jaipur, but honestly, I was disappointed.It is situated on JLN Marg (Malviya Nagar) near the airport and near another happening place, the GT Mall.The mall has 2-level basement parking and there are adequate number of parking personnel to aid you in parking the car.The ground and first floor of the mall has showrooms of various brands like Zara and Marks and Spencer, to name a few.There is also a market on the middle floor where we can buy footwear, clothes, decoration items (we bought a few keychains and a wind-chime) and mobile accessories at reasonable rates. The top floor has a section called Dubai Bazar where there are numerous shops selling garments, watches, fashion accessories, mobile accessories, bluetooth speakers, bluetooth headphones and other electronic items.The part of the mall we loved was the food court. It has food options for every palate; veg, non-veg, Indian, Punjabi, Italian... you name it.We had our lunch at Yellow Chilli restaurant. The food was exceptionally good and authentic punjabi taste. The complimentary pan was a delight.This mall is best for people who wish to spend a few hours shopping for first-copy electronics items and cheap home decoration items. Food lovers will not go anywhere else, considering the various options available.

Name: Shruthi P
Title: Average place
Review: Was told it's the best mall in Jaipur. . But turned out to be below expectations when compared to malls in other places like Bengaluru. Not that many shops and very little to choose from other than Marks and Spencer. The air conditioning was close to non existing and the escalators especially the ones going up weren't functioning. Food court ..OK I'd say. Better restaurants could be tried at the same price. Could be avoided unless you have nothing else to do .

Name: zorabeekhan59
Title: visited this amazing park with myraid if shopping brands
Review: met sheraz khan. lazeez foods had real value for money...amazing taste of chicken paratas and just 520 rupees...highlight of our meals in jaipur

Name: bhopalsrc
Title: Better than many international malls
Review: Visited this attraction but really highly impressed. Very well maintained though still under construction at some places. Food court is impressive and so is Dubai bazar in it. Many attractions for kids too, massage chairs and you name it and it has it. Must visit to relax from the scorching heat outside.

Name: DDR1234
Title: Good Shopping!
Review: Very nice mall with chandeliers lining the roofs! Great brand name shops. Modern building, also nice restaurants.

Name: Bikram999
Title: Jaipur View
Review: This place is very nice. Its a Big Mall in Jaipur as well as the IT companies are there.Its Out side view looks like Dubai Style. Every one take photos.

Name: appyfizzkmn
Title: great experiance
Review: World trade park is the biggest mall i ever visited .such a nice place for branded cloths shopping ,good fast food  , jewelry shopping and many more.

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: wtp
Review: its in malviya nagar on jln marg has cinepolis an shoppers stop enjoy movie an shopping have good pix  with friends

Name: shiza784
Title: New year dinner
Review: Awesum mall.. One d best mall I had ever visited.. Superb location.. High class ambience.. Decorative  n creative stores.. Well defined architecture.. Heart of d city.. Amazing food court.. Lits of variety 2 eat wid creatively theamed backdrops.. Best for taking pictures as well..

Name: Sandeep Yadav
Title: Excellent mall
Review: It's near by my home at jaipur and visited very often for the shopping, food, movie and many more. It's very nice especially the structure of the mall give us more attraction.

Name: umangtibrewala
Title: Perfect shopping destination
Review: A great place for shopping. Very well designed..located close to the airport and well connected to the city..definitely a shopper‚Äôs paradise.

Name: Adnan_Chowdhury67
Title: Shah Rukh khan's mall
Review: Well, that's what we were told. By the way, those who are unfamiliar with SRK, he is one of India's biggest actors.Anyway, regardless of SRK's connection or not, the mall is worth a visit.Our hotel was close by and so we decided to give it a visit.First, it's huge. It has some famous brand names like M&S, etc. We went to the food court and had breakfast at a South Indian restaurant. Very inexpensive. But there was a lot of other variety so you won't go hungry. We bought perfumes and attars at the Dubai Gold Souk and got some great deals. Worth a visit if you are in Jaipur.

Name: Leena K
Title: Indeed the Biggest and the Best!
Review: During our 2 nights short stay at Jaipur, we spent 1 whole day at this mall. With a baby in hand and the real hot weather, it gets difficult to enjoy the beauty of Jaipur which lies in all its forts and architectural marvels. This mall really satisfied our thirst of having fun in a real hot weather.You will find most swanky brands at the ground level, and most local favorites from level 2 onwards. I personally didn't expect to pay only Rs. 250 for a pair of sandals that i bought from a small shop at level 2, and a non-branded UV protected sunglasses at only Rs. 100. This was however possible only with a committed bargain with the shopkeepers ;-)The food court was massive, and had stalls of almost all kinds of food ranging from western to traditional Rajasthani cuisines. We had a Rajasthani Thali at around Rs.600 and it was more than enough for 2 adults.For a foodie like me, a whole day can be spent here to relish various kinds of world over cuisines. A MUST visit for all travelers and localites.

Name: Kunal_Bhowmick
Title: Largest Mall of Jaipur...üòÄüòÄ
Review: This is the largest mall in Jaipur...It is spread up in eleven floors...This mall opened in 2012 and is located at Malviya nagar...There is a four screen plex maintained by Cinepolis...All the floors have different themes a part of different countries...The food court is something to watch out for...There are many options to choose from...Also there is an outlet of Barcelo's at WTP...üçóüçó

Name: Vikki Agarwal
Title: Best mall in Jaipur
Review: Nice place for visiting...The entrance of mall is like you are in western country, very clean and decorated. Good colourful fountains installed on the entrance and look especially a clock hanged on the road side feels like western city. Good building architecture and elevation. i liked the Food Court especially. its one of the best in Rajasthan.

Name: Sanjay S
Title: Awesome ambience but High pricing.
Review: WTP has become a brand among the youngsters in Jaipur. It has become a tourist destination which is good in terms of tourism. Needs to work on the pricing & the fixed rates which is very high. Otherwise all good..

Name: maninderkaur
Title: One of the best Mall in jaipur
Review: Its a nice place to hangout, consist of variety of major brands outlets.So many Dining options are available in Food court.

Name: JainManoJ
Title: One of Major attraction of Jaipur.
Review: It is a good place to visit to World Trade park ( Basically a Large Mall) at Jaipur , having Food Court , Multiplex , Traditional Market , specially main attraction of DUBAI BAZAAR. You will enjoy. You may also go to G T Bazaar for purchasing and enjoy with Food Corners , which is very close to it.

Name: BeowulfReviews
Title: Average
Review: Barcelos was the first restaurant that we went to when I was in Jaipur. My Manager was very vocal about this place as he liked the food earlier when he was in India. It is in the WTP which is the happening mall in Malviya Nagar.We ordered very light as we had a heavy breakfast which was for almost all of us. We had Virgin Mojito, Falafel Wrap, Veg Pita Wrap and Veg Trinchado, Stir Fry Vegetables and Fattoush Salad. We quite liked the dishes that we ordered. The last dish that my Manager ordered pretty much ruined for him and us as well. This is supposed to be their Signature Non Vegetarian Dish.The food was fine but what irked us and my Manager the most was the bad Service. They took a lot of time to serve him a dish and which turned out to be undercooked. This could have been easily avoided. Overall i would say that it's not that a bad place. It's got the nice ambience and lighting. Comfortable seating. The service is too bad and the management in not that attentive either. Hope they will work on it.

Name: zahrashakeri1370
Title: Nice and big!
Review: We went there two times and ate lunch and shop. the foods were delicious specially the pizza. there is a bazaar which is called Dubai bazaar where you can buy many things, shirts, dress, jewelry, souvenir, ... but don't expect a very good quality there.

Name: PK Das
Title: Biggest Mall of Rajasthan
Review: Probably the biggest Mall in the state. The huge facade gives impression of Commercial/Office building type not at all a Mall.The mall hosts many outlets of brands local & international brands. The inter connectivity of the mall is little awkward. You can travel from one part to other through top floor food court area only  not convenient at all.Similarly food court also has wide spread of restaurants

Name: Mannat2104
Title: Best mall in Rajasthan
Review: This is one of the best malls in India. Having various mid level to high brands outlets & international cinema chain(Cinepolis) along with various local,national & international f & b outlets it is undoubtedly the most crowded & best mall in The heritage state of Rajasthan.

Name: Prabir D
Title: Nice
Review: Its a good mall the interior and exterior is very good. You can find every international brand here. It is a good place to hang out. And offcource the only kfc outlet in jaipur is here in this mall. U will like to shop here. Its a enique shop .

Name: Moiz H
Title: Traditional and Modern
Review: It's a huge mall, basically there are two buildings of the mall which looks excatly the same from the exterior but the interior is completely different. From inside one building is made on traditional pattern and other one is on modern theme. You can find almost all top leading brands here, a big food court and theater also. Must visit if you are a mall lover.

Name: Niteshjain1984
Title: Nice big and huge mall
Review: Well recent travel to Jaipur n had visited this mall it beautiful nice clean good for shopping üõí to every of it kind expensive and cheap. Both Food court is good enough all it missing it kid play zone and entertainment for kids Very less amount of games for kids other mall whet i visited had more n better play zone like pink square mall Well world trade park is well nice clean and maintained yet and some of it floor have not yet started I think should open it fast or if it get older thing now a days replaced very soon ...

Name: sravindra1
Title: Nice mall
Review: World trade park is one of the best Mall in Jaipur. The external look and internal look is grand. Food court is good and well maintained. Numerous brand of shops are available.Great place.

Name: TravelDiaries_Pulkit
Title: Great mall !
Review: This mall will give you a different experience of shopping. They have a market area which is similar to the market in Dubai - shops are small and you get almost everything here. Items which you would typically not get in India easily can be found at this market - fruits, spices, etc. They have a good food court area as well which I recommend but it is crowded mostly.

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: Good Archtect
Review: This is a newly built mall in Jaipur on Jawahar Lal Nehru Marg near Gourav Towers shopping complex. A multiplex cinema, eating stalls, branded apparels, Jewelry shops, Mega stores have been opened here. An easy time pass along with utilizing your holiday. The building has been impressively designed. Enter after security check. Ample parking space is available.

Name: acerockolla
Title: Escape The Heat, Enjoy The Shopping & Food Hall
Review: Our visit to Jaipur had been a major culture shock. Being based in the old city area, we were confronted with noise, unbearable heat and some very bad smells! We headed for some civilization and we found it in this stunning modern building and it's welcoming air conditioned atmosphere. A good selection of shops and a fabulous food hall with a few really good options. It also has a multi screen cinema. Oh and also this place has some lovely clean restrooms.

Name: nilima r
Title: Mall  or street shops ?
Review: The mall has marvellous architecture but it is not a mall properly it has street shops  and very dull environment .Being from delhi I found the mall for shopping pathetic but architecture is amazing .

Name: Akshay Kumar G
Title: Feels like you are abroad
Review: Must visit for people who say they have seen the best of malls in India. Come see the architecture and u will be stunned.

Name: Mochilero22
Title: Nice Mall!
Review: Great mall - lots of the usual shops and a great food court.  We had lunch in a woderful Indian cuisine place! Wonderful!

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Beautiful mall
Review: A place  for visit  as this is very special for Jaipur city, Wonderful place well maintained.Good for shopping and kids.Has parking and  fast food is also good

Name: shanupce137
Title: Attraction of Jaipur
Review: I went to WTP with my friend to see Baahubali 2 at Inox. That was first time I saw it. What a place it was, Just Amazing. Many branded showrooms and food stalls are there.

Name: Shubhamk
Title: Loved it.
Review: Well, this place for starters is really beautiful, i mean for the first time ypu see it, it's obviously gonna catch your eye. The towers look just amazing. Now that aside the place is basically a mall, yup a mall where you can buy stuff, eat, play games or watch movies basically spend a day pretty well. The place has a number of stores for shopping which includes a number of big brands like Casio, Vivo, Wrangler, Pepe jeans etc. The cineplex is in contract with Cinepolis and well obviously you have the food court. The food is awesome but at times a litte expensive. The minimum budget for two people to eat satisfactorily is around 500-750 rs. Next time i go I'll sure to add some photos too. Till then "Be Advised to Enjoy The Life" .

Name: Psingh1409
Title: Good place for shopping, food and movies.
Review: We have shifted from Mumbai for job opportunity since a year and we have been missing the Mumbai's crowded places, variety of food, shopping and games for kids. World Trade park was suggested to us by a friend and was indeed a great place to visit in Jaipur. You almost get everything here. From Rajasthani handcrafted stuff to variety of Indian and International food, games for kids, movies and more. A must visit if you are in Jaipur.

Name: Sreyoshi111
Title: Great experience  with thepinkcityholidays travels
Review: The ride was good.Vikas Uncle drove us safely and it was a good and safe journey.The pink city holidays' service was great.Would look forward to travel with them again.

Name: TheKnight2014
Title: Very beautiful mall with a huge shopping & eating places inside
Review: This is a very beautiful mall with a huge shopping & eating places inside. Food court is amazingly big & elaborated. One can also enjoy the fabulous light & sound show while eating.

Name: Anuj Garg
Title: Half Of the Mall is Under Construction
Review: I visited it on Aug - 2017. It's a Good Mall but Almost half the Mall was Under Construction. Maybe Someday in the Future it might become Better but Right now there aren't many Shops to Surf around at this Time. Not Sure How google and TripAdvisor is Saying its the best Mall in Jaipur.

Name: w0w007
Title: Modern but learning
Review: Visited recently, lots of latest stores and world class amenities which are destroyed by blaring music which is so annoying that you are forced to leave. Compare all elite malls worldwide, nice and quiet, if you wish to play music make it soft and easy, take care that there are young children or old people who get disturbed. Why play loud music to satisfy your personal needs????. Check the malls in Delhi and compare, need I say more

Name: jaybulani
Title: Great place for leisure time !!
Review: Dubai Bazar was absolute. Food court having world class interior and serves different cuisines. Overall it was memorable.

Name: Vaibhav
Title: Best mall in rajasthan
Review: WTP is the best mall in jaipur as well as in rajasthan. It is one of the biggest mall in India as well. It has great food court, ‚òÆÔ∏è Ambience and almost every brand of clothing which you can find in jaipur. A marvel to look and one must visit if in jaipur

Name: YouTuber
Title: Amazing shopping experience...
Review: WTP or world trade park is one of the premium shopping malls of jaipur I had a chance to visit last Sunday, very well designed and neat and clean it is in the heart of the city and presents a beautiful view. all the facilities are available here including food, fun and shopping.Good Experience.Must visit.

Name: Arun Aggarwal
Title: Must Visit Happening Place in Jaipur
Review: If you are going Jaipur for the First Time or Going after few years diffrence then you might be surprised to see this magnificient structure called World Trade Park a shopping mall cum picnic spot find all big retail joints here with happening multi screen cinepolis with multi brand food court and place to hang around for hours here . lot of activities for kids as well as youngsters any time of the day its open and in evening colorful fountains add the beauty of the place visit once loved for ever

Name: Sangram Singh Rathore
Title: Trip to Rushirani village
Review: Fabulous trip to this historical place of Rajasthan. Visited the famous Lord Shiva temple which changes its color twice in a day, an awesome experience.

Name: Daan
Title: Rural life with history!
Review: We were lucky enough to visit Rusirani village and get an idea of life in a Hindu village. Giri was an excellent and very welcoming guide that took an obvious pride in his history. We had an excellent lunch, got to interact with the curious and open family that hosted us and got a very positive feeling about this community project. It was interesting to develop a deeper understanding of the contrasts that exist on our globe. I highly recommend this experience and would rate it as one of the highlights of our first-time India trip.

Name: jeffpeters
Title: A great way to get off the beaten track and do some good
Review: If you're looking for something different then this is for you.  From my first chats with Giri I knew he was going to look after me.  He organised my travel from Jaipur, my visit to the village and then my onward travel to Agra.   The drive was long and the roads a little bumpy (but not really that bad), but by the end of the day I had had a wonderful experience that will live with me for a long time.I believe some or all of the money goes to help fund a school in the village so even better.  Thanks Giri for a wonderful day.

Name: Giedre R
Title: Favorite experience, but please reconsider transportation
Review: We loved our day trip to Rusirani. We learned more about Rajasthan rural area, people and nature. We had a delicious lunch and had a pleasant relaxing stay. I do recommend if you are in the  area. One thing I would have done differently is to use our tour company car to drive to the mountain road and then reach the village in the provided Jeep. We road Jeep from Jaipur (4 hours) and it was not safe and uncomfortable. I would not advise to do that. Ask your driver to drive you to the closest meeting point near village and asked to be picked up after you are done.

Name: Claud
Title: Brilliant stay in wonderful rural village
Review: This was one of our favourite parts of our trip to India. Staying with local families, eating amazing home cooked food and watching village life go back. A unique chance to learn more about India's rural communities, ask questions and have interesting chats with lovely Gupi, our guide and understand village life and traditions. A must do if you're visiting Rajasthan.Thanks you!

Name: BBW150
Title: Real India Off the Beaten Track!
Review: We visited Rusi Rani on a tour three years ago -- on our recent trip to India with friends, we made sure to include a second visit for our group! We love the experience of sitting and visiting with people of the area, sharing a meal, visiting the ancient Hindu ruins and also seeing the sights on the way to the village. We made a stop at a Hindu holy site built around baths and also in the middle of a little village for chai tea on our way to Rusi Rani. Our group of 10 traveled in two jeeps, one open air and one closed. I will say that the roads are awfully bumpy and it is an all-day trip from Jaipur. Giri, who we met on our previous trip, was also our guide for this trip and he is so knowledgeable and speaks excellent English. We were pleased to notice improvements in the village infrastructure -- restrooms with running water and solar panels -- that had been added since our last trip. Giri said that the money received from the tours (usually one a week) was being used for girls' education and village infrastructure. The villagers were very friendly, especially the children. You might want to think about bringing some bubbles, markers & paper or other small activities to play with the kids -- they enjoyed my pathetic attempts at drawing animals! I would highly recommend this tour if you are on the "Golden Triangle" tour and want a day away from touristy sites and vendors and also want to improve education for girls at the same time.

Name: danielabedandview
Title: The real Rajasthan. Off the beaten track: wonderful experience Rusirani Village
Review: Rusirani is a traditional village, more than 2000 years old.  A place situated around 130 km. from Jaipur, so put it in your itinerary if you are travelling from Jaipur to Agra and you will have a different, more real experience over this incledible country. Rusirani is simplicity, there is no use of money in the village, there is no proper supply of electricity , network connection and transportation. I was really looking for a place like this, when I was building my itinerary in Rajasthan, Agra and Delhi and now that I have been there for a day with my husband and our 10 years old daughter, I feel that this experience has been the most fullfilling of the entire trip. Our wonderful guide, Mr. Girdhari (Giri), that I contacted at rusirani.village@gmail.com, had told me: this is not a touristy experience, so I don't promise anything, nobody is going to do anything special or fake for you. It was true, nothing was done to sell us a carpet or a juwel, but the people that we met had a lot to give, they warmed our hearts with their pure smiles and our communication went beyond the difficulty of understanding each other!We paid some money, yes, but this money is for the jeep transportation, for the guided tour of the ancient temple and ruins and..the beautiful thing is that most of this money is for a great cause: for the solar panels that they are installing and for the family of a young girl of the village, so she can go to school. In Rusirani children can only study until 14 years old and most of the times girls would quit school instead of going to study in the cities around, unless supported by people like us. The family (that changes every time) prepares your lunch and together with the rest of the village, offers you what they have: simplicity and love. Our 10 years old daughter loved the experience too! THANK YOU MR. GIRI!!!

Name: Rusirani_villagers
Title: The Best Hospitality In A Beautiful Place
Review:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for rating us. Your motivational words encourage us to provide a better experience for our upcoming guests.

Regards.

Giri

Name: Vivienne C
Title: people here treat you like a family.
Review:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for rating us. Your motivational words encourage us to provide a better experience for our upcoming guests.

Regards.

Giri

Name: Sarthak J
Title: A look back in time.
Review: We loved our overnight stay and days in Rusirani Village. We met Girdhari at Abhaneri step-well and went via jeep to the Village where we received a friendly welcome from Raju and the group of families living in her area. We had 4 meals during our stay, all were local recipes, filling and delicious. Our itinerary was nicely filled, allowing us to spend time with the community in the beautiful quiet countryside, soaking it all in. We watched the sunset from the fort walls with three of the local girls and that evening talked with the locals around the fire pit. Dancing and playing with the children is a memory I cherish. The next day was lovely as we had gotten to know the family more and they kindly showed me the views from the rooftops before picking berries and coriander in the fields. After a hearty breakfast we walked the local landscape, exploring few of the 352 beautiful heritage sites of Rusirani Village with Girdhari before lunch then a drop off in Jaipur. It was the hospitality of Raju and her family and Girdhari and the company of Chandni and the villagers that made our experience so happy and special. Plus the quiet nature of the village and clean rooms meant that it was the best night sleep we had our whole trip! Arrangements were easy as we got quick replies and Girdhari‚Äôs easy going nature filled us with confidence. It was clear to see that the money was going to a good place. Thanks again to Raju and her family for a brilliant stay.

Name: Glenn M
Review: Rusirani Village - 2000+ years old, this village take you back to the ancient time. A place situated around 130 km. from Jaipur, near Sariska National park. Here in this village there is no proper supply of electricity , network connection and  transportation. People here cultivate crops like wheat, bajra, etc. To meet their daily requirements and an NGO name INSPIRE is helping the village by educating the kids, giving money to the village through tourism and in the year 2011 this NGO helped rusirani by providing small solar panels and contributing towards the development.Thanks to Girdhari bhaiya and rusirani village poeple to make a greatful day and giving us the best ever food for lunch.

I visited the village as part of a small photographic group and saw the marvelous 2000 year old temples that are being preserved for future generations and also spent several hours visiting one of the family compounds where, as a photographer, you can photograph the local people as they go about their daily tasks that have barely changed as the outside world has modernized. The family prepares a lunch from locally grown produce as part of the package and were happy to pose for photos when asked. The fees charged for the visit are used to enhance the community so it is a great way to contribute to the village whilst being able to take amazing photographs. The visit to the village takes around 1.5 hours in the back of a jeep from the nearest large town and there is no cellphone coverage in the village or surrounds.

Name: Umang A
Title: Roadies...
Review: If you love to travel to old villages, live with them,know their culture... This is the place... They have ensure their 2500 old culture is safegaurded years after years...

Name: Mohan Y
Title: Awesome four hours with villagers
Review: We had an amazing time. With my two other friends I liked the cultural part of the visit. We enjoyed the local homemade lunch and the time we spent with local school kids. The old ( very old) ancient remains also worth a visit. I liked the local community very much.

Name: sharon D
Title: Hi Light of our Golden Triangle Tour
Review: Our trip to this small farming village was an enjoyable day trip ( couple of hours four wheeling in the back of a jeep) from Jaipur and away from the noise and pollution. We enjoyed the gracious hospitality of a village family who fed us and shared their farming home and children with us.  We stopped at a village school,  helped distribute school supplies and the fun and laughter was reciprocal.  Our guide Giri was very knowledgeable and accommodating and was a great translator and mediator between us and the village people and families.  His love for the region and the culture was very evident and he was more than willing to share his own story with you which we found very inspiring. And the best thing is knowing your visit assists the village girls in obtaining higher education.  It really is a win win.  We are so glad we took a day out of our golden triangle tour to visit this village. We agree 100% with the other reviewers- it was a beautiful experience.   You won't regret a day with the lovely people of Rusirani Village.

Name: Milanovic
Title: Rusirani & Sariska national park
Review: Me and my friend went here in july (don't worry about the rain season) and it was amazing. We met the locals, visited the village that was completely surrounded by nature, and afterwards we went for a trip into Sariska National Park. The host family was heartwarming and welcoming. We brought some Belgian cookies (they seemed to like it) and dipped it in chai tea.The money is well spent on girls education, and the guide Girdhari is a very pleasant man.Absolutely a must for everyone!

Name: Suruchi J
Title: A Beautiful Must Have Visit / Experience Rusirani Village!
Review: Rusirani Ka VillageRusirani village is about 5000 or more years old village near Alwar ( 35 KM approx.), Abhaneri step wells, Bhangarh fort, and Jaipur ( 130 KM approx.).You can club a visit to any of these places (preferably only one), while also visiting the hill top Rusirani village. The village is literally on a hilltop and it is best to take a jeep / other vehicles ( if you plan to go on your own) that have good ground clearance.I have been personally wanting to visit the place since the last 2 years. I first heard about them 2 years ago on Tripadvisor and every time I used to mention their name to anyone, no one knew about them yet there was a village somewhere in Rajasthan that everyone warmly talked about on Tripadvisor. This last weekend, the 8th and 9th July, I decided to visit it (Full Moon). I called up the number I had with me of Mr. Girdari ji ( Giri) and he told me that of course, he remembers talking to me earlier ( many months ago). I had already spoken to him a couple of times now and he had already me an email with all the details of the visit. Giri has an excellent attitude of accommodating visitors' needs. Like in my case, I wished to go on those dates and he managed those days for me. Rusirani village folks are very nice, sweet, welcoming, caring and they will do everything to make you comfortable. I remember mentioning about lemon when I was feeling not so good, and next day one of the village bhaiya got desi lemons... :) I halted their overnight and talked with the ladies until midnight, enjoyed biddi ( very light ones because of the company of them) and slept in a charpai under the sky. I danced with the kids, took a shower under the hand pump, saw the real village life and eat the delicious humble food. Rusirani village is a complete experience in itself. I haven't yet even started talking about its history, temples, forts, and architectural places around the village. There is Neelkhant Mahadev Mandir ( temple), fort ( about 8-9 KM from the village), and other structures worth exploring.Rusirani village started being called as Rusi rani because once a queen ( Rani) got upset with her husband and she came to this village. After spending two months, the raja ( king) asked her to come back but she decided to stay in the village itself. Her husband made the palace for her in the village, made the village gate that you would see upon entering the village and other structures too. If you like to visit Rusirani village, I would suggest ( as a group or solo), to speak with Giri ( 097845 41515 | 09829900120) and tell him about your date of visit. To ensure right sustainability and proper experience of every visitor, they plan the visits. If you are looking for an Indian paid companion during your India travel, then Giri is one of the best persons too. He listens well and he is a decent person so ask him and he would be more than happy to translate conversions, details, add value to your India visit.

Name: SyibliFakih
Title: Great experience again
Review: Another great evening with the people here. Great place to have a rest and escape from the busy life of the cities in Jaipur. If you are in Jaipur do visit this place. Make sure you contact them early since its not a tourist spot and not many people know this place even for local people in jaipur. Thank you for your hospitality, continue your great work on developing this village in the right way not spoiled by the tourism and money.

Name: Kathyandfamily365
Title: A must do experience whilst in India
Review: Our family selected this activity so that our teenage children could experience farm life in India. We had seen the bustle of the cities and wanted to see how many of the India people live. We were not disappointed. The village is in a fairly remote location so life there is still surprisingly simple.  We traveled over bumpy terrain to a small village on the side of a hill. We were greeted by beaming faces and shy children peering around their mother's leg to see us. We felt so welcomed. We were invited to sit in a raised mud sleeping area and offered fresh tea. The villagers don't speak English but our guide translated back and forth for us. The village is home to an extended family of about 100, but when we first arrived only the young children, women and an elderly man were home. The children were fascinated by our digital camera and delighted in seeing their image on the screen. We enjoyed a traditional lunch and given gifts from the village. We also explored the village with its school and temples. Very little money is used in the village, only for petrol for a tractor and for clothing. Everything else is bartered for.By visiting Rusirani village some of the cost goes to the families. In exchange the families must send their girls to school and support them.Without this type of program most rural girls would not attend school.Our visit to the village has left an amazing impression on all of us. I recommend a visit to Rusirani Village to connect with the rural people of India and to learn what is truly important.

Name: Miklos F
Title: Glipse of traditional village life
Review: A traditional Indian village which has retained the customs of many many generations. No electricity, no TV, planting crops, herding animals and close family ties.People are friendly yet they continue their traditional routines. You get a view of the real life of the villagers. You can talk with them and just as you are curious about their traditions they are curious about yours. Thus a real exchange. Only one smalll group is accepted each day and each group visits a different fanily  so there is no possibility of Rusi rani becoming a tourist trap. As the vast majority of Indians still live in the  vllages I found it really insightful to learn about their daily life. Giri our guide is Universty educated and speaks English very well. He facilitates rhe echanges with the villagersAs a bonus the village is located on the grounds of an ancient civilization possibly over 2000 years old with a still funtioning Hindu temple ( great carvings), a ruined Jain temple and the remnants of an old fort built about 600 years ago. A very worthwhile visit which is in stark contrast to the raging tide of humanity that you see in the cities. You will get a more balanced view of India and its many faceted civilization

Name: Margaret B.
Title: Inspirational and Educational Experience
Review: The journey to the village was simply amazing...a jeep ride up the side of a mountain on a one-lane rough rock road!  Meeting the villagers and interacting with them was inspiring. It was humbling to meet them...to learn that their daily lives consist of working to just sustain themselves yet they are smiling and happy and gracious.  We were offered lunch and tea. We also toured ruins of a past civilization. This is not a tourist trap and not your typical Indian village visit...it is unique and definitely worth your time to take a detour to visit.

Name: garlandcasgrain
Title: got a new experience
Review: Came here with our guide as I always wanted to experience Indian village life. This village is quite close to Jaipur and the best delight was the food and the tea, will there is no comparison between Indian and European tea, Indian one is sweet milk, but tasty.Stayed here do 2 hours and its good to meet some local as you can learn a lot about a nation pride from villagers. So do visit rusirani village when you are in pink city

Name: Anjalichandra
Title: A Perfect village
Review: Though I have been first time in any village but I had such a nice experience their . The peaceful environment, the culture and the people all were so nice that I felt really great being their. If anyone wants to visit any peaceful place then he/she must visit RusiRani village at least once.

Name: AvineshPVS
Title: Awesome getaway!!
Review: A perfect place to escape the city life and go live the simple village life with no traffic noise and phone signals. Russirani village is located on a hilltop surrounded by Aravali mountains. It is roughly 100km from Jaipur which comes before Alwar. It is popularly known for its Abhaneri step well (8th century marvel) and 10th century Harshat Mata Temple. The village was named after the queen of Alwar. I found this place here. I was quite surprised to see mostly 5 star reviews for any organisation. I was quite curious and read the reviews. I instantly liked it because of two reasons: 1) The money they collected from the guests was used to sponsor a girl child‚Äôs education in the village 2) I was quite curious how they were conducting village tourism.The road to the village is easily located in the map but the road isn‚Äôt that great. The road from Jaipur to Dausa (NH11) is really nice after that the state highway is quite bumpy for 30km. The hospitality of the villagers was really nice. We had some interesting debates about tattoos, child marriage, village life, education etc. After an awesome lunch we went to an dilapidated fort. An awesome adventure: hiking to the fort and jumping across the fort walls to enter it. The fort seems to be of the historical importance. Strange that it has been left in ruins. The panoramic view from the top of the fort is just amazing. I have never seen a fort surrounded by mountains with a terrific view. Overall sleeping under the stars and enjoying the peaceful village life was the best part of the stay. Thanks Mr. Bhagirath and villagers for an awesome hospitality.

Name: strouthos
Title: Step back in time 200-300 years.
Review: One of the best experiences we've had in India. Rusirani is an eyeopening trip back in time to a few centuries ago. There is no running water, no electricity, no modern amenities. Sheltered from the modern world, most people have lived here their entire lives. It's amazing to watch them interact, go about their daily tasks, tend to their animals, cook, hang out etc. We were invited to lunch that was cooked over a fire, basically the same way our grandparent's grandparents did ages ago. The villagers were very warm and welcoming. They showed a lot of interest in us as we did in them. Our guide (born and raised in the village) was one of the very few with a college education, and did an incredible job explaining and translating everything.I highly recommend a visit - one of the highlights of our trip to India. It's also for a good cause. They use the proceeds as a community to help children get an educationPut this on your itinerary. You will not regret it. An experience that will last a lifetime.

Name: SyibliFakih
Title: PEACEFUL & BEAUTIFUL
Review: If you feel that India is to busy, go here and feel the relaxed, calm environment of Rusirani village. Although the road here is a bit tough, but we really enjoy our trip there.

Name: msydes
Title: Absolutely incredible - can't recommend it highly enough
Review: The village tour was honestly the best experience my wife and I had the entire time we were in India. The people were lovely, showing us their amazing village and sharing some excellent food.I truly wish I have a chance to return in a few years. The people were kind, the sights were incredible, and the village was fascinating. 10/10

Name: Heiko S
Title: Amazing Experience - the real India!
Review: I did read about the Rusirani Village on Tripadvisor and actually this was the main thing I wanted to see when travelling around Jaipur. A big thank you to Girdhari, who did support with translation in the village and did lead me around. I enjoyed especially the time in the school (to interact and play with the children there), as well as the time we spent at a local family's place. It was a wonderful and unique experience for me. Can definately recommend.

Name: klorigan
Title: Awesome experience with the kids!
Review: On the way from Agra to Jaipur, we stopped about 2/3rds of the way to go on this village tour - a small, cooperatively-run set of communities in the hills. They said that the don't have many families, so especially appreciated seeing us with our 11 and 13 year old sons. Part of the tour fee sponsors girls continuing their schooling past 8th grade, a no-brainer for this US teacher. The 30 min jeep ride from the junction point is where the adventure begins (and helps explain why the villagers don't easily/frequently leave). Guests' arrival is always a surprise to a particular community within the larger village bc the organizer, who grew up there, wants it to be a normal day, with whatever happens to be going on. We had some time to chat, asking one another about our daily lives (mostly with the men and kids bc the women were cooking a meal for us). Then we got to watch the chapati-making (and attempt to roll out some ourselves -- we failed and laughed a lot in the process). Our sons connected first with the five year old local kids by sharing names, goofy faces and playing hand clapping games. It broke the timidity we were all experiencing. I highly recommend this trip as a way to connect with people outside of the cities.

Name: drl_smit-may
Title: Traveling 2000 years back into history
Review: If you really want to do something special while visiting Jaipur this is a must. You need all day in order to get there over back country roads as well as have enough time to interact with the village people. There is a fabulous 2000-year-old temple in the village and the people are wonderful. They have been living the same way without electricity or running water for more than one thousand years. They took us in their homes and treated us like family.we had a wonderful opportunity at lunch to interact with all of the family members. I was even able to smoke a hookah with homemade tobacco.The translator assured that all our questions were answered. It was a truly enriching experience. One of our best cultural experiences in India.an absolute must for someone interested the real India.

Name: SandraRodriguesBR
Title: The Best of Jaipur
Review: Tired of busy Jaipur with the horns, the traffic jams, the pushing sellers and old forts? Treat yourself with a day to a rural visit and experience the true hospitality of the people of Rusirani village. Yes you can go by yourself and save a couple of bucks, but no, it will by far not be as rich as it can be. I strongly suggest you contact two social entrepreneurs from the region and let them take you by the hand and help the process of interaction in the local tribal language and their good English. While these youngsters make a living out of it, they do have this commitment of seeing to it the community benefit. One visit a day, with maximum people, to preserve the authenticity and  avoid disturbing the daily life too much. Their focal point is girls education, one of the selection criteria of your host family.They will take you for a full day (or more) and will give you that kind of memory that every time you think about it provokes this peaceful inward smile for the rest of your life. See this beautiful valley with an ancient temple and archaeological sites, irrigated wheat, mustard, or maize. Smell it, listen to the sounds. Feel the genuine and unconditional joy of the children, the diminishing shyness of the women and hesitant curiosity of the village elders. Do bring some photos on your phone or tablet so you can share about your family and your land if asked by the villagers. Special care is taken to assure food is safe so no Delhi Belly to be expected. Treat yourself to this experience after visiting city after city. You will love it, your teenage children will love it. And bring some additional money as in the end it will be hard to resist to donate something extra to this community. You can contact Baghirath or Girdhari by phone +919784541515 or rusirani.village@gmail.com

Name: rakeDelhi
Title: traditional Village to be seen
Review: Situated in between Agra & Jaipur a village expressing the real traditional India,the school ,the small market ,i hope the Govt. gives it some extra attention and certainly can be a great spot for all

Name: Hilda A
Title: A must! - Warm welcome with real village hospitality
Review: I read about the village on Tripadvisor and decided to check it out by myself, since I wanted to have a more authentic experience watching life in the countryside of India.  I can say that I am very grateful I did!  Being a lone woman traveler, I was always worried about my safety, but as soon as I got picked up at my guest house in Jaipur, I could see that I was in good hands.  The driver/guide, Ghirdari was extremely courteous, respectful and friendly, and had a lot of information to share.  We had a nice chat during the 2-3 hour drive up in the hills, and he kindly stopped at interesting places, which allowed me to take wonderful pictures.  The village itself was sparsely populated and very basic, yet refreshing to see after all the hustle and bustle in Jaipur, and the villagers were quite interested to talk and socialize with their new visitor.  Communication was a little difficult at times, but Ghirdari helped out translating, and even without his help, it was not very hard to get a point across.  He showed me around one family's household and surrounding areas of the village, including a temple and some ruins.  Some hired workers with heavy machinery were trying to bore a new well for the village when I arrived, unfortunately without success that day.  After a good home-made meal at one of the families' homes with THE BEST sweet mawa (milk solids) I have ever tasted, I went for a walk with the village women through the fields, and ended up at a larger gathering at the local school. Even though these people had just met me and we were not able to speak a common language, they were quick to invite me to sit down and share their food once again. I found their hospitality quite warm and pleasant.  After the visit, Ghirdari was ready to drop me back in Jaipur late that afternoon, and went out of his way to drive me to the local market when I told him I was looking forward to see it (unfortunately, it was already closed, but I appreciated his efforts), and to help me buy a replacement for my broken cell phone.  I arrived safely in Jaipur that evening.  All in all, I would say if you are looking to see something different and REAL, how other people live day by day in a remote place, go ahead and visit this village.  Do not go if you are looking to have a touristy experience or expect the people to do something special for you (dance, presentation, etc.).  This is just for you to get a glimpse of rural life in this part of the world.  I was particularly glad to see that the organizers (who are members of the village themselves) did not seek to commercialize the village experience, and tried to keep it as authentic as it gets, the goal being to collect all the earnings towards a local fund to improve education of the village's young girls. A good cause indeed!Tips: Wear a hat and sunscreen if you visit during spring/summer. Bring your own toilet paper/hand sanitizer as well, as there are no western toilet facilities. If you wish to bring something for the villagers, do not give clothes or toys, or the like, as the organizers do not wish to create material expectations in the villagers/families from every visitor they have (which I found to be great).  If you must, take school supplies or books that can go to the school and be shared by all the children.

Name: WorldWidePlayer
Title: Interesting Village Life
Review: I've traveled to several villages in my life, but I found this Village to be very organized! By my experiences, this means it is becoming commercialized. By all means, as of now, this is still a meaningful Village to experience. A few things that I found out: (1) I thought it was no communication in the mountains (Found Mr. Bhagirath using his phone frequently) (2) The guide (Bhagirath) is a well educated young man, but he is lying about being from this Village. He has his Business Degree and is making money from these tours... Don't get me wrong, he has it well organized, but why lie? Mr. Bhagirath suggests to not leave money in the Village, however, we did! We gave it to the family that cooked for us, it's only right. We gave them the food and they had no idea what it was (US Money), then I quickly let them know the Rupree currency amount. I spoke with Mr. Bhagirath about why not telling visitors that he isn't from there, but declined comment. Enough about Mr. Bhagirath, the Village is a must if you are looking for a Village that is kind of cut off from the conventional Indian Societies. The whole has a lot of Peacocks and Black Faced Monkeys to see along with historical monuments! The kids and families are fantastic! Very nice and inquisitive. If you can, bring a few books for the kids or things that the Village can use as a whole. It is a young lady that is one of the Universities that is in the Village. (Congrats to her). If you want Mr. Bhagirath's info, here you go: +91-978-4541515 or rusirani.village@gmail.com. If you want another person of contact, he may contact Mr. Vikram Sing Rathore at +91-141-2594006 or vikram_rathore_harsh@yahoo.com

Name: camilapimenta
Title: Great place.
Review: It's an amazing place, for those who want a different Indian experience.If you intend to visit the school that they have there, will be nice to bring with you, if possible, some pencils and/or notebook, to give to the kids. I'm sure they'll love it and you'll make a difference in the life of them.:DIn case you want to know more information visit the blog of Rusirani:http://rusiranivillage.wordpress.com/

Name: Jackie C
Title: A wonderful "must do" experience of village life
Review: One of the highlights of my trip to India was spending time at Rusirani. I was not sure to go, but I'm really glad I did. The village is around 2.5 hours from Jaipur on the way to Agra, and has a challenging road up and over the hills. My guide, Giri, picked me up in Jaipur in a jeep. He and some colleagues have started a NGO to facilitate local kids going to school, which is where the money raised from village visits goes. We went to have chai with a family who were warm, welcoming and curious about me, as I was about them. We looked around the village, which is more like small family groups spaced around the fields. There was a lovely old temple and some other fascinating ruins and lots of wild peacocks. I had a delicious lunch with the family, and we had great fun taking photos of each other. I was staying overnight, I saw where people usually stay, in large tents next to a wetland. There were toilet facilities there. Permits are needed for foreigners to stay there, but the people needed to write them couldn't be found so rather than stay there without a permit, we drove to another family in a different village, who had been asking Giri to have visitors come to stay. It was the first time a guest had spent the night with a family. It may be a challenge for some - no toilets, the light is on in the room all night (!! In case the children get up apparently), and I was woken at 6.00am to get up with the family routine. I didn't get a lot of sleep, but it really didn't matter. The children of the house were very surprised to see a foreigner in their bedroom (we all shared a room) as I had arrived after they had already gone to bed. In the morning we huddled around a fire outside to keep warm, and the mother of the house made lots of chai for all the visitors who came to meet me. Breakfast was millet chapattis with homemade buffalo yogurt with a mix of chilli and garlic in it, absolutely delicious and something I'll try to make at home. Afterwards I visited a couple of other homes, and looked at the site where they want to build a school, walking around with lots of villagers. It really was a special, unique time with lovely warm people, and a chance to cross the cultural barriers. If you have time, do stay overnight. I did some other village visits during my stay in Rajasthan, but these were short and lacked the element of a warm cultural exchange experience that my visit to Rusirani was. Give it a go, you wont be disappointed.

Name: EmmaGrew83
Title: A life changing day
Review: I can't put into words how incredible the day spent at Rusirani village was. The drive from Jaipur took just under 3 hours but half way there we changed from an AC taxi to an SUV. On route, we stopped at local baths and temple. The journey was bumpy towards the end as you climb through the hills but the views were incredible.Upon arrival at the village we were welcomed with traditional offerings and a lovely, refreshing drink. The villagers ask questions and are so welcoming. The children and adults were fascinated by my iPad and taking photos and videos of themselves. Whilst they don't speak English, you will be amazed at how much you can communicate with body language. Gidhari, the tour operator translates questions and answers as well as keeps you in the mix of the political discussions going on (we visited during election time!). We were well looked after, enjoying a delicious lunch and dinner and mineral water is provided (food is also prepared for guests using mineral water). Lack of toilet facilities are not a problem- there is plenty of space behind bushes to relieve yourself!!We were fortunate to visit the village temple, an extremely old temple and ruins. We also took a 30 minute drive the ought he village to a magnificent fort. The views on this cliff top, abandoned fort were breathtaking (as long as you have a head for heights!)Gidhari told us that he hopes to develop the opportunities for visitors to spend longer at Rusirani, volunteering their services, so this might be worth considering.This truly was a highlight of our travels in India. I view my materialistic life somewhat differently now and thank the people of Rusirani for reminding me what happiness is.

Name: ibay8103
Title: Hidden Gem
Review: Rusirani village is not well marked in the map but I think it is located at north east of Jaipur, Rajasthan where we (me and wife) stayed in.  It takes ~3 hour driving each way, but stops at few interesting places like old temple, local market, etc. which make trip feel a lot shorter than it actually takes.Rusirani village is not that far from near bigger villages as I thought but still there is no running water, electricity nor bathrooms.  Few families are grouped together to form sub-villages.  Village people are from infants to old men like any other societies, even though women are more easily seen.They share kitchen, cattle shed, and the court yard as a main gathering place.  Basically they work together, eat together, share happiness and sorrow together.  When you see them through their eyes, you would feel that they have never seen outside of world before.  They are very curious of you as you are to them.  As I find them very fascinated in their lives, they also have many questions to ask about us.  I can not forget their face expressions about curiosities.  I can even feel the pureness through their eyes.You may have to prepare to spend long hours on the road and just few hours in the village.  Activities are quite limited though, which include sightseeing on nearby ruins (awesome!), dancing with local if you wish and having a lunch.  Nothing much, however, you will have interactions with their people.  They do not speak English, nor we speak their language, but we spent hours of communicating with our bodies and souls.  We gave them something we had as a gift, in return I received the beautiful turban and thread bracelets, which signify friendship.  I respected the way they live and they did the same way to us.  This was a truly amazing experience.I also have to note that this is not just typical business oriented tour as you may find all over the India.  Girdhari, the tour operator, is actually from Rusirani village himself and also a member of NGO.  He is thriving to help and improve educations for the village, specially for the children.  If you would like to seek Disneyland like amusement, then forget this experiences.  If your heart is set on appreciating their cultures and helping to preserve their thousands old heritage, then you are right on.I appreciate Gerdhari for his dedication to the village in heart.

Name: beckywager
Title: India showcased
Review: I have been to so many places in india showcasing the culture but nothing as vibrant or pleasing as this. the kids are so very sweet and so are the adults who want to show you their little village

Name: DarinRodrq
Title: Reflects Indian Tradition
Review: Rusirani is a beautiful village, which is located in the heart of Rajasthan. I visited this village a year ago. I was surprised by the warm welcome with a song and dance. The beat of Drums will surely make everyone to dance. Children in the village are very playful. It was full of green crops all around us. The people of the village were very friendly and treated me as a guest. I visited many temples and monuments in the village. The food was very delicious. I can feel the love of the people. I recommend everyone to visit this village to know the unique culture of village.

Name: Chris10023
Title: My amazing 3 days - a different kind of life
Review: Last year I visited Rusirani village for a day and absolutely loved it. Back in India again this year, I decided to stay in the village for a few days. This time I travelled there directly from Agra, rather than via the Pink City as I had seen enough forts etc. on my previous trip and was anxious to get back to village life.IBhagirath picked me up in the jeep and it was great to see him again. He is an excellent guide and goes out of his way to build a communication and rapport between the guests and the villagers. We had lunch with a family whilst Bhagirath explained various options and experiences open to me during my stay. I decided to make myself useful by painting a classroom in the only primary school in the village (great fun) and to spend time making door to door visits interacting with the villagers. I also learned to make and cook rotis over an open fire. The village is self governing and I found it  a really wonderful and educational experience to be able to converse (through Bhagirath) with such friendly and welcoming people whose lives are so different to mine. I highly recommend Rusirani to anyone who wants to see and be in the middle of real Indian village life, which I feel must be pretty much the same today as it was hundreds of years ago.   I loved the food and whilst the facilities are basic, I found them to be totally adequate. If you haven't guessed by now, I absolutely had the best time and highly recommend a visit!!

Name: venusilion
Title: culture of india
Review: to all those coming to india and raving about how they studied the culture, you must come here. only here will you get a real taste of the same. the villages which you hear of in india, this is it. just go and experience it

Name: damianbhagat
Title: Now this is a must visit
Review: If you want a kind of trip where you can understand or begin to understand the local culture etc, then this is the best place you can go. The interaction with the locals, the amazing amazing food, and the very polite people make it a must visit.

Name: Tansy44
Title: Our best cultural experience in India
Review: This was an extremely special day for us both. It was a beautiful insight into a real living Rajasthani village community. Bhagirath was the perfect guide, he was very thoughtful and attentive and spoke fantastic English. The trip showed us a different side to India and one we hadn't seen at all on our trip and didn't see  after! The village community is almost entirely self sufficient, growing all their crops and looking after their livestock. It is beautifully situated deep in the Rajasthani countryside. The village elders spoke with us and welcomed us and at the end gave us gifts of Saris and jewellery! They also provided wonderful mint tea and a traditional lunch. The village children were extremely friendly and playful and we ended up singing and dancing with them in the fields! We had such a great day and I would recommend this trip to anyone who wants a unique cultural experience while in Rajasthan. Bhagirath was fantastic and provided a very interesting insight into his culture and village life while also talking of the contrast of him being a university educated man living there. Altogether a fantastic day and one I would love to repeat! xxx

Name: Rachael C
Title: Incredible experience,a highlight of our trip
Review: We had a very special day at Rusirani village, which was incredibly illuminating and showed us a completely different side to India.  The villagers completely welcomed us into their community, cooked us fantastic homegrown food, gave us fresh chai and local mint drinks and talked with us and shared their community with us.  We were fortunate to see some of the fantastic local temples.  It was fascinating to spend time in such a rural community.  It was an amazing experience to be able to sing and dance with the villagers and we were truly humbled by their kindness.  Many thanks for a wonderful day.  I will email my photos to you soon.

Name: K0l0
Title: Amazing cultural experience with villagers
Review: Completely different experience from other places. An old and hidden village near Abhaneri Stepwell. Everything is managed by local villagers in a genuine Indian way. Very clean, far from crowd but little far from Jaipur. I was picked up in a local village jeep from my hotel in Jaipur and drop back as well. Dancing with local women, organic food with amazing unique taste, community discussion with villagers everything was such a fantastic experience to feel the past like hundreds of years ago. Be careful there isn't any toilet available.  Another advice -do it with Abhaneri Stepell and book with villagers  they will be available, as well as waiting for you.

Name: Crutzen902
Title: Fantastic Experience
Review: Book with local villagers for the transport and food. If you still want to make it more cheaper go in a group. Be ready for the bad road rest all would be unforgettable experience. Go to see historical buildings (ruined) and to experience Indian culture. You will cook and eat with villagers and they will drop you back to Jaipur in their Jeep.

Name: mahenweed
Title: Amazing excursion near Jaipur
Review: Don‚Äôt go in your own car, very bad road. I don‚Äôt even recommend SUV because the way to village is full of bushes. Book transport and food with local villagers. Everything else is amazing. lit bit chat with local villagers ..

Name: M0hit09
