Name: DP1066
Title: A stunning gateway!
Review: Located inside the Amber Fort, this is entrance to the third courtyard.  It is decorated with beautiful frescos and is one of the places people pause to have their photographs taken, in the alcoves either-side of the main doorway, so be ready to get in the queue.

Name: Mandeep Mehta
Title: An excellent architecture
Review: The entrance is very beautifully designed. The colours used are made from fruits  and vegetables. The best part is the colours have not required a repaint since they were originally created a few centuries back. You just can move ahead before clicking a few photos.

Name: Tasha M
Title: Rajasthan Amer fort Ganesh pole
Review: nice place to visit in Jaipur . Historical rich place.Mamy places good places to click photos.nice .

Name: NiRaj92
Title: It looked better when we visited in 2014
Review: Colours on wall have faided. Needs some fresh touch of colours/painting. Though it's really a big entrance for Amber fort visitors.

Name: Orchid4841
Title: Can't help but be impressed ...
Review: Impressively and intricately decorated gateway from the outer courtyard, into the Amber fort interior. There are painted decorations, including Ganesh adorning the archway, as well as fret carved marble in the windows, all demonstrating amazing workmanship. If you are visiting the fort, you definitely won't miss this gateway.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Grand entry gate to Sheesh Mahal & Diwan-E-Khas
Review: The Ganesh Pol Gateway is a grand entry gate to the Sheesh Mahal & the Diwan-e-Khas in the Amer fort. The gate built in Mughal architecture has the Hindu Lord Ganesh in the center. The colors used by the artists in the designs were locally made from plants & are still intact after so many years.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: The grandest entry gate to Amer fort!!
Review: Pol means a gate in the local language. Ganesh pol is the grandest gate to enter the Amer fort. There are other Pol's (gates) as well but none compare to this is terms of size and grandeur.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: A beautiful park and garden
Review: You can relax and enjoy inside this place and feel the experience of water body along with your family and friends. There are many people who will persuade you for elephant ride.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Grand
Review: This is the firsr gate of the beautiful and huge Amber fort. This gate is grand and beautiful and apt start for amazing fort.

Name: Nikhil P
Title: Beautifully decorated gate
Review: This is actually an entrance gate from one section of amer fort to another . Its is one of the most beautifully decorated gates, I have ever seen in my life. Really worth spending some time to observed the minute details crafted on the gate.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Ganesh Pol
Review: The Ganesh Pol is a gate located inside the Amber fort. It marks the entrance to the Sheesh Mahal and the private quarters of the Royals living in the fort. The architecture of the gate is very beautiful with intricate designs and beautiful paintings.

Name: Jaskaran singh
Title: View
Review: Perfect place for hangout with friends and a perfect view of amer fort large place of gorund where you can sit enjoy and by near that you can enjoy street food and have ha gread view of lake in front of amer fort

Name: Shyam B
Title: A gem in a treasure house
Review: The ancient architecture on the gate itself is very beautiful. The decorative details on this were outstanding. You will find it in the second courtyard of the palace leading to the main private royal quarters.

Name: Travellove1025
Title: Highlight of Amber Fort
Review: Ganesh pol is the entrance to the sheesh Mahal and other private quarters of the royals. It has the most beautiful and intricate frescos that this majestic beauty will stay with you even after you leave Jaipur.

Name: jacqferns
Title: Amber fort - Must see
Review: Most important landmark in Jaipur and a must see fort. Very well maintained also with lots of historical value. definately should be on every visitor's list of must see

Name: Mark R
Title: Selfie central
Review: This huge gate is the main gateway into the Amber fort. It‚Äôs really magnificent and deserves many selfies.

Name: FranciscaVergara
Title: Beautiful but it could be better
Review: I loved this site, however, the main problem (and probably is a problem in most of the attractions in India) is the lack of interest for the people there to maintain the place clean. We were walking and there was this amazing building of hundreds of years but a big bunch of garbage next to it was probably what the main reason why it's not an excellent place but a OK.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Absolutely magnificent architecture
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, I had visited the beautiful Amber Fort and this is the main gate inside the fort which connects the courtyard housing the Diwan-e-Aam to the interior housing the Sheesh Mahal. This gate is very beautiful with floral paintings in different colors all over it and at the center there is a beautiful painting of Lord Ganesh and hence the name. At the upper tier of the gate there are big windows covered with intricately carved floral designs in white marble. This grand entrance is a photographer's delight and tourists were enjoying their time clicking selfies as well as group photos with families & friends. This is one of the prime attractions inside the beautiful Amber Fort.

Name: Julio Areck Chang
Title: Magnificent entrance to the inner part of Amber Fort.
Review: This entrance's main characteristic is its highly decorated walls and windows. You will definitely want to take a selfie here.

Name: PatilChinar
Title: Colorful Design and Fabulous Art Work
Review: Ganesh Pol Gateway is the first thing you get to see when you enter Amber/Amer Fort. This gate is filled with colours and beautiful artwork. It is simply breathtaking. you are lucky if you get to click a picture of this gate without any crowd in and around you.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Gate way to a Great architecture
Review: This is the gateway to Amber Fort. The believe is that the Lord Ganesh will protect all who enters and leaves the fort. Taking a photo without people will be a tough task because always this is crowded and much photographed. When you visit Jaipur it is must to visit Amber Fort. If you visit Amber Fort you don't miss this place.

Name: RedLichtie65
Title: As gates go...
Review: ...this is definitely one of the more impressive ones! It is part of Amer Fort, the entrance to the private area and you will see it as part of the Fort trip. It is beautifully decorated and in fantastic condition. Well worth a photo opportunity but difficult to avoid getting others in pics as it is very busy!

Name: GregB052148
Title: Elephant - the only way to arrive at fort
Review: You can ride an elephant up the long entrance to the fort. Yes, it is a bit uncomfortable, still an adventure not to be missed. The views as you ascend are wonderful for pictures. The Gateway itself is not to be missed. Ornate and impressive.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Very good Gateway
Review: Some of the places are just unique and attracts more and more, you will surely be surprised to see such places, must visit at least once.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Magnificent gate of city palace
Review: This is a magnificent entry gate for city palace. The architecture and painting on the gate is superb.

Name: RobertFGCarter
Title: Stunning
Review: An example of the most beautiful fresco work outside of Italy. It is truly stunning and possibly the most lovely part of the fort.

Name: Seema519
Title: Ganesh pol gateway
Review: This gate is majestic entrance to the Amber fort,It is an iconic symbol,There is an ganesh picture on the gate, which is quite captivating,the architecture is beautiful,the colours used are captivating,good place for pictures.It has been a back drop for quite a few events in the pink city

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: ganesh pol gateway
Review: its the entrance point of Amber fort it defines classy architectural work where u can capture good pic and enjoy

Name: Ema Datshi
Title: The Front Door
Review: The Ganesh Pol Gateway is one of the iconic symbols of India - not quite the Taj Mahal, of course, but something that must have millions of photographs snapped every year. It's the grand entrance into the Amber Fort and it sets the tone for what's beyond the entrance. With the jolly symbol of Ganesh - the god of good times and remover of obstacles (sometimes placer of obstacles) is always a favourite and suggests that what a visitor would have found inside was sure to delight.

Name: AAA
Title: Beautiful Gateway
Review: Heart winning art is here. It's a most beautiful place. Most beautiful architecture. Good place for photography. This is very famous Gateway. Must visit.

Name: gauravkhattar
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: This is the royal entrance to Amer fort... it has Ganeshji's picture installed... thats why the name.... provides a good backdrop to pics...

Name: cbk2911
Title: The gate or Entrance of Amber Fort
Review: This Ganesh Pol gateway is famous world over as tourists from all over the world come to see the marvellous architecture of gateway - the Mughal & Rajasthani styles. It was constructed especially for Royals. It has lots of ornamental archways.

Name: gireesh s
Title: Ganesh pol gateway
Review: It is at entrance of the Amer fort of Jaipur it has sculpture of Ganesh ji which shows awesome artwork

Name: Tuhina
Title: Royal entrance...
Review: This is a very beautiful another entrance of Amer fort. There was a picture of lord Ganesha in the middle of entrance gate. That is why its got name Ganesh pol gateway.The place is really very well maintained. Architecture shows there excellent choice of royality, you can not miss this. When the last statement is only if you are are  architectural lover and history lover. In Rajasthan you get to see so many back to back architectural and historical reference that at one point they might seem repeatation and banal but if you have eye for perfection and detail you will definitely see the difference and enjoyed them.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Beautiful...
Review: This gate is one of the entrance of Amber Fort. It is great to watch wonderful artwork on the gate. Shri Ganesh sculpture present at top of the gate.

Name: Ricardo R
Title: Many details
Review: One of the most beautiful part of Amber Fort, a colorful and detailed fa√ßade.See it in the morning, the sun will be shining directly on it enhancing all the details.

Name: anjuanjali
Title: a big enterance gate
Review: lord ganesha picture on this gate. it is inside of amer fort. a must stop to see beauty of this gate. you can enjoy if weather is cool

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Entrance of Amber Fort
Review: This gateway is the main entrance for accessing inner chambers of beautiful Amber Fort. Lord Ganesha's picture is in the top of the gate - reason for its name. Built with excellent architecture and carvings all over. Good for few clicks.

Name: Debopam
Title: Gateway to Amer
Review: This is the main entrance gate now to the main Interiors of the Amer fort. This has nice architecture and should not be missed if you are visiting the fort.

Name: minimize940314
Title: The main gate
Review: This is the main gate of Amber Fort after you present your ticket! It is well decorated and good for photos.

Name: MikeFJones
Title: Ganesh Pol Gateway - The Doorway of Rajasthan Kings, Jewel from the Past!
Review: Located inside Amber Fort, a must stop to admire the beautiful craftsmanship of the mix of the Rajput and Mughal styles of architecture, full of ornate designs in the form of murals and intricate lattice work. The center of the gate has a picture of the Indian god, Ganesha, while the rest of the murals are mostly decorative floral vines. The incredible and varied lattice work on the upper widows and arches are also amazingly intricate. Take as many pictures as you want, its one of the most conserved features of this fort. Entrance fee is included in your ticket, 500INR if foreigner and 100INR during night time, which is also worth for more shots too! Don't miss it!

Name: Deepak A
Title: Gateway to Amer fort
Review: Ganesh pol is gateway to amer fort. There is a painting of god Ganeshji on top of the gate and pol means gate hence the name Ganesh pol.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Ganesh pol gate
Review: Ganesh pol gate is beautiful door. this is also a historical building of Jaipur Rajasthan .good to see m

Name: joanadventure
Title: Nice Architecture!
Review: A interesting artwork on this architecture structure. Located inside the Amber fort. Should not be missed once in amber fort.

Name: vinitasaraf2015
Title: Located inside Amber fort
Review: Nice artwork inside the amber fort. Highly appreciated by tourists for the workmanship. Very famous .

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Ganesh Pol is the entrance to the Private chambers of Amber Fort and has been done so beautifully.
Review: At Amber Fort Ganesh Pol is the most important Gateway to the inner chambers of the Palace. This is beautifully decorated with frescos and derives its name from Ganesh painting at the entrance. Lord Ganesh gets the pride of place because of the religious associations. On the second storey of the Gateway were the places which were used by royal ladies to witness the proceedings at Diwan-e-Am. Ganesh Pol is beautiful and has retained its glory till date.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Ganesh Pol ‚Äì An  elegant gateway of a fusion of Mughal and Rajput art and architectural styles
Review: The Ganesh Pol is a magnificent gateway at the entrance into the palaces of the Maharajas within the Amber fort. There is a beautiful Lord Ganesh painting in this Gate using natural colours. Tourists from all over the world, appreciate the art and architecture of the Ganesh Pol gateway ‚Äì a perfect blend of Mughal and Rajput styles. It is famous for its excellently decorated archways and the fine latticework.

Name: Pulak
Title: Amazing Architecture
Review: A great intrinsic artwork on this structure. Located inside the Amber fort. Should not be missed once in amber fort.

Name: Sandra0852
Title: Not to be missed when in Jaipur
Review: Take an elephant ride up to the fort (worth the discomfort). Amazing structure with incredible views of Jaipur, leave wondering how they managed to complete it in the time it took to build

Name: James W
Title: Impressive !!
Review: Obviously build to impress as well as to defend against enemies, the gateway is both architecturally beautiful and artistically beautiful.  Rather than just rush through to to the delights inside, take time on your trip to just appreciate how this entrance must has impressed both friend and foe in past centuries.

Name: Nikhil192
Title: Beautiful Gate
Review: This Ganesh Pol gate is beautiful gate at Amber fort.its construction is very nice.nice view for photography lover.

Name: Shanth148
Title: The Ganesh Pol at Amer Fort
Review: This is a very large many tiered painted doorway, from the Deewane Khas in the Amer Fort. It is intricately painted by these artists who were brought in from Persia and other places, known for their artistic abilities. At the centre above the doorway is a Ganesh paintingi which is what gives this doorway the name Ganesh Pol.

Name: Eileen E
Title: a must see
Review: fine example of Rajput architecture.  Great rooms, chambers to see decorations and design.  Glad we went .

Name: 1Beat07
Title: Spectacular views
Review: The Amber Fort must have been truley magnificent in days gone by.  There is restoration going on.  The stone work is intricately beautiful.  You can see for miles around a woth while visit.

Name: Sally L
Title: Beautifully intricate work on this elegant gateway.
Review: The intricacy of the tracery and decoration on this gateway is marvellous. Time and money no object, beauty and elegance is all.

Name: Oaklandish3
Title: Worth a Visit But Keep Expectations in Check
Review: We enjoyed our visit here - driver took us all the way up by car - no problem.  The gate is one of the main features of the Amber Form - which is huge and exceptional for the scale.  Otherwise, isn't as interesting as other forts you'll see (such as the Red Fort in Agra) but definitely work a visit.

Name: alisdair t
Title: Beautiful gateway
Review: Built in the honor of Mughal Emperors, its located  in the south side of the courtyard of the palace in the Amber Fort, The hugh structure shows a mixture of the Rajput and Mughal styles of architecture and is full of ornate designs in the form of murals and  lattice work. The center of the gate has a picture of the Indian god, Ganesha,

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Top place to visit
Review: Ganesh pol Gate is looks great.its architecture is very attractive in tourist. it located in amber fort.must see location

Name: Debottom C
Title: Topmost attraction of Jaipur
Review: A very special way to reach the fort. Sheesh Mahal and the Ganesh Pol are the main attractions of the fort. The fort is well-preserved and you can purchase a plethora of things outside the fort.

Name: Buni64
Title: Highlight of Jaipur
Review: The beautiful south gate of Amber Fort is beautiful, well preserved and covered by frescoes coloured with natural paint made from crashed semiprecious stones mixed with leaf's juice.

Name: Rak990
Title: Symbol of Muslim Architecture in Hindu Palace
Review: It is a part of Amber Fort. Ganesh is a Hindu god, erected in the middle of the gate. So,it is named that way. When it was made some 300 years ago, it was a phase of amicable relationship between Hindu Rajput rulers and Mughal Kings. Amber benefited the most out of this relationship. Amer Fort palaces were decorated by royal Mughal masons and artists. First among them was this gate. Interesting part is depiction of this god in middle of this gate. Muslim artists did not know how a god looked like. So they have used their own imagination. It shows on this gate.

Name: Anita B
Title: Beautiful place. Very intricate architectures and well preserved.
Review: You can't miss this place once you are in the area. The architecture is  intricate and breathtaking.  Make sure you carry a bottle of water and some snacks as there are other forts a few steps away and can be a long walk.

Name: Lena130304
Title: Maharadjas and queens
Review: Two forts and a city wall climbing up and down the mountains. Jeeps, taxicars and elephants kan bring you up there. But please, do not take the elephant. Anaybody, who knows animals a litttle, can se that they are extremely unhappy carryin people up and down on that hard stouny ground.Visit the gallery och maharadjas. And feel how the queens were restricted inside the walls . . .

Name: APYE
Title: Amber Fort
Review: Well worth a visit. Our guide was very informative. We loved the whole experience. It is interesting to see the buildings built by the kings of Jaipur.

Name: drn85
Title: Ganesh pol gateway... The gateway of Amber fort.
Review: Ganesh pol gateway is one of the gateway located inside the amber fort in jaipur. It's a magnificent gateway with lot of architectural delights engraved in it. The gateway is like L shaped with two doors which gives privacy for the royal women and protects from enemies. It's an important photo location inside the amber fort. And once you are inside amber fort, you will see this gateway for sure.

Name: Robert L
Title: Essential
Review: The Red Fort is one of the most popular attractions in India. This Ganesh Gate is one of the better areas within the fort. Be sure to go to the top of the gate to look through the hand carved marble lattice windows that the sheltered women would look through.

Name: Sudha Balu
Title: A spectacular architectural marvel!
Review: The first sight of this Gateway takes your breath away.  It is big, bold and beautiful!  Situated inside the Amber Fort, and overlooking a huge terrace, this is one marvellous construction, painted with floral motifs using vegetable dyes..

Name: Swanay
Title: Your ticket to the entry of Grand Amber fort
Review: This is the royal entrance located near the Hamams section of the fort.Its beautiful entrance which leads to the main area of the fort which has a painting of Lord Ganesh at the top hence named after him. The carving and the detailing done which forms this structure is simply genius! Our guide told us its been in similar condition for over few centuries!

Name: Himanshu J
Title: Nice
Review: Took a guide... he told many thing about the place which really help us to relate.... very nice place

Name: TomandHope
Title: Very impressive
Review: Just amazing architecture and well worth a visit. This building is within the Amber palace complex and has retained much of its colorful inlays.

Name: Binu A
Title: A Royal Entrance
Review: The Ganesh Pol is in the south side of the courtyard of the palace in the Amber Fort and was used by Royalty to enter the palace.The Ganesh Pol is so called because there is an image of the elephant headed God on the entrance, and the interesting fact is that Lord Ganesha is not put in the traditional style but in the profile.On either side of the entrance are two areas where one can take pictures.The walls are still vibrant with color because every three years or so the walls are renovated with vegetable dye. The effort that must have gone into creating something so beautiful and intricate is outstanding and truly worthy of Royalty.Above this gate is the Suhag Mandir where ladies of the royal family used to watch functions held in the courtyard through latticed windows

Name: Telakula Sathya... P
Title: Marvel
Review: It marvel how did they do it with intricate painting using of vegetable die.The arches are done to perfection. I could go on and on...a visit would set the experience!!!!!

Name: Mohammad M
Title: Not good
Review: This is the main entrance of amber palace not an added attractions.  I was with go with my girlfriend she is alos not I will  not recommended this place. ...

Name: Vasco Da
Title: Grand
Review: It has a grand view to welcome you, lots of tourists here and there.A glimpse of the city from top is wonderful.Inside is a huge place to keep exploring for 2-3 hours.Had a wonderful time there peeking into history.

Name: Erik M
Title: Impressive
Review: A very impressive gateway at the fort. The detail and design is magnificent and will leave you mesmerized. But the best is yet to come...

Name: janmalvern
Title: Well worth a visit
Review: Elephant ride to the top and it has so many interesting features, also the views from the top are amazing.

Name: Viharin_Nidhikm
Title: Intricate carvings with beautiful designs
Review: A must must visit if in Jaipur. This pol is as colourful and untouched as it was since 100s of years. Intricate carvings and colours are very gripping. Interestingly, all colours are natural vegetable colours.

Name: RakeshJena_IIM
Title: Royal Gate of Amber Fort... Ok sort of place.
Review: Though I loved the amber fort and part of it is the Ganesh Pol (meaning gate)... I feel it can't be branded as a separate attraction. The place has nice architecture. A guide would be useful.

Name: Conrad N
Title: Hi Ganesh
Review: Impressive entrance with a painting of Lord Ganesh above it. This and the surrounding decoration have survived well considering they are done in natural dyes.

Name: pankaj b
Title: Gateway of Amer! india
Review: What a grand entrance! Do not forget to hear the sound of main door. It makes elephant sound which was a sort of welcome gesture for Rajaji...

Name: Travelwisewoman
Title: A stunningly beautiful gateway which embellishes the Amber Fort
Review: The construction of the Amber Fort was started in the 17th Century by Maharaja Mansingh, Mughal Emperor Akbar's most successful General, and, before the City Palace was constructed in Jaipur, Amber was the seat of power.  This is reflected in much of the ornate and impressive construction of the Amber Fort, and none more so than in the Ganesh Pol Gateway, which is superb.  Not to be missed!

Name: LuizDutraNeto
Title: Crossing the Royal Gate of Amber Palace!
Review: Through the beautifully ornamented arches of "Ganesh Pol", the Rajputs Maharajahs would enter the royal quarters of "Amber Fort" (most commonly known as "Amber Palace"). This gateway was built between 1611 and 1667, and is a mix of Mughal and Rajput architectural styles. It honored the Mughal emperors and was dedicated to Lord Ganesh, the Hindu deity that "removes all obstacles in life". At its central and long arch, Lord Ganesh is depicted at an unusual and rare form - its image is in the profile. On its upper floor, known as "Suhag Mahal", delicate latticed windows allowed women of the royal household to observe other areas of "Amber Fort" while unseen from the outside. After crossing "Ganesh Pol", you will reach the beautiful persian "charbagh" style gardens and the famous "Sheesh Mall" (Hall of Mirrors) and "Sukh Mahal" (Hall of Pleasures), the most visited attractions within "Amber Fort". May Lord Ganesh protect your journey throughout Jaipur and Rajasthan! Enjoy!

Name: aah_alim
Title: ganesh pole a brillent saga
Review: Ganesh pole is a fine portal covered with painting.It is built by Sawai Jai Singh.At the entrance to the temple, there is also a carving of Lord Ganesha, which is made out of a single piece of coral....

Name: Globetrottersince97
Title: Discriminating gates :)
Review: The olden day public was not allowed now all can walk in and nothing to it. Look at the pictures and it is all that is there :)

Name: MaheshSKabra
Title: Super Rajasthani art of vegetable acolors
Review: Main entrance to Amer fort palace. Very beautifully colored and colors are still in good condition even after 4 centuries.

Name: Travel Vibes - India
Title: Elegant and regal
Review: This is located in Amer Fort. Ganesh Pol Gateway is named after the famous Hindu deity Lord Ganesha. This elaborately painted gate was built by the Mirza Raja Jai Singh I. The magnificent gateway is the entrance into the palaces of the maharajas.

Name: Sachin_R74
Title: Superb natural vegetable paintings preserved!
Review: Great place to take some time appreciating the beauty of the Gate. Superb natural vegetable color paintings preserved! Great spot to take some nice pics.

Name: jitender_gsm
Title: The Royah Gateway to the courtcard!!!
Review: visited this place during last week long weekend, great place to visit...well maintained, tourist take family photos, selfies at this place...

Name: Stravel2015
Title: One of the most photogenic gate in Rajasthan
Review: This is the colorful gate used in many films (including remake of Khubsurat). It is within Amer fort. There is a great restaurant nearby (1135 AD) and the restaurant is worth visiting (as well as lunch) for dinner when this gate and around area are illuminated.

Name: Parwathi H
Title: Beautiful Gate in Amber Fort
Review: The Ganesh Pol Gate is a beautiful work of architecture. This beautiful gate is located inside the Amber fort and leads to three pllaces inside the fort. There are beautiful paintings done on the gate and is a very sought after place by the tourists as a prop for their photos.

Name: priteshkulkarni
Title: Main entrance from Amer fort and beautiful painting
Review: Ganesh pol gateway is main entrance gate to the kings palace. Gate us huge in shape and it have beautiful Lord Ganesh painting. Fort is huge and beautiful but This entrance gate is stunning and very difficult to move ahead without taking photo of it

Name: JaipurAbhiraj
Title: inside amber fort
Review: Ganesh pol is situated at amber fort and it was built in honor of mughlas emperor . Ganesh pol is the royal mixture of hindu and muslim art and architectural style

Name: Ikbal V
Title: Very beutiful.
Review: Very amazing experience to see Ganesh Pol Gateway in Amer fort. Amer fort is big and beautiful fort.

Name: Freckle_Eye
Title: Beautiful Murials
Review: First things first this is in Amber Fort, just through the gateway in fact and its stunning. All of the fort is a photographers dream, but this gateway in particular is one of the best parts of it; be sure you explore all the court yard (there are baths to the left of this gateway) before walking through here into the hall of mirrors!

Name: AhmedMorshedy
Title: A piece of art
Review: It's also located inside Amber Fort. A pice of art with very neat drawing and marble craving with a fabulous architecture.

Name: Ridhim M
Title: Great piece of Architect
Review: The artwork on Ganesh Pol Gateway is terrific. You will be amazed to see that people at that time managed to work so good that can rarely be done by hands now.P.S. It is located inside of Amber fort.

Name: sargunarao
Title: Almighty Ganesh
Review: Ganesh pol located south side courtyard gate in Amer or Amber fort This is one of the main tourist attraction in Amber Fort. Named after Hindu God Ganesha known as obstacle remover, the magnificient fate stood proud and elegant.

Name: Rahul P Singh
Title: Beautiful Architecture
Review: From the endless variety of paintings and stone inlays eyes run! Very nice and picturesque. Ganesh Pol Gate is located in front of the pillared courtroom. The entrance (Ganesh Pol) leads to three palaces around a garden, the architecture of the gateway is a fusion of Mughal and Rajput architectural styles, which adjoins the villas and private reception areas. This area is decorated almost in baroque style by the amount of white marble, mosaics and small mirrors. The top of the gates have been decorated with lattice pattern as seen outside from the back side, which is also beautiful. It is a place that conveys much peace and one should be treated with the respect it deserves. Worth visit it.

Name: Erindel66
Title: Wonderful entrance to the heaven
Review: This is the feeling that people should have had when they came to visit the Maharaja at Fort Amber. This wonderful gateway leads you to the palaces of the Maharaja. It is dedicated to the deity Ganesh, which chairs the lintel of the main door. Please, spend a little time to admire all the paintings that decorates the gateway and also have a look to the latticework that cover all the windows, which allowed the pass of the wind so as to refresh and also let the women watch without being seen.Its a great way to enter in the world of maharajas after arriving at the main coutyard by elephant.

Name: Arpit Agarwal
Title: Big Ground- Pride of Jaipur
Review: Central Park Jaipur is a huge open space right in the heart of the city. There is a huge polo ground and Golf course attached to it. The entire round of the park is about4-5 km and there are a lot of people who come here for a jog or a brisk walk. There are a few birds around and a lot of greenery.The central park also has a 206 feet high first day and night monumental National flag 28 feet wide and 72 feet in length. This national flag looks magnificent when high voltage light falls on it at night time. It is supposedly the tallest tricolor in the country.There are a few other attractions around this Park like the Musical fountain, a temple and stone statues

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The most pleasing park of the city
Review: Any time you visit this park it feels rewarding . The vastness abd the green covers of trees and lawns are a treat to the soul . There is no entry fee . The opening hours of winter and summer time are followed strictly . Digs are not permitted . The 5 gates in different side give easy access to anyone entering the park . It is a popular spot  for jogger‚Äôs and health conscious crowds . The landscape is astounding and tiny temple located in the centre is popular .Morning hours are the best time to visit .

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The crown a Jewel of  City
Review: This is the pride of the city of Jaipur . This vast , beautiful and sprawling park is a delight to the eyes and food for the soul . At any given time of the there are people relaxing , jogging , sunning in winter and enjoying . There are regulars in mornings who come here from far in cars , scooters , bicycles .The landscape gives a choice to choose the walking / jogging track or the grassy fields the do meditation / yoga . The seatings are picture perfect and breath taking on the green lawns , around the flag hoisting area . There are a couple I‚Äôd temples here for the faithfuls .There are several activities associated with this park , the laughing climb , the yoga group or the open gym are inviting/ open for all . The opening closing time are monitored - in winters 5 :30:am to 8 pm and 5 am to 9 pm summers . There is an issue of a poor Security in evenings . Not advisable to be here after dark - before dawn or after sun set . A perfect place to  have picnics . No entree fee . Not to be missedv

Name: Mehmoodmewat
Title: Excellent park!
Review: This is one of the best park in an Indian city.Well designed & well maintained,park has three gates to allow free entry from different sides of the city.Had leisurely walk and spend lovely time on a mild sunny day.Fresh air in the city centre is breathtaking!Well done!

Name: Madalyn H
Title: Pleasant park for a stroll
Review: A very well maintained park which is pleasant for a stroll and a good place to stretch legs at the end of a busy day.

Name: Cheryllee1963
Title: Quiet Oasis
Review: My husband and I spent a lovely couple of hours here. After entering the main gates and walking for a couple of minutes the noise of busy Jaipur city disappears. The park is well maintained, with some interesting sculptures and a huge Indian flag! There is also a small amount of wildlife around. Any keen runners will find a good track that covers the perimeter of the park. There are quite a few people sleeping in the park and we did get bothered for a short time by some children and some one asking for money. However this did not spoil our afternoon and we would return.

Name: aditi
Title: Pleasant
Review: A large space to roam and I felt that I am atin Jaipur hearts means central place of Jaipur this hotel is located,totally satisfied,i have no negative comments.

Name: Vijay75
Title: Nicely located Nature Park
Review: As the name suggests, this park is nicely located and enjoyable with nature. You can see lot of birds, squirrels etc. The tower at the central park is huge and has the tallest tricolour - National Flag of our country.

Name: Rutba Bhatia
Title: Park for morning joggers and children
Review: Ideal place for morning joggers and runners. This place offers open gym facility too. Flag hoisted in the middle of the park is very beautiful

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Nature
Review: This iis a huge central park located at the heart of Jaipur. Best for morning walks and evening fun with freinds.

Name: Umang A
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is a huge Central Park located in SMS hospital. Nice place for morning jogging or relaxing in evening in the lap of nature. There are few shows as well in evening

Name: rajchaba61
Title: Exercise & Tourism
Review: A great place to exercise, while observing the city and its people. It has got great walking path and is nice and green. Since it is visited by a lot of locals it is safe. Its location is also central and is hence accessible. Follow it up with a cup of tea at the rooftop tea joint 'TAPRI'

Name: Global60009976763
Title: Park with a view
Review: Big big park in middle of city can be a boon. It is for all jaipur people and is a great place to jog or evening walk.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Huge !!
Review: It is a huge park with so many trees, jogging track and sculptures..better to go either in morNing or evening .. I have witness sm activities like Yoga , Running etc ..

Name: Diljeet K
Title: very frequently I go with my little one and we have fun
Review: Its nice place and sit chat and play with kids. Green all around makes heart happy. People love to do jogging there.

Name: Anshul
Title: Peaceful jogging track
Review: Situated in the heart of the city, as centrally located can be accessed easily by many people, the track is of around 4 kms and there are 6-7 entrance gates and ample of parking space on each side . Also there are fountains, environment friendly gyms, swings for children and a lot of space for sitting and for doing exercise .Usually people come here for morning or evening walk on the track.But people also come here for picnic to spend some time with their friends and family.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: A garden with 4 km track
Review: Most of the Indian cities may be competing to become smart cities (whatever it means) but good gardens are hard to find. The Gardens serve different purpose in different cities. Some have good collection of roses, crotons, cactus, flowering plants. However, a good garden must serve different functions- providing green patch to city or colony, track for walking or jogging, space for yoga, space for sitting leisurely even on a sunny day, having a good collection of local and exotic plants etc. Most of the gardens lack many of the desirable features. This garden can serve many purposes and thus is better than other Gardens of Jaipur. It is certainly not an attraction that a tourist must visit. The recent addition is that walking track of 4 km has been laid afresh. The garden is located in a square block of 1 by 1 kilometer and there are many other buildings and facilities located close to garden such as Rajasthan Polo ground, Taj Ram Bagh Palace Hotel, B.M. Birla Auditorium, Lakshmi Vilas Hotel, Bhattarak Ji ki Nasia, Harishchandra Totuka Marriage hall, Golf facility, Horse riding facility. There are gates and parking facilities on all four sides but the main park area is on either side of  Planetarium on Prithvi Raj Road and Bhagwan Das Road. There is a facility of paid toilets near AG office Gate and water filters at least on two locations.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The pride and lungs of the historic  city !
Review: Central Park is a priceless heritage for the future generation of this city and a jewel of the city . The green expense of the vast Park will leave you in a sense wonderment . The Landscspe is enchanting with meadows , rolling lawns and the flowerBeds emanating the fragrance of migrant in summer . There are a couple of old small temple shrines . No entry tickets here . Best time time to visit early morning in summer 5 am - 8 pm and evening in winter months fir viewing  glorious sun set here . The national triclolor will bring a sense of patriotism for Indians . A walk here is an enchanting experience any time . Location is accessible by public transport , auto rickshaws and taxis .

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Biggest park
Review: It is biggest park in Jaipur, it is good for morning and evening walk. It is situated in between the city

Name: Aryan2007
Title: One of the biggest parks in Jaipur, centrally located
Review: Central Park Jaipur is a huge open space right in the heart of the city. There is a huge polo ground and Golf course attached to it. The entire round of the park is about4-5 kms and there are a lot of people who come here for a jog or a brisk walk. There are a few birds around and lot of greenery.Central park also has a 206 feet high first day and night monumental National flag with the flag of 28 feet wide and 72 feet in length. This national flag looks magnificent when high voltage light falls on it at night time. It is supposedly the tallest tricolour of the country.There are a few other attractions around this Park like the Musical fountain, a temple and stone statues.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Charming
Review: Love to see animals the small one enjoy themselves a lot, see people and all people are also enjoying a lot, really such a charming place, must visit with friends and family and especially kids.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Good...
Review: It is one of the largest park in Jaipur. We friends going here every day for jogging. One of the clean and maintained park.

Name: Sergey_and_Elena
Title: Rats and beggars
Review: I don't remember a place, where rats have got so much freedom. They run through bushes, jump on small fences and calmly walk near people, who decided to make a picnic on the grass with rubbish.Not mentioning rats, the place is full of rubbish, stray dogs and beggars.

Name: cbk2911
Title: Largest Park of Jaipur
Review: Its a largest park of Jaipur constructed by Jaipur Development authority & is located in the centre of Jaipur. It has a big lush beautiful garden & is located nearby Rambaug Polo ground & golf club. It has a large no of statues and flag stones.

Name: gireesh s
Title: Central park
Review: Full of greenery a large park having good attractions of visitors at morning and evening yoga are also performed by visitors

Name: Jan O
Title: Nice peaceful park
Review: Quite a large park. Nice walk around and some interesting birds .The squirrels are adorable.  Nice and clean.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Very well maintained park
Review: Centrally located and well maintained park in Jaipur. A place for  visitors of all ages. Morning and evening walk attracts many visitors. Gym and Yoga are also great attractions

Name: anjuanjali
Title: nice location
Review: it is a normal park with good greenery. this is not a must visit place but if you have some spare time in evening you should visit. kids will like this park.

Name: Texas Traveler
Title: Nice park in central Jaipur
Review: Central Park has a great trail that leads around a golf course and polo field and stables.  There are lots of birds to see while walking but recently they put in some really nice art installations that are interesting to look at.  Most of the trail is pavers but beware it can be pretty dusty.

Name: LostAndFoundTravel
Title: When you are ready for some space...
Review: So happy this is on here! Is it just a park? Yes. But to have some green space and a chance to look into the distance is a big deal if you've been traveling from city to city in India. Last time I was there I encountered a group doing "laughter therapy" I guess I would call it. 15 men standing in a circle laughing on purpose. Because your body gives you the good stuff whether the laugh is real on not. Also tons of birds, bugs and critters - in a good way.

Name: mahithaprasad19
Title: Lush green garden
Review: Loved the park! It is so well maintained. Greenery all around and the lawn is so lush. Ideal for an evening walk.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Central Park
Review: Central park is beautiful place. We can spent quality time with family or friends.must visit location.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The best place in Jaipur
Review: Besides the history of Palaces and the historic forts - the present day of Jaipur offers the Central Park - which in my opinion is the pride of Jaipur . This jewel of Jaipur is a sprawling park starting on the left side before the SMS hospital and going all the way to Birla Auditorium  on one side and opposite secretariat main gate to almost to the famed the Pologrounds . The expense of green manicured lawn and the eye catching landscapes will leave you bewitched . In any season any time coming here is a feast for the eyes and and for the soul .There are couple of old Hindu temples here and also a small chatri . Informing hours one can see the activity of the regulars here - a laughter club , a yoga group and of course the regular joggers .  Opening hours for summer are 5 am and in winter time perhaps 6:30 . There is no entree fee . Anyone who loves walking will find it a treasure of the city ! Best time to come here are sunrise / sunset times which are spectacular .A must plac for relaxing and feel the serenity .

Name: Verchasv
Title: Best for morning walk, yoga and meditation
Review: The central park is located near Sawai Mansingh Hospital, Central Park is the huge area for doing activity like morning walk yoga exercise and much more in the central park there are Golf Club. They are connected to Hotel Rambagh Palace and Birla Auditorium and Hotel Ashok Palace.

Name: aman_anil
Title: Comparable to the Central Park of the NYC!
Review: This park is right in the middle of the city, takes inspiration from the original Central Park of NYC! It is also huge. It has a 4KM walking/jogging track. You will find folks engaged in a lot of activites here - meditation, yoga, gymming etc!

Name: 778akshatn
Title: Refreshing place
Review: A good place to refresh your mood. Its a good place having open gym as an attraction point and have one of the tallest INDIAN flag ‚õ≥Ô∏è.

Name: Kapil S
Title: best place for morning walk in Jaipur
Review: its heart of Jaipur best location for morning /evening walkers . lush green well , maintain park with sufficient parking space .

Name: joanadventure
Title: Central Park
Review: A place to check out the park with variety of flora, fauna, trees and creatures on the ground as well in the sky.

Name: Sumit B
Title: Very Big Park
Review: Very Big Park, but not very clean, grass is also dry, Ample Parking Space is available from all gates, has 4.5 kn jogging track for fitness lovers.

Name: joshisandeep
Title: central park
Review: it is biggest park in the city, it is adjacent to the golf club. it is good for morning and evening walkers.

Name: Yashwantpandey
Title: Nice park in the heart of Jaipur
Review: A very good location in the heart of Jaipur. One can say this as green lungs of Jaipur. Lush Green park with open air Gym. Neat clean and beautiful

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Good place for going every day  morning and evening walk.
Review: Well maintained with lot of attractions;musical fountains;seasonal flowers;yoga,etc.once in a while musical events in the evenings

Name: VirendraYadav
Title: Nice garden for walk 'n' play
Review: This is very huge garden in Jaipur City. Walking/jogging path around this garden is approx. 4km. Very well maintained lush green park with stone statues and musical fountain. A nice place to relax and maintain himself fit with jogging in morning and evening.

Name: princ512
Title: Great
Review: Jaipur's largest park, with lush green space, a jogging path, towering flagpole & stone statues. A good place to relax

Name: vibha123
Title: Excellent for Kids
Review: We had been to Central Park towards the end of our Jaipur with kids:Pros:1) Peaceful2) Maintenance is okay3) Open Gym- for those who would like some muscles ;)Cons:1) nothing much to do for kids except chasing birds and squirrels (which my friend's kids love)To stretch out from a hectic day, you can probably visit this place.

Name: Anshuace
Title: Good To Walks
Review: Lovely large park. Has a nice walkway for walking and an open air gym! Only wish it was slightly better lighted in late . I Love This Place Amazing Evening Walk

Name: jimlthomson
Title: Nice Place to Chill
Review: Jaipur is wonderful. When it gets a bit full-on and you want to pull back, Central Park is worth a visit. Quiet and hassle free it is a good place to watch the world go by. Recommend a walk (r jog) around the jogging track, which takes you past the golf & polo clubs.

Name: hsdigital
Title: Excellent cool down and walks
Review: I love this park, Depending upon the day and time you visit will determine the experiences you have. There is an outdoor gym here as well. It has a track for jogging if you like that. People are finding a place to exercise after work from about 4.30 onward and there is yoga happening in some parts. I have often had young children perform magic tricks here for a few rupees and i have often had locals stop me for a photo or 3 . The people are relaxed and it is not a touristy kind of place. There are toilets located at one entrance while also, there are vendors selling ice cream at the gates of most entrances. Gate 3 leads to a main road when i have seen a wedding procession with dazzling lights and music performed live. From here it is only a simple walk to Statue Circle which is another great spot for local families and architecture surrounding.Jump in a Tuk Tuk and ask for central park and check it out.

Name: ROOPshila‚ÄôShaggy
Title: Mornings and Evenings Are cool.
Review: The walking tracks around the greenery are soothing to the nerves and the sprightly breeze makes the spirits buoyant.The largest Flag with a cool sit around makes a convenient stopover for strenuous walkers. An open gym near the musical fountains have a considerable crowd enjoying the surroundings. Parking near the Narain Singh Circle and near the polo Club are not as full as the Secretariat and the main Entry Flag side.

Name: vini_phooh
Title: Walking or Jogging Park
Review: It is a great place to exercise or relax on benches. It has a well maintained 4 km jogging track where you can see flowers and lush green lawns all around. Great place to go for walk in the morning or evening.

Name: Raj S
Title: Big Park..!
Review: I spent some time at the Central Park after having lunch at Tapri. The place is quite big and have some life to it. You will find open air Gym as well as lots of benches to sit and chat around apart from the usual greenery that you expect from a Park!

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Good one
Review: Central park of jaipur is biggest park. we can enjoy there. Nice place for family and couples.This park is center in pink city.

Name: GauravChand
Title: A beautiful park to walk and relax
Review: Central Park is located in the centre of C-Scheme in jaipur right next to the Rambagh polo ground.  it is a popular place for people to visit for their morning and evening walks.  it has a 5km track. It also has a nursery and water fountains.  There are also a number of stone figures.  It is probably the biggest park in aipur.

Name: karth0
Title: Huge Garden
Review: Very nice garden, quite huge, you can see many birds, kids will totally love the place, easy access as its in the city!

Name: RajendraSharda
Title: central park
Review: This place is a huge park in almost heart of the city . This area is surrounded by government offices. It is one of the best place for morning walk. During early morning right from 5 am onwards you will find people coming for morning walk, talk , yoga, jogging and to have fresh air in this lush green surroundings.It is very soothing to visit this place.Well maintained are by the local authorities.

Name: kelsbelles
Title: Brilliant green space
Review: In the centre of a crazy busy city the park offers a lovely retreat with a track around the outside offering a 4km walk/jog within the park there's also a golf course and polo club,a tennis club and a temple, an exercise area and sculptures to enjoy.

Name: Sankar Mukherjee
Title: Greenery everywhere
Review: A large green stretch in the heart of the new mordern city. A heaven for walkers through extreme green. You will love to spend time here.

Name: SeemaMisra
Title: Ideal morning walk place
Review: This is the best urban park one could ask for in the middle of the city. A space that is wonderfully utilized. Rolling tracks amidst greenery, birds, rich tree life and perfect views. There is also an open air gym and place for meditation sessions, a small temple among its attractions. You also get some wonderful health drinks outside like herbal juices or butter milk. The parking space is ample. Only thing lacking is proper directions for the wash rooms.

Name: Texas Traveler
Title: Great place for a walk
Review: This is a great place to take a walk.  There is a tail that goes around the polar field and golf course, then on to the north area where you can see fountains, work out areas and a large sculpture of rocks.  Beware it's a little dusty as some of the trails are sandy/dirt but it's a nice place to see peacocks, owls and lots of birds.

Name: Jack F
Title: Nice park to take a walk
Review: If you want to relax from Jaipur's traffic and noise, go to that park. It's like an oasis.Actually outside of the park it's not very nice, but once you are in, it's very beautiful. It hosts a huge India flag.There are some free yoga classes sometimes. :)

Name: Keith P
Title: Central Park Jaipur
Review: Situated about 20 minutes from the Pink City, Central Park is an oasis of quiet in a city renown for its frenetic traffic. Every effort is made to water the grass and flower beds on a regular basis and so the greenery is maintained. There are some rather iconic statues to view and a huge Indian national flag with lots of information about its origins and meaning. There is also adequate parking for cars and motor cycles. A place to spend a pleasant time strolling to get away from the hustle and bustle of this frenetic city.

Name: Vazbo
Title: Nice for a stroll
Review: My husband and I took a stroll through Central Park on the way to Rambagh Palace.It's a vast park with a running track, polo stables and lots of wildlife even a golf course. A beautiful place for a walk and for a picnic as well.  A nice place to relax and for a bit of time out.

Name: sandeepsharma2384
Title: Best running track of jaipur
Review: If you are a runner u wont find a better place in a jaipur to run. With a 4km circumference u wont ge bored if 10-12 k is ur normal running routine. Only problem is the lighting..get quite dark in the evening.though the infra is there for lights but somehow were not working. Water stations are there at 3k so u wont need a bottle to run if u are ok with taking a water break.

Name: Colin P
Title: A peaceful sanctuary within a city of noise
Review: The wonderful quiet is the first impression of this massive park. The wildlife particularly the variety of beautiful birds is a photographers dream. A walk around the perimeter is challenging but rewarding. Then a coffee on the roof of Fab India to chill out. Enjoy !

Name: Shd Fane K
Title: Not comfortable
Review: I went there with my gf  I saw there crazy people I don't like Central Park because too much crois and voice trafic and garbage ..

Name: mingustheflyingcat
Title: A fun place to visit but you need to be careful
Review: This is a beautiful park in the center of Jaipur.  There are polo stables and lots of beautiful paths.Apparently there are areas that are a little 'iffy' - behind fences, etc.But a great thing to see when in Jaipur

Name: Santosh G
Title: An excellent park
Review: One of the best park I have ever been. Beautiful location and landscape. It remains crowded in the morning as lots of people visit there for morning walk and jugging.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The  pride and the show piece of Jaipur !
Review: This place is the show piece of the city . The sprawling green lawns , the rolling landscape ant the giant tricolor here makes you sit and reflect ! The best time is early morning or subset time . The musical fountain towards the entrance is added attraction . There is opening closing hours for summer and winter . Advisable not to go in dark . Litter free zones are monitored . There are a couple of old temples lcated within this park . Also , there are laughter club, the Yoga practice( free )!takes place during the Kringle hours for anyone to join in . Great location , easy access . No entry fee . A must visit place for all those who come to the city !m

Name: Natalie D
Title: Nice for a short walk
Review: Go early in the morning and this place is packed with local people doing their exercise. Go in the afternoon and it is quieter. Was a nice hour or slightly longer walk round it.

Name: Rkpyda
Title: Excellent park
Review: Must visit for Jaipur green and beautiful well maintained with many amenities. Good for all ages. Conveniently located.

Name: anilneena
Title: Health resort
Review: Fantastic fresh air and very good for morning walk,you will enjoy fresh air and can do yoga and exercise

Name: Rajviryadav
Title: Central Park jaipur
Review: Central Park, constructed by the Jaipur Development Authority is the largest park in Jaipur. Central Park is located, as its name suggest, in the centre of Jaipur city

Name: Ifan_Morgan
Title: Nice relaxing walk
Review: Went for a quick stroll through this park. Unfortunately it started to rain so had to cut our visit short. Many people walking and enjoying themselves. Nice statue on equal right on girls education. Would have liked to spend longer there.

Name: ngrewal
Title: Lots of space
Review: to walk around, have a picnic, enjoy the fresh air and get a gathering of your nearest and dearest together.

Name: Manish_Ramani
Title: Best park in town
Review: very huge and spacious good park very clean nicely managed nice crowd good place for walk exercise in fresh air very good place

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Huge park
Review: It is very big park and having gymnasium equipments are there , it is good gor morning and evening walk

Name: diwanashish
Title: jaipur lovers park
Review: central park is situated in center of the jaipur city and also well known for lovers and morning walker,

Name: Jennifer L
Title: Lovely for walkers, runners and relaxers
Review: In the bustling city this is a lovely tranquil place to visit for a few hours. I often use the running track which is busy in the morning with runners and walkers. The track is a 4km circular track around the outside of the park and is very interesting with blooming flowers and interesting birds, squirrels, and the occasional peacock. There is an internal path where many people are seen sitting in the shade under a tree, practicing yoga or just chilling out. There is massive flag pole in the middle, an interesting sculpture and also an outside permanent 'use your own body weight' gym near the musical fountain. Id recommend it for a walk, run, family game of something or just to sit and relax for a while.

Name: Prince K
Title: fantastic park
Review: very large park with best amenities in  jaipur. central park located in city heart with more option parking. here is more best facility with sitting area.

Name: JaipurAbhiraj
Title: good gardden
Review: This garden is adjoining to Birla auditorium and Birla planetarium ,you will see  world tallest flag of india in garden.Its also near to rajmandir,Here in morning you will find crowd of locals public , longest jogging track is there in garden also a mandir is there which is also very old. This park should be included in local jaipur sight seen

Name: CIRCLETS
Title: ANOTHER BEAUTIFUL PARK IN INDIA.
Review: Loved this park, we walked around and took photos and enjoyed the views from the park, The little squirrels were so playful. We were able to sit down on the grass and relax and just absorb the surroundings.

Name: abhimanyushah
Title: Great for walks
Review: It is a great place for morning walks and evening walks. It is a massive park in the heart of the city.

Name: vivek
Title: Picturesque view...serene environment...lots of greenery...
Review: A wonderful place for a long evening stroll with family and friends...huge area....lush green campus with the tricolour flying high in the centre of the park..Remains open till 9 pm and hence is an apt place for after dinner stroll....üòáüòáüòáüòá

Name: hsdigital
Title: Morning or Night-time visits or strolls .
Review: I passed by Central Park a few times during my sight seeing tour and decided i would look in at some point. My guide informed me that early in the mornings, there are meditation and yoga sessions amongst other such things. This reminded me of the fact that i had seen this on TV and i decided to go in one evening while on my own for a stroll. As with many city parks, one would expect locals of plenty and the usual format. However, as with most of India, there was a fantastic air and "vibe" here. A feeling of both Hippy-Like and regular activity was in flow. It was dark by this time so i could not take in all the activity but the relaxing and spiritual aspect was very much happening for me. Locals couples walked holding hands while others sat or lay on their own attaining peace or reflection.There was life, energy and sound all about but of a kind that one can easily elope into - a mild relaxing atmosphere. It is a great place to go to find a contrast to the general fast moving activity of the city streets and the usual activities. I met some locals here and chatted a while as well as finding a spot to myself simply to wind down in. A good place to take the heat off during the evening.  Well worth a stroll through here if you want to find a laid back spot to chill out in. I did not visit early morning, but will do so next visit.

Name: Marta M
Title: Big, beautiful parc
Review: Nice and pleasant atmosphere although being in the middle of a main road. You can practice yoga every morning for free, go for a walk or just relax.

Name: himangshub0
Title: A Haven
Review: Central Park in the heart of Jaipur is one of the most attractive open spaces available to the people of the city. It is well maintained with lush greenery and excellent walk ways and lawns, Central Park is an ideal place to walk, relax or just sit and watch children playing there or a large variety of birds that can be seen in the countless trees there. It is also the venue for Music in the Park that attracts music lovers in large numbers.Visited April 2016

Name: Vivek Agrawal
Title: Energiser with fresh air
Review: Too motivating place to walk and jog on outer circle of approximately 4.2 Kms.surrounded with dense trees. People running around motivates to take up brisk walk or jog. Weakness is cleanliness and only one clean rest room.

Name: rohitravishankar
Title: Lush green park at the center of the city
Review: This is a great place to go for a long walk. It is a lush green park located at the center of the city. Parking is easily available if you were to drive down.

Name: drgastrokritic
Title: A LUSH GREEN AND HUGE PARK IN THE MIDDLE OF JAIPUR
Review: This is a good place to go for long walks in the center of jaipur. huge lush green area for children to playparking is easily available

Name: Inderpal Singh ... C
Title: Big and Beautifully maintained.
Review: I use to go there in early morning when i got my new car, but its quite big, so i usually become tired after walking too much.

Name: Shailesh09
Title: Morning Walk
Review: The park created by the Raj Govt initially was great and I have visited since. But now the upkeep is very poor. Repair maintenance of certain areas is very poor. Walkways are not maintained properly, new plantation is not done and worst of all there are no flowering plants. Still being in a green area with golf course next to it the place is ideal for morning / evening walks.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: A good place for amateur birders too
Review: If you have been bitten by birding bug recently then you may find this place rewarding to some extent. I found all commonly occurring species of myna- common myna, black-headed myna (Brahminy), rosy pastor, bank myna.& pied myna here. Other birds like Red-vented, Hoopoe, doves, peafowl, tailor bird, black drongo etc are also common. Park is adjacent to Ram Bagh hotel/polo  ground and gold course which together make a rather large patch with scarce building which allows some bird life in area where it is going scarce. Earlier, in C-scheme/Ashok Nagar  locality, where this park is located, Golden oriole & Little minivet could be occasionally seen but now seen very rarely. Even sandpipers could be seen daily at statue circle earlier but now have vanished. The place has parking facilities near all gates and has reasonably well maintained toilets towards west end of park. There are no cafe inside the park which is good in a way.

Name: RajeshBhardwaj
Title: Central Park lush green woodland in City center.
Review: I love to call this big garden Lungs of Jaipur, It located right in middle of the town. More than 6 KM jogging track. Beautiful maintained. I enjoyed the early morning hours in this garden. comfortable parking, Long walk but no repetition of sight. I feel pride when i saw the mighty Indian try color flag it is one the biggest flag in India. Give a feeling of countries strength & power. Now i am waiting for the next music concert organised in the park.  It is a famous evening activity in this park. If you just enjoy the big view of the central garden you can visit near by Tapri restaurant, from roof of the tapri restaurant you will find the long view of the central Park.

Name: GautamAgarwal
Title: Joggers park of jaipur
Review: During my stay in jaipur, I used to go to this place for jogging. Its situated in centre of city and is very near and clean, well maintained. Visit this place if you want to spend some peaceful time with your friends or family.

Name: Indu Abhijeet
Title: really nice place
Review: good place to sit , relax , jog and do internet :-P yes they provide free wi-fi , lush green grounds ,ample parking space and 4 km long jogging track.

Name: gaurav4321
Title: Great park with Largest Indian Tricolour Flag.
Review: this is a very big park and having many parts. in one of the area one can see largest Indian Tricolour flag and you can get delighted if wind waves it. this is good for walking and comfort seekers. overall nice place in Jaipur.

Name: Ashutosh_mehta
Title: Great place for a walk and deer sighting
Review: A green lung and tranquil place where you can go for a walk. Really green with loads of deers and small animals. Good for kids.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Come here to keep with Joneses (of Jaipur)
Review: This place is not a tourist attraction exactly though there is no harm if a tourist includes in its itinerary. People from distant corners gather here in the morning to show their faces to others and to keep with Joneses.  There may be good walking tracks in their localities but it is a park to meet Who's Who of Jaipur. After being health conscious these people ride their cars of two-wheelers to cover small distance, wait for several minutes for elevators or lifts in their office to climb one or two floors and employ servants to do petty physical works. Pretending to be health conscious and being health conscious and integrating physical work for health consciousness are different ball games and majority of visitors of Central Park seems to have mastered the former.

Name: 1969roma
Title: For all the health freaks
Review: All health freaks when travelling to Jaipur Central Park is the place! Amazing 4 plus kilometers of area attached to the golf course ,sitting benches,polo ground! Everything is just perfect in this park!

Name: ANILJOHAR
Title: nice park
Review: It is excellent park very big area. For walking one round is 7 km. People comes for morning walk & they love while walking & jogging, nice green ground.

Name: Arpit Agarwal
Title: Gyan Museum- Must Visit Once
Review: The museum is a tribute to Late Mr. Gyan Chand Dhaddha. It has varieties of Textiles, Mughal Rugs depicting the entire hunting scene- the rarest! All over amazing experience, You can spend as much time you want :)

Name: Nagendra Singh
Title: Visiting Experience
Review: Suppose a theatre, event or an exhibition selling tickets or asking for appointments before the visit. And you discover the tickets/appointments are needed to be taken before the visit as well. Also, you are not sure on what grounds these are approved. Nonetheless, you go through a booking process with no revert from the other side. And travel more than 25 KMs to reach the destination just to discover that it is not open for visitors.I mean respecting your visitors time should be of utmost importance. You have a website that can show your schedule or critical information right? Use it then. Why a visitor could select a date of appointment on a date when no visitation is allowed. What kind of experience is that?

Name: Turkoosi
Title: Amazing beauty
Review: This private collection of different cultural items from India is just amazing, collected with exquisite taste. The architecture of the museum is really beautiful, modern and simple, designed for the collection to give the best impression of it. We had also pleasure to meet the son of collector and have nice lunch in the garden.

Name: arpanmehra
Title: Something different
Review: It's very rare that you see museums in India, that too so well kept. The art and craft will make your experience great. If you want to do something different in Jaipur, this is a must visit if it suits your taste.

Name: 919lz
Title: Absolutely wonderful - A must see in Jaipur
Review: Discretely hidden in an industrial area in the South of Jaipur, the Gyan museum is a perfect place to visit, away from the uproar near the city‚Äôs monuments. First, I have been impressed by the modernity of the architecture, and then stunned by the amazing collection of impressively well-conserved artefacts from all over the world, sometimes dating as far as from the 17th century.The atmosphere inside is very intimate. I have been given a private tour of the museum, so that I got to learn about India‚Äôs exceptional craftmanship (silver craft, textile, painting‚Ä¶). It was fascinating!It was a very unique experience, that I recommend to whoever comes to visit Jaipur.

Name: meetkabir
Title: A great way to start your day
Review: If you are someone who gets captivated with art, craft and gets lost into this unchartered terrain then Gyan Museum is surely going to entice you with it's fine collection and leave you in awe of things.I personally loved the collection of Hookah mouth pieces, watches and Glasses. It spoke its own story and how these would be priced possession since they would have interacted the most with the collector.The distinguishing feature among all the museum visits and this visit was the personal touch. Since we had someone to guide and lead us and it totally added to the entire experience.

Name: Dan F
Title: Truly Beautiful and Intriguing - A Unique Experiance
Review: The Gyan museum is the repository of the collections of Gyan Dhaddha, founder of Gyan Jewelry.  Mr. Dhadda had an eclectic set of interests and a specific and particular taste level.  In other words, he was one of those rare individuals who has a great "eye" for the unique, the unusual, the beautiful.  His collecton ranges from the world's largest collection of hookah stems, to watches, to georgeous tapestries, to objects d'art, crafts, and paintings.  His collection was sourced from all over the world, but mostly India and Asia. This is an adult venue, I was fascinated, but I can imagine that teens, and certainly younger, would be unexcited.  For the adults it was a wonderful and worthwhile use of a couple of hours.  The building itself is unique, and the exhibit space has been meticulously designed and beautifully executed.  Fascinating.

Name: Sm0uli
Title: A great museum experience
Review: Situated in the Industrial  district in Jaipur this museum is worth the visit if you happen to be in Jaipur. Unique private collection of Mr Gyan and housed in a space that is designed superbly well and aesthetically very pleasing . Harneet who is the person incharge of showing us around was well informed about the collections.Appointments to be made prior to the visit. Must see for sure.

Name: idahosail
Title: amazing collection in boutique museum
Review: If you are a serious about museums and want a unique and intimate visit to a museum with Indian and foreign artifacts from the 17th-19th centuries (and more), this place is for you. Based on the personal collections of Mr. Gyan Chand Ji Dhaddha, the gallery is a mind-blowing presentation of artwork, textiles, jewels, metalwork, game pieces, and much more. If you want to visit its best to fill out their inquiry form on the website to get a timeslot.The small but amazingly detailed paintings on rice paper were our favorite. Ms Harneet gave us a personal tour and filled in the back story to many items, both the item itself and/or the mythology behind the art.We spent two hours there to get a full appreciation of the presented collections.If you are also interested in custom jewelry, its worth a visit. There is no requirement to buy, or even to visit the show room, its a soft sell. The company sells most of its jewelry wholesale. But they (sons and grandson) are building brand recognition. If I wasn't retired and we were still accumulating jewelry we would have spent more time in the showroom, the work is exquisite.

Name: Nina8OS
Title: Absolutely stunning
Review: Wow what a museum and collection. From the moment of arrival as you enter the building in the middle of an industrial estate on the outskirts of Jaipur you can‚Äôt help but to be blown away! First the architecture of the building is stunning and just perfect to house the amazing collection of treasures collected by this family. To be also shown their jewellery workshops was so fascinating and what an amazing company and experience this is. We were lucky enough to be shown around by Harneet Kaur, their marketing and communications manager and her knowledge and insight made the whole experience all the more fantastic. A must see place for all to see if you love and appreciate beautiful objects, architecture, amazing jewellery and a stunning collection of treasures.

Name: sahil b
Title: Gyan museum
Review: This is a must good place which art culture history together.a place with incredible architecture and soothing ambience. this place has some amazing art effect and a great place to go for which include masterpieces from history and some amazing text  which can be a great part of learning

Name: Anthony H
Title: Incredibly unique museum experience
Review: Located in a random industrial area on the outskirts of Jaipur, this museum is in an amazing designed building specifically created to hold the collection of gems and artifacts. Because we were the only visitors on the day we were there, we had a private tour of the entire collection. There is a cool synergy between the collection and the physical space. If you're into architecture this place is a worth a visit to see the building alone. Really unique experience that most travelers to Jaipur still don't know about.

Name: Travelbugged1
Title: A must see in Jaipur.
Review: This place is truly a hidden gem! Hard to find but when you do, it is totally worth it. This beautifully designed space. Our visit was elegantly conducted and was very educational.It was an honour to access the curated museum. We saw the factory and the skilled craftsmen at work. You could feel the vibe, the passion and the sense of aesthetics of the founder. A man of taste who you can discover through the visit. The brand is full of heritage and vision translated into the collection which they make with the most personalised experience. This is probably my favourite place in India, just because of the amount of thinking and style that has gone into making this space and designing the experience. Harneet the Marketing executive isa true professional and really represents the brand. Thank you thank you!

Name: Nitza
Title: A Treasure Trove in the Sitapura Industrial Area, 30 Minutes from Jaipur Center
Review: At a first glance, from the road, Gem Place seems like any other industrial building. That is, until you have the opportunity to enter the premises, open its doors, and then witness  this beautiful high tech and yet intimate museum.  Harneet from the marketing team welcomed me and gave me an optional tour of the manufacturing facility before she took me to the first floor and opened that huge door. WOW. The collection begun by Mr. Gyan Chand Dhaddha is stunning. The 17th century jeweled hookah mouthpieces were unique. The textiles and old jewelry were my favorites. I left with a goodie bag as well! The 20 to 30 minute drive is absolutely and totally worth it. Please note it is best to make reservations.

Name: amrita1308
Title: A hidden gem in Jaipur Industrial area
Review: Gyan Museum  is a stunning example of how one man's pursuit of knowledge can become a source of collective learning. The museum houses over 2,500 treasured pieces, which he amassed during his lifetime including textiles, paintings, antique jewellery, vintage spectacles, rare inscriptions and objet d'art from around the world. A tribute by his sons, Suresh and Arun Dhaddha, the museum is a signature concept by French designer Paul Mathieu and is a must visit when in Jaipur!!

Name: aparna p
Title: Peace and passion
Review: Jaipur's riot of colours and crafts can often overwhelm the senses. Gyan Museum provides a refreshing change, with it's minimalist, contemporary design. The collection is amazing; from paintings to jewellery, objets d'art and massive textiles and it's incredible how this is all the work of one man. It's a joy to spend an afternoon pottering around the very chic space. Do pop by the Gem Plaza boutique next door. It's all the luxury and gorgeousness you expect of Jaipur, minus the 'noise'.

Name: rashmi s
Title: Gyan museum is an experience in itself given its assemblage, display & architecture.
Review: Gyan museum is beautiful tribute to celebrate Mr. Gyan Chand's love for art, culture and appreciation; constructed by his sons. As humbling is his mammoth collection so is the warmness of his family and entire staff. The pursuit of excellence is very much visible in both the museum and his family owned factory 'Gem Plaza'. A must visit gem of Jaipur.

Name: JMH252
Title: A Real Treasure of a Museum Located in Sitapura
Review: I booked this visit directly with the museum before I travelled to Jaipur and I was not disappointed. Around 20-25 minute drive from central Jaipur. A very insightful tour led by Harneet. I thought the collection was wonderfully curated and the museum itself is really atmospheric and beautiful. A real eclectic collection which obviously inspires the beautiful jewellery currently handcrafted by Gyan Jewels which has its workshop onsite too.  I was lucky enough to view a selection of their current creations, some of them a modern take on Indian classics. Superb visit, thoroughly recommended.

Name: Heartfelt56
Title: WONDERFUL SURPRISE IN SITAPURA
Review: Such an amazing gallery with beautiful objects collected by this amazing man and exhibited beautifully by his family. I loved my time exploring everything with the very welcoming Harneet who shared her knowledge with me. Also a very lovely cappucino for morning tea. I will be back!

Name: nehaasthana
Title: Experiential Museum In Jaipur, India
Review: Hello Everyone, I am completely in awe to write a short note for wonderful work curated by Dhaddha family in memory of their father late Mr. Gyan Chand Dhaddha. Gyan museum is a wonderful walk into contemprory art curated by artist around the globe and collectiables from families private collection. I am a design & fashion educationist and had a lot of enthusisum to visit the museum and I must say it was beyond our expectation. The family run gem business was an add on offered to our group of students and their hospitality was inexpressible. Cannot put together in words the kindness and passion of the family which has produced a fine collection from jewels, clothing, gracious mouth peices, a pvt. gallery & library. It is truly gracious and the infrastructure of the museum is extremely classy. A must do while you are in Jaipur. Thank you for having us over & best wishes to Team Gyan Museum.
