Name: Rakesh S
Title: Mata temple
Review: Temple of the time of maharajas situated in Nahargarh fort Jaipur. Temple is worth visiting as a tourist apart from the divine location

Name: macedonboy
Title: Worth visiting when in Amber Fort
Review: The Shila Mata Mandir is a Hindu temple inside Amber Fort and is renowned for the statue of Durga in the sanctum Sanctorum. You can easily spot the temple because it‚Äôs got a star shaped fountain just in front of the entrance. Worth visiting when in Amber Fort, but it‚Äôs probably a better experience for devotees.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Very ancient temple of Ma Shila Devi
Review: This is the temple Of Kuldevi of Jaipur Royal Family. She is worshipped every day and special prayers are offered whenever a new important work has to be started. Highly revered by devotees of all backgrounds. You feel blessed after paying homage to this temple.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Devi
Review: This holy temple is dedicated to kul devi of jaipur royal family and located inside the Amber fort..

Name: Umang A
Title: Holy
Review: This temple is located inside Amber fort and dedicated to Kul Devi of Jaipur royal dynasty.. nice place to call your soul and offer prayers.

Name: One_of_the_BOFs
Title: Temple within Am(b)er Fort
Review: This was the first place we visited within the fort proper i.e. beyond the large courtyard. We were in good time for the 10am service which was interesting (& loud). Certainly worth a brief visit given its historical significance.

Name: Verchasv
Title: Establish by King Mansingh
Review: The Sheela Devi Temple is located inside the Amer Fort, Jaipur Raja  Mansingh established the temple in 16th century, in festive time of navratra there are  look likes Mela of the Shila Mata, this palace is so Holly, the attractive of tourist palace. There are free parking the temple is open 6 a.m. to 12 p.m. and 4 p.m. to 8 p.m. Dev entry fees only for 10 rupees.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The temple atop the hill of Amer !
Review: This temple is the deity of Shimla Devi - reigning Goddess for the royals here in Amer before you enter the Palace of Amer . The temple is historic . There is common ticket for the palace as well here . There dress code here , camera / footware are not allowed here . Generally crowded during all hours - more crowded at the time of Navaratri festival time . Timing as are same as the Amer fort visiting times .

Name: Dr Manoj Swaminathan
Title: Lots of historical importance
Review: The temple Goddess is considered to be extremely powerful, and had lots of historical importance. One can also find a standing statue of lord Ganesha.

Name: Umang A
Title: Matarani...
Review: Durga Mata was worshipped by warriors as she is Devi of Shakti(power). This temple is located inside Amber fort and must visit... Guide is useful here.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Marvelous White marble and Coloring
Review: This temple is situated with in the Amber Fort, as I mentioned in the review of Amber Fort, it will be very useful to have a guide. This temple has  a Hindu Goddess, I am told this place is still alive and all poojas were held. It is nice to see the art work (Sculpture) on the white marble. I am told some of the marbles were brought from Italy. This place is fabulous don't miss it.

Name: RedLichtie65
Title: Part of Amer Fort
Review: Another impressive temple. Part of the Amer Fort. I suggest taking a guide to get the most out of your trip to the fort, otherwise its just another old building. The history brings it to life!

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: Powerful deity
Review: Shila Devi temple is within the main premises of Aber fort. Devotees from all parts of the country and abroad come here for blessings of powerful deity of Devi Maa. During Navaratri festival you will not find an inch of place on account of very large number of visitors. You are not allowed to take with you inside the temple anything made of leather. Must put off your shoes outside the temple and also must cover your head. Photography is strictly prohibited.

Name: AAA
Title: Attractive
Review: Shila devi temple is very large and is very attractive. Location is great. The place to look for. Recommended.

Name: KomillaS
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Shila Devi temple in the heart of Amber Fort. The deity Shila Devi was worshiped by the Maharajas of Jaipur and local people come to worship the goddess Tourist will need to take off their shoes and no photography is allowed. Tourists need to be aware it is a sacred placeWe found the experience very powerful as we reached in to me for morning Arati - it is a must for the spiritual traveler The temple is carved in white marble and is exquisite , very quiet, spiritually powerful Lovely experience

Name: Jagdish W
Title: Feeling Blessed....
Review: Its very nice temple inside the Amergadh Fort, Felt blessed along with my wife... One of the best part to start your days first site visit with god's darshan....

Name: Globaltravelers12
Title: Fascinating palace and temple
Review: Go visit it - not to be missed   The palace is magical as is the old temple with its stories -- skip the elephant rides inside the palace compound

Name: Sweta P
Title: Lovely Temple
Review: It is lovely Temple and maintained also good, many people are coming to visit, much traffic in weekends and holidays.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Very beautiful temple
Review: This temple is inside Amer Fort. Very good architecture. Filled with locals daily. People donate wine inside for the Goddess. That was an uh-oh moment for me. But that's ok. Everyone has their own traditions.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Small but perfectly formed. Considerable significance for locals. Decorative and meaningful. Good way to start your visit to Amber Fort.

Name: Babbal
Title: Jai Maa kali
Review: Maa kali with tilted head is the only idol i think in world..........it is centuries old and is divine.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Holy place...
Review: It is a very old temple of goddess Kali. It is situated inside the Amber Fort. It is very holy place for Japurites. Too much crowded in Navratri's.

Name: Nandita Nayak Kattengere
Title: A small beautifully carved Kali temple
Review: The history of this temple is very interesting. The board on its outside wall surmises it. The rulers of Rajasthan seem to have been god fearing with belief in astrologers & palmists.A beautiful clean compact temple with a glowing idol. Extremely positive vibes within its welcoming walls. If its not crowded, a calm place to silently meditate. Inside the Amber Fort after a climb of a few stone steps. You have to take off your hat, socks, shoes, any item made of leather.... belt/wallet etc. & leave it outside. Risky if its your wallet outside on its own. Our tour guide Mr.Manoj Sharma took care of our belongings. He was English speaking, knowledgeable, patient, explained everything in an unhurried manner, answered all our questions, took nice pics of us at strategic spots in the fort.

Name: minimize940314
Title: For local people
Review: It is an active hindu temple where many local people visit and pray. The temple is devoted to Shila. It is inside of Amber Fort.

Name: Anupam18
Title: Local Deity of Jaipur
Review: The Mandir, very serene is part of the Amber fort. It has a separate entrance and one does not need a ticket to visit the Mandir. The Mandir, of Kali, is said to be the protector of Jaipur city. Many lores are associated with the Mandir. You will find peace. It is said all your wishes get answered here. Must visit time permitting. Stay blessed

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: A place tof trust and faith
Review: well located. Many tourist also visit this place. Well maintained and a place worth visiting.It is little away from city and so on week ends and holidays  many people visit

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Shila Devi Temple
Review: Shila Devi Temple is beautiful  spiritual place of Jaipur. this temple is located in Amer Fort. Good one.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The presiding Deity of the Royals of the ! city
Review: This temple is the seat of the presiding Deity Goddess  Shila Devi of the founders and rulers of the city of  jaipur . Situated within the premises of the famous Amer Fort after you reach the main courtyard at entrance of the fort . There is a dress code , no footware , no cameras , generally very crowded on all days and slow moving line of the devotees takes time for Darshan. Traditionally there used to be an offerting of the animal here which has been discontinued nowadays . Faithfully gone here during the

Name: Raman_4
Title: "Good in heaven "
Review: Shila Devi temple is just situated inside the amber FORT ,it's the most famous and we'll known temple in the whole Jaipur . You will experience the inner peace as soon as you enter the temple . Just whenever you are here in Jaipur and come to see the amber FORT do visit this temple because it will give you a refreshing and a very positive evergy as you go inside .Love this place and the experience .Highly recommended.

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Sacred place for the Royal Family the deity image was brought to Amber from Jessore presently in Bangladesh.
Review: There is a place in Amber Fort where they are very strict about prohibiting photography. They will make you remove your shoes and deposit your camera and phone and then only one can enter this beautiful temple which was sacred to the Royal Family. It is believed that the image of Goddess Kali, also called Mahisasur Mardini was brought by Sawai Man Singh II from Jessore now in Bangladesh after defeating him in 1605 AD..The entrance to the temple is through a double door covered in silver with a raised relief. The main deity inside the sanctum is flanked by two lions made of silver. The image of Sila Devi has been carved out of one single stone slab. At the entrance to the temple, there is also a carving of Lord Ganesha, which is made out of a single piece of coral.It is a beautiful temple.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Shila Devi Temple ‚Äì The famous temple situated in the Amber Fort Complex
Review: Shila Devi Temple is a very old temple, houses the idol of Goddess Durga (Shila Mata), situated in the Amber Fort complex. The temple is carved with attractive stone work and the doors of the temple are decorated with magnificent silver work. It is believed that the statue of the Goddess Shila Mata  was brought by Maharaja Man Singh from Jessore (now in Bangladesh), during the end of 16th century.

Name: Lara_Larissa2014
Title: Very nice Temple
Review: The Temple of Goddess Shilla is located in Fort Amber and is really unique temple, holy place that gift you special feeling

Name: Nikhil192
Title: Nice place
Review: Shila Devi Temple is located in Amber fort campus. it's construction is very nice. This place is very important in Amber fort.

Name: kalpajeetbhattachary
Title: Shila Devi Temple, Amber Fort, Jaipur
Review: This temple is as old as the amber fort... about 400 years. Situated inside the Amer Fort the temple has a picturesque route. Maharaja Mansingh brought the statue of the Goddess Durga (Shila Mata) from Jessore, now in Bangladesh and installed here.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Holy place
Review: This Shila Devi Temple was built in Amber Fort . Construction of Shila Devi Temple is nice.  In this temple photography is prohibited.but nice place to visit.

Name: plpalani
Title: Temple complex within the fort
Review: This temple is as old as the amber fort... about 400 years.This Devi, a incarnation of Kali apparently was brought from Kolkata when the then King married a Bengali princess.The door is made of silver and the temple is mostly of marble.

Name: taruna k
Title: Temple inside the fort
Review: This is a small temple built inside the Amber Fort. The temple is for worshiping the goddess Durga. The idol was brought by Raja Mansingh 1. The idol is built on one stone slab which in Hindi is called as Shila.

Name: DevonLioness
Title: Wonderful little temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to the goddess Kali and is probably often missed by Western tourists, however it is well worth the visit. No photography is allowed inside but there are lovely images of the goddess in her 'dark' (don't misinterpret this description as 'evil') form as Kali and also as one of her more benign forms, the goddess Lakshmi (good fortune). If you go to up to the shrine of the goddess, you will be blessed by the priests and given a garland of marigolds to wear round your neck. You may also be given a tikka (red dot in the centre of your forehead). Please remember to give a donation for the upkeep of the temple - 100 rupees (just over ¬£1 at current exchange rate) is about right. One of the highlights of our visit to the Amber Fort.

Name: Swanay
Title: Temple inside Amer fort.
Review: Its the only temple established inside Amer fort located near the main entrance of the Fort once you reach the Courtyard.Strictly no photography is permitted here.Also no leather belts or bags are allowed.But inside the temple there are beautiful carvings on the wall.

Name: Morashen A
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Shila Devi temple is located in amber fort, lots of similar forts are nearby. Car are not allowed from the base of the fort to the peak hence they have jeeps to ferry us to the peak which will cost 400RS per jeep. from 8 to 10 am the amber fort management will be playing the drums to welcome the guest as a ritual from olden days and lots of hawkers will be bugging you to buy the souvenirs and crafts. Some even claims they have sandal wood statues and etc so dont get carried away. the more you say o the more cheaper the product goes. I manage to buy 14 small wood craft for RS 500 which he initially said  5 for RS1000.

Name: Dr Tarvadi P
Title: Simple but Very soothing
Review: Timing in evening after 4 pm.Very nice temple, with a magnificient goddess image. During diwali it very crowded, we were lucky to see it peacefully. Worth a visit

Name: Jyotsna308
Title: a beautiful temple of godess shila
Review: situated near Amer Fort the temple has a picturesque route.the temple is of high religious belief and cultural importance

Name: Venkatesh6660
Title: Mata temple inside the Amber fort
Review: A very old temple built inside the Amber Fort premises.  The entire temple is made of marble and very clean and neat.

Name: karthik p
Title: Temple on Amer fort
Review: Its a beautiful place. But is not significant when compared to the major attractions of jaipur. Jaipur has so much to offer other than this.

Name: pghadamli
Title: A TEMPLE FOR RELAXING
Review: this temple is part of amber fort and located on a hill.here is very old and unfortunatly monkeys are albatross.but regardless here is very nice place and you can have relaxing time.

Name: Manish Sehgal
Title: One of the must visit places in Jaipur
Review: This temple is situated just outside the Amber fort, and one should definitely plan to visit the same whenever you are visiting Jaipur. The major thing to notice in the temple is the standing idol of Lord Ganesha.The major thing to be aware of is the monkeys and if your kids are carrying Prasad, i suggest you take it from them or else monkeys would come and snatch it.

Name: IndianHippi
Title: Holy place
Review: I have been a regular visitor of this place and get lot of peace visiting this.its located within Amber fort, one visiting Amber fort, must  make an attempt to go here too.

Name: MKBhatnagar
Title: Mata Jinka Naam Pukare Wo Kismat Wale Hote Hai
Review: Shila Devi Temple is one of the best tourist place. Its is very old place and the king of Jaipur "Mansingh" ji brought this statue of Goddess and established here.   The temple is situated on the hill which can be visited by Car, Elephants or walking through staircases.People have blind faith in the temple and they worship regularly visit and worship in the temple irrespective of their religion. In the time of Navratra, it is fully covered with the large number of people but controlled systematically.    The place is worth seeing and should not be missed at any cost. There are a lot more gardens and many other tourist places near by. Amber itself has more than hundreds temples of different religions.

Name: sargunarao
Title: Blessed
Review: We visited Sheila Devi temple in Amber Fort in March. We are blessed to received abundance blessing from the God and wa overhelmed when the priest present us with beautiful fresh flowers garlands. Blessings to cherish

Name: Crysalys2210
Title: Unbelievably amazing place to visit
Review: We visited the Amber Fort on our Golden Triangle fully escorted private tour to India in March 2015. It is another amazing temple of many on this trip. These building are awesome. If you are thinking of going, do not hesitate, you will not be disappointed. I would return in a heartbeat.

Name: BigbossGoa
Title: apart from history, nothing much
Review: here every day one narbali was given in the old days. apart from this history, there is nothing much to see here. its on the right hand side while you proceed towards ganesh pole of amer fort.

Name: Shubhang M
Title: Very holy place
Review: very beautiful Mata temple inside the amber temple , open in very special occasions , easy to reach here but wait in queue in case of crowd.

Name: Praneet S
Title: temple inside Amer fort
Review: This temple is located inside the Amer Fort. Be careful of your belongings, specs and prasad as the monkeys are ready to pounce on anything.

Name: rohitravishankar
Title: Shila Devi temple
Review: The Shila Devi temple is located in the Amber fort complex. The place closes at 12 pm and reopens only at 4pm, so, it is advisable to visit this place before 12pm or after 4pm.

Name: Mir41ka
Title: peaceful
Review: The temple was nice but small, as I was expecting to be bigger. Good to visit and bring flowers or sweets and of course pray !!! no photos can be taken

Name: SHDD
Title: kali temple in amber fort
Review: At entrance to the palace near the forts Ganesh gate, there is a temple of Kali. The silver entrance doors to the small kali temple from 16th century to 1980 when it was banned due to a goat being scarified here daily. When in the amber fort one can visit this temple and sought blessings if you wish. Well you have to remove shoes and leather belts before entering temple like any other temple.  Temple is closed between 12 TO 4pm.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Shila Devi is Goddess Kali, also spelled as Sila Devi
Review: It is temple of Kali. It gets Shila devi name as the King got it carved from a rock (rock is known as Shila in Hindi language). Darshan open from 5.00 AM  till 1200 noon except for half an hour between 1030 to 1100 AM when rajbhog (food) is offered. The temple is closed for shayan (sleep) of Goddess between 1200 noon to 4.00 PM. Later at night the darshan close at 8.00 PM. There is very good marble carving inside temple. One is not allowed to take camera, mobile, leather articles (wallets, belt etc) inside the temple. The head of Goddess is tilted towards her right and a hearsay explains reason for this. According to it she tilted her head to her displeasure when animal sacrifice was stopped and she was offered vegetarian food. There is a place for sacrifice downstairs in Jaleb chowk, which is enclosed with iron rod fence. According to hearsay initially even humans were sacrificed which was replaced later by buffalo and then goat. I dont believe this story since sacrifice stopped sometime in 1970s and head of Goddess was tilted even prior to that.

Name: Saurabh S
Title: A must visit
Review: if you are visiting Amer fort,make sure to visit the temple in the couyard. it has a fascinating history. not only tourists , local people also visit regularly to pay respects to Goddess Shakti ,residing as Shila (Rock) Devi.

Name: Jackie B
Title: Fascinating Story
Review: We thoroughly enjoyed our guided tour and felt the sorrow of the of the story of shah Jahan who after having built the Taj Mahal was imprisoned there by his son and could view that beautiful monument every day

Name: Tony S
Title: A must see if you are already at Amber Fort
Review: No visit to Amber Fort is complete without a visit to Shila Devi Temple. It is a peaceful, large and well maintained temple with many beautiful features and wonderful open spaces and gardens.

Name: Rakesh S
Title: A matter of faith
Review: Shila Devi temple is dedicated to the Goddess Shakti or Parvati, who presides over this temple in the form of a Rock or Shila. Hence the name.Located inside the Amber Fort complex, there was a tradition of sacrificing animals at this temple which seems to have been stopped since.

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: amazing temple
Review: th ambience of the temple is really great.. u really feel at peace. the temple is well maintained and beautiful.

Name: omkar h
Title: Well maintained
Review: Clean and well maintained temple premises inside the Amer fort complex. History associated it to be known.

Name: nitsj76
Title: Beautiful temple at Amer
Review: Visited the Shila Devi temple during recent trip to Jaipur.This beautiful temple is dedicated to Goddess Kali and is located inside the Amer Fort. It's a good detour during the visit to the fort and takes about half an hour. Photography of course is not allowed once inside the temple.Used to be frequented by the Royal ladies of Amer in the days gone by. Has retained its essence and spirutuality even onto this date

Name: Shomi S
Title: Well maintained Kalimata mandir inside Amber fort
Review: Even though the place was overcrowded as we visited at Sunday, it was a nice place to visit. Being a Bengali, Kalimata is one of our favorites and we really loved the temple. The inside marble work (which was done later) is really good.

Name: Rao Shivraj Inayati
Title: Divinity with heritage...!!
Review: A temple of Godess Kali in heritage fort Amber, paneled with intricately carved marble panels. Remember leather purse/belts are not permitted inside. Avoid morning hours, you may face traffic jam, due to heavy rush of tourists.Temple is closed at 12 noon till evening.

Name: Dee-Passionate-Wanderer
Title: Old Temple
Review: The temple of Shila Devi is inside the Amber / Amer fort. This is maintained by the royal family. The insides of this temple too is very decorative and beautiful.

Name: gsubramaniyam
Title: Navratra Darshan
Review: The legend says that the statue in this temple was bestowed as a blessing to the ruler Raja Man Singh and as per history there was a human sacrifice everyday however at some point in time the human sacrifice was stopped and animal sacrifice started wherein the Goddess statue's head tilted.

Name: Youngguy
Title: Highly worshipped Deity in Jaipur
Review: Shila Devi Temple is highly worshipped Deity of Jaipur Royal Family and Kachawa Rajputs of Jaipur.Temple is located in Amber Fort ,religious people must visit if travelling to Amber Fort. Managed by Royal Family of Jaipur

Name: Manish B
Title: Temple inside of fort
Review: Dedicated to maa durga,the temple is inside of amber fort jaipur. Durig Navratri the temple is open till late night for public and in normal days one can visit during regular timings.

Name: Ravindra Nath Pareek
Title: Heavenly Experience
Review: ampus as personal temple of Rulers of Jaipur where Goddess Durga's diety, brought from Jessore Bangladesh by the king,Sawai Man Singh Ist of Jaipur.As blessing given by the Godess in dream to king, this statue was recovered as SHILA(in Hindi) or Slab (in english).Shakti cult of Hindus have very special faith in diety of Maa Kali.Immaculate workmanship of 18th Century is excellent.Elegantly carved pillars are point of attraction among architect of temple. Navratra pooja is very special occasion fr this temple.  Temle timings are-6-12 am and 4-8pm.Preist serves Prasadam of wine but people who doesnt use it can ask for simple Charnamrit.Leather items like belt, wallet,camera cover or ladies purse,hand bags of leather are not allowed inside temple.

Name: kapurash
Title: Shila Devi temple @ Amer
Review: The Shila Devi temple is situated inside the Aamer Fort complex just before the Ganesh Pol gateway.Its a serene place and used to serve as the main place of worship for the Kings and other royalty. If wanting to see this place from inside, it's important to note its opening & closing times, else one could be disappointed to fine the temple closed.Also, no photography is allowed in the temple precincts

Name: A-Chaudhari
Title: Heavenly Experience....
Review: This temple is amazing. The statue of goddess is having two believes. One is that it is given to king for victory over bengal and second is that king received it in form of stone (sheela). They also serve alcohol as prasad. You have to remove shoes, belt,socks and camera outside

Name: triptworld
Title: jai mata di
Review: its a temple situated in amer fort.. very beautiful and religious and historical rich too. its a godess dakshin Kali temple.

Name: Prashant D
Title: Temple in Amber Fort
Review: This is a part of Amber Fort/Palace, so in included in the visit.The guide told me that it was a Kali Mata temple and the idol was brought from Bangladesh. The worship of the idol happens in the mornings and whenever the royalty visits the palace.There is a large Ganesha statue outside the temple, on the temple walls.There are security cameras around and you cannot take pictures there. The temple was closed, so didn't get a chance to see the idol.

Name: 1Travelmum
Title: Nice stop before entering Amber palace
Review: We stopped here prior to entering the palace.  The details were beautiful. We were presented with floral necklaces. It was interesting to see the offerings that people were bringing.

Name: Mariana B
Title: Devine
Review: This was my first and only temple while in India. I have become more and more interested in Hinduism during our trip. The moment I walked in I was overpowered with so many different strong feelings, tears in my eyes, a peaceful warmth in my heart.

Name: ANILJOHAR
Title: This temple is in Amber Fort
Review: This is temple of Goddess Devi Durga this temple is in the Amber Fort. History shows The King of Jaipur Man Singh Ji brought Shila Devi from Afganistan. Man Singh Ji  & Shila Devi talk with each other. I can say if you go to jaipur you should not miss Shila Devi Temple you must visit there but ask the time what time temple is open for devoties.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The city deity of jaipur
Review: If you are in jaipur - it is must visit holy place . Generally crowded like any touristy place - it has the magic of the divine .

Name: Himmat B
Title: Divine Blssings
Review: The temple has a lot of following and the best time to visit the temple 0700 hrs in the morning to 0900 hrs. The earlier the better if you want to beat the crowds. This is one of those temples where liquor is offered as Prasad. Devotees can also organize to offer Kheer to all who visit. The temple organises the Kheer Offering.

Name: KLE2013
Title: The Silver Doored  temple in the Amber Fort
Review: On the right side of the main entrance to Amber Fort is the Shila Devi Temple with its ornately carved silver doors.  Open only to worshipers on the day of our visit, we were not able to view the interior with its silver oillamps, pillars carved to look like banana trees and the famous stone image of the goddess Kali.

Name: BhoopathiVizag
Title: good temple
Review: At the entrance of Amer Fort. Will be closed at 12:00 noon. The family diety of royal family. Shila means stone so the name. The history will be depicted at the temple. Photography not allowed.

Name: Tanwani
Title: A nice temple for evening hours
Review: This temple is situated in a fort complex which is made completely of hard stones. Its quite an old temple and the sunset is seen here at its best. I loved the place of its architecture and the sunset view from this temple. A must go in the evening hours but before sunset.

Name: Ysa T
Title: Very Friendly Caretaker
Review: Stopped by this temple to take photos. Caretaker welcomed us to view the temple. Need to remove shoes to enter so be prepared.

Name: Selwyn Kaumaya
Title: Pictures
Review: It was closed and could not make pictures of the magnificent silver door. But at some point there were no-one so I had my picture :)

Name: Ruchi M
Title: "Beautiful temple"
Review: This temple is in Amer fort,very nice temple and fort,so many people come there to darshan and very crowded in navratra.

Name: Ruby S
Title: Historical Temple!!
Review: Visit to the Amer fort was successful by entering this temple. This temple has its great historical value. One must visit while visiting the fort. There is no entry fees for the temple.

Name: vivekjaipur460
Title: holy and grand
Review: always a very holy and grand temple. the walk on the hill is enjoyable with the lake and surrounded by hills and amber fort, grand old royal temple that emits a lot of energy. awesome.

Name: vivek k
Title: Must know the history before u visit this place
Review: A great temple to explore. It is inside amber fort and u dont hav to pay anything to see this. Beware of the monkeys as u go up towards the temple door. And u hav to leave all your leather stuff outside the door, like shoes, belt, wallet etc. we went inside around 5pm and were lucky to see the evening "aarti".. U will be amazed when u see the entry doors of the temple made of silver and many more things inside all silver...like those big drums

Name: KARAN AHLUWALIA
Title: Temple with immense historical value
Review: The temple can be very very crowded during festive periods like Navaratri. However during non-festive periods, the visits are very peaceful and you can enjoy the holiness and spirituality of the place. The temple was the private temple of the Jaipur royal family. It is inside the Amber fort premises only and to visit it you don't require a ticket (ticket would be required for seeing the fort's other areas though). The temple is at a height and you would need to climb some stairs. You would need to leave outside the temple premises any items made of leather (including your belt), cameras and shoes (luckily they allowed wallets). It can become a problem for someone who is visiting alone (like I was) but the guard at the door promised to look after my belongings for a small fee. If you have interest in history and religion the temple is a must visit.

Name: bizbull
Title: Goddess in full Avataar
Review: Shila Devi (Goddess) Temple is right in there in Amer Fort Complex. A visit to the temple just cannot be avoided specially if you plan to visit Amer Fort (and why would n't you go there if you are on leisure in Jaipur). Goddess - a form of 'Kali' is one of the nine incarnations of the supreme Mother.  My Guide "Bunty" told us that this temple still belongs to the Royal family of Jaipur - not sure whether that is true but temple inspires a myriad of feelings. He also shared that this is a temple where a goat is still sacrificed around 4:00 AM every morning after which goat meat is distributed amongst priests and some portion is sent out to the royal family. Again, I cannot vouch for the same; could just be myth. At the entrance, I confess, I noticed some foreign tourists, in a bit "not sure whether to go in" mood but believe me whether you are a local citizen or other wise, step-in to a wonderful view of the goddess who is claimed to have trampled upon the Lord Shiva in fury & rage. As soon as you sttep in, a lot of history and character of the place almost seizes you. Remember, photography may not be allowed. Preferably try to have your head, legs and arms covered. Goddess' statue is divine; temple complex has statues of other Hindu gods as well including Ganesha. It almost feels like a dip in Ganges in Haridwar or Varanasi; believe me or try out yourself. Oh, BTW, some more useful information at the following links:http://www.google.co.in/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&sqi=2&ved=0CCkQFjAA&url=http%3A%2F%2Fdevasthan.rajasthan.gov.in%2Fimages%2FJaipur%2FShilaDeviji.htm&ei=WfcvUvu0IaTOiAeCoYG4BQ&usg=AFQjCNHGR2UJXDl_pPZq_xriQ8Z1k830bQ&bvm=bv.51773540,d.aGchttp://www.pinkcityroyals.com/Shila_devi_Ji_jaipur.htmP.S. Please note that the photo uploaded here does not represent temple complex but a moment captured while viewing the nearby surroundings.

Name: Amit
Title: World's Largest Cannon of Ancient Era
Review: Travelling with friends, I went to see the Biggest Cannon of the world that has its Abode at the Jaigarh Fort of Jaipur. The cannon has a barrel of 20.2 ft and weighs 50 tonne.  The cannon tears on a  a two-wheeled vehicle and the wheels are about 5ft in diameter. Apart from this, the vehicle also has two removable additional wheels for transport, their diameter is about 9 feet.The cannon has the capacity of being fed with 100 kg of gunpowder with 50 kg shell making it able to fire package load of 150kgs.The cannon was fired only once, with 100 kilograms of gunpowder, and when fired was claimed to have covered a distance of about 35 kilometres. It is said that the projectile fired from it made a small lake in Chaksu.As per the stories doing the rounds and being believed, the impact was so powerful that it actually lived to its words as Weapon of  Mass destruction. The loud noise created by the blow made people deaf and pregnant women suffered miscarriages. Seeing this destruction of large scale it was never used again.  But being a lethal weapon with immense power it was kept in the fort as a backbone. And the Royal family still gets it maintained every year and prays before it once a year by performing the Swastik Pooja. Must visit place as you explore Jaipur. Stay connected as I bring more stories from the Pink city of Forts - Jaipur. Fort timings : 9am to 5pm ticket price : Rs. 100 for Indians  Rs. 200 for foreigners

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: World's largest canon!!
Review: It is the largest canon in the world. We had visited this site along with the family. It's really amazing to feel and see such a huge canon on the mountain top.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Magestic
Review: This Canon is a Majestic piece of Art and Bravery. Its just awesome feeling to see it.A must to see thing in Jaipur. This was my second visit and I loved it.

Name: abrahamsuji
Title: Marvelous
Review: Giant canon. Demonstrates the metalurgical knowledge of ancient Indian artisans. Must visit. Easy access.

Name: Vishal S
Title: Worst fort of Jaipur..Nothing to see..
Review: Worst fort...Please save money and most important your precious time..nothing to see except for dirt and trash...worst is tgat too see this dirt they take rs 70 per head...pls pls avoid this..

Name: Shutterbug_Iyer
Title: The biggest Cannon
Review: If you are visiting Jaigarh fort in Jaipur you are sure to see Jaivana, believed to be the biggest cannon in the world. It was cast by Maharaja Jaisingh II in 1720. Jai Singh II took a keen interest in developing armory and munitions. Perhaps he also wanted to impress his Mughal overlords. The gigantic proportion of the gun is quite impressive. But the size and weight itself would have been a weakness. It was (test) fired only once. Folklore has it that the 50 kg cannon ball traveled 45 kms. Ballistics experts reckon that it would not have been more than 5 kms. Definitely worth ticking the box if you visit Jaigarh.

Name: Charvi_Shah
Title: Famous Canon in the World
Review: This is the famous and strongest canon in the world and it is located at Jaigarh fort I recommend this place who want to see the strongest weapon in ancient time.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: The largest cannon now in Jaigarh!!
Review: Jaivana was the largest cannon of the modern times and one of its speciality other than the humungous size is the ability to move it on wheels. Its simply huge!!

Name: S B Khare
Title: The world's largest cannon
Review: It is situated in Jaigarh fort. This cannon is another incentive to visit Jaigarh fort. Its size is quite impressive. What is also impressive is that it was manufactured in the cannon making factory situated in the fort itself. The cannon was fired only once in its lifetime.

Name: S. Singh
Title: The Jaivana Canon , One of The Largest Canon
Review: Jaivana, the world's largest cannon on wheels at the Jaigarh Fort in Amer, Rajasthan .Ticket - Applicable. Single Ticket is applicable for all Attractions , near JaiGarh FortIf you get Fine and proper Guide Then you have know lot`s of historical and interesting fact about this place . Before Hire Guide please clear That how much area he will cover and which monument will cover , otherwise they will left the monuments and take moneyIt`s Placing is little far one of the side in fort , Steep way , you go via walking or with your cab/ Vehicle and park near the canon . Parking Place is little narrow and steep / slope, so keep safe while ParkingMust Have - Cap/ HAT , Water Bottles , comfortable Shoes  The 50 ton cannon rests on six massive wheels, each 9 ft in circumference. The cannon is 31 ft long with a 20 ft barrel that can be raised or lowered by an 8 ft tall elevating screw.

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Grand
Review: This is worlds largest cannon on wheels in world. This is placed in Fort Jaigarh and worth a visit..

Name: Umang A
Title: Histroy...
Review: This is the largest cannon on wheels in the world. Placed in Jaipgarh fort, which is near to Amber fort.

Name: Alok S
Title: Largest canon on wheel
Review: It is 1/2 an hour visit inside Jaigarh fort.Jaigarh is near to Amber fort. Jaiwana is the largest canon on wheel build in factory (karkhaana) inside Jaigarh fort. The canon was only once used during testing. It requires 100 kgs of gun powder for a shot. Canon ball used in the canon is 50 kgs.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Huge Artillary Gun but used only once
Review: This Artillary Gun was made under the instructions of Maharaja Jai Singh Of Jaipur State. This was considered most powerful during those times and needed an few tons of Gun Powder. When it was tried,the noise made many people deaf because of unbearable noise. After that it is a show piece and is a big tourist attraction.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: Deepak K
Title: Jaivana visit
Review: Good experience to view the world's largest cannon and understand its history. You need a guide or read about it beforehand. Only then it will mean something. Symbol of pride. Needs lots of walking as there are lots of places to take pictures from.

Name: Jatindecent
Title: World's largest cannon on wheels
Review: It's world's largest cannon on wheels situated in jaigarh fort. But it's not that worth that one should visit specially to see it. Seeing Amer fort is enough in Amer.

Name: AkhileshM9800
Title: Fantastic !!
Review: Go and have a look at the world's largest cannon and soak in its history. Something to be proud of !!

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Powerhouse of History
Review: A canon of this magnitude isextremely rare to find in this world . If you come to Jaipur , you must visit this master piece .Amolak Rattan KohliFormer Governor of Mizoram

Name: sid_18052015
Title: world's largest cannon
Review: this is well worth a visit. it is the world's largest cannon and is huge! also notice the beautiful carvings

Name: ashrafazrol
Title: Big Cannon but full of inscriptions.
Review: I must admire the size of this cannot and the tenacity needed to haul it up the hilly fort. Nevertheless, there are inscriptions on the cannon body. I'm not sure if they were some kind of mantra out of religions beliefs or vandalism.

Name: Carl R
Title: Worlds biggest canon!
Review: One of the most interesting parts of the Jaigarh Fort. This canon is truly amazing. The shock wave from this canon was so loud that it killed an elephant! You've never seen a canon this big.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Largest cannon
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, I had visited the Jaigarh Fort and Jaivana is the main attraction of this fort. It is located at the topmost section of the fort and we had walked along an inclined pathway from the fort entrance to reach it. It is the largest canon in the world and when I stood beside it to click a selfie, I found that the height of the canon wheel itself was taller than me i.e. 5 feet 11 inches. One can enjoy breathtaking views of Man Sagar lake on one side and the spectacular Amber Fort on another side from here.

Name: George
Title: The bigeat Canonball
Review: It is said to be the world's biggest canon on wheels. If you have enough time worth the visit. You will enjoy great views towards Jal Mahal.

Name: PatilChinar
Title: Said to be the worlds largest land cannon
Review: It is just a huge cannon in the Jaigargh fort. You won't need more than 45 minutes to see the entire fort and even this cannon.

Name: advance1984
Title: Biggest canon
Review: This is world biggest canon. This is in Jaigarh fort. Canon is very well maintained. View from this place is too good.

Name: Aadhes
Title: great work But a destruction Weapon
Review: This is situated at Jaigarh Fort. Considering the period it was built it was a master piece of a art work but still I feel sorry that they have done a weapon for destruction. If you going to Amber Fort, this place also close by.

Name: Myrddin
Title: surprising
Review: something of a big surprise, this canon is HUGE.  You can see from where it is situated that it would have been a big peace keeper in it's day

Name: Umang A
Title: Yalgar...
Review: Located at Jaipgarh fort.... This is said to be biggest top in world which was only fired once and that too also for testing only...

Name: AAA
Title: Amazing Cannon, Must visit place
Review: There was great pleasure visiting here, the cannon here is magnificent. Cannon is quite big. I was surprised to see. Everyone should definitely visit here.

Name: andysolanki
Title: Biggest in the world
Review: Visited this site and it was unbelieveable the size of this cannon, biggest in the world, although it was only tested and not used in its time. Once again well looked after and preserved.

Name: Sonny S
Title: One BIG Cannon
Review: A cannon that reportedly fires a 50kg shot which can reach up to 34 km. Only ever fired once (so the guide tells me). An amazing piece of military equipment.

Name: David D
Title: Massive old cannon
Review: Thursday 15th February and we visited Jaigarth Fort. The first thing we saw was reportedly the largest cannon in the world, Jaivana, which sits on it's 2 wheel carriage.The barrel of the cannon is very ornate with flowers and animals and birds carved along it. This massive cannon has only been fired once, the sight of it alone would make any attacker run in the opposite direction.From its position on the top of the Fort, there are some incredible views.

Name: Muhammad A
Title: check the view as well!
Review: YOu climb all the way up to see the cannon !Not that it's not worth seeing, being old and having a history behind it, but not a huge deal though. I had cool clicks of the scenery from the top though!

Name: Aneesh S
Title: Cannon..
Review: This formidable piece of weaponry Comissioned by the then royalty..Sawai Jai Singh II is located at the Jaigarh fort in Jaipur.Loaded on a carriage for being carried by elephants,this is the largest mobile cannon in the world with a firing distance of nearly 20-30km.Though showing enormous potential for causing damage,this was never used in war.Also the barrel has intricate designs in the front as well as back.

Name: MarcinDrP
Title: It was tried once...
Review: Cannon that was so powerful that it was used only once and everyone was so afraid that they did not want to try to attack????  Which part of this story is true? ;_)

Name: Jagdish W
Title: Impressive
Review: it was impressive to see the worlds biggest and the only Toph kep at Jaigadh Fort, worth watching however rest of the fort is just Ok ok

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Wow, one must see
Review: The canon is world's largest and unique. Its a short visit in Jaigarh fort but one must see. You can enjoy the fast flowing wind on top of hills in Jaipur.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Nice
Review: This fort has almost all of the different tools as well as those being used in war back in those years, nice collection and must visit.

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: jaivana
Review: its an canon which is asias largest canon kept in jaigarh fort nice to see enjoy with friends an have  pix

Name: Sanjay G
Title: Amazing
Review: The Jaivana canon in Jaigarh fort is an amazing piece of military equipment designed and executed locally.it is said to be one of the largest canons of its kind with a firing range of 22 miles4 elephants were needed to swivel on the axisit has been used only once in history

Name: jonesharma29
Title: Jaivana
Review: Jaivana is amazing place of jaipur here have one of biggest canon of world.dont forget to take a camera

Name: SKulveer
Title: Inspiring place - wonderful views
Review: The Jaivana Cannon in itself is a master-piece; said to be used once and its shell is said to have fallen around 40 kms away (range, almost as much as a modern day Bofors). But the impact was so loud that many people lost their ears and hence it was never used again. Said to be the largest ancient gun in India.Visit this place, also for the views from the ramparts surrounding this Cannon. Don't just stand near the cannon, move around, climb the surrounding wall and see the panaroma all around. Also, the factory of the Jaivana is close to the site; don't forget to see it. Take a good guide along who can explain you the factory, it is worth it.

Name: Arun S
Title: Canon with 22 Miles range
Review: This canon was built to defend the Amer kingdom, had once test fired with 22 miles range, but for good reasons no one attacked Amer and it was never fired again. Its quite interesting to see the canon this big and with a range beyond anyone can see. It is one of the main attraction in Jaigarh fort and included as part of the fort ticket. One can also take his own vehicle all the way up to this canon inside the fort (with additional entry fee), as its bit of walking and climbing some section of the fort. Though we walked to it from the main fort entrance, as i find walking the best way to explore the places.

Name: MaxVentura
Title: World's biggest moving cannon
Review: This was apparently used only once at the same place. Must visit if u r anywhere near Amber fort. The area offers good view also.

Name: Mayank Rawal's L
Title: size does matter
Review: World's biggest canon. very simple design. It has floral design. Ducks, elephant and a pair of peacocks are carved on it. But it was used only once. We heard number of stories about its range. One should visit this place to see this canon.

Name: MAYANKBIGDELHIFOODIE
Title: must
Review: wat 2 say about thisi guess almost everybody knows would be knowing about itlargest and biggest in asia

Name: cbk2911
Title: Large cannon of 18th century at Jaigarh Fort
Review: We saw this large cannon of 18th century located at Jaigarh fort & were speechless. Its placed at Dungar darwaza & is strategically located as same road goes to Nalgarh fort.

Name: LKEHRAAJ
Title: Biggest Cannon
Review: located in Jaigarh FortDonot take guided tour herePeople trash every where so be aware to itBig Cannon

Name: Prashant M
Title: There's a good history behind it!
Review: This is the biggest canon on wheels in the world placed in Jaigarh fort. This place has good views of the whole Jaipur city.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Great to watch...
Review: It is world's largest and biggest cannon, built in 17th century. It is used for test fire only once. It was fired in the direction of chaksu and guides said it impects was powerful enough to have caused a depression where a pond can be seen today. It is situated in jaigarh fort. It's barrel weights approx 50 tons.

Name: The wOrld tRaveler
Title: Jaipur's Military Pride... Jaivana Cannon
Review: One of the biggest and heaviest cannon of India. Built in 17th century by Jai Singh II. Weight of cannon is around 50 tons however the stand weight is not included. It was used just one time and it for trail only. They said the fire range was around 35 km and The impact is so powerful enough to have caused a depression where a pond can be seen today.

Name: debikaghosh
Title: The Giant Cannon
Review: This is the biggest cannon ever built. Definitely worth a visit. This is located inside Jaigarh fort.

Name: RkRoadie
Title: Biggest cannon of India
Review: Jaivana is said to be one of the biggest canon in India. This is located on Jaigarh fort. The approach road is very very steep and parking near cannon can be task in itself.Jaivana Cannon is the only highlight of Jaigarh Fort. This can be skipped if one is short of time.

Name: anjuanjali
Title: big and very old canon
Review: the worlds largest canon. really it is very great. it will be good to listen history of this canon. this canon is in jaigarh fort. and worth to visit here

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Rajput's Cannon
Review: This 300 years old fascinating cannon is the world's largest cannon of its kind. They manufactured it in their own foundry which was located inside the Jaigarh Fort. The mechanism is excellent as it can turn 360 deg and enable them to fire in any direction instantly - But never used in any war except test fired once. Proves Indians (were) are technologically strong.

Name: Jiju Mathew P
Title: Canon
Review: This is the world largest canon on the wheels. The wheels are gigantic and worth seeing. The canon balls used in this 50 kg heavy

Name: neeldharaprajapati
Title: Excellent

Name: Jai Singh
Title: Big cannon
Review: There is a big cannon which was one fired once as per local guide and there is a pond near by and the person who shot the  cannon jumped to pond to save his ear from the fire sound.

Name: Deepak A

Review: This is a huge gun, you can see it's a monster. This is the only thing which is of attraction in Jaigarh fort.

Name: Iratdog
Title: It's a biggen
Review: Hard to miss this. It's on every list. It's an amazing piece and you're way up the mountain so the view is fine. They let my tuk tuk drive right up to it. It's not a long visit but you won't see a better old cannon. Never fired in anger.

Name: HarryHSR
Title: Royal Cannon
Review: Jaivava is believed to be the world's biggest cannon ever built, currently located at Jaigarh fort in Jaipur.It is believed to have been fired only once in the year 1720

Name: UshRiz
Title: The largest cannon
Review: Situated in the jaigarh fort, the Jaivana is the largest cannon in the world. Jaigarh is 10 mts drive on the way back from Amber fort. It's not a palace, but was a place for the soldiers and armour and forms the large boundary wall for the Amber fort. Besides the Jaivana, the canon...not much to see here.  If short of time, can be skipped...

Name: sid_ups
Title: Worlds Biggest Cannon
Review: This is a huge cannon. It is said that shot of this cannon fell after 51 kilometers away. This cannon is features as world's biggest cannon and now a days this cannon is covered by huge iron plates.

Name: 549arthurm
Title: Cannon
Review: Its a very big cannon. they say that this cannon was only shot once and the cannon ball went for 30km. One does get an amazing view of how wars could have been fought with there protection from being positioned on a mountain.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Awesome.....
Review: This Gun is an Awesome piece of showcasing one's might. Even today it stands solid and has the ability to simply tear apart any attack. The irony is that it was never actually used in any war. It was just fired once for testing. The govt should test it once again

Name: Tracing_F00tsteps
Title: Dauntingly grand
Review: This cannon is huge and very majestic. It is placed at the top of Jagarh Fort and is it's most noteworthy attraction. It was commissioned by Raja Jaisingh but was never used in battle. It's formidable size and fierce glory is very humbling. It's a must-visit.

Name: susanta nath
Title: Biggest cannon in the world
Review: Situated on top of the jaigarh fort, cannon is placed inside an housing, can be reached easily with vehicle(vehicle pass at gate entry)

Name: docboysolan
Title: Great Monster
Review: This huge cannon, constructed nearly 300 years ago is a treat to the eyes. Fantastic history to go with it.. remarkable.

Name: Anirudhag G
Title: excellent
Review: excellent cannon , the range is 50 km , the road to the fort is steep , but this cannon is must to watch for.

Name: Ridey
Title: Jaivana-The Biggest Cannon
Review: Jaivana is one of the biggest cannon of historical importance. This is kept in Jaigarh Fort. Must See.

Name: VSC699
Title: Jaiban
Review: Jaiban is the worlds largest canon kept at the highest point in Jaigarh fort. Jaigarh, Nahargarh and Amber Fort are all connected from inside and anyone should visit all of them. It will take a full day tour if you want to see all of them together. The magnificent Jaiban was test fired only once and there are some very interesting stories related to it. The museum has a good collection of the weapons, amours and shields of the Rajput warriors.

Name: Aditya S
Title: Awesome
Review: This is the thing I came to see in Jaipur. Magnificent. Do a google on the importance of this cannon. And the enormous size ....

Name: Gavin R
Title: The Largest Cannon apparently
Review: yes its true, Jaivana is one of the biggest attractions in Jaigarh fort, its super crowded with loads of people trying to take selfies. All in all its worth seeing because of its historical significance, but if you are not a history buff , I would skip this because of the crowds. Another bad experience is cars are allowed to go all the way to the top which is inconvenient for many people on foot.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: World' largest cannon
Review: Jaivana is world's largest cannon. This jaivana cannon is located in jaighar fort. this cannon is attract tourist.

Name: Shushom
Title: The Big no bigger oh no it's Biggest Cannon!
Review: Jaivana; The Big no bigger oh no it's Biggest Cannon @ Jaigarh Fort. Must & Worthy visit with the Cannon.

Name: Neelam_Arora
Title: The biggest cannon
Review: This was some sight! The only thing to watch in this jaigarh fort. IT should not be missed. Amer is beauty all over, but this is also worth watching

Name: Saipola1970
Title: Jaivana
Review: The Jaivana Cannon (located at the Jaigarh Fort, Jaipur) was only Fired Once by the Jai Singh-II, as a test-fire in 1720 and the then Mughal Emperor Muhammad Shah is known to have attended the event before ousting the Sayyid Brothers from power. The most exaggerated myth claims that the weapon had a range of 40 km (25 mi), other sources say it is 35, 22 and 11 km (6.8 mi), although the exact range could perhaps never be determined without adequate scientific computation. Most sources, including local tourist guides agree that it was fired in the direction of Chaksu. The impact is said by many locals and tourist guides to be powerful enough to have caused a depression where a pond can be seen today.Legend also says that when it was about to be shot, it was kept near a water tank. This was kept there for the gunner to dive in and escape the shock waves. But during the shot, he and eight other soldiers along with one elephant were reportedly killed due to the shock waves. Many small houses in Jaipur collapsed as well.

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Big Cannon
Review: Jaivana is a biggest cannon of the world. it's really big. if you are jaigarh you can't miss it. Must visit.

Name: TheManuVashishth
Title: Awsome Place
Review: Best place to go out for a picnic with family on a rainy or good weather day. Place looks awesome in evening with view of the city. They even have a bar a bit further which serves beer and limited snacks. But the view and ambiance of sitting in a real fort will get you intoxicated !!

Name: Kumkumjaipur
Title: Amazing
Review: This cannon is one of its kind in the world. It is the largest cannon in the world. It was fired only once. I am amazed at how it was made and transported.

Name: Texas Traveler
Title: biggest cannon in the world
Review: If you want to see the biggest cannon in the world this is your place :-) It's inside Jaigarh Fort - you can pay a bit extra and go inside and see it up close or walk around  it from a small distance.

Name: charles j
Title: Giant Canon
Review: This is the biggest ever Canon, very huge on the top of Fort, extremely huge and its strength is amazing.

Name: MohammadNejad

Review: may be only attractive item in the Jaigarh Fort , located at highest part of the Fort . after a few minutes walking you reach to this big weapon , take some photo and nothing more . the tour leader told this is the biggest canon in the world but i could not find any proof for this statement.

Title: Amazing piece of war weapon

It is so big and magnificant that you will just keep wondering how such heavy weapon was installed at Hill top and how it was used in royal times . Hats off to the creator and user

Name: Amit S
Title: It was good.
Review: The three forts are in line, Jaivana - The world biggest canon is only attraction of this fort. It was good.

Name: Namrata A
Title: Major Attraction
Review: The only reason of visiting this fort was the huge cannon. It was advised by my friends not too miss. It was worth too. Massive fort!!!!

Name: Martin T
Title: Its a big gun .
Review: If you go up here for the views after visiting the Amber Fort, anything is going to suffer in comparison. Threres not much up there , but it is OK as a add-on . make sure your driver takes you to the Amber Fort first though ... the elephants  only work in the m morning !

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: At Jaigarh Fort, this was the biggest cannon of its time.
Review: The biggest attraction at Jaigarh fort today is this massive cannon, called Javana, which was cast in 1720 at this fort itself during the reign of Sawai Jai Singh II. It  has 20 feet long barrel weighing about 50 tonnes. Diameter of its barrel is 11 inches and it could fire to the range of 22 miles having 100 kg gunpowder. This was the biggest gun of its time. Even today it attracts awe among the visitors. It is on top of the fort and from the surroundings of the gun you get a fabulous view of the city.

Name: RajjasHolidays
Title: The big cannon

Name: SydnTooli

Review: The monster canon worth a visit. The water storage phenomenal. The armoury less so. A lot of walking or you can pay to get closer. Shame there aren't electric vehicles for us.

Name: Atul Garg
Title: Impressive
Review: It is housed in Jaigarh fort and not to be missed if you are visinting Jaipur. 4 elephants used to move this gun which was fired only once.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: good
Review: Birla Auditorium is Very famous Auditorium in jaipur. its construction is very attractive.This Auditorium in is very popular in tourist.

Name: Dr Pragati S

Review: I had the opportunity to visit BM Birla Auditorium this January when our Annual National Conference of the Indian Radiological & Imaging Association was held.I must say,it is one of the finest Auditoriums I have ever visited.It is centrally located with ample parking space for the vehicles to be parked.Halls & lecture theatres are of excellent quality with great upkeep.The seating arrangements are excellent with comfortable chairs.Washrooms were clean & well maintained.I shall be happy to visit the place again,should there be an opportunity.It is definitely pride of Jaipur.

Nice insight into the MARS mission and other details of our Galaxy. There is much up gradation of information regarding space and the planet. There is a park with food court with proper parking. Name: prabhakar1964
Title: a must visit place

Name: Kjs
Title: Spacious and Comfortable Seating
Review: Attended many concerts, lecture and inaugural events. Perfect ambience for any show. Its spacious and seats are comfortable. The wash rooms are also clean.

Name: Rahul P Singh
Title: INTRESTING JOURNEY OF GALAXY & STARS
Review: Birla Auditorium ‚ÄúB.M. Birla science & technology center‚Äù located in the heart of PinkCity, near the famous landmark Statue Circle. The Birla Planetarium was formally inaugurated by the first Prime Minister of India, Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru on 2nd July 1963. Prior to that, Birla planetarium was functioning only as an educational, scientific and research body. The planetarium, spread across 9.8 acres of land, houses a science museum, information processing and dissemination cell, auditorium, research centers and a planetarium. Everyday planetarium offers a special audio-visual show on the scientific researches and celestial bodies, which attracts number of students.Birla Planetarium welcomes everyone to the lesser known world of galaxy and stars. It introduces the mother earth in such a fascinating method, which leaves one awestruck at the beauty and depth of the universe. A whole new universe can be explored by simply sitting inside a round dome inside the planetarium, where projectors with audio visuals give you a deep insight into each and every functioning of the planets and the solar system. Anyone can visit the planetarium between 1200 hours to 1900 hours and experience the world of stars.There is an astronomical observatory which has the provision for Celestron C-14 telescope, including its accessories like the ST6 CCD camera, solar filters etc. An automation system was established after two years of rigorous work in the year 1993 in order to carry out special effects for the planetarium shows. Though anyone is welcome here, but students are given a special concession to watch the shows.Show Timings 11.00 a. m. Hindi Show1.00 p.m. Hindi Show3.00 p.m. Hindi Show5.00 p.m. Hindi Show6.00 p.m. English Show7.00 p.m. Hindi Show Science MuseumShow Timings10.00 a. m. to 7.00 p.m..Entry fee INR 40.00

Its a very nice place, not highly technical or scientific working models you can find, but lots of information and models ideal for taking kids between the age of 5-10 years you can find here. There was an astronaut suit also kept there. It was a back to school nostalgia for us. There is also a show conducted here which is approximately of 30-45 minutes. The show was about human evolution, but we kind of got bored at the end. But still it was a good experience as you feel like school students again.

Name: Jaipalofficial
Title: Amazing

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Perhaps still the best centrally located auditorium of the town
Review: This auditorium is located close to Sawai Jai Singh Statue Circle (popularly known as Statue Circle) monument. In the same complex there is a planetarium, exhibition halls, a science museum and a research center (apart from the auditorium). The halls/lawns/auditorium may be hired for scientific/academic/cultural events/exhibitions. I have observed that many reviewers have given their comments on planetarium and museum here though the property for reviews are expected is "auditorium". This is surely one of the best auditoriums of Jaipur. There was a time when govt. owned Ravindra Rang Manch/Ravindra Manch (named after Ravindra Nath Tagore and located in Ram Niwas Bag) was the only auditorium available in the city. Construction of this auditorium widened the choice for organizers. This was much clean and far more equipped then Ravindra Manch so became popular in a short time despite its high rates as compared to the other. It became a status symbol to hold event here. Good sound system, better chairs, enough leg space, clean carpets, soothing lights and ample space around auditorium are the reasons for its popularity. The entrance gate of Auditorium and museum complex itself is an attraction as it is huge and resembles Ganesh Pol of Amber Fort. Many tourists/visitors fondly get themselves photographed on stairs leading to this gate. The Science museum is not good, not at all close to the lesser known Science Museum of Shastri Nagar, Jaipur. It was perhaps built to justify the initial terms and conditions on which Birlas (the famous corporate house of India) got this land. The planetarium, was most modern one of its time as Mr. A.G. Kulkarni who was first Director of the Planetarium has told me. It had automated slide projectors which could project colourful images of clouds and horizon, a feature that was not available in other planetarium then.

Name: kaushal874
Title: Plenty to Learn and have fun
Review: This is a classic establishment, unique in its own kind of way. Seating capacity is more than 1300, which is amazing. I have never seen so much capacity in a single auditorium.The maintenance is good and furnished. The display is really good and worth the fun.

Name: PRIYANK U
Title: Good for kids & education
Review: On of the childhood favorites. We used to go here often as a part of school picnic. Good place to see fascinating stuff about science.

Name: Gurleen08
Title: largest audi with marvelous architecture
Review: one and only theater of india that is a classic mixture of old and contemporary Indian architecture with the fresco highlighting traditional Rajasthani art. The main auditorium with a seating capacity of 1350 people, is one of the largest auditoriums in India, built to international conference standards.

Name: dcb23
Title: Thumbs up!!
Review: A well maintained, large capacity holder, well furnished auditorium adorable for all kinds of functions and events like sangeet, musical concerts, exhibitions, plays. I have visited this place several times on various occasions and have always found it worth the visit.

Name: Suket314
Title: BIRLA AUDI
Review: located at a good connecting place. good parking space , large capacity, mostly full through out the year.... many cultural , traditional , seminars , workshop happens in this audi... it has a large capacity

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Good for kids
Review: Birla Planetarium offers good experience for kids definitely and parents as well.The show is good and the displays around the dome is interesting as well. Its for sure that Children will like it and definitely come out happy.The place is surrounded with gardens and evening is a good time to spend here.

Name: sudhanshuy
Title: Nothing worthwhile
Review: Except for the planetarium in the same compound- this place does not offer anything new. the other saving grace is the photo opportunities the front facade offers.

Name: virendra a
Title: Best place to go with kids
Review: There is birla planetorium here where you can watch a 35 min show which is awesome. after that there is a science building where many science models are kept for kids. there is food available.

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: musical evenings!
Review: the best place for any music concert! recently attended sankalp musical show which was a hit.. the sitting arrangement is excellent

Name: Sayan B
Title: poor maintenance
Review: Location is  very good but the property is not maintained at all. Nice yo organise conferences and get togethers, but staff is very rude.

Name: ChrisJ45
Title: Astronomy Defined
Review: A nice little place if you are a astronomy/space/science fan. A gallery to walk around with exhibits on space missions and Einstein. The visit ticket also includes a 40 minutes show on astronomy over the ages. Kids would like it.

Name: 224juliaandjim
Title: Brilliant !!! So wonderful
Review: Brilliant !!! So wonderful There's nothing much to see at this museum which is at the basement of Birla Mandir except for a miniatures of ship & few more. You could plan it in your itinerary if you are interested to know about Birla's family history.If you are in Jaipur and neven been to such a place. It's worth visiting for a short 30 minute movie.

Name: aryan108
Title: GOOOD...
Review: this place is very good it tells you about the formation of different stars and the connection of them from the egypt about the sun, the egypt culture and all..... this place gives you a traditional feel that is why it is boring .... the young people won't be able to understand it  as it is interesting in the starting and boring towards the end ..... the sound and picture quality is brilliant..

Name: Saksham2014
Title: The world of Space
Review: This place is located on Statue circle which is almost the central location of Jaipur. This is basically a multipurpose place . There is also a Planitorium here which hosts shows round the day in English and Hindi.Also the auditorium hosts many shows round the year. The plantiorium is worth visiting. You must go here with family..

Name: anurag842011
Title: nice big
Review: auditorium is big enough for more than 1000 people with all the facilities and seats are very comfortable for people.

Name: pavangupta
Title: auditorium
Review: Birla Auditorium is an iconic and landmark building, at the must visit statue circle and it's period architecture is so pleasing to the eye with it's perfect and imposing proportions, surrounded by a well manicured and excellently maintained garden frequented by variety of birds

Name: Missbutterscotch
Title: "Perfect Place...... "
Review: it is perfect place for events like any drama shows,annual functions, assembly& official meetings   etc . I attended my school annual function .... it was really nice ..... and the staff was well mannered with every one :)  .... & it is located at the best part .... :D

Name: deejay90210
Title: Great convention center
Review: Nicely located, with great cultural architecture and modern halls. A perfect blend of traditional architecture with modern facilities. The main hall is huge with all the amenities. The central park is also well maintained with flowers and fountains and gives the auditorium a calm atmosphere.

Name: SuhasBd
Title: Excellent
Review: I had been to conference to Jaipur recently. The venue was B M Birla Auditorium. It is an excellent place for conference. The location is very good. The surrounding and entrance are impressive at first sight. The entry arch is typically looks like an entry to the Rajasthani Palace. The lobby is simple, but gracefully decorated with pictures of the icons in every field. The main auditorium is huge and with comfortable chairs. Ours was a medical conference and the speeches were simulteniously conducted in five to six halls. The halls on first and second floors were bit smaller in size. The banquete was conducted on lawns of the venue, which was quite large and well maintained. The auditorium was clean with well functioning airconditioning and comfortable sitting ( and dozing, especially after lunch). I liked this venue very much.

Name: mohibahmed786
Title: Excellent
Review: Yes I say it with emphasis ....."EXCELLENT".......!!!!for convention. Large central auditorium, interiors are well crafted, cleanliness, plush green lawns, designed fountains. .....Other labs and rooms are also good...

Name: prince pulkit
Title: PERFECT PLACE
Review: B M BIRLA Auditorium is very good in heritage building design.ITis properly maintained by the government.The garden view fron inside and outside is very good.Here in this place a lots of events and conferences are going out every day.

Name: RudyLuise
Title: 9th Conference on the Jurassic System
Review: Great organisation and having fine dinners in shelters on the lawn at the end of presentation sessions

Name: Sanjy66
Title: I have been master of ceremony here many a times!!
Review: Hey!folks as you know I am a borned in jaipur at later in post university days I was a complete hit with my oratory and was master of ceremony  for several cultural events.this auditorium is very tastefully done up.the auditorium is well equipped with high class audio system .the stage is a huge success as the depth ,the width is perfect.very busy place in the evenings as every now and then one or the other function takes place over here.you can enjoy the surrounding carvings on the outside walls and the whole place is very beautiful and a positively proud monument of recent decades.

Name: damianbhagat
Title: Best place for children
Review: The presentation of knowledge in this place is beyond comparison. The audio visual aids to present little facts are unseen almost anywhere in the world. Do go there if you have children.

Name: Pinakin81
Title: architectural delight
Review: B M Birla Auditorium is by now an iconic and landmark building, at the must visit statue circle and the entire impressive road from "Paanch Batti" to "Vidhan Bhavan", it's period architecture is so pleasing to the eye with it's perfect and imposing proportions, surrounded by a well manicured and excellently maintained garden frequented by variety of birds, which together immediately uplifts the soul the moment you enter in the complex, housing very large auditorium,museum, planetarium, and other halls with ample parking lots. Not to be avoided if you have an eye for beauty. P D Lalsodagar

Name: AMIT AGARWAL
Title: Must go for children
Review: In a place like India where very few learning options for small children are made, the B M Birla Planetarium is a breath of fresh air. Small children really enjoy learning about the glaxy in a fun way and it is a must watch. Hats of to the Birla's - only they can do such things in India.

Name: dpagrawal24
Title: Wonderful Place
Review: BM Birala auditorium is one of the finest auditoriums of the state, and undoubtedly the best in the Pink City. Its seating facilities, sound system, stage - everything is SUPERB! It is very well maintained and professionally managed.

Name: manash d
Title: wow....
Review: There's nothing much to see at this museum which is at the basement of Birla Mandir except for a miniatures of ship & few more. You could plan it in your itinerary if you are interested to know about Birla's family history.

Name: Gaurav Verma
Title: Skippable
Review: There's nothing much to see at this museum which is at the basement of Birla Mandir except for a miniatures of ship & few more. You could plan it in your itinerary if you are interested to know about Birla's family history.

Name: Omdeepak
Title: There is a Planetarium inside it...
Review: A fun place for those who have some interests in the Sky and Planets. They keep on changing the small movies every month. For adults and children, it's a wonderful experience if you haven't been to a planetarium before.If you are in Jaipur and neven been to such a place. It's worth visiting for a short 30 minute movie.

Name: rohitc3
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: Lovely place and nice architecture. historical monument in jaipur.Lovely place and nice architecture. historical monument in jaipur.Lovely place and nice architecture. historical monument in jaipur.

Name: Manoj Awasthi
Title: Good for confrence
Review: Its very well managed etc in terms of sitting arrangement, sound quality hall for big event like speech and motivational programme

Name: saurkumar
Title: International Audiotorium
Review: even after almost one and half decade this auditorium is giving hard time to any organizing council..because it is most beautiful, the most admired, the most busiest and most appraised auditorium in jaipur... Don't miss your chance to visit it

Name: aroranuj
Title: Planetorium a must for kids
Review: Birla Planetorium is an excellent way to brush up your knowledge of our solar system. I had been to Delhi planetorium long ago in 1987 when Pluto was a planet. We were reminded that now it has lost its exalted position in the celestial sphere. After the show at planetorium you take a round of the auditorium where interesting facts about space and man's bid to conquer it are displayed.

Name: Capt Sudhir Dixit
Title: Land mark itself alongside Statue Circle
Review: Excellent place for shows, exhibitions, sales n conferences. Centrally located and well maintained in traditional Rajasthani design n paintings. Very neat n clean place with easy access from parts of Jaipur.

Name: Maharookh
Title: Astronomy .
Review: A lovely building and a lovely little show  at the planetarium but held only in Hindi - so if you're not excellent at the language, some of the terms and explanations just pass you by.

Name: vivek_kool
Title: nice place
Review: Must see for children.fantastic place to learn about astronomy.they have different shows for english and hindi.Also they organise different shows and seminar's and shows

Name: Mayurpatell
Title: Excellent !!!!!!!!!!
Review: B M Birla Auditorium is good for the knowledge about space. Located between the hart of the Jaipur city. All different language program performed daily. Nice child A/c with vise of space activities and lot of knowledge.

Name: BrandieBee
Title: Don't waste your time
Review: I checked the official website of the planetarium to verify that there was an English showing. The site indicated one English showing, however, when I arrived this was not the case. The price was also different, which is not that surprising from my experience thus far in India. Since I had paid 80 rps for the auto i decided to stay and enjoy the view of the solar system without the benefit of the narration. Unfortunately there was a school group entering at this time and it was myself and 75 very loud and rude children who were all staring at me. I would never recommend anyone to waste their time at this location when there are so many other wonderful ways to spend your time in Jaipur.

Name: Funwithall
Title: fun with family
Review: its a wonderful place , every student should visit this, clean fully air conditioned and very reasonably priced ticket, they will take you to the another world for next half an hour, u will feel the effects created by them documentary is too good, must go if your children are above 10

Name: rachel83
Title: Enjoyed
Review: I went alone a bit boring for toddlers, interesting to see how it all works and was impressed the clock actually gave the correct time! Just do a short visit not worth a long time as more interesting places to see

Name: Amit
Title: The temple of Meera Bai
Review: Built in 1600 AD by the king Sawai Maan Singh in the memory of his son Jagat Singh, this temple located in Amer, Rajastan is dedicated to Lord Krishna and the devotee Meera Bai. The temple contains a statue of Lord Shri Krishna which is believed to be the same statue that Meera Bai worshipped in the State of Mewar. This idol was saved from being destroyed during the Mughal attack on Mewar by Amer rulers & was brought to Amer. And for that very reason it is also known as Meera Bai temple. The striking architectural elements of the temple are a blend of different architectural styles taking inspiration from Mughal, Jain, and Hindu, Mughal ones. At the entrance of the temple, you will come across a beautiful marble archway which is being guarded by two marble elephants. Surprisingly, the archway and the elephants have been carved from a single piece of stone. The temple is connected to the Amer Palace having two entrances, where the first one leads you to the Palace and other one leads you to the Amer town. This temple was built beside the courtyard of the Amer palace in a way so that the queen could easily visit the temple anytime. Whenever you plan to visit Jaipur, explore the streets of Amer with a visit to this divine place. Timings:  06:00 AM to 01:00 PM;  04:00 PM to 08:00 PM

Name: Deb
Title: An Artistic Masterpiece
Review: This is one of the most beautiful temples I have seen so far. An architectural marvel. The sheer grandeur of the intricate work on the stone will get you mesmerized. A peaceful abode that is majestic at the same time. Must-visit if one plans to visit the Amber Fort and its surroundings.

Name: lena nash
Title: Beautiful temple
