Review: Worth visiting  . It's behind Amer fort . No crowd . Can easily spend like 15 mins  . . U need to get there in cab .

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: Awesom
Review: This is beautiful hindu temple located near amber fort. The architecture is amazing and there are 2 huge elephants status at entrance.

Name: Scenic704513jimmy
Title: stop at this beautiful temple on the way to amer fort
Review: this is a very beautiful temple architecture is marvellous  located at the foothill of amer fort   not to be miss if you happen to visit amer fort   surrounding around the temple is quiet since not much tourist know about the place  just spend some time relax and enjoy the view   entry is free just pay 30rupees to the keeper as donation  he will issue u a receipt

Name: Jim W
Title: Beautiful Small Temple Near the Amber Fort
Review: This is less than a mile from the Amber Fort and yet nobody seems to go there.  Don't make that mistake.  I realize many are on a big bus tour and don't have a choice but try your best.  It is a temple to Krishna & Meera and it is good to have a guide to explain the story.  The detail inside and outside the temple is amazing.  I'm glad we had the opportunity to visit. There are many other sites to see in the same little area around the temple.

Name: meipporul
Title: Amazing temple
Review: Awesome temple of Krishna and Meera. Excellent architecture of Rajputs in Marble. You have to see this to believe. Simply awesome! It's on the way to Amber fort. Lot of Langurs linger around - but are harmless.

Name: BhavraPune_India
Title: In Awe
Review: If you are visiting Amer fort in Jaipur , one should definitly visit this temple. It is visible from back side of the fort. Trek down the fort from back gate and ask any locals around. Its also known as Krishna-Meera temple. Most of the people in jaipur are not aware of this temple. Its an excellent example of hindu architecture and feels like articians have poured their heart while carving various motifs.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful Radha Krishna temple
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, we had visited the beautiful Amber Fort and this beautiful temple was located close by and so we decided to visit this too. The temple is dedicated to Radha Krishna with Lord Krishna who is beautifully dressed with a flute in hand. We liked the beautiful architecture of the temple with intricately sculpted images of God's on the walls and two giant elephant sculptures at the entrance. We enjoyed clicking selfies with the beautiful architecture at the background.

Name: Umang A
Title: Radha krishna...
Review: Located on the way to Maber fort... Just after Jalmahal... An old beautiful temple of Radha Krishna...

Name: RedLichtie65
Title: Quick visit
Review: Visited this temple as part of a trip to Amer Fort. It is a working temple and we had the privilege of hearing a worshipper chant their prayer. It has some beautiful stone carvings inside. Worth a visit as part of day trip to Amer Fort. No payments needed but a donation to the temple is welcomed.

Name: Arun S
Title: Amazing and Peaceful
Review: This temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna and Meera Bai (one of its king in India). The temple architeture is mix of mugal, jain and south Indian styles. This temple was made in the memory of Jagat Singh, the son of king Man Singh, when fighting against Mugals. Legends says that on Jagat Singh death her mother demanded Mughal emperor to construct a temple in her son's memory. The cost of the temple in those days (1701 AD) came around equivalent to 982 thousand rupees in that time(which was huge for that time). This temple has the same lord Krishna idol which Meera used to worship in Mewar. It was saved from Mughals and brought here in this temple. You'll see Meera's idol placed next to Krishna in here.The architecture of this temple is amazing. Just next to it there is a Lord Gradua temple, which is amazing as well. It is very quiet away from the corwds. Entry to this place is free. Priest at this temple is very humble and tell the history very proudly if you ask him. There were many movies shot at this temple (Bhool Bhulaiya etc). Recently there was another movie scene shot here. Must visit when in Amer, i can assure that you'll be more happy that you decided to visit here.

Name: DrNic1
Title: Outstanding Beautiful Temple that is Quiet and Peaceful
Review: On the way yup top the main fort and in many respects may be more satisfying as it is quiet without huge numbers of touristsIt‚Äôs replete with carvings and amazing architecture that is put together without any mortar. Incredible detail everywhere and a working temple where you can receive a blessing and make offerings in a peaceful and meditative environment

Name: gireesh s
Title: Shiromani ji temple
Review: Cravings on made on stones beautiful sculpture you will love the temple and capture good images  just to see

Name: RupaMajumder
Title: An Architectural Excellence
Review: I visited Jaipur during Monsoon 2017. Had a great view of Temple under cloudy backdrop. Inside temple, there was idol of Meera. Entire mandir premises is maintained nicely. One should take time to see properly all the sculptures. This Mandir is just beside Amer Fort and visible from roadside. Travelers should not miss visiting this place while visiting Amer Palace.

Name: Ricardo R
Title: It is good but do not pay anything, it is free
Review: It is very near the Step Well so do not miss the chance to visit this temple, it has many carvings in the stones. it is a quick visit as the place is very small.No entrance fee, the policeman that keeps the place will try to charge the visitors speciallly when the visitor is the only one inside, do not be afraid and  do not pay, it is a bad beharvior of these people, do as I did, ask " where is the ticket office and the sign with the price ? Then just turn your back and walk away.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Wonderful temple
Review: Jagat Shiromani temple is beautiful construct building.  This building is mind blowing for view. this is so attractive in tourist  must see this.

Name: Kumkumjaipur
Title: A rare temple
Review: The Jagat Shiromani temple is a temple built by Man Singh. It houses the statue of Lord Krishna which Meera used to carry with her. Man Singh got a statue of Meera made and he got Meera and Krishna married in this temple. The temple is built like a chariot. The palki which used to carry Lord Krishna with Meera is still there in the temple.

Name: Martin T
Title: A terrific add on to your visit to Amber Fort !
Review: Its a bit hidden away in the town / village of Amer , ask the way .....its very reqrding , beautiful carvings , and a truly spiritual place built by the founding ruler of Amber / Jaipur . Unlike many holy places in India , here we felt the invitation to partake in Puja was genuine , and it became a truly  personal experience for me. Dont miss the frescoes in the upstairs gallery ....mind the stairs are really steep though !.The Step Well is only 200 metres away ...again just ask !

Name: chirag s
Title: Great temple
Review: we visit this temple it was so great and beautiful  me and my friends take many pictures of temple it was nice experience

Name: Tracy E
Title: beautiful temple, annoying 'staff'
Review: we wandered over from the amber fort, and there was hardly anyone around, which was a relief after the crush of people at the fort. however, we climbed the steps and were immediately told we had to pay an entrance fee of 25r each. i researched a lot of places before our trip, and i didn't remember an entrance fee for this temple, so i was on guard after that. at amber fort, a security guard had sort of shanghaied us into a tour we didn't want, and this seemed to be heading in the same direction. the guy hovered around us after that, trying to lead us in a different direction, and we really just wanted to explore on our own. more (Indian) people started streaming in, and we asked him, didn't he need to go collect the entrance fee from them? to which he just looked at us blankly and wouldn't leave. maybe he didn't have any bad intentions, but we just didn't want a tour! we just wanted to walk around! why does everyone else get to walk at their own pace but not us? eventually, i had enough of being followed and we left which was a real shame because we barely saw any of it and the whole experience felt unsafe. before we traveled to india, i had read about a 'foreigner tax' and i expected to be overcharged for some things, but i didn't expect to be followed and lead around- that was actually kind of disturbing and made me feel unsafe.

Name: vini_phooh
Title: Very serene and peaceful place
Review: I liked the whole place as it was not crowded. It is an ancient temple which has great historical significance. Will like to go again if possible.

Name: BananaLu
Title: Magical temple!
Review: I spotted this temple from Amber Fort and bugged my friends until we located it in the village down the hill (you might need to ask directions several times as people seemed rather confused on what temple we were looking for and where it was...). We went there late afternoon after finishing the forts visits and the sunlight made the temple look even better. It dates back to 17th Century. We did not find much information on it, but it is dedicated to Meera Bai (poet who was devoted to Krishna), Krishna and Vishnu.The sculptures are superb and perfectly well preserved. Some elephants sculptures and towers at the entrance are very impressive. It is a beautiful and peaceful place. Do not hesitate to sit and meditate. As most temples of that period, there is not much to see inside and distract you from the deity; the most spectacular is the structure and the outside part of the temple.It is totally worth a visit! Do not miss it as it is very different from the Rajput forts and palaces you will visit in this area. Totally magical!Note that there are few steps to climb, I doubt there is an access for disabled people...

Name: drn85
Title: Jagat shiromani ji temple... Have a view from Amber fort.
Review: This temple is located near to the Amber fort jaipur on your return way after the amber visit.its a temple dedicated for meera bhai. Everyone will note this big temple located there with the pillars going high up the sky. Altogether it's worth visiting this place on your jaipur trip

Name: Mukundan S
Title: A Temple dedicated to Meera Bai
Review: We all know that Meera Bai, wife of mewar king,  was the devote of lord Krishna and considered Him as her husband. This magnificent Jagat Shiromai temple is dedicated to Meera Bai and Lord Krishna. The temple is located next to Amer fort. Built by the queen Kanakwati wife of king Man Singh 1st during 1599-1608 AD,  in the memory of son Jagat Singh, this temple is a master piece of Jain, Hindu,Mughal and South Indian Hindu architecture, all amalgamated in to one, producing an awesome temple.As one walks through the entrance arch/pylon made of marbles the ornamental features will take your breath away. It is said that these torans are made from single piece of a marble.The temple houses Idols of Lord Vishnu, Lord Krishna along with Meera Bai. It is claimed that the idol of Lord Krishna housing this temple is the same idol  that Meera Bai used to worship in the state of Mewar, 600 years ago.In a canopy joined with this temple, is the idol of Garuda, which is a carrier of Lord Vishnu. An idol of Garuda, carrier of Lord Vishnu, can be seen at the entrance in the canopy.The square shaped sanctum is crowned by shikhara. The pillared mandapa has transepts and vaulted ceiling which is decorated with paintings. This temple resembles a majestic mansion built on a peak. The temple has lot of carving on the exterior in rows, predominantly in the pedestal section showing elephants, horses, illustration of some sort of procession and people  etc, enhancing the beauty of the temple. The top row has  a carvings of a birds quite possibly, peacock.Placed just above the pedestal in black stone are three marbles plates, depiction of Indian mythological characters ‚Äì possibly Gods and Goddesses.This ASI protected monument is not to be missed for any reason. Timings:Morning :	6.00 am to 1.00 pm	 Evening: 4.00 pm to 8.00 pm

Name: Tom W
Title: Peaceful oasis of calm
Review: During a walkabout through Amer village we had a welcome break at this beautiful Hindu Temple. Although we were led to believe that it is often quite crowded our visit was very peaceful and was a welcome change from the cacophony of hooters which is part and parcel of everyday India when in built-up areas. A quiet place for reflection which afforded our guide the opportunity to give quite a detailed explanation of the various carvings throughout the Temple. We were allowed to take pictures within the Temple and also with the resident priest who was very accommodating. It is courtesy to offer a small amount for this opportunity.

Name: Olivier R
Title: Great Hindu temple near Jaipur
Review: This temple is justa short tuk tuk distance from Amer fort and the Panna Meen ka Kund so it makes a perfect short stop to look at Hindu architecture. The entrance gate is wonderful, as well as the multiple carvings of animals and gods on the temple itself.You have to pay 25 roupies to take pictures.15-20 minutes on site is enough.

Name: Anushka c
Title: Ancient temle located outside the amer fort
Review: This a very beautiful ancient temple. Please visit this temple if you are visiting the Amber fort. Stone carving inside the temple is must watch for all. Various animals and God and Goddess are carved here.

Name: Rahul A
Title: Famous temple
Review: This is one of those famous temples that is perennially crowded. We went on a Friday and were surprised to find not such a big crowd

Name: Parwathi H
Title: Ancient Temple of Lord Krishna
Review: This ancient temple of Lord Krishna can be visited en route from Amber fort to Panna Meena ka Kund. This less known place also was recommended to us by our driver and hence we visited this temple. The temple is quiet ancient (built in 15th / 16th century AD). The two tall towers forming the gateway to the temple give it an impressive look. The temple premises are reasonably clean. We found the entire visit pleasant and relaxing.

Name: Shobhit G
Title: Very peaceful and enticing temple
Review: We were lucky to be there during the Arti. The temple has a long anecdote associated with it. Again, a good time to go is during the evening.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Most beautiful Jagat Shiromani Temple
Review: I got the opportunity to visit this temple enroute to Amber palace. The temple also has Meera diety and Garuda diety. The care taker of the temple is almost 80 years old and I got the opportunity to get blessings from him as well. I suggest please visit this temple not only for the spiritual purpose but also for the marvelous architecture.

Name: JoseDW
Title: Small temple in the old city.
Review: Well worth seeing as part of a short, old-city tour. Well preserved and functioning. Some of the stone-work is top quality.

Name: TOURWORTH TRAVEL
Title: Jagat Shiromani Ji Temple | Jaipur | India
Review: This temple is on the way of Amer Fort to Panna Meena Ka Kund. It was made in 1599 ‚Äì 1608 over a period of 9 years.Built by Rani Kanakawati in memories of her son Jagat Singhji. He died in his young age in a war.It is a temple of Lord Krishna & Mira. Mira was a devotee of Lord Krishna.The Krishna idol which is placed in Jagat Shiromani Temple was one of the idols worshipped by Meera Bai.

Name: baj2300
Title: Worth stopping at
Review: If you are visiting amber fort or the Amer village it is worth stopping at but not worth driving from downtown for. The entry is impressive with two giant elephant statues on either side of the steps leading up. The interior is well decorated but becomes an ABC if you have seen other temples.We spent a maximum 15 minutes

Name: Martin1313
Title: In the shadow of the Amber Fort
Review: We had already seen the Amber fort on a previous visit, so were looking for something a bit different. Our driver had taken us to see the Elephants in their stables, so what could we do next? The temple is beautiful, built at the turn of the 15th/16th centuries. Quiet and peaceful, with wonderful architecture. I would imagine that most tourists come and see the Fort and then leave, but this is definitely worth the extra effort.

Name: Niya1315
Title: On the way to "Panna Meena Ka Kund" from Amber Fort
Review: This is a beautiful temple dedicated to Radha-Krishan. This temple will come on the way between Amer Fort (Chand Pol) to Panna Meena Ka Kund. This is a beautiful temple but it remains closed in the afternoon hours. It opens in the morning and in the evening after 5 pm. There are many other old temples near to this temple.Must visit place if you go to Amber fort

Name: ND1910
Title: Must visit temple@Amer
Review: This temple was built by the queen Kanakawati to commemorate her son Jagat Singhji. She wanted the temple to be a universally renowned temple and hence the nomenclature ‚Äú Jagat Singh Mani‚Äù. It is constructed with locally available marble.A must visit place..

Name: RajeshBhardwaj
Title: Tempel of Lord Krishna
Review: When we look down from Amber palaces we saw a big dom of a hindu temple. when we get their we find its a unique temple of Lord krishna & Mira devotee of Lord Krishna. This temple built by one of the queen of famous king of Amber Raja Man Singh. Queen lose her young son Name Jagat Singh in a war. Couple want to come out of sorrow due to death of young son. In his memory they built the lord krishna temple. Its fine carving of marble and sand stone. beauty of the temple is sculpture on the dom of the temple.

Name: Manish B
Title: Lord Krishna Temple
Review: Beautiful temple to see and worship. If you are planning to go Amer fort you can visit as its near by.

Name: Manjumohpal
Title: Viberated with the sensation of Meerabai as the consort of Krishna!
Review: The small statues everywhere on the pillars have deep spiritual meanings if only one knows how to read the expressions carved.The spiritual growth in Meera is well seen here.One gets the experience according to his/her level of consciousness.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Old temple built by Queen of Jaipur in memory of her son.
Review: Amer town offers many small attractions apart from Amer and Jaigarh fort. If you are not short of time you can include this place in your itinerary. It is on way to to Amer Fort if you are taking your vehicle to Amer fort. However, it will not be possible to park car and see this monument on busy days due to traffic. The monument is under Archaeological Survey of India. It is said that Amer has about 300 temples. This is one of the best  temples of Amer area as it has many idols carved in stone. Many other temples such as Laxmi Narayan and Shiva Temple are built with plain flat stone blocks and are not exquisitely carved.If you intend to see this temple the best strategy would be to park your vehicle near Panna Meena Kund and walk upto this place. Public conveyance is available from Jaipur to Amer town from where this temple is hardly a kilometer away.

Name: Rshukla51
Title: Celebration of Meera's devotion to Krishna
Review: It is next to Amer fort. Believed to feature Krishna idol that Saint Poetess Meera-bai used to carry with her and pray to. Possibly the only temple that celebrates Meera-Krishna. For someone with eternal love for Krishna and no expectation, it would have filled Meera's heart with happiness. The architecture is lovely. But the reason to visit is to celebrate Meera.

Name: triptworld
Title: Meera bai temple
Review: beautiful is the word.... its in amer town..just below the amer fort.. the only temple of Lord Krishna-meera. beautifully build and historically rich too.

Name: Ankit_87
Title: Good architecture
Review: Nice temple for tourists to visit. Offers a peek into rich architecture of Jaipur. Not very crowded and easily accessible.

Name: 1Travelmum
Title: Beautifully carved temple
Review: We had a guide from Amber Fort who took us down a back stairway to get to this temple.  It was a lovely stop, but I believe his true intentions were to get us into a shop or two before making our way back to the fort. Regardless of that, we still enjoyed our visit here and the beautiful carvings.

Name: darshita
Title: Stop by before visiting the Amber fort.
Review: We had taken a local jeep from the foothills to go upto amber fort. On our way, in one of the bylanes our driver stopped at this beautiful temple. It is one of the oldest temples around and the only temple in the world with a statue of meera and lord krishna. The locals call this the meera temple. It is very quiet, peaceful and secluded. Stop to admire the beautiful architecture and carvings around the temple. Good spot for pictures. A warm up before one reaches the Magnificent amber fort and goes insane taking pictures.

Name: JAGDISH RAVAL
Title: A Nice Temple
Review: The Jagat Shiromani ji Temple is near Amber Fort. The temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu.The temple was built by Queen Kankavati wife of Raja Man Sinh in memory of her deceased son Jagat Sinh before 400 years. The local Stone, Black stone and white marble are used in construction of this beautiful temple. A nice vissit.

Name: Arun
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: Very beautiful structure and a peaceful place, not infested with tourists. Won't take more than 15 minutes there. Make sure you stop by.

Name: capri
Title: surely this temple rates as must visit
Review: This temple dates back to few centuries and has very interesting story which I will not detail here.The temple is named after Raja man singh's son Jagat singh who passed away at early age. The temple houses idols of Lord vishnu, Lord Krishna and Meera bai. The temple dates back to sixteenth century and was built over period of 9 years.Things that make this temple unique are:1.this is only temple in the world having idol of Krishna and meera bai together.2. The idol of Lord Krishna is the same idol that Meera bai used to worship.(for the uninitiated Meera Bai was popular "bhajan" singer and devout Lord Krishna follower; she was rajput princess born in fifteenth century)3. The architectural style of temple incorporates hindu, mugal and jain styles.4. Temple is built using different stones and is unique amalgamation with very intricate carvings.  5. The mandap is two storied, having paintings dating few centuries back.The importance of this temple for the ruling family of amber is well known and can be clearly seen with stairs leading from ambers palace's back door.The temple is maintained by ASI. The temple can be accessed from either amber palace's back door or through lanes of amber town. The steps leading from amber is shorter for the people who are visiting amber palace, however there is quite some filth strewn around. If you are okay with that, go ahead.temple is open from 6am to 1 pm and from 4pm to 8 pm.don't miss :1.the beautifully ornamental "toran" at the entrance which is supposedly made out of marble. ask for the priest to explain why this was placed in temple. There is another toran near main entrance just near the garuda idol.2. depiction of trumpeting elephant and horse on the outside wall (it is actually pedestal of temple). these are arranged in series -entire line.There is no fee. For Non Indians, all customs that are followed in other temples need to be followed.

Name: bharthul
Title: A beautiful temple right next to the Amber fort
Review: After visiting the Amber fort in Jaipur, the average tourist will head elsewhere. But, it is important to note that one of Jaipur's most beautiful temples is literally a stone's throw away. There is a path that connects the Amber fort to the Jagat Shiromaniji temple and this temple is a must visit when in Jaipur.The temple was first built by Queen Kankawati, the wife of Raja Man Singh for her son Jagat Singh in 1608. The main deity is Krishna and the temple carvings are exquisite.As usual the path between the temple and the fort are not very well maintained and there is trash lining both sides of the path at any given point of time. The Temple could also be maintained better. It is clean but the premises could be cleaner. But do not miss it as it provides some wonderful photo opportunities and can be combined with a visit to the fort. This temple is also not crowded and very pleasant.

Name: raofca
Title: brilliant architecture
Review: A 11th Century temple at the foothills of the Amber Fort palace near Panna Meena ka kund. Get down from your transport at Panna Meena ka kund and walk up to this temple. Dont miss.

Name: Ruchi M
Title: "very nice carving"
Review: This is the temple of Radha-Krishna and was build between A.D. 1599 - 1608 by Rani Kankawati, the wife of Raja Man Singh-T in memory of her son Jagat Singh,situated in amer.very nice stone carving ,beautiful place.

Name: Peregrineri
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: A beautiful temple, worth the visit. Rs25 camera fee. Closed from noon-4pm. Not wheelchair accessible. There are some other interesting temples nearby. Would have liked to go up the stairs to the gallery, if you can call it that, but the custodian didn't have the key. Unlike the nearby fort, the temple has not been defaced by graffiti. There was no one else there when I visited but the custodian and the temple priest.

Name: Rainer W
Title: Small hidden temple in Amer - A stop worth when visiting Amer Fort
Review: This small quiet temple dedicated to Radha-Krishna was build in the 16th century. The well conserved  temple is a perfect example of northern Indian architecture. It is away from any of the popular tourist attractions. We were the only tourists around. The guardian was helpful and kindly answered all our questions. We had visited Amer Fort a few days before but still decided to drive back from Jaipur just to visit this temple! It was worth the drive!

Name: Damian O
Title: Off the beaten track jewel
Review: After you go to Amber Palace after your visit ask your driver to stop by this temple. It is on the way down the hill. The stone sculptures and carvings are amazing. very well conserved.. Inside the temple there are some unusual paintings around the top. The guardian was very friendly. You may be harassed by one or two vendors but it is not so bad.

Name: muirean2000
Title: Sri Jagat Siromaniji Temple, Amber, Jaipur
Review: The Temple is dedicated to Radha-Krishna and was build between A.D. 1599 - 1608 by Rani Kankawati, the wife of Raja Man Singh-T in memory of her son Jagat Singh. It consists of a sanctum, vestibule and mandapa with projecting screen windows on either side. The temple stands on a hight ornate adhisthana. The beautiful marble torana is flanked by elephant figures,It is one of the most beautiful temples I have seen through my Rajasthan trip and can easily be reached from Jaipur via cab driver or tuc tuc.

Name: farooqguide
Title: Jagat Shiromani Temple, Amer, Jaipur.
Review: It`s Lord Krishna temple, it was built in the end  of 16th century, it has a lovely gate with two big elephants, it is on the way to Amer palace in Amer town, one can visit it within half an hour.

Name: megan g
Title: Local culture and Exquisite beauty without the tourist trap feel
Review: This was one of the most wonderful and surprising temple sites we came upon, located in Amer Jaipur, India behind Amer Fort. Built around 1601, It was simply gorgeous with its amazing giant marble and sandstone carvings of elephants and elegant pillars, grand stairway, and shrines to Krishna and Meera Bai that are still used by the locals. Be sure to ask what the bell is for at the entrance.  Our guide referred to it as "Meera Temple" so it was a little confusing for me to locate it online, so it may go by both names with the locals if you are trying to find it by tuk-tuk.  This was one of my favorite places we visited in India. There were no lines, and no fees. We simply pulled up, hopped out of our car and checked the place out. There were a few others there, but it wasn't too busy either. It didn't feel like a tourist trap.  Check it out, especially if you are in the area of Amer Fort and want the feel of something a little more quaint and local, but with culture, history, and exquisite beauty.  There are several web sites to read up on the history of the Meera Bai and Krishna and Jagat Shiromani Ji Temple if you do a web search and want more info.

Name: Daniel
Title: Antique things to see here
Review: Museum is having very antique things. Staff there having good behavior with guest. Cleaning is little bit more required there.

Name: Skeney57
Title: God Only
Review: Some of these Maharajas were big lads going by some of the royal tunics on display? Sing 11 was a polo player & soldier and led an interesting life & the Museum does display some interesting artifacts. Worth a quick look but no photos allowed.

Name: Gidons51
Title: Museum for textiles, art , and the royal dynasty
Review: This museum consists of a few parts . One is textiles and clothes of the royal family . Second is art and paintings, third is for the royal family dynasty furniture and portraits .One of the exhibits is the biggest water jar in the world , sterling silver , 345 kg and capacity of 2040 liters.

Name: RicherTrips
Title: Don¬¥t miss the Four Seasons Door
Review: The museum has a small collection of crafts, garments, weapons and art, some nice ceilings and beautiful wooden doors, but nothing really memorable.The interesting part is the inner courtyard known as Pritam Niwas Chowk, with four gates that represent the four Seasons. In particular, the Northeast gate, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and the Autumn, depicts beautiful peacocks. The green door, dedicated to Lord Ganesha and Spring, is also remarkable.

Name: Vishal Shah
Title: Visit
Review: For indian nationality adult ticket is 200 rs per person.5 years old kids are free.and students id get have discount for entry tickets.

Name: 188petere
Title: Nice history in the middle of the city
Review: A lovely walk through the museum as part of the Palace compound with some lovely artefacts on display as well as some interesting story boards.There are a few sections with a great display of old Indian textiles, the 2 large silver urns (although didn't appreciate the 'helper in uniform' race into my photo & then asked for a payment), weapons, ceremonial room with photos of the Maharajas, furniture, art & clothes. There is a shop & cafe as well as a museum.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Great Museum.
Review: Very good collection of crafts and art. Very well maintained. This place is a must visit in Jaipur. Great.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Museum which gives you fantastic view of the history
Review: This is one of the best museums of India. You can see superb paintings,artifacts, carpets weapons and Royal coaches. To do justice to the museum and to your visit, you must give at least half a day. Engage a good guide to ensure your great learning and satisfying experience.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: One_of_the_BOFs
Title: Interesting museum in Jaipur Palace
Review: We visited this museum as part of our tour of the Jaipur City Palace. Some interesting displays of carpets, paintings, enamelware, royal carriages and 15th century weapons.

Name: Christopher
Title: Jaipur's rich history and beautiful architecture for all to see.
Review: This is a must if you are in Jaipur for more than a day; you will need to spend at least half a day there to enjoy and absorb its rich history and beautiful architecture.  It‚Äôs worth going online before you visit because there are numerous visitor ‚Äòpackages‚Äô on offer, including exclusive access to private rooms in the Palace, night-time visits, and how much you should pay one of the tourist guides who hover inside the gates (300 Rupees).  The standard entry cost however is 700 Rupees if you just turn up, worth every penny or Rupee.There is so much to see, most of which has been written about here, but I would urge you, if you‚Äôre interested in this sort of thing, to visit the easy-to-miss Arms and Armour museum, tucked away in a corner, which has the most exquisite and inventive weapons of attack and defence, including serrated swords that slice through chain mail and armour.  My favourite exhibit was the ‚Äòtiger claw‚Äô ‚Äì a knuckleduster concealing in the palm of the hand of its wearer, five razor sharp curved blades.  Given the choice, I‚Äôd rather be killed by a tiger.

Name: Ethelberga H
Title: Amazing Collection
Review: Inside the City palace is the Sawai Man Singh 2nd museum and we so enjoyed seeing the enormous silver pots that had been taken to the UK with water from the Ganges by the Maharaja for the coronation of Edward 7th in 1902. Not left behind. The beautiful artefacts, swords all within arcades and small rooms were really interesting.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Inside City Palace complex
Review: During my holidays in Jaipur, I had visited the beautiful City Palace complex and this museum named after Rajput king Sawai Man Singh is located inside this complex. It showcases a combination of beautiful Rajasthani and Mughal architecture style. The museum has a large collection of art, carpets, paintings, enamel wares, royal carriages and 15th century weapons. It took us more than 2 hours visiting this museum and the palace complex.

Name: PushExplore
Title: Very Interesting Collection
Review: The Maharaja's private collection of transportation was quite elaborate and the things are well kept and maintained. Kids enjoyed being here.

Name: yns_10
Title: Nice museum of transport
Review: It is interesting to see the carriages and other methods of transport that was previously used.  It is clear just how lavish the maharaja family lived from this museum.

Name: GregB052148
Title: Just okay
Review: As part of the palace, this is probably the least exciting.  Displays of carriages and other modes of transportation. Worth a short visit if you have time to  spare. Other parts of Palace far more interesting.

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Heritage & culture preserved
Review: When you see you will not believe the beauty of craft and the 'Shahi Sawari' the kings used as transport in ancient times.Have a look.

Name: Chris Barr
Title: Inside The City Palace
Review: Well worth a look in here, a collection of old cart vehicles and a state boardroom.Lots of things to see and a real insight in to the past.Worth a look.

Name: Vikas G
Title: Excellent collection
Review: This is a part of palace where carts and cars of the royal families are kept in a decent and organised manner... a great place to look into the lavishness of the royal family culture ... highly recommended

Name: LKEHRAAJ
Title: Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum
Review: You won't even know you are in the museumIts in City PalaceOld Vehicles kept for display for public

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Larger than life
Review: Huge man who had a presence that meant he did not have a long life expectancy. Notable exhibits. Good selection of carts and carriages.

Name: tripson6
Title: display of vintage horse's cart and carriage
Review: Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum is an open air museum. Museum displays all the vintage horse's cart and carriage. This museum is located inside the campus of City Palace Jaipur.

Name: jonahNJ
Title: A larger than life man
Review: Though this is a relatively small museum, it provided great insight into Man Singh. The displays showed that this was not just a powerful man who is iconic in the history of India in general and Jaipur in particular. He was also a literally huge man‚Äîapproximately 7 feet tall who weighed approximately 500 pounds. The robe that was on display looked more  like a tent that could provide cover for a small family. Yet the robe was very ornate as were other articles of clothing that were on display. Also adjacent to the museum is a ‚Äúgarage‚Äù which displays several vintage carriages.A visit to this museum is well worth a look for the robe alone!

Name: brnaidu11
Title: must visit when in Jaipur
Review: Beautiful museum in the heart of Jaipur with great artefacts. I enjoyed my trip but was full with foreigners. Try and go early morning to avoid the rush.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Showcase of Royals
Review: Located inside the City Palace, this small museum exhibits the properties used by the royal family of Raja Sawai Man Singh II. This museum holds many beautiful Sarot cars, Dresses & accessories and photograph of royalties. Good historical museum.

Name: jamesdean25745
Title: Over the top but interesting
Review: Three steps lead up to the entrance where a small foreigners rate (100 rupees) gains you entrance to a corridor that winds around the well-lit building, in which there are various rooms with exhibits. These range from masks to full size puppets; the masks primarily denoting evil and various wall mounted examples of the puppets and central display tables containing background information papers (not in English) were typically for folklore support.Although there are ceiling fans these were not activated even when were invited to watch a 10 minute puppet show. The auditorium is quite small and the end stage clearly allows the puppets to carry off their extravagant routines (Bollywood for puppets).The sheer flamboyance makes this a site to visit.

Name: minimize940314
Title: OK museum
Review: It is a part of city palace complex. The entrance fee of the complex covers the admission of the museum. It is a place where you can see many different historical items.

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Part of City Palace this Museum has collection of Carriages, Arms and Ammunition and dresses.
Review: Inside the City Palace this Museum has collection of items used by the royalty. It has collection of private carriages used on ceremonial occasions. One section has collection of Arms and Ammunition and another has privates clothes, dresses and wearing apparels. This museum gives a glimpse of the Royalty and their ways. If you are in the city Palace it is worth spending half an hour in this museum.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Nice
Review: Maharaja sawai man singh 2 museum is located in city palace. it has great collection of historical pieces.

Name: Gavin R
Title: Itsy bittsy museum
Review: This is a very small museum, you will come by it by casually walking through the city palace, there are a few carriages and cannons to see and thats about it.

Name: Shruti M
Title: Very nice museum
Review: Museum is very nice, must visit place.Do not buy anything from Art Palace shop inside museum, specially Pashmina. It is way overpriced and quality is pathetic, I bought one Pashmina rajai which costed 5500 and very first time we used, it got torn out.

Name: SanHec
Title: The Maharajas of Rajasthan
Review: This museum is located inside the City Palace Jaipur. It is an open air museum, displaying all the vintage horse's cart and carriage. It also display the royal elephant's cart too which is still use during the royal ceremony. The carts and carriage were so well preserved. Also visit the Sabha Niwas (hall of public audience) was built during the reign of Maharaja Sawai Pratap Singh (1778-1803), in this very hall the public could have an audience with the kings since 18th century. Late Maharajas are represented by large photographs or by paintings that are based on photographs were largely hang on the wall. (no photographing allow here).Admission INR300 for foreign tourist.

Name: drn85
Title: Maharaja mansingh museum... short and quick visit..
Review: Maharaja mansingh museum is located inside the city palace which is a part of the city sight seeing package in jaipur city. City palace has got an entry fee and entry to this is included in the fee collected. It's a museum whuch contain the manuscripts and other monuments of the royal dynasty. We can have a view of this by spending few minute inside the museum. Altogether it's a must visit location during the trip to Rajasthan.

Name: relaxtripp
Title: Excellent Museums in India
Review: It is one of the Museum inside the City Palace. Don't forget to visit the Armory. I was stunned by the display of artillery there. If u are a person having great fond of History of our Great Nation you must visit this place. You will be amazed to see how the kings have lived during their period. U can see their masterpiece and even a love towards their artillery. The art and craft work shown in the artillery is amazing. You can see the clothes, currencies of jaipur, craft of jaipur during those days. Nothing less than amazing.

Name: Binu A
Title: A Window into the Past
Review: This museum is part of the City Palace in Jaipur.The museum gives a rare glimpse into the 'Maharaja Lifestyle' and a look into the past.There is a Carriage museum, A clothes Museum and an Armoury.All can be viewed within the City Palace.

Name: Kat J
Title: definitely worth seeing
Review: Gives a sense of the great and complex history of this part of India.  Good displays with English write-ups.

Name: Vishal V
Title: Old carts, Monumentals
Review: This museum is exclusively meant to see the history and lavishness of the old kings. Had there legacy survived, no wonder we may have  got great luxurious cars like Mercedes designed here. it has other 2 sections - Great armory, once seen, you may not forget. once seen.

Name: Travel Vibes - India
Title: The Bhaggi Khana (Carriage House)
Review: Bhaggi Khana is a museum in the City Palace complex where a collection of old carriages, palanquins, and European cabs adopted as baggis to Indian situations are on display. The baggi which attracts attention is the one gifted by Prince of Wales to the Maharaja in 1876, called the Victoria baggi. Also on display here are the mahadol, a palanquin with a single bamboo bar that was used to carry the priests and a ratha (chariot) that was used for carrying the idols of Hindu gods in procession on festive occasions.

Name: Ethnic Travels
Title: Great place !
Review: The city palace of Jaipur city,mis surely a like a jewel crown, and this historic museum, is a hub of culture and numerous collection, of paintings, clothes, artefacts and others. The place has its own charm, where one can learn and experience, various things from the past to present day developments and tradition. To understand Jaipur,mis origin and history, this place serves as a great platform.

Name: jaakamat
Title: too good !!
Review: good place to visit.display of lovely artifacts,items, n cars used by the royal families.must visit !!

Name: IMRAN K
Title: sawai man singh town hall - Jaipur
Review: From 1952 to 2000, the Sawai Man Singh Town Hall was being used for Rajasthan Legislative Assembly. The 5th session of the 11th Legislative Assembly was the last sessionThe interior entrance lounges have been decorated in the famous Rajasthani traditional art on walls and ceilings representing traditional art of four regions of Jaipur, Shekhawati, Marwar and Mewar.

Name: Ikbal V
Title: Very good
Review: I saw hundreds of years old vehicles which used by royal families there. This place must visit who like hystory.

Name: Apurva J
Title: visit the royal times
Review: if you are enthusiastic about the old world relics and stories - this is a place not the be missed. Do visit.

Name: Sanjy66
Title: It was my first visit and will be with me till my end
Review: Pay ‚Çπ100/- each for an entry to this piece of 288years history by Indian tourists and 200‚Çπeach for foreigners enter the palace and witness the glorious past of kachchwaha kings .see what they wore what they used for their life styles their clothes ,footwear,jewellery,utensils,weapons and decorations besides vehicles or carts.i along with my daughter lived this history by seeing all sabha bhawan,armery,museums of clothing and other royal items. The huge royal court is full of portraits of kachchwaha kings  and the live scene of  royal Court mesmerises you with it's grand and gracious beauty intact  yet after a longtime .the shops of traditional rajasthani dresses, paintings,mojris and souvenirs catch your eyes as well boost your bargain skills ,the barabari restaurant  and other snacks shop may quench your thirst and fill your heart with tasty food.puppetwallah and snake charmers are bonus treats to eyes.

Name: Kalpit0302
Title: Royal Times!!
Review: This museum is the showcase of royal family of Jaipur. Here you can see the various jewellery, wept, cloths and other items used by the royal family. Worth a visit if you want to know about history of Jaipur and its Kings.

Name: NIR006
Title: Fine place, but nothing special
Review: - The museum is decently maintained- Has a lot of ancient items and weapons used by the maharajas- Information on the displays is limited...so the historical significance is not highlighted- Nothing to impress the kids...

Name: Rahul P Singh
Title: Nice Museum
Review: This sprawling complex, with its gorgeous buildings and marvelous collection of art and artifacts is without parallel in Rajasthan. This museum main focus is on artifacts that were connected to Indian culture. This museum has wide collection of sculptures, paintings or carpets. The Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum is situated inside the City Palace complex at Jaipur. The museum has an excellent collection of the ancestral objects of Kachwaha clans of Amber.A major part of the ‚ÄòCity Palace‚Äô now consists of the ‚ÄòMaharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum‚Äô. It is also the residence of the Jaipur Royal Family.Located within the City Palace complex and nestled amidst older buildings, temples and the palace quarters, this museum was launched in 1959 by Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II. The artifacts comprise of the ancestral collections built up by the successive rulers of Amer and Jaipur, and are presently run by a public charitable trust.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: This and City Palace Museum are one and the same attraction
Review: I have seen duplicate entries of attraction on tripadvisor. It appears from reviews posted here that many tourists have gathered a wrong impression that Maharaja Sawai Mansingh II Museum is just a collection of Buggies and different from City Palace. In fact City Palace is name for entire Palace of past Rulers of Jaipur out of which some part has been thrown open as Museum which is known as  Maharaja Sawai Mansingh II Museum and has following parts/galleries- 1. Mubaraq Mahal ( Gallery of Textiles).2. Friends of Museum (36 karkhana) just behind Mubaraq Mahal where you can see local artists working and can also buy their works/articles. There is a separate ticket of Rs 10/head. 3 Sileh Khana (Armoury- a collection of arms/weapons) 4 Sarvatobhadra of Hall of Private audience or Diwan-e-Khaas ( a building open on all 4 sides accept corners and having 2 large silver urns)5 Sabha Niwas or Hall of Public audience or Diwan-e-aam (closed hall)6. Pritam Niwas Chowk 7 Riddhi-Siddhi Pol (gates)8 Bagghi-khana (gallery of chariots, Victoria and coaches)9 A restaurant called Baradari. 10 Chndra Mahal (from outside only)There are entries for Serial No. 4,5,7 & 10 as separate attraction in Tripadvisor site. Entry gates are as following - 1 Virendra Pol is near ticket counter of Jantar-mantar or observatory.2 Udai Pol or Atish Pol is near Baggi Khana and leads to Jaleb Chowk (now used as parking area for tourists)3 While the above mentioned 2 gates are used by public the Singh Pol is reserved for royal family and faces towards Tripoliya Gate.

Name: Kakashi G
Title: once a watch
Review: it has some ancient articrafts and vehicles like cars and buggy kept there which were used by kings and maharajas of Jaipur

Name: priteshkulkarni
Title: collection of vehicles used by royal people
Review: Maharaja sawai man singh museum is the collection of vehicles used by royal people. there are more than 25 cars which were used by them. got o know that all are in running condition and on day of Dashera, they take a rally of all vehicles

Name: Bradley T
Title: this is the city palace
Review: This is the part of the city palace that visitors can enter.  It includes access to 4 courtyards and 4 museums.  Eg the textile museum, the art gallery, the armory, the small car museum, the Diwan-e-Khas Hall of Private Audience.

Name: Prashant D
Title: Nice glimpse of erstwhile royalty
Review: This is a part of the City Palace and is definitely worth a visit.You get glimpses into how royalty used to live and dress during their days and their various accomplishments. There are also pics of how they entertained guests, especially the English viceroys and generals of those days.There is also a fine display of their swords and other things.In a nutshell, this is worth a visit, some of the grandeur is clearly evident from the displays.

Name: Dhaval Mehta
Title: History of Jaipur
Review: Just like any other raja maharaja mueseum .but worth visiting to learn more about history of Jaipur... lot of guns, swords and shields.... a few knights in not so shining armours... but excellent place to take children who are inquisitive about history.. well documented and managed venue . be advised, it can get crowded sometimes... but overall pleasant experience

Name: PRIYANK U
Title: Must see in Jaipur
Review: Must watch to understand the history and legacy of Jaipur and Rajasthan. Have been there during recent tour with colleagues for annual business review

Name: Vibhuti
Title: an average place
Review: A very small museum, with few collectables placed in one lobby. Nothing extra ordinary about the place.

Name: Manish Deo
Title: Average
Review: Just like any ancient museum, this is no less. Nothing much to see else than ther antiques. Right in the heart of the city.

Name: Suket314
Title: sms museum
Review: good collection of old asset... history itself...... good chance to meet and experience history itself...

Name: Shishir S
Title: Clothes and traditions
Review: Museum shows the tradition and types of clothes royal family used to wear. It gives you lots of knowledge about their traditions, interests, tastes etc. Overall a gud museum to visit.

Name: Jolyon67
Title: Other name for City Palace
Review: This is a doubled up listing with Jaipur City Palace, under its commercial name. There are a number of buildings you can enter, no photos allowed in most of them. The Armoury, textile gallery, durbar hall and coach museum. You can hire audio guides and there is an extended Royal Grandeur tour which takes you into previously off limit areas in the main royal palace. It costs 300Rs to visit and another 200Rs if you want to video anything.

Name: Aparna S
Title: Can be avoided
Review: Its part of th city palace.. doesnt need a separate mention.. nuthn spectacular.. rather spend time adorning the architecture of the city palce and the peacock gates

Name: Vividh L
Title: Great visit
Review: Really nice and grand, reminiscent of the past. Well maintained palaces. Nicely labelled too. However photography not allowed in certain parts.

Name: Damon P
Title: Great visit
Review: This place has a really good architecture and worth a visit. It screams history and the museum is really good with all the artifacts. The paintings are worth looking at and one gets to see royalty up close. A must visit for history buffs.

Name: Radhika G
Title: A let-down
Review: Another tourist attraction that yells for attenton and good up-keep. We visited this place 9 years back too, and recalled fond memories, but this time round, things weren't the same. It seemed that upkeep of the place has been compromised upon heavily.

Name: MrPKI
Title: Interesting History and Decent Museum
Review: This place is best known for its architecture and buildings.  There is some good pictures and exhibits to document and show of the history of this Maharaja.  Most things are in good shape and not run down.

Name: Vaarun
Title: Averag-ish
Review: its a small museum all the collectables are place in one lobby... that too is small one... Not a place to specially juz to see this one.. lot more things are there in jaygarh fort...

Name: Vasundhra78
Title: Beautiful palace
Review: A Must see palace if you are plannng your trip to Jaipur.  I would say that ths is the only palace in Jaipur that is so much maintained. The king of this palace - Maharaja - ManSingh II is still alive. The designing on the walls are the beauty of this palace.  This palace is not converted into museum.  I personally observed this spot as one of the favs for non indian visitors.

Name: Lisa K
Title: Get insight into the life of the Raj
Review: I actually enjoyed this far more than the review suggests - but to be fair it's no Louvre or London National Gallery. The art, textiles, paintings and weaponry put the palace into perspective and you should not miss the museum just for this reason.

Name: cukoo
Title: mueeum
Review: maintained very well..you can know the history..and how they lived in those days and  few items like(swords,polo equipment,painting,etc)

Name: tk44
Title: Interesting enough, but not exciting
Review: This museum is located in the gorgeous City Palace of Jaipur and is kind of a poor cousin to it. It's like they thought a palace needs an additional attraction - put up some pictures and called it a museum. The collection has some value as a brief view of history, of course, but as a separate attraction, the museum was not attractive enough for me.You need to go through all the usual hassle - bag checks, ticketing, double-stamping etc and it is not really worth the crowds in there. If I'd visit the City Palace again, I would stay outside and stare/photograph the exeptionally beautiful moghul palace architecture and only go inside if it gets really hot in the sun. The visit took me about 10 mins in the queue and 15 mins inside.

Name: Rajat984
Title: Good Museum
Review: Beautiful place to visit. It make history relive. The old things look beautiful and when watch then it‚Äôs a wonderful experience. You feel very royal watching all those things. There are couple of things which are very amazing like 200 lts pots and all.

Name: NaikAvi
Title: Worth a visit
Review: Do visit this museum to understand how Indian Kings used to lap in luxury in their times. Located conveniently in the city centre, it is easily accessible by all corners. Not only will you find artefacts dating ancient Indian history, you will also find a collection of International artefacts here. The most interesting

Name: MANAGEMENT INNO... b
Title: amazing
Review: not too miss, very interesting, make sure you have a guide to explain details and history, its huge....

Title: Good place to visit in Jaipur
Review: Good place to visit.Photographers are fooling people by saying Free Photographs. They charge when you take printouts.Spacious. Small musuem.Meeting places and standard palace stuff.Entry Fee - Very High.Near to Jantar Mantar and Hawa Mahal.

Name: Michaela B
Title: Interesting architecture and function in this ancient planetarium which has been restored and maintained
Review: Fascinating and well worth a visit. Have a guide. The instruments are not only visually pleasing, Their functions are amazing and varied and accurate. Restorations have been carried out in 1901, but when you consider when the originals were placed.... it is mindblowing technology!

Name: Film G
Title: Impressive Technology
Review: A massive sundial (highly accurate) and other zodiac/astrological instruments are on display at this small park near the City Palace. Science-minded people will be impressed.

Name: Barbara A
Title: Loved the geometry of the place
Review: A great way to view the stars. It has great open areas and you can take your time musing what people might have seen years ago

Name: DP1066
Title: A guide is essential!
Review: This is an extensive and interesting collection of astrological instruments which is best visited on a sunny day.  A guide is essential to demonstrate the various sundials and explain how they tell the time, with impressive accuracy.  The positioning of the various constellations of the zodiac also needs some explanation!

Name: coll612
Title: A must do !
Review: With a guide this was one of the best things we did in Jaipur but have a guide to help you really understand this amazing historical siteMy wife and I loved it Early morning is best

Name: Jo VL
Title: Interesting
Review: Interesting visit of 30 minutes to 1 hour. You need a guide (might be the audio guide) to fully understand the place.

Name: ukrishnaswamy
Title: Jantar Mantar- Be amazed.
Review: Well, if you think the West ahd it all figured out, visit the Jantar Mantar and learn about our universe, and the calculation of time and the Sun's path through the year. Be amazed as to how much Astronomy our ancients knew.

Name: Arqueros
Title: Hadn‚Äôt heard of this but fascinating
Review: Our guide took us to Jantar Mantar which is an incredible series of astronomical structures, one of which can tell the time to within 2 seconds. It‚Äôs smaller version works to 20 seconds. Other structures relate to the zodiac and point to the relevant constellations. One of the best surprises to date.

Name: Andrew T
Title: Incredible
Review: This is a real must if you visit Jaipur. The park is absolutely fascinating but I would recommend a guide as it‚Äôs really helpful to understand the multitude of astronomical/astrological devices

Name: Wrappo
Title: Extraordinary place
Review: This historic park is a collection of apparatus for measuring time and the position of the planets.  It dates back to the 18th century and our guide was very knowledgeable and pointed out how these monuments functioned

Name: DonkScotland
Title: Absolutely fascinating
Review: Our guide brought us here and his understanding of the structures and the development of this astronomical and astrological complex was just amazing, and so helpful to us.  Really was quite a highlight of our visit to Jaipur

Name: EONJoburg
Title: Interesting
Review: Spend 1 hour with a well equipped guide ,and you will truly enjoy this stop. It‚Äôs fascinating how accurate these astrology facilities were built more than 300 years ago.

Name: April S
Title: So intersting
Review: When we first arrived I didn't know what to make of all the structures. I am so glad we had a guide; I highly recommend this so you can learn about what all these amazing structures can do. It was truly amazing how both sundials were accurate to my cell phone time; amazing!

Name: Ktrine_San132229
Title: Fascinating!!!
Review: Must hire a guide for they make astronomy science interesting. An open air astronomical artifacts museum, our guide Lucky was informative for we didn't mind the heat. Amazing how the calculation of the sun dial is accurate to our watch.Worth the visit.

Name: durham05
Title: An astronomical wonder
Review: The highlight of my visit to Jaipur, after having heard about the instruments beforehand. Inexpensive to get in and there is a huge amount to see. The sundial's accuracy in amazing!

Name: Lv2Travel
Title: Tips for visiting the observatory
Review: - Have a guide take you around and explain the importance of the different items to the Hindu culture.  Horoscope is very important, and you‚Äôll get a much better experience than just reading the plaques.- Take water and a hat, as it is all outdoors.  - Go in the early daytime to avoid the afternoon heat.- You can also see the backside of the Palace of the Winds from this site.

Name: Essexnat
Title: Informative
Review: I normally hate this kind of thing but was amazed. Highly recommend the fact something hundreds of years old can tell the time by two seconds of accuracy. Could spend a few hours here to see the largest sundial in the world!

Name: reeceyb
Title: Impressive
Review: This is a great place to see how people would tell the time and read star signs etc etc many years ago it‚Äôs amazing to see how accurate the massive instruments are

Name: John W
Title: You may learn more than you need to know about astrology
Review: Its actually very historically significant. The "equipment" is amazing for when t was constructed. And the accuracy of the measurements is unreal.

Name: Johnny R
Title: Impressive astrological museum
Review: Great museum showing different structures used for astrological measurements.  Every item has an explanation to how it was used and when relevan it Waldo shows calculations. There are a lot of guides whom speak English fluently (even heard some Spanish one).

Name: kiwitripper64
Title: Big and science
Review: Really nice to see old, accurate science with accurate local time and star positions. The way it way all made is now also art. We really enjoyed this

Name: batramadhur
Title: Art, Science, Astronomy, Archaeology all are here
Review: This Jantar Mantar is actually bigger than the one in Delhi and has a lot of time calculation techniques which were used on Old days.Things to Remember:-1) Ticket is cheap for Indian Nationals.2) Do take a Authorized Guide with you unless you won't be able to know the significance on each which us quite interesting3) Beautiful Garden and photo points inside.4) Completely open so go wisely on a hot day5) Nearby city palace could be visited along with it

Name: deltoro1990
Title: Unbelievable
Review: Absolutely unbelievable place. I didn‚Äôt expect it to be as incredible as it is. Spent about an hour just strolling and staring at these magnificent structures. I didn‚Äôt take a guide but it might be helpful to explain how the structures work. If you are a photographer, you will love this place too

Name: ashrafazrol
Title: Overpriced open museum
Review: Don't get me wrong. The scientific aspect of the place is totally awe-inspiring. However, the price ticket of I think 1000-2000 rp is just too much. Not worth it for the space and actual scientific learning that could be done inside the vicinity.

Name: Deblina B
Title: Science lover must go.Guide must
Review: This place is at heart of the city, and you can cover hawa mahal, jantar mantar and city palace in one shot as those are nearby.Guides are available to cover these 3 places.This place is a symbol of Scientific  awareness of ancient Indian royals. Science lovers will like this place , You need a  guide to help you to understand the mystery inside otherwise it will be just some boring place for you .I would highly recommend to take your kids there, they can relate their astronomy readings there.

Name: cisco289
Title: If You Like Astronomy and Astrology....!
Review: Our tour guide led us through this expansive astronomical and astrological site and described the many structures with their relation to the days, months, and years, i.e., it is an astronomical clock. Many structures are also labeled to fit the 12 zodiacs. The precision is so very impressive for people who had no hi tech equipment several hundred years ago!

Name: Bromewood, flowers
Title: Surprised
Review: We visited because it was on the list of things to see. Pleasantly surprised by the precision of these instruments conceived in the late 1700‚Äôs. Best to hire a guide.

Name: Sabbitan B
Title: Hire a Guide !
Review: This place needs a lot of explanation don‚Äôt miss it because it‚Äôs very interesting and the guides here are very knowledgeable. Hire a guide and let him leave you astounded with the knowledge the Indian ancestors had possessed

Name: TrevB56
Title: Really Interesting....
Review: ..... if you are into astrology, science, astronomy or mathematics  or just cool things that are quite interesting when explained. You need a good guide to do this place justice and if it is sunny (which happens quite often :-)) then you can tell the time with the sun dials and check against your watch (adjusting for the local time difference caused by Indian Standard Time). If I have sent you to sleep already then this is probably not the place for you but if you are still awake then believe me some of these constructions are impressive when you consider some of them are over 300 years old and are more accurate than some watches I can mention.

Name: RoamHere
Title: Amazing place
Review: To think that this was built in the early 1700‚Äôs is extraordinary and that this the 5th observatory built by Jai Singh II is remarkable. There‚Äôs a lot to see here but best to avoid midday if you can as there is little protection from the sun, but obvious reasons! But there is a cafe with a shaded area where you can have some refreshment.

Name: RonM
Title: Fascinating
Review: Amazing history of India. This place show how far advance ancient India was. I highly recommend this place and suggest you spend some time understanding the structures.

Name: kk19632015
Title: Probably more interesting to scientists
Review: Absolutely lost on me I'm afraid.  I don't understand astronomy, don't believe in astrology and it was far too hot to be a pleasant place to be.

Name: pherbert1
Title: truly amazing
Review: this is one of the most fascinating places and the accuracy that these devices achieve is incredible, 3 seconds accuracy all year, the different measurements are fascinating and on a huge scale, well worth a visit

Name: Cous Cous J
Title: Great if you love or work in STEM
Review: The Jaipur Astronomical Clock was recommended to by my Father who visited it 30 odd years ago and when my guide on a grouo tour suggested it as an optional activity I jumped at the chance. The sundials are acurate to within seconds and the guides explain the mathematics involved to covert time from local Jaipur time to standard time. There is also the clock or machine used by the vedic astrologers to calculate horoscopes and the actual horoscope sundials themselves. Each horoscope's sundial is based on meridiand of lattitude and also where constellations sit in the sky. The wonderful guides will explain it all to you and I think a guide is included in the small entrance fee. There is also the opportunity to meet with Astrologers to have your horoscope mapped and written if they are available which I missed as I visited too late in the day close to closing time.

Name: Geo G
Title: Must have a to guide explain.
Review: This is the Royal Astronomical Observatory.  Fascinating astronomical instruments from the 16th century.  Guides are available and I believe they are included as part of the entrance fee.

Name: Sandy S
Title: Fascinating!!
Review: We were blown away with the ideas and concepts that the ancients used re Maths and science. Well kept open air museum with a lot to see and learn from. History recorded, at its best!

Name: Annnyy
Title: QUITE UNIQUE!
Review: If you believe in Astrological science this would be a good place. Apart from the astrologers there is a beautiful museum you can visit in..

Name: nrm77
Title: Mystical
Review: I was taken here by my husbands cousins, as just because they said it is really good experience in Jaipur and that the vedic astrologers are really accurate. Well only time will tell whether it is or it isn‚Äôt, but as far as the experience goes, the astrologers were quite keen and quite expensive. Will only recommend if you have time and money to spare in life.

Name: Kobus69
Title: So fascinating
Review: At first, we thought we can give this open air museum a miss because of the heat, but we are so glad we went.  It is amazing how the astrological clocks and ancient sundials were developed and used.  A real eye opener in terms of India's contribution to science.

Name: Siddharth S
Title: Sisodia garden
Review: A place you can give a skip, not that great and prefer going during evening.If been to rock garden in Chandigarh don't go to this place

Name: Nandini
Title: Interesting
Review: Tucked away, we decided to go here . The staff at the counter were very cordial and we were informed that till 31st October, it is on a 505 discount of entry tickets. On entering the garden, we thoroughly enjoed ourselves but it hardly takes much time to see the multi layered garden. What we found more interesting is on coming out of the garden, on the walls opposite to it, the paintings are still visible and given the fact, that there were on time tested palace walls, it mage it more special.

Name: Coastal826245
Title: Garden & garden
Review: Maharaja time royal garden. beautifull landscpaed with fountains and flowers. Reasonable entry ticket.

Name: Shoeb S
Title: Beautiful Palace and Garden
Review: the Palace is closed for visitors, therefore we can only view the garden which is on the ground floor.the entire palace is divided into three segments.Ground - GardenFirst - Kind of BalacySecond  - Actual Palace.we enter into the monument from the second phase that is beside the palace.

Name: Leslie L
Title: Nice gardens
Review: I visited Sisodia Rani Palace and Gardens during my day tour of Jaipur City with Royal Majestic Tours and an excellent guide, Mukesh who provided an excellent account of the history of the Rani Garden. The garden was lovely, but not very large with lots of frangipanni trees exuding a beautiful fragrance.

Name: jazsacher
Title: beautiful garden
Review: I enjoyed my visit to the Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden.  There was no one here when we visited in the afternoon and was ideal for taking a nice stroll, enjoying the sites, and taking scenic photos.  However, the garden and palace seemed a bit generic and ordinary for me compared to the ones we had already visited.  I don't mean to detract from the review but there were so many others in Delhi and Jaipur that were simply 'out of this world' that I need to rate this place as ordinary compared to the others.

Name: sanjeevkdass
Title: Beautiful
Review: The Sisodiya Rani garden depicts the kind of love the king has for his queen. He built this garden for her exclusively and it‚Äôs been made beautifully. The garden is in levels and I loved it. Do visit once.

Name: Tanvi
Title: Beautiful garden
Review: The garden is beautiful and clean . I visited here with husband and kids . It was not too crowded . The entry fee is also not too expensive . It is a huge garden and we enjoyed . Although we were here for 20-30 mins here .

Name: JillyKent
Title: Green and peaceful garden
Review: We visited this garden as we are keen gardeners. The garden is a multi - tiered paradise garden , very green and peaceful. We were disappointed that the fountains were not working and there was no water in the channels so it missed the effect of being a true Paradise garden. Nice change after the noise of Jaipur.

Name: Aveek B
Title: Bit on the outskirts of Jaipur but not very far and wonderful place
Review: The Sisodia Garden is very well maintained and is on the city outskirts. One might get Ola from the garden post visit or need to rely on local transport like Auto. Its not in the itinerary for most travelers but the garden is well maintained and is a stepped garden. Its surrounded by hills all over and its serenity is the best feature.

Name: Tish A
Title: Beautiful Garden and Palace
Review: Its a beautifully maintained place. Not crowded as it has an entry ticket and few tourists are aware of this beauty.Its a stepped garden with a palace sorrounded by mountains. Must visit.

Name: M9000
Title: Not worth the entrance fee nor the time
Review: The place is about 10km away from the Jaipur city center and we book a taxi via Ola to get there. The entrance fee for foreigners is 200INR which I thought was way overpriced for what it was. The palace which is overlooking the garden was under renovation (as of Feb 2019) and thus not accessible The garden were nice but nothing spectacular at least not in winter. The "canals/fountains" did not contain water - not sure if that is season dependent or not. In the evening there should be a fountain show which we had to complain (they said there were not enough people to do the show) in order to see it. The "fountain show" was also underwhelming. To see the gardens and pictures we took like 20min. The place is quite far away from any other attractions in Jaipur. Considering the location/entrance fee and the fact there is really not much to see I would say it is not worth the visit.

Name: Jccj49
Title: Lovely quiet Oasis
Review: What a pleasant surprise to find this small garden hidden away.  It was so quiet and peaceful, the toilets and grounds were very well kept.  Unfortunately as in most places we visited the fountains were not working.  But I would recommend a visit.

Name: siva200
Title: Away from other attractions
Review: Its located away from other attractions. Its a small garden which has been average one.Good place to walk for 10-15 min. It can be skipped.

Name: Kishanu Karmakar
Title: worst because of officers behavior
Review: I heard about place and decided to go there, after reaching the address one of officer said me camera is not allowed hence other regular visitor bringing camera as they feel like home. place would be good, because i did not enter just because of their officers who sited on ticket counter shop. never thought about this kind of worst services i got in jaipur.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal...
Review: This situated approx 10-12 km from main city on Jaipur Agra highway...beautiful garden with royal palace. It has se entry ticket as well..

Name: vmtrek_travel
Title: Passable
Review: Rupees 50 as entry was unjustified as access to the main palace was restricted due to renovation. Even the fountains in the garden were switched off.The garden was decently maintained but more greenery than colourful flowers.On return from Galtaji temple we spared sometime to drop in. Surely, it could have been avoided.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Not essential but picturesque
Review: This is not extra ordinary garden and if you are hard pressed you can skip this garden. However, if you have included Galta temple in your itenarary then you can see this Garden by sparing 10 minutes on your route. This time I did not find a little change. The palace was being renovated, doors were being painted and their wire gauge, which did not allow view of inside has been replaced with Glass panes. I am not sure whether the palace will be thrown open to public or not? I have found it closed on my earlier visits. Entry ticket is Rs 50 for Indians which is a little expensive for this small Garden which has nothing unusual to offer.

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Good place to see in outskirt of Jaipur
Review: The garden name itself gives it's clarification made for queens. Good place to see on the way to Galtaji Temple.

Name: Nehal V
Title: Super place
Review: A nice historical place that has been well maintained. It is sent in a great location with splendid views all around. There are many places to take that perfect photo as well.

Name: jonesharma29
Title: Beautiful place
Review: sisodia rani palace is good place for spent some time in evening.nice walking pathway surrounded by greenery area

Name: shanupce137
Title: Great...
Review: It is such a beautiful garden. We went here when we were going to Agra because it was in the way. We take some pictures and we spent some great time here.

Name: siya18
Title: Garden for  queen of Maharaja sawai jai singh 2
Review: It is a very nice garden which is 6kms away from jaipur city.It was built by mahraja sawai jai singh 2 in 1728for her queenIt has beautiful fountains which starts around sunset with rajasthani music in background.Visit garden at around 5-5.30 and sit till 8.00Feel the peace at the place and enjoy at fullest

Name: iamsoConfused
Title: Free time - activity
Review: You can visit this place if you are free as most of the attractions in Jaipur closes at 5 in evening. Entry free is 50 RS per person. As this place is far from city and not with very good internet connectivity. Either you have your own vehicle or try to leave on time. Place is clear and gives a good view. You will feel good as it's peaceful place. Your an hour is enough time to be there.

Name: darshcv
Title: Beautiful Garden
Review: It was not in my priority list while visiting Jaipur. While passing through for Galtaji I saw some nice paintings on the outside wall of this garden. Then I visited it, and wow! Very beautiful garden. Nicely maintained. No crowd. So peaceful.

Name: tosuman
Title: Small royal garden
Review: Its a small garden with Mughal influence. It is going through repairing so the main building is closed but the garden is open. You can enjoy the nice relaxing breeze there. Not much to see or do, Just spend some time and relax.

Name: Charlotte R
Title: Peaceful
Review: It was very quiet when we visited, with very few other visitors - a welcome respite from the noise of the streets of Jaipur. We mainly went because it was part of our composite tickets, but were very pleased we‚Äôd come and enjoyed the gardens and wildlife.

Name: travelpassion
Title: Clean and peaceful
Review: The gardens are very well kept and very clean, which was not the case for many of the places we visited; ironically it was the only place we saw a rat during our 11-day trip in Northern India and the place I least expected it! We had the place to ourselves when we visited and the clean contrast compared to the "Monkey Palace" that we had just come from was marked! Worth a visit.

Name: tripson6
Title: Palace and Garden is Superb.....
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace is surrounded by Mountains. The view is really good with nature. Palace and Garden is beautiful place to visit. The palace and garden surroundings are kept neat and tidy.

Name: Verchasv
Title: Occasion of marriage
Review: Sisodia Rani Garden is a way of the between Transport Nagar and Ghat ke Balaji, everyone reach there 2 way, the another way is bypass of tunnel, this place is know as lavishly party and celebrating, they are huge parking area, these garden the Vintage Palace are there.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Beautiful...
Review: One of the very old garden, Now restored and make it more beautiful and attractive. It is surrounded by mountains. Must see...

Name: Sanjay S
Title: Beautiful location.
Review: Nice place for weekend to be spent. Tickets prices could be little cheaper. Beautiful fountains, nice garden. More of activities should be there for children..

Name: TravelDiaries_Pulkit
Title: Classy weddings
Review: Not really sure whether it is a tourist attraction but they have some very classy weddings. On the way to LNM IIT, it sure has hosted some grand celebrations.

Name: Varun J
Title: Good place and well managed
Review: It is a beautiful place where you can see garden and the palace coming together . Drive to this place is also quite scenic . Would totally recommend it if you are going to jaipur . If you are not too late in evening then you can probably go to galta ji temple which is on the same road ahead . There is police and security everywhere so security isn‚Äôt much of a problem . You can go there with a book or to spend some good time to relax .

Name: Rosy L
Title: Marvellous gardens
Review: The gardens were breathtaking and they were really maintained and the gardens had so many flowers like jasmines and a good spot to have a picnic. It was so lovely and everyone loved it a lot.

Name: Rajiv R
Title: Beautiful View
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden is beautiful place to visit, it was all surrounded by Mountains and the view was really good with lots of different birds and well maintained garden.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Royal Palace
Review: Sisodia Rani palace and garden is beautiful . Its royal look is amazing. Beautiful palace to see. Must see location.

Name: sid_ups
Title: Surrounded with Natural Beauty
