Review: This garden is little far from Jaipur. But when you there, you see beautiful heritage on both side of the road for that no need to go through tunnel. Just follow the old road. I went there in a marriage function.

Name: naveen_oberoi
Title: Beautiful Garden at Outskirt of Jaipur
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden is very beautiful and located at jaipur -agra highway. If you have time, I would suggest to visit this garden, it hardly takes 1 hour to cover this garden. It's an ancient type garden, beautifully made. Nice architecture make it more beautiful

Name: traceyquick
Title: Peaceful and green
Review: This is a beautiful garden that provides some respite from the crowds of Jaipur. I walked around taking in the lovely well cared for gardens filled with chipmunks and birds and enjoyed its simplicity. The women who are maintaining the gardens are doing a fabulous job. Although the fountains and watercourses were not in operation I was able to imagine what it was like in the past. Take a visit here it is a lovely place. Shame the restaurant is no longer operating because a cup of masala chai or  coffee in the gardens would have been perfect.

Name: Myblo
Title: Feel royal
Review: Very nice place. building is nicely built. Series of buildings beside the road are very nice and worth visiting. It is located at the bottom of a hill. A main temple is located at the hill top also a nice place to visit.

Name: moveoutnow
Title: Beautiful, serene place
Review: This is a well-maintained garden, slightly away from the city. When we went, there were very few people around. It's a great place to take loads of photos, or just to admire the scenery of the garden and the hills nearby.

Name: Shantanu D
Title: Majestic..
Review: This place is away from the main city. Away from all hustle-bustle and busy city life.Wonder after reaching here we found very few people actually present at the spot. The garden is beautifully maintained and one will feel relaxed and fresh just to roam in it. The view of majestic mountains adds sparks to it. The garden has beautiful plants and trees and greenery all round. After roaming to forts and museums we found the place very relaxing and calm.

Name: vibha123
Title: Must visit for some peace and breathtaking views
Review: We visited this place after amer fort...trust me we needed some peace and views to feel refreshed and this place offered it all.There are so many birds and squirrels and kids enjoyed chasing them all.You can also sight some migrated birds ...in this garden...This place reminded me of history where queen and her friends must have had a good time....The history of this place is also very interesting.. Entry fee is minimal ..

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Royal Gardan
Review: This Royal Garden is famous in jaipur. This Gardan is surrounding of green mountain. This gardan is good for Marriage and parties.

Name: jitendra g
Title: nice place to visit
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace and Gardens is one of the most popular attractions in Jaipur. Built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II , the garden is so beautiful.

Name: Praveer_20
Title: Avoid at all costs
Review: Very basic garden and small palace(can you call it a palace?) along with corrupt entry officer who refuses to give a receipt for entry fee...nothing great about this place

Name: relaxtripp
Title: Nice time to spend with kids
Review: It's a Well Maintained Park. If u think lot of trees or flowers will be there, it is not the place. But a well maintained beautiful garden and amazing forground and background looks are there. you can spend a nice time with your kids here. A small palace (very small one) Built of Rani is there. Not allowed into that. My feel is worth visiting this if u have kids with u.

Name: Nomad100621
Title: A well mantained garden with nice views
Review: This is on the outskirts of city so many people msy give it a miss but it is one of the good gardens i have seen...in three levels..many places to sit...surrounded by hills...you can feel like being in time of kings amd queen..nice architecture.. and clean..you can enjoy sitting in winter sun and enjoy the marvel

Name: abunasar786
Title: Great cool ambiance
Review: This is one place away from the eyes of tourists. We thought of skipping it initially. Who wants to visit a garden. Then we bought the composite Jaipur ticket at Hawa Mahal. We had paid for Sisodia garden. And what a good choice. We took an auto rickshaw from Albert museum. We let our car be in parking. Its at a strange place. On the road to Agra. Very few visitors. The ticket is Rs 50 therefore no lovebirds. Its actually a mahal. The backdrop is aravali hills. Just beautiful. Architecture is mughal like. Very little building and lots of garden. Gardens at three levels. You need to visit to absorb. Must visit.

Name: karth0
Title: Nice but small garden
Review: We were the only visitors during our one hour stay at the garden.. its a beautiful garden with many types of birds!!

Name: ruchi_kapoor
Title: Amazing
Review: This is a palace which is surrounded by green mountains and has lovely gardens.I have attended many wedding here........its a great open place to go for picnics and for parties.

Name: Olivier R
Title: Nice walk in some greenery
Review: Not a must, but interesting to see if you go to Monkey temple from the back side. This garden makes a nice rest stop since there's not that much green spaces in Jaipur. The palace is also interesting.

Name: ajit309
Title: A nice and huge garden.
Review: It is a nice cooling place. a nice hide out for couples; we have caught one already red handed. Overall it is a nice place to visit.

Name: AADSUN
Title: Beautiful Place
Review: Nice garden and well maintained. Better to visit during evening after the sun is down to enjoy the pleasant place.

Name: Nilanjan77
Title: On way back to Jaipur
Review: Nice small garden. Nothing much to see. Small place for leisure after a long gruelling trip to Jaigarh and Nahargarh Forts.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Good peacefulPlace
Review: Enjoy a very peaceful sweet environment  with greenery and hill all around. Royal get up and nice place

Name: pankhain
Title: better not to visit
Review: in my opinion there is nothing special that worth visiting there. it needs a lot of maintenance. one should rethink before going there.

Name: Rahul Sharma üòé
Title: Beautiful Garden and surroundings
Review: I recommend going to sisodia rani Bagh in the evening.  The ambiance with the lights and fountains on is quite good.

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Nice garden
Review: It is nice to go there , very beautiful scenic views and it id near to galta peeth, can be visited there.

Name: om c
Title: Historic .Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden....
Review: such a royal garden...it situated out side from main location from jaipur....not so popular..if you are free than you can visit its normal park...ramniwas bag is best..

Name: bartoldelaselva
Title: Greennn
Review: All green garden all over.. very well maintained . It was very quick look but , we are happy to visit this garden.

Name: Rahul P Singh
Title: Nice and peaceful Garden
Review: The royal garden of Sisodia Rani Ka Bagh is 10 km away from the Jaipur city and lies on Jaipur-Agra highway. It was built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh in 1728 and dedicated to his lovely second wife Sisodia. Elements like the beautiful wall paintings of Radha-Krishna love story further beautify the garden. The paintings on the wall and the narrative details represent the eternal love. The garden is abundant in flowerbeds, foliage, beautiful water fountains, pavilions, galleries, iridescent water channels and murals making it all the more appealing. History says that the garden used as an ideal getaway for the Queen. This multi-tiered bagh that has been breathing life to the desert soil of Jaipur is a wonderful picnic spot. you can walk in the gardens overlooking the Aravalli hills in the background. Many temples nearby. The place is not very touristy and this makes it an excellent choice to escape hustle bustle of city and enjoy some peace. Place is Ideal for a picnic or just to spend time. The garden is beautiful, very well maintained.‚Ä¢  Visiting Hours ‚Äì 8:00 AM to 6:00 PM ‚Ä¢  Entrance Fee ‚Äì Rs. 25 (Indian)/ Rs. 50 (Foreigner)

Name: Tender0
Title: Oh wow.
Review: Beautiful expanse of storeyed lawns and out houses. Best enjoyed when there is an event (wedding or party) in the evenings with full lights on. Rich interesting histpory

Name: welcomeumesh
Title: Good garden but no activities
Review: I really felt cheated when I had to pay Rs. 50 as entry fee per person in the name of this garden. Only good thing is view of mountain from garden. The garden was clean. There were no specific variety of flowers and plants. No boating, no fountain kind of activities at all. There is provision for fountain. An average place only for locals.

Name: SHDD
Title: lovely garden
Review: We visited this garden on our way back from the Galta. This place consists of   tiered multi levelled gardens with fountains, water courses and painted pavilions. This palace garden derives its name , Sisodia Rani Palace  and  garden from the queen (rani ) of whom it was built, Its a nice quiet place to relax, as we found  many young couples hanging around there. It a pity when we were there  renovations were taking place and the fountains where not in operation. Its a good place to visit if you have the time in Jaipur. It has good architecture as well.

Name: drnaveenbp
Title: The Love This Garden In Jaipur!!!!
Review: Many Package tours do not take you here. Please visit if you have 2 days to spare in Jaipur, its accessible by an auto or a private vehicle. Nice place to spend time with your family and close friends during evening.

Name: Kakashi G
Title: nice place to pass the time
Review: This is a garden where you will mostly find young couples sitting there. There are gardens and other shops there

Name: Amanvari
Title: Must visit this secret gem
Review: We really enjoyed the tranquility and bliss of being here. Virtually no other visitors make it a wonderful way to see beautiful architecture and gardens.Using mainly Plumerias as sculptural elements in this formal Mughal styled ( char bagh) garden gives a great formal tropical feel. In the mid afternoon when we visited the fragrance was intense, really showing how gardens are used as oases of escape from the arid geography and heat that is the rest of Rajasthan.

Name: Eldestein
Title: A garden fit for maharajas
Review: This elegantly designed garden is a beautiful place to be, in case you are traveling in that direction.It is maintained very well and is pristine clean with the guards keeping a hawk eye for anyone playing mischief. Incase you are in no mood to rest, then you can surely give this place a miss.

Name: Sivagajan V
Title: Beautiful
Review: This is a beautiful and relaxing place in the outskirts of Jaipur. We had a romantic time here. The premises are kept  very clean. Flowers are well maintained. It is worth the visit for any couples visiting Jaipur.

Name: Manish B
Title: Excellent Garden
Review: Well Maintained Garden, with excellent architecture around the place, not very big but one good place to sit and relax.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: A well maintained garden from period of maharajas
Review: Though it is not a huge garden like Vrindawan Gardens but it is located in a very nice place and is very well maintained. There is not a great variety of plants. Mostly Cycas, Lantana, Thuja, Wild Date, Plumeria, a variety of Tabernemontana with small leaves (T. orientalis?) have been planted but the plants and lawn was in very good condition when we visited here. I believe the species of Cycas here is Cycas revoluta (King sago). I observed only female reproductive structures and seeds in many plants but male cone in none! Both species of Frangipani i.e. Plumeria rubra and P. obtusa can be seen here. There were fountains and light but were not operating when we visited here. The places is also rented for holding banquets. There are toilets available here but no facility of snacks or food available inside. There is a shop near entrance gate that sells basic eatables like biscuits. There is entry ticket of Rs 50 for Indians and 200 for foreigners which is slightly higher side. Thankfully there is no charge for camera. It is on way to Galta temple so you can visit this place by sparing 15 minutes. It is on route of Agra too but to touch this place while going to Agra you need to avoid the new long tunnel that has been built recently and take the old route of 'Ghat ki Guni' which in itself is a road worth seeing.

Name: curlylynn
Title: Would not recommend
Review: Very average gardens that could be a lot better. All water fountains and canals were empty of water and very sad looking. It would be far prettier if these were functioning. It looked like they hasn't worked in  long while.Considering the 200rps entrance fee for each foreigner, I expected more.

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: ideal place for wedding!
Review: its a very beautiful garden.. i have attended a few weddings and the place looks just wow at night! must visit

Name: Zexi
Title: A nice quiet garden to end a crazy day in Jaipur
Review: After weeks of travelling India, my girlfriend and I found that at some point each day it was great to just go to a garden and relax.  It got us away from people and noise and the general craziness of India.This garden was typical of many, built on a hillside it had several levels.  Some places to sit and some art work could be found at each level as well as lots of flowers and trees and the reflecting pools.Maybe not the best kept, but it suited us great as we were the only ones so we could spend quiet time watching the birds, squirrels and just enjoying some peace and quiet to end a busy day in Jaipur.Make sure you have travel to and from as we saw at least one tourist get dropped off by a taxi and get stuck there because the taxi took off when he went inside.

Name: SAJIDNOW
Title: Majestic Garden and a Palace
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden is a few kilometers away from the hustle bustle of the Jaipur city and that what makes it so splendid.  Its quiteness and calmness lingers on the mind. The palace has a beautiful three-storeyed structure and is a novel in itself.

Name: Devesh G
Title: A neglected Palace worth a visit
Review: Sisodia Rani Palace is in depleting condition with almost zero maintenance. However, this has been the residence of Sisodia Rani and therefore has immense nostalgia attached. The furniture mostly is getting worn out due to unkept maintenance. I have visited this palace as a teenager way back in 1983 when it was in good condition. I am therefore pained to see the poor maintenance of the palace now.The surrounding garden is beautifully maintained. The outside of the palace walls transforms one to a different pleasure altogether from the depleting condition of the palace.I have visited Sisodia Rani Palace and Garden many times with family, friends and visitors. Without an exception everyone likes the garden and outside of palace walls but feels so sorry for the palace itself considering that other properties in Jaipur are well maintained.

Name: ND1910
Title: A beautiful combination of a Palace and garden
Review: The name of the garden is derived from Sisodiya rani(queen) for whom it was built. It is situated couple of kms away from the city on Jaipur Agra highway.This place consists of tiered multi layered gardens with fountains, watercourses and painted pavilions. A double storey palace occupies the top terrace of the garden. The palace has many galleries, pavilions and beautiful murals depicting scenes from the life of lord Krishna.

Name: Alex M
Title: Lovely little garden, away from the bustle of Jaipur
Review: This is a lovely little garden, east of Jaipur. It's pretty small but when combined with the nearby Vidyadhar garden, it'd easy to lose a couple of hours. Although I couldn't find the cafe, toilets were available, the grass well watered and everything looked very pretty. Sadly it is right next to a busy road, and as such there's the ubiquitous sounding of horns which breaks the spell a bit.

Name: January1872
Title: The Frangipani Garden
Review: the au naturale fragrance beats any paris made perfume. simply divine and despite the heat, i was intoxicated

Name: Iman F
Title: Nice place! Should be explored more
Review: Its a small and nice palace where the Sisodia Rani used to live. A calm and peaceful place to sit and enjoy the architecture. The gardens are big and beautiful. If you have spare time and don't know where to go, you can go here and enjoy a peaceful moment from the hustle and bustle.

Name: KLE2013
Title: The country palace and gardens for a royal wife in the 18th century
Review: On the way back from Galta to Jaipur we passed this garden and made a brief stop.  Built by Sawai  Jai Singh II for his second wife so she could live away from the palace conflict with other wives, this terraced garden and two story country palace is now often the site for Indian films and wedding ceremonies.  The exterior walls are decorated with colorful murals and the gardens are nice, but not outstanding.

Name: GautamChakraborty
Title: Sisodia Rani Garden - 31 Dec 2014
Review: This is outside the city. We had some free time so thought to give this a visit. NOT WORTH. We expected some nice garden where kids could possibly play a bit. But it was not that. A very ordinary garden where arrangements were being made for 31st night party.

Name: PNRao
Title: Beautiful Garden
Review: Sisodia Rani Garden and Palace was built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II in 1779. It is about 6 kilometres from Jaipur, located on NH11, Lal Dungri. It is a beautiful garden and is well maintained. It is not in the main tourist route but is really well worth a visit. It is on the way to Galtaji temple.

Name: Mayur S
Title: Good to the eyes
Review: This formal terraced garden is 6 km from the city on the road to Agra.  The gardens are in front of Sisodia Rani Palace whose outer walls are decorated with murals depicting hunting scenes and the Krishna legend.  Open 8 am to 5 pm.  Entry fee Rs.10.  Worth the effort to get there.

Name: Ruth C
Title: Confused
Review: Reading the other reviews it seems we missed something... a lot. Stopped by on the way to the Monkey temple, drawn by the beautifully painted walls on the roadside and the free entry on the Composite ticket.  However, inside it was a rather underwhelming poorly maintained garden with broken fountains.   Night time pictures look more impressive and maybe I'm doing it a disservice.

Name: seafare74
Title: Beautiful Gardens
Review: Our visit here was brief but what we saw was beautiful and well maintained with fountains and flowering plants.

Name: JaiMataDi2015
Title: Wedding Venue..
Review: Not worth visting as this has been converted into a park mainly used for functions and wedding, Not well maintained. We went to see the park and cam back in 10 mins.

Name: manish24x7
Title: an awsome place to visit
Review: The multi-tiered garden is covered with numerous beautiful fountains, extrinsic flowers, shrubs and other exotic plants.  The walls of palace wear the mesmerizing paintings of lord Krishna and his beloved Radha. The stunning galleries and pillars are clad with the pictures depicting love of Radha-Krishna. The garden gives the feeling of Mughal presence as it is made according to the traditional Charbagh or paradise garden style popular with the Mughals. Many hindi movies have been shot in this palace

Name: JaipurAbhiraj
Title: Awesome
Review: I went to this place on 14/01/15 on makarsakranti with my family ,this is really abeautiful garden and well maintained ,if you are going to agra so its better to stop here or while going to galta jiMe and my cute little daughter enjoyed a lot and we flew kites also in garden

Name: MountainloverKolkata
Title: A great place to visit
Review: This is a great place to visit. The garden is beautifully maintained with lots of flowers in bloom. The "chatris" are exquisite. The place is very peaceful. When we went to the garden, we were the only tourist there.  We enjoyed the beauty and serenity of the place.We had bought a combined ticket for Jantar Mantar, City Palace, Albert Hall,Amer fort (I guess so, saw so many monuments), Sisodia Rani's garden and one more garden. The ticket is valid for 2 days.

Name: Sasanf
Title: Serene but boring
Review: This place is not really on a tourist map. We certainly didn't see any other tourists there. In fact at about five pm, there were hardly anyone at all. It's a serene place. However it is sadly also kind of boring, there really isn't much there to do.Go there if you feel you have plenty of time or if you are looking for some peace.

Name: deepak_it7
Title: Lovely Heritage Garden
Review: Sisodia Palace is 6 KM from Jaipur on Jaipur -Agra road.As soon as you enter Ghat gate you can see this Palace on rightside of the road.It consists of tiered multi-level gardens with fountains, watercourses and painted pavilions. The palace house has several galleries, pavilions and beautiful murals depicting scenes from the life of lord Krishna.Well maintained and neat place.Outside of this Palace can see one crafts shop,having good gift items,price is reasonabel.Timing 8am to 5pm.

Name: Sunil R
Title: Garden is beautiful
Review: Only the Garden is open for visitors. Well maintained and neat place. Elaborate and at multiple levels. Good place to go during evening. One thing that was lacking was a good restaurant within the complex, even though there is a provision for the same.

Name: Ajay Kala
Title: It's a Royal garden
Review: Park,garden, lawns are normally plain grounds with lot of greenery. This Bagh(garden) in 3 levels situated in a surrounding of small hills. Typical Jaipur architecture with big walled gates and covered from all sides with painting on walls gives a sense of celebrations. Security and privacy in walled city for womenfolk has always been the culture of Jaipur.It's a good sight seeing place but limited activities during the day for a tourist. The Sisodia Rani Bagh is best in night. Lighting makes it entirely a different place. Few big fat marriages have taken place in past and place is still a preference for exclusive parties and get togethers.It can accommodate 1000 people in four lawns.  Fountains in the passage gives you Royal treatment.Generally maintained lawns by govt. deptt gives a spirited  feel of Jaipur Royalty. After low ticketed entry you feel it should  have been  maintainted better. The constructed palace can't be visited being a heritage property but outer looks is reflection of good old days of tradition and culture of Jaipur Royal family.

Name: ChrisJ45
Title: Less known but truly beautiful
Review: The Sisodia Rani Garden, I felt, was a less visited but an extremely lovely location of the city. I may be wrong about the less visited part but there were no other visitors in the entire 30 minute period we were there. The gardens are a lovely multi tiered creation which are very well maintained. Makes for some lovely photo ops!

Name: murali8121
Title: Rani sisodia garden, Jaipur
Review: Around ten km from the city centre it's a beautiful garden surprisingly well kept. With not many visitors, you can spend a very peaceful time strolling around watching peacocks and other birds. The terraced layout of the garden is nice. If all the fountains are working, it would be a real treat. Unfortunately, only a couple of them were working when we visited.

Name: Jaikishan D
Title: Good place
Review: The Sisodia Rani Bagh is a little away from the main town. Though the name says garden, it is not that big. It is a small garden with a nice lawn and picturesque surrounding. I would have expected it to be better maintained knowing that there is a entry free for visiting this garden.

Name: A K S
Title: Best lawns in town
Review: This place has probably best lawns in town. Recently renovated, its terraced gardens and view of surrounding hills is unparalleled in the city. Very unique. Very quiet and calm. Must visit ! Do carry your own water and food as nothing is there in the vicinity.

Name: Jack huwaei
Title: Amazing elephant riding
Review: We explore the new accommodation in jaipur elephant fun park . There are many things to do with elephant. We enjoyed elephant ride. That was amazing.  It's natural ride some meters on the top I took ride on elephant. After that we enjoyed with feeding and washing aslo. Definitely they deserve this 5 Star ‚≠ê review for service

Name: Nanny
Title: Solo trip with elephant
Review: I went elephant fun park last Sunday it's was great experience I got  by elephants . There are some activities to spend time with elephant I learned different things about elephant. I enjoyed with elephant ride elephant washing, elephant feeding it's really good experience for me . I would like to recommend this park

Name: james
Title: Most valuable place in Jaipur elephant fun park
Review: Fantastic elephant experience with elephant fun park I love this place from our heart side. I would like to share our experience with elephant fun park. I booked this activity  through the trip advisor. Its our first time experience with elephants.  We enjoyed with elephant care and sharing.  Elephant riding elephant feeding elephant washing that was totally amazing highly recommend this activity.

Name: Fardeen K
Title: My kids enjoyed with elephants
Review: Last Friday we went elephant fun park. That was my second time experience with elephant but my kids first time with elephant,  they really enjoyed with elephant, we spend 3 hours in elephant fun park, our kids enjoyed with elephant ride, elephant washing, elephant feeding, totally great fun we got by elephant fun park. Highly recommend elephant fun park in jaipur

Name: Hassan P
Title: Day with rescued elephant in Jaipur
Review: We glad to join elephant fun park in Jaipur that is amazing experience with them we enjoyed our day with our elephant shanti she is 35 year old she is amazing and friendly with us we feed them more then 2 hours . after that we take a walk with our elephant and last experience was Amazing we got shower with our elephant totally great day I would like to reccomend this place

Name: natlaia
Title: Awesome hands on experience with rescued elephant in elephant Fun park
Review: Me and my husband we have been absolutely blown away by this experience. We were picked up at our hotel.we were glad we chose elephant Fun park . We walked with them through the park feed them multiple bananas and made them lunch which was a joy. Definitely we would like to come elephant Fun park

Name: Sikandar d
Title: Fantastic birthday celebration with elephant
Review: A wonderful Day with elephant adventure fun park. We did  celebration my kids birthday there. We enjoyed day with elephant. Nice to meet with Mr Adil. He is knowledgeable person. Greatest experience get by Him I would like to reccomend this activities

Name: Gresham
Title: Best family trip at  elephant adventure Fun park
Review: Best family trip at elephant adventure Fun park. We enjoyed with elephant riding elephant feeding elephant washing. Thank you so much Adil

Name: Elephant adventure fun park
Review: We went elephant adventure fun park last Sunday. I booked this attraction through the call Mr Adil. He gived us the location of  activities. When we arrived elephant adventure fun park they welcome us. First they explained some amazing things about elephant. That was amazing for us its totally great learning experience. Our activities started by the introduction with elephant after that me and my kids take a great walk with elephant after we gave some food to elephant.  Last activiti  is too more fun for us this  call elephant washing we gave shower elephant. Memorable experience we get by the elephant adventure fun park. Thank you so much Mr Adil to make a great day for my family

It's a cool place to visit with family it is a elephant adventure fun park. There are approximately 5 elephant live in there. You can multiple activities in the elephant adventure fun park. Name: Mohd Y
Title: My kids enjoyed with Shanti (elephant üêò)
Review: One of the best tourist attractions place in Jaipur. And also best for kids and families. We went elephant adventure Fun park with my family we enjoyed with Shanti (elephant) she is very friendly with us my kids paint them with natural colour after that washing elephant, kids enjoyed with elephant ride, all family gave food elephant, mr Adil explained each and every thing about elephant this is totally fantastic for us. I would like to come agin this beautiful place in vacation. Thank you so much elephant adventure Fun park team

Name: jafran
Title: Awesome experience
Review:
Greetings from Elephant adventure fun park Family !

I recommend them all, but I absolutely recommend the Pizhichil with abhyyangam massage.  Ladies this treatment is so beautiful it felt like a spiritual experience.  Every staff member went above and beyond to make my experiences there healing and special.

Review: Great Ayurveda spa experience in India! I found this place to be the perfect level of hospitality that made the entire experience from start to finish relaxing. First of all, they organize transport for you which is just a nice touch. Then the staff, who spoke decent English, would walk you through your package options without being any sort of pushy. Very professional and relaxing process and I found the facilities to be quite clean. The massage itself was great. It was my first time ever doing shirodhara, which is the Indian hot oil dripping and wow was it surreal. My massage therapist ‚ÄúLucy‚Äù (probably spelling that wrong) was great throughout the whole process checking on my pressure, making sure I was comfortable, etc. and finally, pricing was reasonable. definitely recommend if you‚Äôre looking for a massage place in Jaipur! Absolutely brilliant and so gentle. Being a 60 year old gentleman with a slightly damaged back I was a little concerned about a massage but the staff where very thorough asking pre-massage questions to assess my needs. The result was the perfect massage a felt a young man again.

We stayed at the homestay that is run by Dr. Mahendra Sharma and were pleasantly surprised that this Ayurvedic spa was on the property. What a treat! Booking a massage was very easy and we were seen promptly. The massage itself was typical of what you will find in an Asian spa (if you have modesty qualms, you will need to communicate this upfront with English-speaking staff). I loved the oil massage and my facial; they were both invigorating and relaxing. My husband also had a massage and nasal treatment, and found both to be excellent. Highly recommend for anyone in need of a recharge while in Jaipur.

Name: Sarvraj S
Title: Vacations
Review: It was a nice welcome.we spent good time with elephants ,staff was kind and helpful in every activities. Good experience,must come in jaipur!

Name: Oliver T
Title: Dangerous experience!!!
Review: Avoid at all cost!! This is not safe at all, I will explain what happened during my visit:First of all, we go there with our driver, and we sit down with the guy who explain everything from his cellphone, he explain the packages and to be honest, even for Europeans is very expensive (over ‚Ç¨60 for 1h) I told him I only wanted to ride the elephant, he said for half an hour it would cost me 2500 rupies (20-30‚Ç¨) I accepted that offer, and I sat on the elephants neck. First 10 minutes were amazing, first time being elephant it was an incredible moment, then the elephant started getting angry by breathing hard and harder, and later he started making sounds with his trump louder and louder and i said to the guy to calm him down (he did not speak English) he kept telling me it‚Äôs ok it‚Äôs ok, no problem, but then he started beating the elephant with his stick, and then it got a lot worse, the elephant was starting moving around, trying to get out of the situation, he got really upset and was making huge sounds with his trumpet. Scariest moment of my life, luckily for me, the elephant got close to an edge at the same level of my feet, and I jumped out of the animal to be safe. This animals are wild animals, it was 40 degrees to ride them, and if you look at YouTube videos of people killed by elephants you will see how dangerous it is, it literally can kill you.

Name: acu023
Title: One of the highlights of my trip!!!
Review: Absolutely had so much fun riding the elephant. It was very important to me that the elephants are being treated well and kept in a spacious village. I could tell that they are being looked after. The ride took about half an hour. It costed me a lot but it was worth the experience.

Name: DDR1234
Title: Elephants beautiful!
Review: Went on elephant ride in Jaipur and it was fabulous! We had so  much fun and it is very safe ! I will recommend it when you are in Jaipur go on an elephant ride.

Title: Disappointing
Review: We had been told this was a good place for elephants but it was too touristy. You should not paint elephants or ride them - they are animals!!

Review: the very good excited ride of elephant maintain by government. One should try this. around 10 -15 minutes ride.

Review: It was different experience when you visit this and see lovely Elephant, had a ride and we all friends really enjoyed a lot.

Name: RDS582014
Title: A must when visiting Amber Fort
Review: What lovely female elephants.  We enjoyed our ride with Rohini and her owner.  She was magnificent and so friendly! She raised her trunk when her owner requested her to say "hello" to us.  It was a great experience.

Name: julie t
Title: not nice
Review: I saw elephants shackled in souless concrete blocks. I saw a 'social area' that contained no socialising elelephants. Why would anyone want to paint an elephant?  The most unnatural place ive ever seen animals kept in. At least in zoos the animals are kept in a group not isolated like this.

Review: If all the place I've been to visit on my trip around India I would highly recommend coming the the elephant village. The elephants were looked after very well and there were an amazing amount of activities available. Yeah people who looked after them were also externally nice and very informative!!Would highly recommend coming to the elephant village!!!!

Name: Didier v
Title: Good value. Nice elephants. Friendly staff
Review: Payd 2200 rs for the two of us and had a fun elephant ride. The elephants are well taken care off and get plenty of food, which we found really important. The trails' environment need some improvement though, but they are working on it.

Name: Previn S
Title: Elephant tour
Review: This is the place to go for a proper elephant walk! The guides are well informed and they teach you all about the elephants, how to climb onto them using the trunk, how to ride without a saddle! I felt very relaxed, the walk was not rushed.. although we went in summer and it was super hot, the guide still offered an extra few minutes in the walk just to make the experience more worth while. After the ride we also got to feed the elephants a huge bag of bananas, chats with the well informed Salim and the rest of the crew.. absolutely no rush to leave, super accommodating teamüôè‚úåÔ∏èüí™üëåü§ò

Name: Majd W
Title: Elephant Tour
Review: I had a great time here. They offered me free refreshment, took me on the elephant ride and didn't rush me to get off. They taught me how to get up and down the elephant and I was able to practice as many times as I wanted. I fed the elephant and took pictures with no hassle. Overall, I strongly recommend this if you are in Jaipur. Just ask for Salim when you get there.

Name: Mazhweel A
Title: Solo Visit
Review: Visited elephant sanctuary and met wonderful people who also had good stories to share. Saw an elephant feed in the shed with good conditions

Name: Yinka O
Title: Awesome experience
Review: It was our pleasure to be with such a lovely elephant we road on elephant and feed some peanut and bananas to them that was great narsi co- owner he was really helpful Thanks a lot of such an awesome experience

Name: Sholto W
Title: Fantastic
Review: It was really nice with team of elejaipur I went their with my friends we went to elephant ride after the ride we spent special time with elephants thanks narsing to make us feel so special he is very great guy

Name: Lily P
Title: Incredible awesome time
Review: We went to elephant village it was like elephant all around you I felt really amazing to went very close to gentle giants.... and then I met narsi there he is really a god gifted guy he has 17 elephant there he explained me about the life of elephants then I did ride on elephant and I fed them bananas as well ....I will never forget this experience Thanks narsi and whole elejaipur team

Review: You must go to the elephant sanctuary - wonderful elephants and people in a beautiful place. All the elephants are raised here, ranging from 8-63 which you can feed, wash, paint and ride. It was an amazing experience i'll never forget. Narsi the owner knows and cares a lot for these animals.

Name: Lukas W
Title: Nice place
Review: Me and my friend visit this place and it was really amazing to be there.... The Rode on elephant and then we Feed them some bananas and Grass and everybody should visit this place when you're in Jaipur.... We get to know many Things about elephant their by the owner narsi He is very nice Guy and speak many language.... And not forget Salim He took our some Great pics... Thank you elejaipur for making our Trip so nice and special thanks for narsi and Salim

Name: Guido W
Title: Amazing
Review: It was great to be there and be with a huge animal it was fantastic to feed the elephants and climb on them .....The team over there was absolutely very good and friendly..... the owner narsi was very kind person..... it was nice to take chai with narsi he gave us good knowledge about elephantsHighly recommended to everyone

Name: Hayden P
Title: My Bahulibali moment
Review: Got the chance to meet an elephant, Shaq. It was an amazing experience. You can tell they take very good care of their elephants. We got the chance to climb on to their neck from the trunk. So much fun! Thanks for the great time :)

Name: Lucas R
Title: Wonderful place for elephants!
Review: Very peaceful place! Me and my 2 other friends were very welcome, the Chai is good and the discussion as well.I recommend this place to have a great experience on elephants in the Elephants Village just few minutes outside Jaipur by tuk tuk.

Name: Clement T
Title: Amazing √©l√©phant experience
Review: It was a really amazing experience with the √©l√©phant in a peaceful place with friendly people and good thai Highly recommanded

Name: Andrewyourboy
Title: Awesome experience with elephants!
Review: Luckily we had the opportunity of arriving at the elephant village. We met Madin through a recommendation and we couldn't have been happier.  They are having good food lots of room for activities and great care. I have been to elephant sanctuaries in Thailand and this place was a much better experience.

Name: David D
Title: Amazing experience
Review: We come to india to visit more than monuments this place gave us the opportunity to relate with roxanne and shakuntala this two elephants where amazing we feed them and shower them. An experience i will never forget. Ask for saleem and narsi they will guide you the whole way. Cheers.

Name: jasonh
Title: Amazing elephants
Review: While visiting jaipur we wanted to do more than visit monuments, we wanted to have experiences. initially we were a little put off by the price but realised money was going to help home and rehabilitate the elephants. Each couple are assigned to their own elephant. It was a fantastic experience as you spent time getting to know your elephant and then going through the different activities with your elephant. The operation runs so smoothly and is incredibly professional - without losing the Indian authenticity. All staff are fantastic but specially narsing. Make sure you have a 100% battery for your camera!!because the guy there salim took great photos of us........The only regret you will have is if you don't go..... must recommend

Name: Junead K
Title: Tremendous and mesmerising
Review: Me and my girlfriend visit this place it was surprised that my girlfriend gave me on my birthday............ it was so amazing the elephant there was so nice and friendly. ...... it was our first time that we went this close to elephant it was fantastic the guide and owner over there  nursi is very funny guy and because of him we got to know many things about elephants we had a exceptional experience there we ride on elephant and then we fed some bananas to our elephant Shakuntala and the bottom line is this place is 110% recommended

Name: Rehan K
Title: Great experience with elephants
Review: I was there with my friends and it was fantastic experience with them the guys over there explain us about elephant very briefly and then we went to ride to ride i n jungle where we saw many species of birds and the ride was fun and then we spent some quality time with our elephant I think her name is shakuntla and the owner of elephant narsi was great man he's very knowledgeable person ...... I can't describe our feelings and emotions review so everyone should go there and check that out.... If you are visiting jaipur this is must recommended place

Name: Lau C
Title: Fanatastic experience
Review: It was amazing to be with elephant very looked after by owner we did ride on elephant its was amazing painting on them feed some choclate (bananas )Highly recommend

Name: hejiranyc
Title: Up close and personal with the elephants
Review: It's a bit out of the ray but definitely worth your while to ask about and find a driver who can take you to the "Elephant Village."  Guaranteed to be the most up close and personal experience with elephants.

Name: Stvnlswrth
Title: Amazing Elephant Experience
Review: Today we visited the Elephant experience in Jaipur where we got to feed the elephants, wash the elephants, ride the elephants and even paint them. Was really good fun and the elephants seem to enjoy there time here. The owner (Narsi) was friendly and had very good english.The elephants here were born in this place and have grown up here, you can see them being washed and bathed on the way in where they seem to be having so much fun. The elephant we saw was 32 years old and is currently looking for a male. Steven (UK) Would definitely recommend!

Name: Hailey D
Title: The best elephant park
Review: We loved meeting this amazing animal in personal..got to do rides,painting on the elephant,feeding lots of food..and bath...Go there for real experience of elephant..

Name: killaB3
Title: Ele in Jaipur
Review: The best elephant experience we ever had in our lifetime,.you can go for. Smooth ride ,washing,painting,feeding...highly recommended.

Name: Ibrahim M
Title: Bad time of my life
Review: The activity was very very expensive. Include in riding, painting, feeding,washing in  7000 rupees for 2 person.the route was to much short time like 15 mints.here is noting special...

Name: Luis B
Title: Best day in my world trip
Review: Sincerely I couldn‚Äôt be happier with this experience. Gori is a happy and mighty elephant and I love her to my guts. This is a once in a lifetime experience. Don‚Äôt miss this out!

Name: Kevin L
Title: Wonderful experience !
Review: That was a so original and unique experience with Gori (the name of the elephants) ! We didn't just had an elephant ride but we also took care of them ! We first painted them (with washable painting obviously!), feed them and we were also there for the bath at the end.I highly recommend it !Thanks a lot

Name: Furkan Aras
Title: Wonderful
Review: I can not describe my feelings in this review but i was phenomenal to do such types of activities with gori our elephant we started with riding and then we did sone exceptional things like feeding them was awesome and arif our guide there was very knowlegable person he explained us very briefly about elephant behavior .....Thanks arif and elephant activity planner team for made our day so special.....Furkan

Name: JAntCarvalho
Title: Elephant feeding and riding
Review: Good place near Jaipur to go ride and feed an elephant. Friendly staff. Good experience. They allow petting the elephant and riding bareback.

Name: Yusuf A
Title: Elephant
Review: We spent two and three hour with elephant and they are so freindly and we do paint,ride and feed them.elephant are like human not like animal..........

Name: Farid A
Title: very interesting animals we had a great time
Review: the elephants are very friendly we feed them paint them and went for a ride the are very beautifull creatures

Name: Zara Z
Title: Elephant
Review: Like Elephant, very good. elephant are very friendly. I meet with khan he is so friendly. Thanks for elephant

Name: Ingunn
Title: Elephant riding
Review: This was so nice, and they take good care of the elephants. We have fed the animals, drank good tea and went for a nice walk. Khan took good care of us.

Name: Juho L
Title: Very Good Experience whit Very Good Peoples!
Review: ÏùòÏã¨ÏùòÏó¨ÏßÄÏóÜÏù¥ Ïù∏ÎèÑÏóêÏÑú Ï¶êÍ∏∏ÏàòÏûàÎäî ÏµúÍ≥†Ïùò ÏΩîÎÅºÎ¶¨ Ïó¨ÌñâÏù¥ÏóàÎçò Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî. ÏÇ¨Ïû•ÎãòÎèÑ Ïö∞Î¶¨Î•º ÏïÑÏ£º ÏûòÎåÄÌï¥Ï£ºÍ≥† ÏπúÏ†àÌûà Ìï¥Ï£ºÏÖîÏÑú Ï¢ãÏïòÏäµÎãàÎã§.A day spent  with  the lovely  people at Elephant actity planner  without  a doubt the highlight  of our trip to India. These gentle giants were happy and well looked after. We rode bareback, fed with bananas and washed the elephants with a hose.  Truly a magical  experience  that with stay with us. .......

Name: Farouk E
Title: Elephant experience
Review: The elephant experience was great. Something you should defenitly do when in jaipur. Besides riding the elephants you get to feed them and hug them. Loved it!

Name: Scott M
Title: First time on an elephant, simply amazing!
Review: If you are in Jaipur, this is a must do activity. You can take care of the elephants and you can spend time with them (feeding and washing). If you are not used to, this is a great chance plus because people that run the place are nice and very welcoming. I strongly recommend.

Name: R0CKY2000
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Staff are very friendly, hospitable and they are very gentle with the elephants. Natural environment, no chains or whips. Definitely must try if you are visiting Jaipur! Worth every cent.

Name: javier c
Title: Elephant ride
Review: Staff here was friendlyExperience of a lifetime, you need to ride elephant in indiaYou can do different activities

Name: Sanusi S
Title: amazing stuffs
Review: Hmmmm, life is always cool and awesome. i have really enjoyed taking a little round with elephants that are amazing and most especially the people there are very friendly in performing their service an at cheap price

Name: C√©lie B
Title: Great place to go to !
Review: I came here with 2 friends and it was awesome !  Elephants look happy and we did a tour on them, good prices and warm welcome ! Go there !

Name: Paula H
Title: Dream come true
Review: So didnt actually plan this as we were at the amber fort and our tuk tuk driver just said i want to show you something nice (i think part of the tuk tuk school training as well as the visit to my uncle/cousins textile factory) but..... so glad we did. We didnt even know where we were going, its not far from the fort and into what looked like a local village. We stopped at large gates and entered into a walled grass area. We were invited to sit down and offered tea. The grass had chickens running around and very friendly labrodour pups (5 months) . So by the size of the pool and yard we asumed we were here for the elephants. The main man started talking to us and then the elephant arrived. It was all very casual but nice after the hassle of hawkers all day. He said we could take photos and sent someone to buy bananas. We fed the elephant then they asked if we would like to sit on one. We said yes. The guide then took us a walk around the village which by now was after 7pm. I cant describe this experience in words. It took my breath away. The elephant (8 in the village) were so happy looking and looked really well cared for. I think we arrived quite late and perhaps took them by surprise but if this is how they normally do it then i would not complain. It was peaceful, beautiful and dare i say an almost spiritual experience we felt connected with the elephant and not commercial in anyway. I did see paints and things and knew you could help bathe the elephant but as i said we arrived unplanned. We paid equivalent of ¬£36 for an hour and a half of absolute beauty and worth every penny.

Name: hannah rachel
Title: Loved the experience!!
Review: We had a great day with the elephants and  adored the experience! The owner was super helpful and we got to do everything with the elephants! We fed them bananas and rode them. Great for friends, families and couples!

Name: Billy0606
Title: Fantastic Place to see the Elephants
Review: Had such a great welcoming to this place. It's hidden away from the hustle and bustle, in a calm and relaxing area. The Elephants were happy and well looked after.

Name: Zachary E
Title: Elephants
Review: Great elephants very friendly and healthy looking. I had an amazing day riding and visiting with the elephants. Highly recommend taking this tour, you won't regret it, once in a life time experience.

Name: Astrid E
Title: Amazing!
Review: Great hospitality and friendliness! They really make you feel like one of the family. I would recommend it to anyone who wants a pure and fun experience.

Name: Naseer N
Title: Memory of a lifetime
Review: I was visit to elephant activity planner was a special highlight of our visit to india and I well never forget our time with champa- she is very beautiful and friendly.. I am do with paint, wash, feed and ride them..thanks for elephant activity planner...

Name: jabdrum
Title: Amazing experience
Review: Very nice experience not only with elephants but also with the people owning the place. I was very lucky to share a chai, drinks and food with these very nice men. They are not pushy and seriously try to provide you with the best experience ever. Totally recommend it !!!

Name: Stephanie T
Title: Amazing place to chill with elephants
Review: I stumbled upon Elephant Activity Planner after meeting some locals who grew up in Amer. If you're an animal lover looking to play with some happy elephants, this is the place. The owners / caretakers are extremely nice and knowledgeable, and you're invited to pet, help paint, bathe, or even ride the elephants. They have a really nice facility with shade, grass and an elephant swimming pool.

Name: Pietrojessica
Title: Vary nice place
Review: Nice place,  very kindly people! We have been there only few ours but we had the opportunity to stay with the elephants..  So nice! They organize a lot of activities with them:feeding,bathing,riding,etc. Don't miss it!! :)

Name: kamaraddin h
Title: Elephant house remarks
Review: The have a very good intertainment their visitors and given them cured which this will encourage somany people to visit the elephant house  Due to their highly welcoming every person whose come to their palace. The secon recomadation is that the place is soo clean there's no any dirty in their palace  even the elephant place is tooo healthy and secured.  The elephant also welcoming enybody  whose come for tourism and even those from the country that's Indian.  The elephant will  Know how to play with a people,especially  some activity which Will call the attention of somany people by hear the story to come for visit, in order to come for eye witness.

Name: Tobias S
Title: A great elephant experience
Review: This is a wonderfull place to visit! My friend and I had a great time enjoying the time with our "own" elephant. Walking, painting, feeding and especially washing the elephant was a blast! Furthermore the crew was really friendly and helpfull. Certainly a place to visit if u go to Jeipur

Name: screanaym
Title: Elephants..
Review: It was a half day visit ..we get to do ride for half an hour...then we got to do painting on elephant,after that we bath the elephant in pool..in the end we feed elephant with lots of bananas,it was really fun feed this animal...worth the money we paid for this experience..highly recommendThanks

Name: Steve N
Title: Holiday visit
Review: Came here today with my daughter. Arid was very welcoming and we had a fantastic time. The elephants are happy and well cared for. Our package included painting, feeding, going for a ride and washing. A truly amazing experience that is once in a lifetime. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone

Name: Sebastian H
Title: Elephant ride
Review: Awesome experience!  Lovely staff, sweet nuri and guri! Very nice place You can feed them do painting make them have their bath. Very respectful towards the elephants

Name: Usman A
Title: Go for elephant ride
Review: I have had the best experience in my life at amer, Jaipur while at elephant activity planner. It is a very good place to go and the elephants there are so amiable.

Name: Jelle N
Title: Best time with elephants!!!
Review: We several elephant experinces in Kerala and Sri Lanka, but this ws the best. Very relaxed, not touristic, good explanations and lots of time with three(!) elephants(we were with 5 persons) we enjouyed the bathing the most. Being so close ans seeing the elephants enjoying themselves as well!

Name: Hajnal I
Title: My really amazing Holi Festival with the Elephants :)
Review: The day before Holi I went to visit the Elephants and while I was there the really friendly pepole who works there invited me to come and celebrate the Holi festival with them. It was one of my best day ever to be able to spend time with the Elephants, to pet them and to have fun with them. The stuff are also really welcoming and nice people with the true nature of carring about the Elephants.  Thank you for the amazing time together. Lidy :)

Name: Louisdelphine
Title: Great time with elephants
Review: Unlike other elephants tour, here, you can see well treated animals in a friendly environnement.Staff take their time to give you explanation about elephant. There is variety of activities you can do with them : Painting, bathing, giving them bananas and riding them.Giving them bananas is a really funny experience. The good thing about this place is that you can r√©solu feel the animals are happy and the staff takes care of them, its not a "tourist factory".The visit was conducted by a french girl, volunteer on the camp. She can give you goods trip for you travel plan and give you indian culture insight as well.A very good experience

Name: Melvyn S
Title: Beautiful place
Review: A beautiful place with beautiful elephants. Very relaxing and chilled atmosphere. Highly recommended and thank you for a great day

Name: Kathi_LDN
Title: My very best experience in India!
Review: Together with my friend, we were recommended by our driver (Pratap Singh) going to this elephant place in Jaipur.I personally had my very best experience during our whole India trip here. I didn't know that elephants are such nice and charming animals.The guys from Elephant Activity Planner were so nice.At first, we got to know a little about the elephants they have and then we enjoyed a ride on Shobha, one of the elephant ladies.Afterwards, they let us paint the elephants and wash then. Finally, we gave them lots of bananas to eat.This was so much fun!The elephants are treated very well here and seem to be a part of the family at this place.In the evening we even had a little cooking class and afterwards enjoyed a lovely self-cooked Indian dinner outside.Thank you very much for this awesome experience!!!

Name: An≈ºelika ≈Å
Title: elephant's paradise :)
Review: Very nice people and a great place for elephants. I was there for a while but I remember that time very well.My dream has been fulfilled. The best was getting on the elephant :)

Name: Aimee
Title: Beautiful experience with the elephants
Review: We rode and fed the elephants, which was a wonderful experience. We were shown around the village and spoke with Arif (?) about their work, their history and the treatment of the elephants. Worth a visit.

Name: franczlxk
Title: Great place
Review: This is a great place to ride and interact with elephants. The people are very friendly and hospitable, the place is very peaceful, away from the noise and chaos of Jaipur, and the elephants are well treated. I warmly recommand a visit.

Name: Pedro R
Title: Amazing time!
Review: It was the best elephant ride in Jaipur! If you go to this city visit this place!! Friendly people, good reception... Amazing time!

Name: Docter A
Title: Go for  elephant right
Review: I came into jaipur... Then I goes to  elephant village I saw many elephant and I go for a ride on a  painted elephant  it was so amazing .  Thanks for elephant activity planner

Name: 795yusufm
Title: Visit
Review: People were really warm and nice with cute elephants I would recommend you once you should visit and try elephant ride..

Name: Rajat
Title: Beautiful lake near Amber fort
Review: Great place near the road for going to Amber fort, its a huge lake with the Jal Mahal constructed in its middle....there's a walkway around the lake with vendors selling icecream, corn etc. It is a great place for birdwatchers housing huge amount of birds like cormorants, herons, pelicans, ducks etc especially in winter

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Beautiful lake in the heart of the city
Review: The Man Sagar Lake is located in the heart of the city. The Jal Mahal is the main attraction at the lake constructed in the middle of the lake.

Name: Lucy
Title: Underwhelming despite apparent popularity
Review: We went here as part of a day tour which took us to 5/6 other places. There is an unbelievable amount of people selling things and the hassle that comes with it as a tourist. We took a photo of it and left, as it‚Äôs quite far away and you can‚Äôt approach it, it felt like once we had seen it we could walk away after a minute.

Name: Charvi_Shah
Title: Nice place to visit specially in Monsoon
Review: if you are visiting Amber fort then you can stop for a few minutes and take a few pics of this location on your way.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Jal Mahal lake!!
Review: I had come down to this place for a photo of the Jal Mahal and found the lake also very peaceful and scenic.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: A major tourist attraction of Jaipur
Review: This lake is a huge water body around Jal Mahal when you approach Jaipur from Aamer fort. You can see lot of migratory birds and enjoy good local snacks from road side vendors and some good restaurants. Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: Umang A
Title: Beautiful
Review: Located on amber road this week s beautiful lake. Jal Mahal is constructed right in the centre of lake . Best time to visit in evening

Name: kattullus
Title: Giood for palace, people and bird watching
Review: While admiring Jalk Mahal and contemplating that you only see the uppermost part of this fascinating building also have a look at the birds by the shore and the rather colourful street vendors.

Name: Manish K
Title: The lake housing the Jal Mahal; needs better amenities
Review: The Man Sagar Lake is better known as the lake housing the famous Jal Mahal. Surrounded by hills on 3 sides, this lake has a promenade on the fourth side, where visitors come to take photos.The lake itself is not in good shape, with cleanliness (rather, the lack of it) being a major issue. Also, there is no boating facility provided, which could be useful for tourists as well as a money-spinner for the authorities. On the positive side, the pavilions in the lake, offer great opportunities for bird watching, with a large number and variety of birds gathered on them at any given point of time. Sprucing up of the place by authorities will make it a top attraction.

Name: rapha_y_nici
Title: Beautiful area
Review: The scenery here is picturesque if you are able to forget the traffic and the crowds. The water palast Jal Mahal has been built by Jai Singh II. even its history doesn‚Äôt seem to be absolutely clear. Worth a stop and doable onthe way to Amber and Nahargarh Fort.

Name: PhilMiddleham
Title: Great views......
Review: Excellent views from the road that runs by the lake..... but very difficult to park or stop to take great pictures.

Name: Andrew C
Title: A Quick Look
Review: The palace on the lake looks outstanding as you drive past. Sadly it not open to visitors so you have to look at it from the promenade along the road.There are a number of vendors selling the usual tourist tat, and watch out for the beggars who will hound you relentlesly

Name: SerendipityIndia
Title: Huge pretty lake
Review: Man Sagar Lake is the one with Jal Mahal in center of it. On a day with nice weather, with the backdrop of mountains, it makes for an interesting evening out. The pictures with the half submerged Jal Mahal are a photographers delight. Don't think you can step into the lake with boats and all, just can enjoy the scenery and the ducks that are swimming by. There are lot of vendors along the lake with things like Camel ride, photos in traditional attire - especially opposite the Trident hotel.

Name: Gaurav C
Title: nice lake
Review: this is a large lake as you enter jaipur city...not well maintained though...in the evening it gets quite lively there...the famous jal mahal is situated in thi lake only

Name: Rohit Aveek Mukherjee
Title: Large lake
Review: Huge and big lake with jal mahal.in the.middle . Ducks and birds can be spotted in  the lake. Light show happens in night where the water looks beautiful

Name: VIVEK M
Title: Nice lake
Review: This contains blue water means pure and clean . yah.. This is cool and sweat for all heart . you will find a lot of piece far away from the city of huge rush. Really lovely place I had ever seen .

Name: AkhileshM9800
Title: what could have been..
Review: Very poorly maintained lake. It has a great potential but the water pollution and dirt all around will put you off!!

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful lake holding Jal Mahal
Review: We had visited this lake during our trip to Jaipur to see the Jal Mahal or Water Palace which is located in the middle of the lake. We saw many birds on the waters of the lake. One of my friends took a camel ride along the banks of the lake for 500 bucks. There were many small vendors sitting on the walkway around the lake and selling various types of Rajasthani handicrafts items.

Name: adisrinoida
Title: 15-minute activity
Review: This is the lake with the Jal Mahal in the middle of it. There are people there selling fish food, and it is a fun activity for some to throw that food to the fish and to see them gather around. Most of the water is dirty now, you will spend a maximum of 15 minutes here anyway

Name: Aadhes
Title: Beautiful Lake and the Palace
Review: This is almost in the City. There is a Palace in this lake, and it is very picturesque. You can walk around this area in the evening when there is no hot sun.

Name: Borislav Ivanov
Title: Palace in lake
Review: Beautiful place. Unfortunately you can‚Äôt go in the palace. You can see the palace, only from outside. If you have enough time in Jaipur, it‚Äôs worth it to see this place

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Lake with palace
Review: One can enjoy the evening here and enjoy the ice-cream with view of lake and palace. Couple can enjoy the good time, though it's roadside sitting.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Nice
Review: Water has been surrounded to this place, it can be good once people looked after carefully, one can visit with friends.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Not clean
Review: Place is famous because of Jal Mahal. But it has nothing to attract tourists on its own. Local throng it always and the shores are dirty.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Good...
Review: Man Sagar Lake is very popular because of Jal Mahal. It is a artificial lake. You saw jal mahal from a distance because no one allowed to enter. But you enjoyed food items. You also take camel ride.

Name: DrNic1
Title: Amazing Floating Palace on Artificial Lake
Review: This palace was built in the middle of an artificial lake that was created afterwards - only accessible by boat. Currently closed to the public and under litigation between the people who bought it to open a hotel and those wanting it not to open (sad).It was restored apparently but you can‚Äôt se it currently except from afarThe view is impressive but spoilt by trash strewn everywhere and in the water. Great shame as the palace really looks like it is floating on water

Name: cbk2911
Title: Magnificent Artificial lake located in the centre of Jaipur
Review: Its a magnificent lake situated in the centre of Jaipur. Its named after Raja Man Singh, the then ruler of Amber Fort, who constructed the same on 16th century in Dharbawati river & has one more magnificent landmark - Jal mahal of Jaipur.

Name: LKEHRAAJ
Title: For Littering
Review: It houses jal mahalArtificial lakeNo proper ParkingDefinitely no boat riding Its filled with local peoplegreat for children to enjoy

Name: gireesh s
Title: Man Sagar Lake
Review: Its an artificial lake in Jaipur migratory birds can be seen here no entrance to palace  u can see buy some distance this one

Name: travelpassion
Title: Dirty shores
Review: Picturesque lake but the shores are covered in litter which detracts from the natural beauty; they really need to start cleaning this place up.

Name: tripson6
Title: Artificial lake
Review: Man Sagar Lake is an artificial lake located in Jaipur. We can spot lots of migratory birds near the lake. No boating facility is available. Birds feeding themselves is very amazing to watch.

Name: debikaghosh
Title: The Summer Palace of the kings
Review: It is currently not allowed to go to the palace so one can only park at lake side and have some snacks. The tour cars normally dont stop here.

Name: Ricardo R
Title: Just a lake with not much to do
Review: The lake where is located the Jal Mahal or Water Palace. many people on the way vack from amber Fort stop here for some pictures, better in the afternoon so the sun will be shining directly on the palace. We can¬¥t visit the palace but for some ruppes we may find someone with a boat to take a bit close to the palace but not too much close because is also forbidden.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Lake with Palace
Review: Many tourists visit here just for Jal Mahal stands spectacularly in the middle of the lake. But the entry is restricted to the palace. The view of the palace from the shore is really marvellous.

Name: Pulak
Title: Amazing Palace On Lakes
Review: Its amazing to see this Palace rise on the lakes. Located near Amber fort offering mesmerizing views

Name: Nitin Bachani
Title: Worth Visiting
Review: I visited On Diwali(Festival) Night. Enlightened View of MAHAL was awesome. Jal Mahal place is One of the most attractive Places in Jaipur.

Name: Milpitas_traveller
Title: Take a few pictures of the pretty fort, nothing else except lake, birds, and pushy vendors
Review: You can not visit the fort, you can only take pictures of it from shore.  So stop the bush/car, take some pictures, say "No, thanks" to the pushy vendors, and drive on.

Name: 69tiger888
Title: Palace on the lake
Review: This is a must to see on way to the Fort . A spectacular palace rises in the middle of the lake ,with camels strolling along the lakeside , reminding us the rich history of this country

Name: cg2792
Title: Relaxing Stroll
Review: Had a lovely few hours walking along the lake side. The Jal Mahal and the lake are extremely picturesque. Vendors along the waters edge also sell a good range of clothing and souvenirs and (when I went) were not pushy or in your face the whole time.

Title: Stinky cess pool
Review: No comments dashed away fast , the smell was not supportable.Clean it up and a new jewel will be added to this fabolous area!!!

Name: minimize940314
Title: Water Palace Lake
Review: It is a lake near Amber Fort (not the one right in front of it). It is a lake that has water palace aka Jal Mahal. You can take camel or elephant near there.

Name: MikeFJones
Title: Man Sagar Lake - Built for Famines, turned into a Toilet but slowly Recovering!
Review: Its an artificial lake, situated in Jaipur, the capital of the state of Rajasthan in India. It was named after Raja Man Singh, the then ruler of Amer, who constructed it in 1610 by damming the Dharbawati river. The Jal Mahal is situated in the middle of the lake. It was built to avoid famines that desolated this region 400 years gos. Badly, the majority of the sewage from Jaipur City is flowing to the lake body untreated and hence there is severe contamination of the ground water in and around the lake area, but seems the local government is about to doing something (... they said). Easy to arrive by tuk-tuk, taxi or private car, and not worth to stop by but by Jal Mahal shots only.

Name: Deepak A
Title: the lake around Lake palace
Review: This is not a separate attraction, this is the lake surrounding the jal mahal or lake palace. nice place for photography.

Name: Debopam
Title: Evening walk on the Lake side
Review: This is ideal for a nice evening walk by the side of the lake. The place remains abuzz with so many people, street foods etc.

Name: Robin T
Title: Beautiful building on the lake
Review: Worth stopping to take a photograph, but as always in Jaipur there are plenty of touts offering camel or elephant rides etc.

Name: Hotel Thikana Palace
Title: good
Review: Hotel Thikana Palace offers accommodations with high comfort in Jaipur. Guests can enjoy the on-site restaurant, hassle free parking space and high class amenities. All rooms are equipped with best in class infrastructure and features catering all your needs. Twenty four hours room service and front desk available for catering customer needs at the hotel. Our onsite restaurant provides delicacies of all regions keeping hygiene and quality on priority. Our motive is to provide the best comfort and luxury to our esteemed guests in an affordable pricing with privacy and hassle free environment

Name: Geraldine
Title: Nice view from afar but dirty close up
Review: The lake has so much potential and has the stunning Jal Mahal building in the centre; however as with most places in India it is dirty with rubbish...such a shame.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Mansagar lake
Review: Man sagar lake is beautiful lake . Nice place for photography lovers.must see location for everyone.

Name: NomadR64
Title: Floating palace
Review: Beautiful setting with the palace being an island in the lake. Worth a stop for pictures. Near the Amber Fort.

Name: Amit K
Title: Horrible
Review: The most talked about tourist place of Jaipur is left in such a bad shape and conditions. The lake is more of a junkyard.... In evening only 2 bulbs are lit in jal Mahal in the name of lighting... And local shack vendors just loot the tourist like anything

Name: Mikhail N
Title: Reality vs picture
Review: This palace also made us disappointed. The lake is dirty and the palace is not so shine like in glance magazine and iconic photo. Buffalos and cormorants live well in this place))

Name: RedorDead58
Title: Opening up for the better in 2018
Review: A joyous view across the road from our hotel. Theres a street market all along the boulevard where you admire the former palace. We are told it was being restored as a heritage site to open for visitors in 2018. Trips out there on the lake would be splendid.

Name: cazbatt
Title: Pretty
Review: This is definitely worth a short photo stop as you're going to/ from Amber Fort.The lake and palace are very pretty, it looks like the palace is floating on the water.

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Scenic beauty
Review: It is scenic beauty of jaipur, it is called Jal mahal as well. very good tourist place for jaipurites.

Name: C2Sonia
Title: A palace located in middle of lake
Review: There are lots of migratory birds near the lake also you can see them fishing. The palace is inaccessible for general public as there is no boat to ferry. The view is beautiful.

Name: kelmci
Title: worth a visit
Review: this palace is worth a stop - we were on a coach tour, and the driver stopped for about 20 mins which was about the correct length of time to see the cows lazying in the waters

Name: Crystal m
Title: Photo stop
Review: Was taken here on my tour.  Nice area to visit and see.  This place is just a photo stop for now, I was told they are going to make it a restaurant soon, which that would be great place to go out for dinner at.

Name: kk19632015
Title: Pretty - but photo stop only
Review: Not possible to visit the Summer Palace, but a very pretty lake and view - a bit of calm in the bustling city.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Man Sagar Lake ‚Äì A wonderful place to enjoy the refreshing beauties
Review: Man Sagar Lake is a beautiful artificial lake. It is surrounded by Nahargarh Hills. An exquisite piece of architecture, Jal Mahal,  is standing in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake with structural base in water. The lake  with Jal Mahal and the surrounding hills present a wonderful view  specially in the evening sunset and the night lights. It is a nice place for watching birds as a lot of migratory birds visit the lake. Local vendors sell kulfi, icecream, chat etc. near the Man Sagar Lake by the side of the road.

Name: Rohit T
Title: Official Visit
Review: Good experience to visit sight seens at Jaipur Jal Mahal and Hawa Mahal are good . Also visited Central Park . Especially Coffee shops are there and very tasty Coffee they made. Every one should taste it .

Name: bougivalbob
Title: Take a photo.
Review: A palace built in the lake. Worth stopping to take a photo but you can't go in so only stop a couple of minutes.

Name: Shushom
Title: Jalmahal & Man Sagar made for each other!
Review: Jalmahal & Man Sagar made for each other! Cause Jal mahal is surrounded by Man Sagar lake and only accessible by boat. In empire days, the queens came here to hunt. Godo to visit

Name: rsaxena67
Title: A place for Bird watching and walk
Review: Lake exists in front of Jal mahal palace which is not open presently for the tourist. Migratory birds ars often found around the lake which has plenty of fish in the water.in front of lake there is a walk way of about 750metres and one can enjoy in group . One can have aloo chat , chana chor garam , kulfi , icecream etc as snacks from local vendor

Name: Neelam_Arora
Title: Scenic beauty
Review: On the way to Amer fort, we stopped to see jal mahal, the guide said that we cannot enter jal mahal. so we can just see it from far and admire it

Name: Saipola1970
Title: Mansagar
Review: The Jal Mahal Palace at the centre of the lake was originally constructed in the 18th century as a shooting lodge by the Maharaja, as the lake was a thriving home to diverse wildlife that included a large flamingo population. The destructive pollution of the 1990s combined with intensive farming demands significantly reduced the extent of aquatic wildlife and migratory birds found more suitable locations but things are being reversed. Today grey heron, wagtails and blue-tailed bee-eaters are all making a comeback while fish stocks are even increasing.Most visitors stop along the Amer-Jaipur road as this provides the best views over the Jal Mahal Palace.Lake Mansagar lies in a natural depression that would, without human interference, be annually filled by the monsoon rains. The natural shallow lake was enhanced by a dam stretching between the two hill ranges of Amer and Amagarh. This initial dam was constructed in the 16th century after a deadly famine in 1596 was caused by a failure of the monsoon rains.Maharaja Mansingh-I constructed the primitive dam in 1610 from soil and rock over the Darbhavati River so as to increase the levels of stored water and prevent another famine. The height of the dam was increased and strengthened in the 18th century by Maharaja Jai Singh-II who also constructed the water Palace. This later dam was constructed from solid cut rock to provide additional strength and gave the Lake Man Sagar its present maximum depth of 7 meters.

Name: abtisam1
Title: Cool fort built in the lake
Review: Our tour group stopped at this stop so we could see the fort and take pictures. The only way to actually get to the fort is by boat. There are people at this stop begging for food or money, so be prepared for that. The pictures are fun, but that's about all you can get at this stop.

Name: lizzie481
Title: Man Sugar Lake
Review: Stunning able to see wild fowl and fiamingoes on the lake hawkers on pavements but they dont really hassle you.

Name: Irek007
Title: No access inside
Review: This used to be sleeping place in summer, cooled by surrounded lake. There are apparently plans to have boat access to still to be opened restaurant for now, the palace can be only appreciated from the distance.

Name: Ashish A
Title: Lake around the palace
Review: It the lake around the Jal Mahal. It was on the way to Amer fort. It is a nice waterfront, well kept. Neat and clean. You can feed fishes if you want

Name: alex_dayer
Title: Nice too look at but too far away
Review: Only worth five minutes, because you cannot get out to it. Nothing spectacular from a distance, was disappointed

Name: malborz82
Title: Nice view
Review: Nice view that you see it from road with about 700 meters distance but that is good place to take photograph and it should be memorable photo

Name: Helen B
Title: Pretty palace set in the lake
Review: This is lovely for a photo stop or short walk, the setting is lovely and it could be quite idyllic. There are usually camels hanging around the area to provide an extra attraction.

Name: Rajat Chakraborty
Title: Spectacular Lake Palace- I think that's why Jaipur should be called 'The Pink City'
Review: If I were to quote my reason for calling Jaipur the 'Pink City', apart for all the existing reasons, it would be the colour of this palace over sunset, best viewed from the Jaigarh Fort. When you look at this palace from the jaigarh fort, it appears as a shining pink palace placed between the adjacent hills in such a way that the sunset lies exactly behind the entire setup, throwing its last amber light over the lake waters and makes it look majestically beautiful. So, Jaipur may be called the Pink City because of the historic pink coloured terracota stone buidings, or because the city was painted pink once to welcome Prince of Wales and Queen Victoria, my reason for calling it a Pink City would be the glimpse of this palace in the evening. If you have not tried it, you should try it out.

Name: Rahul_Taluja
Title: Beautiful
Review: Again, beautiful but left to rot by the government and the concerned authorities, can be easily converted into a beautiful tourist spot.

Name: RodgerH74
Title: Lovely setting.
Review: This is just a photo stop on the way to the Amber fort. Lots of rubbish around but we were fortunate enough to see a mongoose rooting through it. At the far end of the lake there were white flamingos.Hawkers galore but we did enjoy watching the young magician.

Name: Tracy E
Title: stop on the way to amber fort
