Review: pretty cool sight to behold- but it is on a busy street and surrounded by a market and lots of hawkers, so it is hard to enjoy in peace. the pollution on the riverbank is also sad.

Name: Aparna Bagz
Title: Beautiful lake at the centre of which is the Jal Mahal
Review: I visited Jaipur recently with friends and wanted to see the Jal Mahal. We were told we are not allowed in the Mahal, but could visit the lake. We saw lots of water birds, including ducks, swans, egrets, etc. There are some beautiful metal sculptures between the road and the lake... with elephants and a procession of humans. Really nice. Street vendors of kulfi icecream and people taking photos of tourists dressed in rajasthani colourful clothes. Nice place.

Name: Baraskar N
Title: Drainage water dumped in the lake
Review: Very bad smell coming from the lake and all water is like  a drainage water.  Picture and reality are very different and you can just spend some 5 minutes at maximum there.

Name: Sally L
Title: Lovely setting and impressive building
Review: Stopped here on our way back from the Amber Fort for a short break. Lovely position and a picturesque photo opportunity.

Name: Oaklandish3
Title: Beautiful view but don't look down
Review: Like many places in India, the view is spoiled by the incredible amounts of trash along the lake and the stench from it rotting.  Rats and other animals were everywhere.

Name: alisdair t
Title: Lovely lake and palace, spoiled.....
Review: The main attraction of the lake is Jal Mahal, the lake palace, which is a most beautiful building, which can change colour in different lights. There is also lots of bird life alonf the shores.. However, it is totally spoiled by the amount of rubbish along the shoreline, and can be very off putting..  We stayed in the hotel right opposite , so got some great views and photos

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Nice lake and place
Review: Man Sagar lake is very beautiful lake . In the center of Man Sagar lake there is amazing place. This building is known as Jal Mahal.

Name: vini_phooh
Title: Beautiful Lake and palace
Review: Saw it while returning from Amer Fort. Worth stopping for 10-15 minutes. You may site beautiful birds, if lucky.

Name: AzRat
Title: Sewage Lake
Review: At first glance from the car the Jal Mahal lake palace looks enchanting. Walk closer and it's hard to find the beauty in this smelly, trash filled, polluted lake. I could only stand the raw sewage smell for about three photos. Then you must wade through the vendors who surround your car. What ever reviewer stated 'lake is well maintained' must either have been at a different lake or been used to this environmental shame. Sad. Drive slow, take photo from car, keep going to Amber Fort.

Name: TheShis
Title: A lovely lake, but the palace is the true gem.
Review: This is a lovely lake located outside of Jaipur.While the lake itself is beautiful, the palace itself steals the show and provides endless photo-ops.

Name: Starnurse2
Title: Nice for Photos
Review: Not a long here, but a great photo opportunity.  Many street traders all around the road overlooking the summer palace. Worth a short stop.

Name: Anil N
Title: Filthy smelly lake !!!
Review: Only looks good in picture. When you get there water is very smelly. You can watch the colony of rats that live on the shore for a few minutes before you feel sick.

Name: 1Jayanthi
Title: lake with a palace
Review: we could not go boating as it was a rainy day. The jal mahal inside the lake is a beauty. the surrounding of the lake is maintained well.

Name: Staghunt
Title: Scruffy
Review: Litter of all kinds everywhere.  It cannot be an attraction if the polluted water looks like a municipal rubbish tip. Hawkers everywhere. You do not stay long.

Name: mishra712
Title: Pleasant
Review: The Man Sagar Lake allows a pleasant waterside to walk on, especially after a hot sunny day. Though post sunset one would not be able to capture the Jal Mahal well in their cameras. There are a lot of fun activities like camel ride, local fast food and street shopping to spend some time.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Great lake and nice view
Review: A place worth visiting with family and friends. Well maintained beautiful place.A place you feel very homely

Name: Khushal
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: This place provides the followings;1. Nice lake view for photography2. Street shopping experience, believe me it's approx 40% cheaper than Tripoliamarket3. Proximity benefit for locations like Nahargarh fort Jaigarh fortMust visit, don't miss

Name: relaxtripp
Title: Jal Mahal Lake
Review: Great views from the banks. Now they are not allowing for boating in the lake. There are information in net that a light show at evening is there. But locals have told me no light shows for sometime.

Name: Heather A
Title: Good Stop Off Point
Review: There's not a lot to see here, but we stopped off on our way back from Amer Fort to see the summer residence of the Mararaja in the lake. It was a bit of a hazy winters day so the views weren't perfect, however it's still a pretty spot to explore. We only stopped for a few minutes as we'd had a long day of touring the city at this point and the children were getting fed up! There are stall holders here and be aware of the "professional" beggars (as our driver called them!). We could have strolled up the prominade a bit more if we'd had the time.

Name: Napoleon521
Title: Magical site ...
Review: This palace is a gem to appreciate from the road.. of if you have time, organize a visit.View from the road to Jaipur... with camels , sometimes elephants as neighbors

Name: Richa Kedia
Title: Great Lake with a large number of birds
Review: The lake is beautiful especially in the morning when there are less people around. I reached the lake at 7 am and took some great pictures of the sunrise at the lake and Jal Mahal and then sat there till 10 am to observe the birds and take their shots. It is only after 11 am that there are too many people at the lake and then the birds fly away.

Name: drn85
Title: Mansagar lake... Tourist spot...
Review: Mansagar lake located in Jaipur around 6km from the city, is one of the most sought tourist attractions in Jaipur. The famous jalmahal is located in this lake. There is a small park on the banks of this lake, where people can have an evening walk, making use of the street sales. The rates are very affordable and are subjected to bargaining. Many other options avail include the Jaipur costume photography and small refreshment. The lake is nice to see, but throwing the waste over it had made it a bit ugly. Let's forget all those... once you are in Jaipur visit this place for sure.

Name: glenn1gc
Title: Enjoyable
Review: Stoppedhere on my way back from the Amber Palace. Very pleasant for a break. A palace on the lake to look at and plenty of stalls to enjoy. It was fun watching the family's get dress up in traditional clothes and get their photo's taken. Lots of smiles all round.

Name: Stuartessaouira
Title: Stop off for Amer
Review: On the road to Amer.Beautiful palace, not visitable, in the middle of the lake.Watch out for the rats!

Name: Richard D
Title: Palace by lake
Review: Whilst we didn't get the chance to go out to this palace and I'm not sure we could have anyway, it is easily viewed from the shoreline and its beauty is in seeing it in situ.

Name: eesaw
Title: Albert Hall Museum  Ram Niwas Garden Jaipur Rajasthan
Review: I have been to Jaipur more than 10 times & this was the first time I visited the Albert Hall Museum located part of the Ram Niwas Garden......it was by chance as I was t the Hawa Mahal when some locals mentioned that I should visit it.  Walking almost 3 kilometers from the Hawa Mahal, I reached the Albert Hall......I was totally mesmerized by the scale of the museum & the spectacular LED lights bathing the facades of the building in a rhythmic change of colours.  This is a must visit location when in Jaipur.

Name: Umang A
Title: Great place
Review: This is located in the heart of city and house of many attraction e.g. bird house,zoo, albet hall, ranvindra manch and food court.

Name: Ethelberga H
Title: Visit Early When it is Quiet
Review: We enjoyed looking around these gardens of 33 acres made by Sawn Sing Ram in 1868. They have recently been renovated, so the tropical house did have some cacti in and some large leafed plants but no information. The gardens were only reasonably maintained and none of the many beautiful water fountains or pools were operating. Some good topiary. Beware of beggars pestering you especially young ones being sent by their elders hiding behind trees.

Name: durham05
Title: Beautiful gardens
Review: These are the garden set around the Albert Museum. Well worth exploring. Found them to be well maintained. Take care as there are a lot of homeless people in this area. I didn't have a problem beyond I felt uncomfortable at times walking around on my own..

Name: Regina.K
Title: Not worth it.
Review: Expected beautiful exotic gardens.  This place was overgrown & dilapidated.  The gardens were overgrown & unkempt. Plants were dead. No flower garden. Main fountain had no water. 40 rupees to get in is cheap, but don't waste your time.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Green Garden but crowded
Review: This is situated near the Albert Museum. If you have some time it's worth moving around in this area. In the evenings and weekends it is fully occupied by the locals.

Name: Verchasv
Title: Play area live cricket and football
Review: The Ram Niwas Garden is located in the year New Sanganeri Gate, Jaipur the all over area are covered by Nagar Nigam to provide the facilities of parkings who visits city area, Dharam Niwas Garden attachment Ravindra Manch theatre, the play area is attached of the Ram Niwas Garden.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Great Garden
Review: It is in the heart of the city and a very great garden, its large place and kids and everyone can enjoy a lot, almost everything is reachable from here.

Name: Puneet D
Title: Good time spend
Review: Centrally located park near to Albert museum, full of greenery all around.It is well maintained and also has fountains.It opens until around 8 in the evening and illuminated by lamp posts which gives an awesome feeling.One thing I liked the most was the formation which birds were making while flying in bunches. And the sound of bird chirping and water fountain made the mood.

Name: gastronaut_11
Title: Just delightful
Review: Not far from the Old Town this public park is large and interesting. Well utilised it reminded me of some of the Royal Parks in London.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: very nice garden
Review: Nicely improved and maintained. Good pavements and parking facility. Good to visit in mornings and evenings Well located in the city center surrounded with other attractions

Name: harishjangir9
Title: Near to ajmeri gate
Review: It is near to ajmeri gate ...situated in the heart of the city at JAWAHAR LAL NEHRU MARG... awsm place to visit

Name: shanupce137
Title: Spend quality time with Friends and Family
Review: Ram Niwas Garden is a great place to take rest and spend time with your family and friends. This Garden is situated middle of the JAIPUR. Albart Hall Museum, Zoo, Ravindra Rang Manch all are here.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Oldest garden
Review: Ram Niwas garden is oldest garden in Jaipur. This is beautiful garden in middle of the pink city.must go.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: Past the glory days !
Review: Ram Niwas Garden was at one time in fifties was a green lush and best lived garden of Jaipur but now it is sad reminder of the past days . This was well spread out garden over years has slowly shrunk - making the way for the public and the public concrete car parking . The major thourough fare with heavy traffic  going around Albert Museum and running thru this park now mars the beauty of this park . There are horse rides and the evening charming eats around this areas are attraction for the families with kids .Still some place have the patches of greenery are joys of the city . The occasional flower beds are still there . No entree fee .

Name: Om Joshi
Title: Museum and Zoo
Review: One should the place for archeaology Museum and Zoo. It has a one of the attractive place for tourists. British architecture and a attraction to see the heritage.

Name: VirendraYadav
Title: Good place
Review: This garden is situated in the heart of Jaipur City opposite the New Gate (Chora Rasta). this is very huge garden having Zoo (Animals & Birds), Albert Hall (Museum), Ravindra Manch and some more attractions with a big underground parking. In the evening horse riding and some other activities are being done.

Name: princ512
Title: Must see
Review: Ram Niwas Garden is a garden situated in Jaipur city in Indian state of Rajasthan, built by Maharaja Sawai Ram Singh of Jaipur in 1868.

Name: Nikhil192
Title: Beautiful
Review: Ram Niwas garden is so beautiful garden of Jaipur city.This is old garden. Ram Niwas garden is near Albert hall.

Name: drn85
Title: Ram nivas garden.. good destination..
Review: Ram nivas garden located in the heart of jaipur city next to Albert Hall museum is a worth visiting place for the travellers here. You can have some nice clicks over there. It will give a soothing effect to our mind and body. Don't miss it.

Name: vimal m
Title: Good
Review: This place is situated in centre of Jaipur city .it is city of attraction . it made by raja  sawai jai Singh .

Name: V7429YCinfo
Title: Arts
Review: Must visite Ram Niwas Garden with Albert Hall, very nice collection of Arts & Crafts, Minatures pantings,& so many things related olden period.

Name: Rajasthan Royal Palaces Tours
Title: Beautiful
Review: The Albert Hall Museum located in the heart of Jaipur. It speaks all about Royal Rajasthan and its Splendid Architecture.

Name: Vilayat Ali
Title: Royalty unlimited.
Review: One must visit this place if he is interested in history and architecture, one of the best place in jaipur to be.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Masti and fun
Review: Jaipur's Ram Niwas Gardan is funny place.we enjoyed a lot .This Gardan is Historical place.This Gardan ia located in middle of pink city.

Name: jitendra g
Title: nice place to visit
Review: this place is good, but don't expect to much with this place. if you are planning to visit jaipur, than this place only takes 10 to 15 minutes to see.

Name: Swanay
Title: Garden by the side Albert Hall Museum
Review: This is the name of the garden around the Albert Hall Museum.The day we went to visit the museum we saw some cultural program being performed by school kids.Post you explore the museum you can sit here and relax your tired feet and enjoy some snacks and the sun in the chilling cold weather of the city in the morning time! Its wide and peaceful and not more than half an  hour of your time.

Name: Krupali S
Title: Garden built by king
Review: This garden was built by Maharaja Sawai Ram Singh in 1868. This garden is  Located in the heart of the city jaipur. In the garden the Albert Hall Museum, bird park, zoo, the theatre, an art gallery and an exhibition ground located.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: A place to visit
Review: Overall a good place to visit on Sunday or any holiday. Maintenance has improved. Nice gardens and parking facility.

Name: yogeshramdeo69
Title: albert hall
Review: very nice place to visit,located near ajmeri gate,also zoo nearby,good connectivity from all places,need atleast 1 -3 hours

Name: Aalind S
Title: Ram Niwas Garden
Review: Ram Niwas Garden is good place to roam around as it one of the most beautiful gardens in Jaipur. It also has a zoo which is closed every tuesday.

Name: asocrates
Title: Beautiful and tranquil gardens in Jaipur City
Review: Well maintained and peaceful gardens in Jaipur though you can't escape the noise of the traffic and horns. A good place to walk or exercise after eating too many local delicacies at breakfast.

Name: Anushka c
Title: Beautiful garden
Review: It is a very beautiful garden located in front of Albert Hall Museum. The sight looks astonishing with lots of dove moving around the places.

Name: Umesh P
Title: nice place
Review: ram niwas bagh is situated near wall city , and in ramniwas bagh u can visit albert hall ,albert hall is a museum , and there is a zoo near, u can see white peacock in the zoo

Name: deepak943
Title: amazing place
Review: I wonder when i visit the the garden this is very beautiful this is a peace place there is zoo inside the garden

Name: Naouel
Title: Beautiful garden
Review: This garden is a very huge place and very close to the city centre. was built by Maharaja Sawai Ram Singh in 1868. The garden was really green with a lot of old trees.

Name: 1965ng
Title: good garden
Review: Its very old garden but not well maintained. Drawback of this garden is that there are roads in this garden and a heavy traffic of all types of vehicles throughout the day which disturbs its peace.

Name: guddu1954
Title: magnificent
Review: I happened to be here on Independence Day in the evening and witnessed spectacularly illuminated building.close to the museum ,a must visit place in Jaipur.

Name: chanderksoni
Title: awesome awesome awesome
Review: everything is awesome here. location, food delicacy, service, helpful staff, etc. every thing is awesome.

Name: Parwathi H
Title: Nice Garden close to Albert Hall Museum
Review: The Ram Niwas Garden is centrally located and is adjacent to the Albert Hall Museum. We just strolled around the garden after out visit to the museum.We found the garden to be well maintained with good green lawns. The place is also very popular with locals and school children.

Name: JJB2006
Title: The Traffic Garden
Review: Just Before entering to the walled pink city, walk here or park here. With a good amount of greenery, it counts one of the largest gardens of Jaipur. But you need to be always conscious(specially if with kids) about the  running traffic form all the directions. This compound houses some historical monuments like Albert Hall & JAYACHARYA CHHATARI (A Jain saint) with a Theater (not of movie) & the Zoo.Horse ride is available among the hurdle of pigeons. And off course, you can feed tones of grains to these thousand of KABOOTARs

Name: suresh c
Title: Albert Hall Museum
Review: Ram Niwas Garden is located outside the city wall which is located opposite to the New Gate in Jaipur. Albert Hall is the oldest museum in Jaipur. Maharaja Sawai Ram Singh II was responsible for the construction of this museum in the year 1868, when King Edward the Prince of Wales visited India.  we should be known for the art of Jaipur.

Name: Neeraj771
Title: heritage gardent in the heart of pink city.
Review: the gardens is good place for morning walk.attraction for tourist as Albert hall museum is in the centre of this park.But now days  - the ZOO is no more here, that is shifted to naharghar.not much clean like central park of jaipur. - So if u can go to central park go to there - that is big ver big and lots of facilities.

Name: Sanjay Malhotra
Title: Ram Niwas Garden
Review: This is one of the famous and oldest well maintained garden near Albert Hall Museum. On the both side of the garden, one can also visit the zoo.

Name: Prince K
Title: best garden in jaipur
Review: very nice and best garden in jaipur. with zoo all types animals. it is located in main city, i will come again.

Name: piush s
Title: Mummy in Jaipur
Review: This is a must visit place for all who love to know history, One can see Egyptian Mummy here.Jaipur Zoo is also just adjacent to it. All in all its a must visit place.

Name: JaipurAbhiraj
Title: In loving memory of king Edward
Review: Albert hall is situated at the center of Ram Niwas garden . This garden consist of zoo ,Albert hall and museum   and jogging track .This is one of the oldest garden in the town since from jaipur rulers . best to see and easily can get local bus , tuk tuk ,auto and rickshaw to reach this place

Name: Shobhit2661997
Title: Best attraction of jaipur.
Review: It is a very nice holy place to visit in jaipur. Also many other tourist places find a place nearbuy it.

Name: manisharma7
Title: Awesome Architecture
Review: Last few days ago i was gone with family. Its a center place of Jaipur. I liked walking on garden. Please visit once.

Name: MKBhatnagar
Title: The Land mark of Jaipur
Review: There is a beautiful Garden in the heart of city called Ram Niwas Garden, In the center of that there is a museum named "Albert Hall". Old historical antiques have been kept there in including an old Mummy also.There are two more section of the Garden where one side is Zoo "Chidiyaghar" where birds are kept and another side wild animals are kept. It was a pride of Jaipur once up on a time but now due to traffic entry through the garden made the atmosphere more polluted. The museum is worth seeing because of its historic identity and has a beautiful heritage architecture.

Name: Kalpit0302
Title: Not much of garden
Review: This was a beautiful garden earlier but now not much of it is left. It has the Museum "Albert Hall" as well as the Zoo in it. It is just outside the walled city and so it is on very busy road.

Name: Hanif C
Title: Morden garden
Review: The garden is good enough and well maintained but too small to visits as a tourist attraction. any how if you have enough time you can visit.

Name: Dhanpatraj D
Title: Renovated and Improved Garden
Review: Lot of improvements in the maintenance and upkeep. Garden re-engineered and  now impressive. Cleanliness has considerably improved. Parking  is no longer a a problem.Lot of local visitors come for morning and evening walk.Nice place

Name: Rahul P Singh
Title: Many tourist attractions within the vicinity
Review: Ram Niwas Bagh built by Maharaja Swai Ram Singh in 1868 is one of the few gardens in Jaipur that welcomes tourists with its pleasant atmosphere. This 33 acres of beautiful land consists of a bird park, zoo, theater, art gallery and other re-recreational spots. Along with lush green lawns and beautiful flowers, Ram Niwas garden is also the home to the famous Albert Hall Museum, which exhibits the objects portraying the rich history of Jaipur. However; Garden needs to be maintained properly which is in a poor condition now a days But one can enjoyed attractions inside the rambagh tertiary, as garden is not in that way attractive now a days to consider for visit only for garden.

Name: ViLs2023
Title: Garden with Albert Hall Museum and a small Zoo
Review: I have been a regular visitor at Ram Niwas Garden. A road pass through it, so if you are residing in Jaipur for sometime you'll happen to pass through it and from the front of Albert Hall Museum. Visiting Ram Niwas Bagh (as called locally) means a visit to Albert Hall Museum or Zoo or both. You can see many pigeons in front of Albert Hall which makes the view spectacular.

Name: BhagwatiPrasad
Title: Beautiful Garden - Well maintained
Review: Went to Ramniwas garden. Its too big & has well maintained greenery.One can go for a peaceful sitting.Enjoyed it.

Name: RajCity
Title: Jaipur City Attraction
Review: Ram niwas garden best Jaipur City Attraction this place have a big garden this place is full of natural beauty in jaipur city center

Name: pramod_5029
Title: Huge open area in middle of city.
Review: This garden is a very huge place and very close to the city centre. Also, zoo and Albert hall are in close vicinity.

Name: harendra s
Title: scenic beauty
Review: I have been going to this place since childhood days and amused of its greenery always. within it Jaipur zoo, albert hall etc are located which are also must visit places. In olden days it had a place for foodies of Jaipur of that time.

Name: kamalsinghtanwar
Title: ry nice musium
Review: nyc place whre we  can see the  all 7 secven industry articles establish by jaipur kucchawa dynasty .as per architecture , three types of architecture .

Name: SHDD
Title: Centrally situated garden
Review: Ram Niwas garden is a historical garden built bt Maharaja Sawai Singh and is located in the heart of the city . Within the garden is the Albert Hall museum. There is also a bird park, zoo, theatre , art gallery, exhibition ground , cafes and picinic spots in the garden. The garden needs a bit of maintenance . Many locls and youngsters  frequent these gardens

Name: Ajay Kala
Title: Still holds the old charm
Review: Famous Ram Niwas Garden situated at heart of city encompasses 2 zoos, one prestigious  museum,a theatre,a cricket ground, huge lawns and now underground parking. Though with time the lawns  have deteriorated but museum holds the charm and it can be labelled as one of the best buildings in Jaipur. Recently done stone work has added beauty of the Garden but it needs more focussing from government yet a visit is a must.

Name: Tender0
Title: In the heart of the city
Review: Could be maintained a little better....yet a very pleasant place .....remniscant of the earlier chat pakora and kulfi places in the centre of the city.

Name: Ashu30
Title: Ramniwas garden
Review: Ram Niwas Garden is the must visit place in jaipur city. Its located central to Jaipur City 1 km from Badi Chaupar. The place is well maintained with many attrections and facilities.Like Albert Hall Museum, Zoo, Play grounds, Underground parking, Ravindra munch open theatre and stage play theatre. There is many garden on both sides of central road form Sanganeri Gate to SMS Medical College. Its very nice to find such a refreshing place into the city. There is availability of Cycle Rickshaw easily who can't walk enough. There is various food corners just outside to this place.

Name: maheshkj
Title: garden
Review: very big size garden in the middle of the city. it has a zoo , a museum & caffeteria . green grass all ovet the garden but some times it is conveted for political meetings which should not be allowed.

Name: neerajarora76
Title: Nice place spend time in evening
Review: This is a big garden, just next to the Albert Hall Museum. So, while visiting to Albert Hall Museum, you can end your evening at Ram Niwas Garden.

Name: Rajendra M
Title: cleaned but in mid of polluted environment
Review: I am localite of Jaipur and usually travels to ajmeri gate and I visit this place whenever I go to college. so I know this place and there is good building of albert hall which gives best view. well there is more traffic remains at most of the time that's why visitng in garden only at that time when there is clean environment and less traffic. zoo is also very nearer to ramniwas garden and albert hall is a great historical place to visit. that's why everyone who visits Jaipur must go to albert hall.

Name: Md Pervez Alam K
Title: Great museum
Review: The building as well as museum is great. the mummy kept in the museum is special attraction. Clothes and weapons of Rajput rulers are also displayed.

Name: CannyJain
Title: The historical garden
Review: The historical garden is located in the heart of the city and covers an area of 33 acres and was built by Maharaja Sawai Ram Singh in 1868. Albert Hall Within the garden which originally spread over 76 acres in early 20th century is the Albert Hall Museum (now known as Central Museum). Apart from that it also has a bird park, the Zoo, Ravindra Rang Manch Theatre, art gallery, exhibition ground, gymnasium and several cafes and picnic spots are housed in the garden.

Name: vc_mukeshg
Title: Ram niwas garden-one of the city's oldest place of pride
Review: It is not only one of the most prestigious place to visit in Jaipur but also it is the most suitable place to visit nearby markets after parking your vehicle safely as there is multi-storey parking also developed now.

Name: Manoj jaipur
Title: very interesting
Review: jaipur has lot of monument albert hall one of them..and this is very nice to see inside.. this is oldest museum in jaipur

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: pride of jaipur
Review: it is one of most beautiful garden in jaipur and the view of albert hall from ram niwas garden is just gorgeous.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The big one glory of Jaipur
Review: This land mark garden was once the pride of Jaipur . Just out side walled city and the Ajmeri Gate - this garden still commands respect and the centre piece being the jewel of  Albert museum . . The loss of lush lawn of the fifties and the flowers of the season are missing today but the still worth passing thru this . If you gave time The best way is to hire the cycle rickshaw and move around . There is a zoo , and other attractions .

Name: punit_jain03
Title: Amazing Service
Review: Satisfied by the services and had lot of fun. Me and my friends enjoyed a lot there , nice everything

Name: ANILJOHAR
Title: ALBERT HALL MUSEUM
Review: In India only here in this museum u will see Mumy (as in Egypt Pyramid) & also antique articles. It is situated very closed to city. Nice location & closed to Zoo. I think if u love history u should visit & also on the way to other sight seen places.

Name: joharneeraj
Title: ALBERT HALL - EGYPTIAN MUMMY
Review: Ram Niwas Garden..a place to visit..it has Albert Hall the museum in the center and the Jaipur Zoo on its sides..lush green lawns all around. In the center of the garden is  the Status of the Late Maharaja of Jaipur. You will find lots of pigeons just like the way we have them out side Gate Way of India in Mumbai,,.,The Museum has lots of old artifacts etc but the main attraction is the very old EGYPTIAN MUMMY, which is worth seeing closely.A place to VISIT for the MUMMY atleast....and definitely other old historic artefacts

Name: rsaxena67
Title: A place in the heart of Jaipur City
Review: RamNiwas Garden is a place where Albert Hall (Palace converted to Museum ) is located . Till 1980s there used to be a huge garden place where people use to come for Morning walk . In this area also located is Chidiyaghar and a cultural activity centre named Ravindra Manch . A big ground where you can find childrens playing cricket.Because of traffic after 8 am , one can not enjoy much roaming in this area .Horse Riding is available at Albert Hall

Name: Neerajdangi15
Title: Ram Niwas Bagh
Review: Its the heart of the city Jaipur. For tourists its a good place as the museum, zoo and the city market are all near by.

Name: anilneena
Title: Garden to see
Review: Garden located near City and  good area, who is visiting Jaipur must see this garden.museum and Zoo worth to see are also in the garden.

Name: Smias90
Title: Visit if you can
Review: Can be visited, time permitting, along with Albert Hall Museum, but no great shakes. There are some stalls selling good Indian fast food herein.

Name: PremiumTravelPlanner
Title: beautiful  place
Review: beautiful albert museum, Nice place, nice city and nice people, me and my friends recommend this place and Museum.

Name: PINECREEKINDIA
Title: Visit with My family
Review: This old building and very interested. My kids are clicked many photo graph across the Ram Niwas garden

Name: triptworld
Title: ramniwas garden
Review: ram niwas garden is situated in mid city of jaipur. beautiful garden.you ahve city zoo and albert hall near around it as well.

Name: Harshit K
Title: good place in heart of city
Review: beautiful albert museum and jaipur zoo in the heart of the city. place worth to visit. Also mummy taken from egypt can also be seen in the zoo.

Name: joshisandeep
Title: Jaipur visit
Review: We saw  Albert hall, Zoo, horse riding . This garden is not properly maintained. One time can be seen.

Name: agarwalridhi
Title: pretty garden!
Review: this is one of the most prettiest garden in the city with a view of albert hall museum... nice place to relax n chill in the evenings!!

Name: Vishwajeet25
Title: Awesome Place
Review: nice place to spend some time / day with family especially with children. This garden contains a historic museum, zoo for children to visit and a panoramic view of the aravali mountains... this garden faces the most visited market place - Bapu / Nehru bazar, Link road ... here the tourists can spend full day in shopping .. specially Ladies

Name: msingh11o8
Title: glory of jaipur
Review: it s in the centre of the city.. near traditional markets.. it has the zoo of jaipur , a theatre . and the main albert hall or the museum.. it s a beautiful building of historical architecture .. with hoards of pigeons in front of it.. surrounded all around with green gardens n a fountain.. the museum is good n also has an ancient mummy which is very rare n amidst a few world over.. if u dont have much time than atleast a snapshot in front of it is a must as a memory of jaipur in it s glory.. it has a very easy approach with vehicles going almost to the front..

Name: BASANT1991
Title: must visit in rainy season
Review: Despite the sprawling green scenery, the majestic structures in the vicinity of the garden, built over the successive years, are definitely gripping. The impressive Albert Hall Museum at Ram Niwas Bagh is one such eye catcher. Built in an Indo-Sarcenic architectural style, the museum amazingly houses a huge collection of artifacts like marble statues, sculptures and miniature paintings.

Name: rudrakshnagar
Title: Touristically Fantastic
Review: I have been visiting this place since 1988 when I was a child.We used to live quite close to Ram Niwas Garden in professors' quarters of Maharaja College. My father was warden in Gokhale Hostel in the campus then. This place is one of the best tourist destinations in the city, with sprawling garden around the zoo and Albert Hall. Earlier, it used to have markets with good dhabas, kulfi walas, south indian snacks etc. One can feast on traditional eateries around this place leisurely.

Name: Youngguy
Title: No garden only museum and zoo to visit.
Review: This Garden has famous museum by the name of Albert Hall.Worth visiting but needs maintenance and upkeep.I wish they close the garden for traffic than only worth visiting.Otherwise too crowded and not worth visiting.Zoo is worth for animal lovers and children.

Name: Himmat B
Title: Green Belt
Review: More of lawns than gardens, the attraction here is the Albert hall museum. You could also take a walk to the zoo and Maharaja College when there.

Name: KLE2013
Title: Disappointing and poorly maintained garden
Review: The area surrounding the Albert Hall Museum was once a lively, verdant public space but now a rather barren space that hardly qualifies as a garden.  Visit the museum and then move on to other worthwhile Jaipur sites.

Name: ddevarshi
Title: "Graveyard' of a Garden
Review: Though the place is know as garden but you will hardly find anything that can make the place qualify to call it a garden. However, things were not all that since beginning. There was a time when this place was a happening place of Jaipur. The garden was really green with a lot of old trees. People used to spend evenings here in summer season and days during winters. The Union ground adjacent to garden was always packed with players. There was a cluster of fast food shops among which Kiran Cafe and Kiran Kulfi (local ice cream) shops were most popular. Middle class families used to call prospective brides and grooms to meet each other at this place. The place was also last resort to students and applicants who needed a passport size photograph in hurry as there were 4-5 box camera owners who would give a photograph in matter of hours. This was the fastest service in those days (prior to invention of digital cameras and printers). Then there was Ravindra manch (theatre) which was the only theatre for cultural programs and peopple had to plan their evens according to availability of this place. Later an open air thetre was also built. An art gallery in the basement was second home for local artists. The venue for all the circus and fairs in olden times was a ground on backside of Albert Hall. Things have changed a great deal. Now the place is visited only for Albert Hall Museum, Zoo and a parking. You must be a mad person to include this on your itinerary even if you dont intend visit to Zoo or Albert Hall. Since it may fall in your route so may be you will get to see it briefly and that much ention it deserves.

Name: A K S
Title: Pitiful
Review: Its probably the worst maintained potentially great public place in the city. Great location. Excellent area and layout. Pitiful maintainance. Best avoided. If you must go, then go in winters. Keep away from all forms of beggers around.

Name: Missbutterscotch
Title: "Garden no more...."
Review: now we can not say that is is a garden because there is no more grass to sit and talk ..... ... in simple words no worthy to visit this "Garden"

Name: vickydelhiindia
Title: Exit after the museum
Review: This place is not worth visiting. I don't know why it is still even called a garden. There is hardly any grass worth sitting on, no shade at all and cars plying right there. Only footfall it receives is from people who visit the museum and are told of this garden.

Name: BradJill
Title: Not really worth the visit other than the Albert Hall Museum
Review: We visited the area referred to as the Ram Niwas Gardens during our trip to Jaipur in early January and were surprised at the state of the once famed garden area.  What we found was more of an aged and dilapidated city park area with too much traffic, pollution and people.  The Garden itself was not in great shape. However, there is one attraction there we found worthy of visiting. The Central Government (Albert Hall) Museum, which is an intriguing of curios, some artefacts and other items of interest.  The Albert Hall is also an interesting architectural feat blending English and Northern Indian styles from the late 19th century, which might strike an interest in those who enjoy architecture.  There is a zoo that can be visited in the area as well.  Overall, we were disappointed in the Ram Niwas Gardens and wouldn't recommend allocating your holiday time to visit this area unless you are particularly keen on curiosities museums and or architecture in which time you might want to spare some time for the Central Government (Albert Hall) Museum.

Name: Sumit Jain
Title: Nothing to call it a graden anymore
Review: Earlier One of the finest places in  Jaipur for a morning walk if you live in the city. I would say this is still the same. But as soon as the day starts to progress the agony of this place starts badly. Though it has two of the highly visited attractions of Jaipur - The Albert hall and the jaipur ZOO, but the traffic which starts flowing from here actually makes it a place not to be. Highly poluted in the day due to high traffic

Name: Rajnish P
Title: No more garden left....
Review: Ram Niwas garden once used to be a 'Pride of Jaipir'. In earlier days this place was out of walled city; but  with a spread of the city, it is now a centrally located garden.Albert Hall Museum, Zoo, and Ravindra Manch (a theater for drama, and dance performances) are located within this vast area. You will find thousands of pigeons on the grounds in front of Albert Hall Museum. This museum has rare unique collection of Curio given by Maharaja of Jaipur.This garden once used to be so green and cool that local families will make it a point to pass their evenings here. Children will play and elderly will take a stroll....But, Alas, with poor maintenance of it, with traffic allowed to pass through, and with coming up of multi story parking lot in it, the charm has gone.........

Name: DP1066
Title: An impressive Hall!
Review: Located in the second courtyard of the Amber Fort, the Hall of Public Audience has two rows of columns each topped by a elephant-shaped capital.  This is where the Maharaja used to address his subjects.

Name: SalimM
Title: Public hall
Review: Diwan-e-Aam or Hall of public audience is a large hall. There are two rows of pillars supporting the structure. The top of these columns have elephant shaped structure and galleries with lattice work. The hall is open on three sides. The king used to sit in the hall and listen to the queries of common men. This hall is famous for its mosaic glass works.

Name: Memoirs-Sachin
Title: Hall for the citizens of the state
Review: The Diwan-e-Aam Hall of Public Audience is a section in the Amber Fort where the King would address the public. It is a huge courtyard providing panoramic view of the village downhill.

Name: reubenranjanfern2017
Title: Nice place.
Review: This place is a major attraction and acts a hall for groups of people. This place has  historic meaning.

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Hall for the subjects!!
Review: The counterpart to Diwan-e-Khaas, this is the hall where the royals would meet the subjects and listen to their queries/complaints.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: You experience Royal giving audiences to the common citizens
Review: This is the place where Maharaja of Jaipur heard common citizens grievances and redressed them. On the walls you will see impressive paintings of all the Maharajas. You must go see for your convenience.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: City palace
Review: This is one of the major attractions of the city palace of jaipur. Located at the heart of city. This hall was used for public meetings.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal hall
Review: This hall located in city palace was dedicated for public meetings during dynasty rule in Jaipur ....

Name: rjpriyanka
Title: City palace...
Review: This one is also located inside the royal city palace... This hall was used to conduct public meetings... Life sized paintings of rulers are displayed here.

Name: Kaushik G
Title: Beautiful hall inside City Palace
Review: During my vacation in Jaipur, I had visited the beautiful City Palace complex and this marble floored courtyard called Diwan-e-Aam is located between the armory and the art gallery within the complex. This was the hall of public audience where king used to hear grievances of common people. We saw here 2 giant sterling silver vessels which holds Guinness World record as world's largest sterling silver vessels. One can also see beautiful crystal chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.Entrance ticket for City Palace is priced at 130 Rupees for Indians and 500 Rupees for foreigners and also there is a special ticket of 2500 Rupees which gives special access to private rooms in the Chandra Mahal with a personal guide.

Name: Jaroslaw Kaczmarski
Title: Where the old meets temporary
Review: Go there if you want to see how these all old building were furnished and set up. This is a very unique place, where you can see it. Very recommended.

Name: ashrafazrol
Title: At the center of the city palace
Review: This place provides historical understanding of the royal Jaipur kingship. I has multitudes of impressive architecture and decoration. There are also exhibition of historical royal artifacts, attire, and garments. Weapons are also on display. There are many corners of the palace worthy of Insta-pictures.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal...
Review: The city palace gives you glipms of royal era of Rajsthani/ erthwhile Rajlutana.. hire a guide to learn about many old facinating stories...

Name: Smrutirekha
Title: Part of the City Palace
Review: The name defines the place. One can see the canons standing with pride and elegance and the antiques are worth a picture to be clicked with. This is part of the City Palace tour. There is a large vessel made of Brass which is worth a click. In the old times this was used to fetch water water from the Ganges for the Palace. Its a good place overall.

Name: Ricardo B
Title: One of the features of the palace
Review: The Jaipur city palace is pretty magnificent and this is one of the nicest features. In the style of the Mughal public audience building, one of the highlights is the huge silver jars in the main entrace

Name: Manish Sarraf
Title: Site included in City palace tour
Review: The place is in mid of palace having big silver jars, old guns decorated in sun pattern. Nice to get clicked with antique items.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Royal at its Best
Review: Lots and lots of stories are there for this place, the name itself feels Royal and things also feels the touch of Royal, great to visit.

Name: Prabal G
Title: Beautiful and airy
Review: Two big silver vessels make it stand apart. Beautiful arches and pillars inside it. This is the place where the king would meet general public and sort out their matters.

Name: MAYANKBIGDELHIFOODIE
Title: loved it
Review: this muesum is worth going loved itwe can see our cultureold era of kings queenhow they used 2 dressplayfightlive old era

Name: TravellingSands
Title: World's largest Silver Vessels on Display
Review: This artistic hall of public audience is an airy building with numerous arches and a mosaic flooring. The highlights of this hall are the two huge silver urns which the Kin used to transport the Holy water of River Ganges on his trip to England.

Name: jonahNJ
Title: Home of the enormous silver urns
Review: This Hall of Public Audience is similar to other Halls I visited while traveling through northern India. There were the ornate pillars that the ornate arches. However, in this Diwan e Aam, there were two large silver urns which are reportedly the largest of their kind in the world. There were also displays of swords. However, a special treat I had was watching a man demonstrate how turbans are wrapped as headwear. I was surprised to learn that the cloths used for turbans can be as long as 7-9 yards. This was the highlight of my brief visit to this Diwan e Aam.

Name: Moiz H
Title: Meeting place
Review: Diwane e aam is a meeting place for common people, in old days rulers hear common peoples cases here.

Name: cg2792
Title: Lovely area of the city palace
Review: Really lovely and relaxing area to walk around in the city palace. Few indoor exhibits available too which I wish they would have allowed photography inside as postcards do not do it justice!

Name: karthikeya r
Title: Special meeting place of the kings
Review: Diwan-e-Aam was a meeting place for special people from the king's court. Important meetings were organized here in the olden days.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The mesmerizing royal court of audience for general meetings !
Review: Any one coming to jaipur generally comes to Amer Fort and this place is the first which comes in the view ! It leaves one spell bound by its history and the architectural Beaty . The work on the round shaped pillars and the huge hall is open on all sides with beautiful work on the ceiling ! A true reflection of the bygone era . The Mughal influence is very visible here . The entry fee for the Fort visit is heavy but , it is different pricing for Indians / non Indians visitors . The visit to the from here forts starts here . Would advise to have an experienced guide approved by the govt .

Name: VIPIN_GOEL_TP_Impex
Title: Meeting place for common people with the Rulers
Review: Rulers of Jaipur State listen to the grievances of common people here in the City Palace. The concept name 'Diwan-e-Aam' is originated from Mughals.

Name: Satyendra Garg
Title: Diwan-e-Aam used to be place where meetings with common people were held. It is there at Red Fort, Amber and City Palace
Review: As distinguished from Diwan-e-Khas which was for the special people Diwan-e-AAm was for the common people. The Royalty used to meet common man at this place. You find this at Red Fort and so also at Amber Fort. The Rajputs of Jaipur drew their inspiration from the Mughals and named their important establishments on Mughal pattern. At Amber you find beautiful Diwan-e-Aam and so also at City Palace which was also called Sabha Grih. At city palace there are two massive elegant single stone elephants at the entrance of Diwan-e-Aam and at Amber the Diwan-e-Aam is on beautiful sandstone pillars. Diwan-e-Aam were the places of public festival celebrations and public meetings.Spend sometime to understand the nuances of places where common meetings and important meeting were held. Visit to these places is to familiarise with Mughal art and culture which was adopted by those Rajputs who aligned with them.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Diwan-e-Aam (Hall of Public Audience) ‚Äì A historical place in City Palace of Jaipur
Review: Diwan-e-Aam (Hall of Public Audience) was the place where the Maharajas of Jaipur used to hear and decide the grievances of his people.  It is also called ‚ÄúSabha Niwas‚Äù. This audience hall is famous for its beautifully ornamented flowery ceilings and the two large elephants at the entrance which are made with a single marble rock.

Name: Gavin R
Title: Within the city palace
Review: If you visit the City palace of Jaipur you can visit, this place too, Its nice, its historic, and thats about it. If your sent quite into history you can skip it and just see the rest of the palace.

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: City palace
Review: Diwan -e- Aam hall is also city palace part.this hall is very beautiful.must see this.its architecture is nice.

Name: Alok Kumar A
Title: Waste of Time and Money
Review: Not worth to go such a distance just to see a very small section of History. Indian tourist are not allowed in most of the City palace area.

Name: princ512
Title: Interesting place
Review: This place was a meeting area for general public, all issues of public were addressed here by the wajir. One can only imagine how the proceedings were used to happen at this place. It is the first main hall, when you enter the paid area of Amber Fort.

Name: Suzzanna2014
Title: A walk to the ancient life
Review: The place is pretty good as it takes you to the lifestyle of the royal family. There is a full collection of armoury, ancient clothing and pictures. There is also the dining room, kitchen setup (with real utensils that were used then) and a place with puppet show (must watch and pay him good money- he does a good job but hardly gets money). It's a an amazing place altogether.

Name: Prabhs13
Title: Main attraction of City Palace Hall
Review: The main usp of visiting City Palace is Diwan-e-aam Hall. Various portrays of kings has been placed and well preserved to this date.

Name: Eileen E
Title: not to be missed
Review: Wonderful site, best seen with a guide, since the Indian culture is so unique, an explanation is most useful.

Name: bubbles080
Title: museum
Review: well presented museum documenting all the past maharajahs of India with portraits and furniture where public audiences with ministers took place

Name: gourmetclub
Title: Wow, the way the royalty lived !!
Review: The City palace has the Deewane Aam open for most public viewing. However you can pay more and visit special areas. The open courtyard displayed the silver urns which were used to transport the holy water for the king to Britain were spectacular. The museum display was also intriguing and the main hall  with the portraits of the various kings was a little dull though systematic. The jewellery outlet within the premises  had a rich display. An in- fort cafe was nice though very expensive. A guide might be handy to bring in the local flavour.

Name: drn85
Title: Diwaan-e-aam architectural excellence...
Review: Diwaan-e-aam Hall of public audience is a part of the city palace located in jaipur. Everyone will visit this place on your trip to city palace. There is an entry fee for the city palace and students will get concession once you submit your identity cards. Credit cards are also accepted. The most important attractions nived there are the red thrones and the huge chandelier kept over there. We can click some nice pics over there. Except that there is not mucj yo explore in this area. Altogether it's a must visit place for the travellers in jaipur.

Name: jitendra g
Title: Nice place to visit
Review: It is very nice place to visit with friends and family as well. but don't expect to much with this place.

Name: Rumples
Title: Beautiful Hall
Review: This large hall -- part of Jaipur's City Palace Museum -- features two red thrones placed together; a huge, mostly red carpet; and a massive chandelier. Architectural details include double rows of marble columns and scalloped arches. The area is roped off, so we joined a long line of people who shuffled around it for a better look. No photography is allowed.Though I enjoyed looking at the space, I found the the walls around the edges to be more interesting. They featured miniature paintings and sculpture.We visited in the late afternoon on a weekday in December when most of the City Palace that is open to the public was crowded. There may be less visitors early in the morning or at other times of the year.

Name: ranjana c
Title: nice
Review: All part of Amber Fort. reaching the fort was very time consuming since the road was narrow and traffic hold ups occured despite being a one way street- the  parking at the fort seemed to be the problem. but the entire fort is very nice. Hearsay was that residents of Sirmaur, HP, get to get in free since the Rani is from Sirmaur, but that was not so!! Anyway  the gardens, the restoration work on the walls that was in progress was amazing.good excursion , all in all.

Name: jaiprakash1202
Title: Diwan-e-Aam (The royal feel)
Review: i was so happy to see this place as this looks exactly to watch was shown in the movie "Jodha Akbar". Its really giving the royal feels and proud moment of witnessing the greatness of our historical past.

Name: Baarish
Title: Impressive Hall
Review: This is the first structure one comes across as one enters the gate of amber palace.The pillars are restored but one can have a good idea of the beautiful original carvings by looking at the cornice of each pillar.

Name: Patricia D
Title: Part of Palace Museum
Review: Really a great place to soak in the local ambience. There was a cute puppet show with music, we saw snake charmers as we walked in. I found the palace public audience room beautiful with the silver throne chairs, carpets, chandeliers and wall pictures.

Name: Sankar Mukherjee
Title: Public meet
Review: a single storied building of deewan-e-aam in the courtyard of the city palace as you enter from the Sabha Griha, at the center of the courtyard, with a display of old guns in a beautiful way is framed. This place contains two container of silver(largest of the world) is displayed in glass box. Some mementos are sold here.

Name: Binu A
Title: Wait here for the king!!
Review: Diwan-i-Aam, the Hall of Public Audience, is a marble floored chamber located between the armory and the art gallery and is part of the City Palace.The main attraction here are two huge sterling silver vessels and they hold the Guinness World Record as the world's largest sterling silver vessels.This Hall along with others can be seen as part of the larger City Palace tour.

Name: Cruzz H
Title: Good Place
Review: Diwan-e-Am Hall of Public Audience is good place to see the king royalty even see th real life of a king in Diwane-e-Aam Hall. good place to visit tourist attraction even old history within

Name: Carol P
Title: An impressive hall with great portraits of former royalty
Review: Helpful to understand the lineage of Royalty and an impressive internal space.Well worth visiting the bookshop.

Name: Auldrin2016
Title: Historical palace
Review: Lots and lots to know about the kings and queens life about their culture and lifestyle. will give you history of the battles and victories

Name: Vishal V
Title: Part Jaigarh fort - has got much ore to see.
Review: This is a small part of Jaigarh Fort. The fort itself has too good parts to see. The open hall has some ancient machinery, exclusively meant to viewed here. Ever cared how to get cold breezes in hot weather?  they had there own hand made ACs - all mechanical, hand driven wooden machinery to cool down the rough weather in Rajisthan - I found Exclusive.

Name: YogRan
Title: Good place
Review: Situated inside the City palace.. very close from Hawa Mahal.. No guide required.. Nothing much to see

Name: Rockwell M
Title: So Fascinating
Review: this so nice to see the real feeling of those day where king and rulers and ministers you to sit down what they use to do. this is so real. Amazing

Name: Travelwisewoman
Title: Another beautiful Hall in the myriad of buildings comprising the City Palace!
Review: The Hall of Public Audience is yet another beautiful spot in the myriad of buildings which comprise the City Palace of Jaipur and the elaborate doorways and lovely pink walls are a must for another photo stop!

Name: LuizDutraNeto
Title: At the historical Hall of Public Audiences of the Maharajahs of Jaipur ...
Review: At this magnificent hall, the "Maharajahs of Jaipur" used to hold public meetings and gatherings. Today, "Diwan-e-Aam" is an art gallery. Enjoy its beautiful painted ceilings, its collections of Persian, Rajasthan and Mughal paintings, rare manuscripts, shawls and carpets. And, principally, the stunning "Golden Throne", the historical seat of the "Maharajahs of Jaipur"! Enjoy!

Name: Globetrottersince97
Title: All part and parcel of royalty
Review: Discrimination based on wealth. Common man given separate halls and rest a special hall. Not much worth it to be honest

Name: Travel Vibes - India
Title: The Sabha Niwas (Hall of Public Audience)
Review: The 'Hall of Public Audience' is a hall with the ceiling painted in rich red and gold colours. This chamber, functioning now as an art gallery, has exhibits of exquisite miniature paintings (of Rajastahni, Mughal and Persian art), ancient texts, embroidered rugs, Kashmir shawls and carpets. At present, it is an art gallery showcasing enthralling painted ceilings and rare ancient handwritten original manuscripts of Hindu scriptures (the Hindu holy scripture of the Bhagavad Gita handwritten in tiny script). Also seen in the art gallery is the Royal throne (called as Takth-e-Rawal) that was the seat of the Maharaja during public audience. It was mounted on an elephant or carried by palanquin bearers during the Maharajas visit outside the palace. At the entry gateway to the hall, two large elephants, each made out of single marble rock are on display.

Name: anjaliprabhu
Title: Part of City Palace
Review: This is part of the city palace which is huge. Take a guide along so that you can understand the historical importance.

Name: Ikbal V
Title: Very nice
Review: I visited Diwan e aam hall of Public audience in city palace with my family.  This very nice to see ..

Name: HudsonS16
Title: Great Gallery
Review: The carpets are 17thC and the workmanship is impressive. It must have taken ages to complete the whole carpet. Don't miss the early manuscripts & delicate books, the minature paintings and of course, the chandelier

Name: Manish B
Title: Excellent Building
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is inside at the city palace and its open for tourists to visit. Excellent building in the middle of City. You will love the place and see many great items of the royal family. highly recommended place to visit.

Name: Kashyap Dwivedi
Title: Lovely Architecture :-)
Review: This place is unique in itself & with mix architecture work by Mughals, Rajputs & Europeans makes it different.Maharaja use this place for public meetings where issues of society were discussed & taken care publicly.

Name: sargunarao
Title: Beautiful
Review: Diwan E-Aam Hall of public audience located in the city palace complex. The hall served as the place where the King address  the public. The hall known as Sabha Niwas among the local of Jaipur and made of Jiapur's signature architecture of pink sandstones.

Name: NIR006
Title: Great place for history lovers
Review: - Located inside the city place- The hall where the maharajas used to hold their assembly- Elaborate seating areas for maharajas, the queens, the ministers and the common people- Clean, neat and well-maintained

Name: EshwarSaba
Title: Nothing very kaas about the Diwan-e-Aam
Review: When one goes around historical locations in Delhi, Agra and Jaipur, two words that frequent at every location are Diwan-e-Aam, and Diwan-e-khas - where the first is place (in or around the palace), where the ruler met the general public, and the later is the place where the ruler met the special guests. The city palace at Jaipur also has a similar place.

Name: Kum_akh
Title: Histroci place
Review: maharaja used to meet the common man at this place. well connected to public transport.Diwan-e -Aam is a part of the city palace

Name: ddevarshi
Title: Also known as Sabha Niwas
Review: This is a part of City Palace of Maharaja Sawai Mansingh II Museum. It is a huge hall, where Maharaja used to meet people. There are carpets, paintings and furniture of olden times. You get to see life size paintings of rulers. LED display shows collection of some old photographs from this hall and other occasions of City Palace. Photography is not allowed in this gallery too.

Name: Cooltraveller3
Title: Amazed at the beauty of the palace
Review: Beautiful, magnificent structure. The silver jar which the maharaja used during his trip to London is one of the exhibits there. Also many Guns and swords adorn the walls.

Name: santanu
Title: Part of the City Palace
Review: Diwan-e -Aam is a part of the city palace. In past kings meets the common people here and addressed their problems.

Name: Rajendraraje
Title: A peep in the past
Review: Experience the royal glory first hand. Get a fair idea of how the royalty lived in the era gone by. The grandeur and the sheer aura of the place would floor anyone.

Name: bishwaksen
Title: Hall with Massive Jars
Review: The hall lies in the middle of the City Palace complex. There are a couple of big chandeliers. On both sides, there are decorations made with swords and guns. The undoubted attraction here are the two massive jars - reputed to be the biggest silver vessels in the world.

Name: priteshkulkarni
Title: Royal palace part
Review: Diwan e aam hall is a part of city palace. It is open hall where royal people used to meet common people of jaipur. Nice building with simple carving. place is maintained properly.

Name: MumbaiPradeep
Title: Part of City Palace
Review: This is part of the city palace where the king used to hold his Darbar. A bit of history can be read here.

Name: Naouel
Title: Diwan-e-Aam Hall of Public Audience
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is one of the parts of City Palace in Jaipur. This hall was the place where the Kings used to have their public meetings. The hall is majestic and huge.

Name: pkaran
Title: Great monument inside City Palace Jaipur
Review: Diwan e Aam is one of the parts of amazing City Palace in Jaipur. This is the place where kings used to have public gathering. Surrounded by pink walls, it is a big courtyard with a hall in the middle with 2 big silver jars and chandeliers.

Name: Dee-Passionate-Wanderer
Title: A big spacious hall
Review: Beautiful works of marble and open well ventilated hall. The kings used this place to conduct public meetings and to meet the aam aadmi.

Name: DrWJW
Title: Grand Hall
Review: The entrance to "Central Hall." This is one of the few "decorated" interiors.  You can only wonder how the materials withstand the heat and the humidity.  Be prepared to "tip" the guard if you want to take a picture.

Name: godspeed4476
Title: Average place
Review: Just a very average place inside the city palace complex, do not know why its mentioned as a separate landmark, you do not need to buy any tickets to see it (apart from the palace ticket)

Name: nitsj76
Title: Public Audience Hall at City Palace
Review: We visited the Diwan E Aam at Royal City Palace in Jaipur sometime back.The place with its red and pink coloured walls and field guns parked nearby, takes you back to the bygone dates of Rajput era. This hall was the place where the Kings used to have their public meetings with their subjects of their everday issues.The courtyard is pretty huge and can easily  accommodate hundreds of men. Closely is the hall for private audience which was reserved for the noblemen and royalty.Nice attraction when visiting the city palace in the Pink City

Name: Ankit250384
Title: Diwan- e-Aam Good place
Review: It is located in the city palace. this place is used by jaiour king to listen common people issued and request

Name: ASHISH SETHI
Title: The 'Diwan-E-Aam' (Sabha Niwas) or the 'Hall of Public Audience' is an enchanting chamber
Review: The works of art displayed on the walls include two remarkable large paintings on cloth depicting Lord Krishna celebrating Holi. This magnificent assembly hall was the throne room of the palace, designed for ceremonial assemblies involving the ruling Maharaja

Name: chetan1586
Title: Public Grievance zone
Review: Diwan-e-Aam is the part of city palace which was used as a public forum area in the royal era.The outer pillar are made of red stone which does not get heated even with sun rays while the inner pillars are made of marble.This is a must see place in city palace

Name: Prashant D
Title: Part of City Palace, for Public Gatherings
Review: This is a part of City Palace, and was meant for public gatherings. There are cannons kept outside and the overall view of the Hall is good.The walls inside the Hall are adorned with photographs of the royal lineage. It is also nicely decorated with carpets on the floor and nice paintings on the wall and ceiling.Worth stopping by to admire this portion during the tour of the City Palace.

Name: Vikshar
Title: Public place(during royal era) in City palace
Review: part of city palace and guide or audio guide will give details about it.Meant for general public gatherings

Name: Abhishek M
Title: Silver Vessels
Review: Must see huge silver cans place in center of hall, this was used by king to carry ganges water to london in 1902

Name: Lalchhanhima R
Title: must do in Jaipur
Review: now this is a must see in jaipur. Pictures of the all the previous kings of jaipur, the royal dress, chair and other monuments. The hall is majestic and huge

Name: Kaushal D
Title: Nice
Review: This place is in the City Palace.the interiors of this place is very beautiful. While touring the City palace you will visit this place.

Name: Himmat B
Title: Grand Hall
Review: A part of the City Palace, this is a grand open hall that exhibits great Architecture. If you visit the City Palace, it would take effort to miss this place.

Name: Charming_Karl
Title: The more museum-like section of the City Palace complex
Review: There are times when not being allowed to take photographs seems less an attempt to get you to buy their books full of photos, and more a matter of showing respect.  The latter is certainly the case here, although I must admit, I was really tempted to yank out my camera more than once.  What stopped me?  Well, our guide was a serious but kind person and I would've been embarrassed to do anything for which he might need to chide me.  Plus, there were plenty of other areas where we were welcome to take photos.As for this hall, we avoided the section that has been turned into a military museum and focused on the part devoted to the history of the royal family.  Lovely.

Name: KLE2013
Title: Magnificent Throne Room
Review: The former ceremonial hall now displays rare miniature Mughal paintings and larger than life portraits of the Maharajas of Jaipur.  Seeing these portraits made the history of the Palace come alive and the stories of the rulers more impactful.  The massive carpet that stretched the length of the hall was only partially displayed but the extravagant silver throne was fully visible.  Sadly Photography is not allowed in this part of City Palace Museum.

Name: raja p
Title: excellent
Review: i visited this place in 10feb2015.this is part of city palace.i like the place here.firangis the kings transport vehicles exhibited here.nice memory.

Name: Ravi Kishore
Title: heritage at its best
Review: very well maintained even though made into a hall of exhibits. can't take photos here but you'll admire the architecture and heritage of the place.

Name: M C
Title: Glimpse of History
Review: The hall is part of the city palace, and the design was changed slightly to make the exhibition, but not a major change.The items exhibited are well maintained compared to such period.

Name: Ashish Singla
Title: Speechless
Review: I am speechless to describe about this place. The meeting hall of the royal family is very well maintained. Photography is not allowed at this place. One can feel a real royal experience here. This is situated inside the City Palace in Jaipur.

Name: itspriyanka
Title: Excellent
Review: Its located inside the City Palace, one of the grandest places in Jaipur. Loved the architecture. Must visit.

Name: murali8121
Title: Diwan e aam at city palace
Review: Its part of the city palace complex in Jaipur and as in any other part of the palace, the work has been fantastic. A place where the king used to meet the public to address their grievances. The place where the king used to sit along with appointed places for the ministers, the other nobles are all very interesting to see.

Name: PrestonGuild
Title: Audience in the city
Review: Mubarak Mahal was built by Maharaja Madho Singh. Contained within it is the Diwan-e-Khas (the Hall of private audience) and Diwan-e-Aam (the hall of public audience). The Hall of the public audience as the name implies were members of the public would arrive with petitions and grievances and seek audience to the King and his ministers. However for more exquisite halls, look at the Amber Fort.

Name: annehA4231CL
Title: the palace
Review: We queued for tickets to gain entry and definitely worth it. It is part of the City Palace complex and as you climbed to each level and turned a corner another interesting view appeared. Looking out onto the hurly burly of life in the streets below made it feel all the more special and some beautiful stained glass simmering in the sunshine.

Name: SalimM
Title: Maharajas palace
Review: Another of the attractions in City Palace. There is fantastic inner courtyard where you can see four different gates that represent four different seasons: the Peacock Gate associated with autumn, the Green Gate ‚Äì with summer, the Leheriya gate with spring and finally the Rose Gate with winter. Each gate is decorated with different kinds of flowers. Apparently, Chandra Mahal is the place where the present Raja of the Jaipur resides therefore you can only visit the ground floor. All other floors are out of bounds.

Name: Ipek T
Title: Must- seen
Review: This one of the must-seen places in Caipur. Especially the inner doors with the season context were very beautiful

Name: Alex Walker
Title: Chandra Mahal
Review: Situated inside the leviathan City Palace, the Chandra Mahal was built by Maharaja Jai Singh II. The magnificent palace is a seven storied citadel that is home to verdant gardens, marvelous paintings and ornately decorated ceilings. Luxury, beauty and architectural brilliance, Chnadra Mahal is a must visit place for anyone in Jaipur. The ground and the first floor of the palace form the Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II museum. Chandra Mahal, at present, is the residence of the current Maharaja of Jaipur.

Name: John Connell
Title: I don‚Äôt want to seem mean but...........
Review: We visited The City Palace Museum paying 700 rupees each . On entering the complex We were surprised to learn that the 700 rupee fee did not get entrance to the Chandra Mahal. This was an additional 3500 for full access or in excess of 50 usd, almost three times the cost of entrance to the stunning Taj Mahal.  So for a family of three it would have cost us more to view this one attraction than the cost of our train journey from Delhi to Agra plus a car journey from Agra to Jaipur. Hard to see how the cost is justifiable.

Name: divsi
Title: Must visit for Architecture lovers
Review: Honestly, I thought 3000INR was way too much at the entrance of the City Palace for Chandra Mahal, but once I entered the rooms of this wing, I was stunned. One room is drenched in blue frescos, the other is covered with mirror work, a third comes alive with lamps and their reflections. A must must visit for those who love architecture, Truly worth the price as you have lesser crowds to deal with and have a guide with you through out. The tour is not rushed and you can take you own time.Loved every bit of the tour!

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Royal Family still stays here
Review: You will get a wonderful experience about life style of Royal Family of Jaipur. The part where Royal family lives is not open to public. But other portion gives you a splendid experience of the rich life style. It is an experience of life time. Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: Prathamesh Sawant
Title: Still used by the royals!!
Review: Its a beautiful building with access restricted to some places (as the royals still live here). The blue room gives you a sense of the grandeur of the times.

Name: John W
Title: Worth the visit
Review: The City Palace is really a beautiful structure/complex and worth the visit in Jaipur. Parts are still used by the royal family, so aren't accessible, but still worth it.

Name: Alice O
Title: Astonishingly beautiful
Review: In addition to the beutiful hue of pink, the building has intricate designs on the walls and ceilings. Windows and archways give a medieval atmosphere.

Name: Binemaan
Title: Beautiful
Review: The place is beautiful, but doesn't take hours to see. We had an English speaking guide, but it was hard to understand what he was telling. At least he tried.

Name: Umang A
Title: Royal palace..
Review: Chandra Mahal is one of the royal palace/part of City Palace which is still occupied by Royal Family of Jaipur..

Name: Popsicle8
Title: City palace was the reason why I went to Jaipur
Review: Having seen photos from many people going to Jaipur, I thought I had to see this place. I really like this city palace. Willing to pay 2500 INR for entering the palace to see the rooms with guide and I learnt a lot from the guide. The blue room is really nice. Those four gates are beautiful. I didn't disappoint at all. I personally like this place more than Versailles. I went there on mid-April and it's a low season for this place as it's very hot but it's bearable for me. Spent nearly 2 hours inside and the crowd at the gates was almost empty which allowed me to enjoy the place more.

Name: FLworldwanderer
Title: Beautiful surroundings ...
Review: If you are traveling to Jaipur, then you must come to the City Palace, and visit the Chandra Mahal.  This Mahal was built by Maharaja Jai Singh II and later, renovations were done by his descendants. At present Chandra Mahal serves as the residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur (the descendants of Royal family of Jaipur).  Hope this helps with your first visit.

Name: Sweta P
Title: Beautiful Mahal
Review: The Mahal or Palace is really beautiful, we had so many pictures of almost everything, I just love the Palaces, though bit bigger. Enjoyable.

Name: Ratbag
Title: Beautiful
Review: So much stunning architecture, was a great place to see and take lots of interesting pictures. The whole city palace complex contains much worth wandering round. It is helpful to go with a guide who will clear a path for you through the hawkers. Otherwise just keep saying 'no thank you' if you do not want to buy anything and you'll be fine.

Name: Sunshine7861
Title: Ok
Review: If you really want to see it then you could it's architecture is good and thers few buildings which are nice within the place.

Name: donsaunderson
Title: Disappointment Plus
Review: We were presented with options to visit the museum or the private quarters.  The price was very steep 5,000 rupees ($100) for a couple - it was about the same price as tickets to Versailles so thought it would be spectacular - we got to visit just a just a few rooms and yes they were great but some restricted photographs - definitely nothing to compare to a visit to Versailles and a total rip off!    We were expecting much more for the price and left feeling very disappointed.

Name: shanupce137
Title: Wonderful...
Review: It is situated inside the city palace, built by Sawai Jai Singh II. Great architecture, it is a seven storied building, part of museum.

Name: Dinesh_cbe
Title: Wonderful Palace
Review: The architecture of this palace is simply wonderful. Chandra Mahal is situated inside the City Palace and it is the living place of the descendants of the Jaipur royal family. Great artworks on the walls is good for photographs.

Name: VIPIN_GOEL_TP_Impex
Title: Part of City Palace converted into a Museum
Review: Chandra Palace is part of City Palace, which is now converted into a museum. One can see the history of Jaipur Rulers, their photographs, their dresses, arms etc.

Name: cazbatt
Title: Wonderful
Review: This is one of the palatial buildings inside the City Palace and it is very interesting. The architecture and decoration of the place is wonderful and it houses some very beautiful objects and artwork.

Name: Arghya Das
Title: Chandra Mahal ‚Äì The Royal Palace in City Palace
Review: Chandra Mahal is a magnificent multi-storeyed palace situated inside the City Palace. According to our tourist guide, this wonderful mahal was built by Maharaja Jai Singh II and afterward renovations were done by his descendants. At present Chandra Mahal  serves as the residence of the Maharaja of Jaipur (the descendants of Royal family of Jaipur).

Name: Paridhi7392
Title: Good architecture
Review: Chandra Mahal of Jaipur is located on Moti Dungri Road. Good place for visit its construction is great

Name: Tom-Kenny
Title: Wonderful
Review: We paid extra to have the tour of some of the private areas. And it was well worth it. We were the only people on this. It included coffee/tea biscuits in the royal courtyard and a tour of some incredible rooms. Our guide wasn't the best, but hey!Great views, insights into the life of the maharajah who still lives here. Opulent wealth on the inside of these walls. The architecture was beautiful. It felt a special place!

Name: drn85
Title: Chandra mahal... The royal space...
Review: Chandra mahal is a part of the city palace of jaipur and it will become part of the trip to city palace. City palace has got an entry fee which comes with a reduction to students with identity card. Chandra mahal is the official living area of the royal descendants and it is closed to the public. It's a seven storeyed building with lots of architectural excellence in each and everything over there. The entry is allowed to tourists who pay 2500 per person from morning to evening on special permission. We can have nice photographs of this even from outside. Altogether it's a good place to have a visit during your trip to Jaipur

Name: Patricia D
Title: Pretty Courtyard
Review: It was nice to walk around the local area and then enter the various attractions of this area. Chandra is pretty with the tiles and peacock tile work, statues. You are able to look up at the royal residence.

Name: Robert L
Title: Courtyard
Review: This courtyard is worth a brief excursion. The Peacock Gate is quite striking and is a popular photo op place. You can see the 7 story building where the 5 members of the royal family are currently living.

Name: MidNight P
Title: Expensive for outsiders
Review: If you don't look Indian it cost more if you don't look young it's more of you look young it's cheap. Nice place a bit pricy the stairs are uniquely flat for horses and stuff the rooms are beautiful and there is three packages the all in one the museum and  one royal place it has small stores and food service too! Really pricy though.

Name: AnnieAries
